Sandslash-Alola.comments:
Other Options

Ice

Icicle Crash can be used in place of Knock Off to punish foes such as Dragapult, Garchomp, and Choice Scarf Landorus; however, Knock Off's utility in threatening spinblockers and removing items is generally more useful, as Alolan Sandslash's teammates can deal with these threats. Rock Slide can be used to allow Alolan Sandslash to outspeed and OHKO +1 Volcarona under snow, as well as 2HKO Moltres, but it is difficult to fit on its moveset over other mostly more useful options.

Slush Rush Support (Ice).description:
Alolan Sandslash provides valuable role compression for fast-paced Ice teams. It offers not only entry hazard removal, a Toxic immunity, and a resistance to Fairy but also speed control thanks to Slush Rush. Under snow, it notably outpaces and threatens Chien-Pao, Flutter Mane, Dragapult, Spectrier, and +1 Baxcalibur, as well as Choice Scarf users such as Hisuian Arcanine and Gholdengo. Slush Rush finds further use in facilitating Alolan Sandslash's entry hazard removal, as it can spin on forced switches against foes such as Flutter Mane, and even if it is being sacrificed, it can generally get a Rapid Spin off before it is KOed. Iron Head is Alolan Sandslash’s primary attacking move, proving especially deadly to Flutter Mane, Hatterene, Alolan Ninetales, and Air Balloon Glimmora. Earthquake allows Alolan Sandslash to offensively pressure Toxapex, and it also smacks targets such as Heatran, Sneasler, and Hisuian Arcanine. Knock Off is valuable for menacing spinblockers such as Dragapult, Hisuian Zoroark, and Gholdengo; it also creates permanent progress by removing Heavy-Duty Boots from foes such as Toxapex, opening them up to hazard damage.

Alolan Ninetales is an essential partner to Alolan Sandslash, not only setting snow to shore up Alolan Sandslash’s Defense and allowing it to take advantage of Slush Rush but also putting up Aurora Veil to allow Alolan Sandslash to easily enter the field. Moreover, Alolan Ninetales handles the Fighting-types such as Urshifu-R and Great Tusk that Alolan Sandslash is extremely weak to. With a Nasty Plot + Encore set, Alolan Ninetales can also take advantage of and remove Dondozo, Toxapex, Calm Mind Clefable, and Iron Defense Corviknight. Baxcalibur makes an excellent pairing with Alolan Sandslash, greatly appreciating Alolan Sandslash eliminating targets such as Flutter Mane and Alolan Ninetales and removing entry hazards to allow it to sweep unimpeded. Choice Band Chien-Pao is another teammate that appreciates Alolan Sandslash pressuring Fairy-types, clearing entry hazards, and generally softening up the opposing team so it can avoid being chipped down over the course of a game and easily clean. In exchange, Chien-Pao can threaten Corviknight and Kingambit. Froslass absorbs Fighting-type moves for Alolan Sandslash and enjoys it removing Heavy-Duty Boots from foes such as Toxapex, Quagsire, and Empoleon via Knock Off, rendering them vulnerable to Froslass’s Spikes. Smack Down Mamoswine similarly appreciates Alolan Sandslash’s Knock Off with regard to its Stealth Rock and can take out Corviknight, which otherwise walls Alolan Sandslash. Frosmoth values Alolan Sandslash bringing down Articuno and Flutter Mane, while in return threatening the pesky Quagsire, Great Tusk, and Ursaluna-B. Cetitan and Cloyster are other examples of Ice-type sweepers that massively benefit from Alolan Sandslash clearing entry hazards prior to their setup.

Clefable.comments:
Other Options

Clefable can use a combination of Unaware and Heavy-Duty Boots to bluff Magic Guard as well as beat other setup sweepers like Volcarona and Azumarill. However, this leaves Clefable vulnerable to Toxic from Pokemon like Toxapex and Clodsire.

Calm Mind.description:
Boasting a great ability and various coverage options, Clefable cements itself as a great bulky setup sweeper on Fairy teams, threatening hard-to-beat Pokemon like Corviknight, Toxapex, and Gliscor. Moonblast provides a reliable and powerful STAB move that hits neutral targets such as Gastrodon, Mamoswine, and Ogerpon-W. Alternatively, Ice Beam may be used to hit Ground- and Flying-type Pokemon like Clodsire, Zapdos, and Gliscor. Thunderbolt threatens the aforementioned Corviknight, Toxapex, and Empoleon as well as Articuno, Moltres, and Manaphy. Flamethrower may be used to hit Steel-types such as Gholdengo and Scizor; it should also be noted that Clefable survives a Bullet Punch from Choice Band Scizor and OHKOes it back. Magic Guard notably offers Clefable an extremely valuable immunity to entry hazards due to the Fairy type's lack of entry hazard removal, in addition to negating Toxic from Toxapex, Gliscor, and Clodsire and letting Clefable use Life Orb without recoil, enhancing its setup ability. Furthermore, Magic Guard allows Clefable to combat Alolan Muk more effectively, and Life Orb enables valuable damage rolls like 2HKOing Toxapex with unboosted Thunderbolt, 2HKOing Assault Vest Iron Hands using Moonblast after a Calm Mind, OHKOing Dragapult with Moonblast, and applying additional pressure on Quagsire. Leftovers can be condsidered to improve Clefable's survivability due to Moonlight's limited recovery and Clefable's mediocre bulk. The given EV spread allows Clefable to outpace Corviknight and maximizes its physical bulk, lessening the chance of Clefable being revenge killed once set up, and prevents Clefable from being 2HKO'ed by Choice Specs Dragapult's Shadow Ball.

Iron Valiant is an excellent teammate due to its ability to remove Steel-types like Heatran, Hisuian Goodra, and Iron Treads as well as weaken Clefable's checks like Articuno and Clodsire. Iron Valiant also provides setup opportunities for Clefable via Trick, hindering walls like Gastrodon and Heavy Slam Ting-Lu. In return, Clefable wears down Flying-types like Corviknight, Moltres, and Gliscor as well as Poison-types such as Toxapex and Amoonguss. Klefki provides dual screens support to aid in Clefable's Calm Mind setup, deters setup sweepers such as Scizor and Ogerpon-W with Foul Play, and sets up Spikes to wear down foes like Alolan Muk. Azumarill is a major asset in the Ground, Fire, and Steel matchups, threatening Clodsire, Hisuian Arcanine, and Gholdengo as well as aiding in the Poison matchup by removing walls like Alolan Muk and Galarian Slowking. Flutter Mane aids in the Ghost matchup, taking out threats like Gholdengo and Ceruledge and eliminating threats such as Articuno and Volcarona with Power Gem and Okidogi and Clodsire with Psyshock. In return, Flutter Mane appreciates Clefable chipping down Toxapex, Gliscor, and specially defensive Corviknight. Hatterene takes on Poison-types such as Sneasler and Okidogi as well as threatening Gastrodon and Barraskewda via Giga Drain and can free up a moveslot for Clefable to use Thunderbolt if using Mystical Fire. Tinkaton offers a Poison-type immunity, Stealth Rock support, and the removal of roadblocks like Galarian Slowking, Articuno, Hatterene, and Alolan Muk. Furthermore, Tinkaton aids in Clefable's setup via Knock Off and Encore by taking away passive healing from Pokemon like Clodsire, Alolan Muk, and Iron Treads and locking walls into moves. Choice Scarf Enamorus provides a Ground-type immunity and various anti-Steel coverage options to combat Hisuian Goodra Gholdengo, and Heatran as well as provides Healing Wish support to give Clefable more setup opportunities late-game.

Sun Setter.description:
Ninetales offers the sun's blessing to its teammates and utility with Healing Wish and Encore. The chosen STAB move is a tradeoff between power and consistency; Flamethrower trades a slightly lower Base Power for consistency, making it the preferred option. Solar Beam deals with Water-type foes such as Urshifu-R, Swampert, and Hisuian Samurott. With Healing Wish, Ninetales allows safe entry to any sweeper on the field, while Encore punishes entry hazard setters and setup sweepers such as Zamazenta, Primarina, and Ceruledge.

Gouging Fire is a natural teammate to Ninetales thanks to Protosynthesis, which provides it with a pseudo-Choice Scarf, transforming its Choice Band set into a formidable wallbreaker that can OHKO most foes that are not Fire-resistant such as Gliscor, Landorus, and Galarian Moltres. After a boost, Ogerpon-H also benefits greatly from sun both offensively, with Ivy Cudgel dealing with bulky threats such as Iron Hands, Gliscor, and Mandibuzz, and defensively by reducing the damage from Water-type moves, which can turn Ogerpon-H into a potent wincon with its Grass-type STAB moves in the non-weather variants of the Water and Ground matchups. Other popular teammates include Swords Dance Ceruledge and Air Balloon Heatran, both of which bring valuable immunities to the team and can help in certain matchups such as Ground, Fighting, and Dragon by targeting specific threats like Clodsire, Earthquake Hippowdon, Gouging Fire, and Zamazenta. Furthermore, Ceruledge, after a Swords Dance, takes out Iron Boulder with Shadow Sneak while Heatran handles Flutter Mane and Toxapex with Heavy Slam and Magma Storm, respectively, and can set Stealth Rock up. Volcarona also reaps quite a few benefits for both its offensive and defensive variants, taking less damage from Water-type moves and getting access to sun-boosted Morning Sun, which makes it possible for Volcarona to set up on Keldeo as well as Greninja in the Dark matchup. Lastly, Ninetales appreciates having Cinderace as a teammate to avoid unnecessary chip damage from hazards when setting up sun thanks to Court Change.

Choice Scarf.description:
Ninetales is a great asset to Fire teams, setting up sun to boost its teammates' wallbreaking or sweeping abilities or using Healing Wish to re-enable its weakened offensive teammates. Aside from this, with a Choice Scarf, Ninetales is able to outspeed and threaten the likes of Choice Scarf Great Tusk and non-Choice Scarf Iron Treads. With Will-O-Wisp, Ninetales is able to weaken physical attackers such as Kingambit, Zamazenta, and Dragonite. Solar Beam allows Ninetales to threaten the likes of Gastrodon, Quagsire, Barraskewda, and Rotom-W, which all resist its Fire-type STAB attacks. With Encore, Ninetales can force out passive Pokemon to create an opportunity to freely switch out into one of its teammates, as well as lock Pokemon like Baxcalibur and Iron Defense Zamazenta into their setup moves.

Setup sweepers such as Volcarona and Ceruledge are two of the biggest beneficiaries of Ninetales's sun, boosting their Fire-type STAB moves to great levels. In return, they can threaten Kommo-o and Flutter Mane with Psychic and Poltergeist, respectively. Sun's boost to Bitter Blade can also increase Ceruledge's longevity. Ogerpon-H's part Grass-typing allows it to match up well against Pokemon Ninetales struggles with, such as Gliscor, Heatran, and Empoleon. Because Ninetales is susceptible to entry hazards, hazard removal from the likes of Cinderace and Talonflame is appreciated. Talonflame's typing also allows it to check various Ground-types such as Gliscor and Iron Treads for Ninetales. Heatran is another great teammate, as with a combination of Taunt and Magma Storm, it is able to trap and remove walls Ninetales struggles with like Toxapex. It can also provide Stealth Rock in order to aid both Ninetales and its teammates. Volcanion's Water immunity allows it to check the likes of Azumarill and Basculegion. Infernape and Hisuian Arcanine appreciate Ninetales's sun to boost their Flare Blitz to explosive levels, as well as its ability to remove Quagsire with Solar Beam. Infernape in particular greatly appreciates Healing Wish support due to the damage it takes from Flare Blitz. In return, Infernape is able to match up well against Dark-types that can pick off Ninetales such as Kingambit, while Hisuian Arcanine handles Flying-types such as both Moltres formes. Choice Specs Iron Moth becomes a terrifying wallbreaker under sun, and with the boost to its Overheat, can OHKO non-Assault Vest Iron Hands and Alolan Muk, although the latter requires prior Stealth Rock damage.

Snow Support (Ice).description:
Alolan Ninetales is a great support Pokemon for Ice teams thanks to its ability to set snow and Aurora Veil to make its team much harder to take down as well as facilitate its teammates' sweeping attempts with Encore. In addition, its typing and Speed tier lets it hit otherwise troublesome Fighting-types such as Kommo-o, Urshifu-R, and Great Tusk. Freeze-Dry is useful against Water teams, being able to threaten Pelipper and Quagsire out and win the weather war against rain. Moonblast is useful against the ubiquitous Fighting- and Dragon-types in the tier, as it hits Pokemon such as Great Tusk, Baxcalibur, and Kommo-o that are otherwise problems for Ice teams. Encore allows Alolan Ninetales to lock a defensive Pokemon, such as Toxapex, into a weak move or a setup sweeper, such as Iron Defense Corviknight, into a stat-boosting move, letting Alolan Ninetales's teammates take care of the aforementioned Pokemon.

Baxcalibur is an amazing teammate for Alolan Ninetales, as it is an incredibly dangerous sweeper that can run through teams after one Swords Dance or Dragon Dance, which is easily facilitated by Alolan Ninetales's snow and Aurora Veil. It also appreciates Alolan Ninetales giving it setup opportunities thanks to Encore and eliminating Quagsire thanks to Freeze-Dry. Alolan Ninetales appreciates Baxcalibur's ability to switch in on Fire-type moves and gain an Attack boost for itself, as well as run through Poison and Steel teams. Chien-Pao provides wallbreaking power or clean-up potential depending on its set while also hitting Steel-types such as Heatran, Kingambit, and Empoleon with a strong Sacred Sword. It appreciates Alolan Ninetales's ability to hit Fighting-types. Mamoswine can threaten Fire-types like Heatran and Torkoal with Earthquake, while packing Thick Fat for a pseudo-Fire neutrality. Additionally, it sets Stealth Rock, which can help Alolan Ninetales pick off weakened threats such as Baxcalibur. It also appreciates the bulk boost in snow. Cetitan is a great partner, as Slush Rush allows it to outspeed and OHKO most of the metagame after a Belly Drum boost, which is easier to acquire thanks to snow and Aurora Veil from Alolan Ninetales. Alolan Sandslash appreciates snow and Aurora Veil both bolstering its bulk and Slush Rush doubling its Speed. In exchange, Alolan Sandslash can use Rapid Spin to clear entry hazards and deal with Hatterene and Flutter Mane, which can both take advantage of Alolan Ninetales. It can also threaten Fire, Steel, and Poison teams with Earthquake. Cloyster brings a lot to the table: namely another Fire neutrality, a way to hit Fire-types such as Talonflame and Ceruledge thanks to Rock Blast and Water-type coverage, and a high Defense stat that makes it nearly unbreakable in snow. In return, Alolan Ninetales facilitates Cloyster's Shell Smash thanks to Aurora Veil and snow support. It also appreciates Alolan Ninetales locking defensive answers to Cloyster, such as Toxapex and Corviknight, into unfavorable moves. Avalugg is a defensive behemoth that, when under snow and Aurora Veil, takes on almost every physical attacker in the tier. It can also remove Stealth Rock with Rapid Spin to improve Alolan Ninetales's lacking longevity. Finally, Frosmoth becomes a dangerous sweeping threat under snow and Aurora Veil thanks to Quiver Dance, letting it potentially win the Ground, Flying, and Fairy matchups.

Choice Band (Rock).description:
Hisuian Arcanine is a terrifying wallbreaker capable of threatening Steel- and Grass-types due to its strong STAB moves and supporting ability, great coverage, and Fire typing, helping Rock teams combat the aforementioned type matchups. Notably, it lives all of Meowscarada's attacks and +2 Scizor's Bullet Punch. Rock Head allows Hisuian Arcanine to freely use Head Smash and Flare Blitz without their recoil damage. Head Smash is an immensely powerful move, enabling Hisuian Arcanine to 2HKO Toxapex and defensive Landorus-T after Intimidate. Flare Blitz threatens Amoonguss, Corviknight, and Toedscruel, while breaking through Steel teams in general with ease in conjunction with Close Combat. Close Combat provides coverage for Hisuian Goodra, Ursaluna, and Heatran, while also fighting off Dark-types such as Ting-Lu and non-Choice Scarf Hisuian Samurott. Extreme Speed allows Hisuian Arcanine to revenge kill faster opponents like weakened Greninja, Azumarill, and Breloom.

Lycanroc appreciates Hisuian Arcanine threatening walls like Toxapex, Corviknight, and Amoonguss; in return, Lycanroc deals with Hydreigon and Greninja under sand. Garganacl is one of Hisuian Arcanine's best teammates due to its ability to force progress against Water and Steel, notably wearing down Quagsire, Gastrodon, and Quaquaval with Salt Cure. Glimmora forms a potent wallbreaking core with Hisuian Arcanine, taking on Grass and Fairy teams effectively. Furthermore, Glimmora provides entry hazard control with Mortal Spin and sets its own array of hazards to wear down Hisuian Arcanine's switch-ins. In return, Glimmora appreciates Hisuian Arcanine removing Steel-types for it so it can freely use Mortal Spin. Tyranitar provides sandstorm to help chip down opponents and improve Hisuian Arcanine's special bulk, making it trickier to shut down, as well as sets Stealth Rock and spreads paralysis with Thunder Wave to help Hisuian Arcanine outpace and OHKO faster offensive Pokemon. Kleavor provides Stealth Rock with Stone Axe and pivots into Hisuian Arcanine with U-turn, as well as providing additional support in the Steel matchup by hitting Gholdengo, Iron Treads, and Heatran with either Night Slash or Close Combat. Shell Smash Drednaw is a great asset in the Water and Ground matchups due to Swift Swim and Air Balloon, heavily weakening those types for Hisuian Arcanine. In return, Drednaw appreciates Amoonguss and Toxapex being removed by Hisuian Arcanine.

Choice Scarf (Rock).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Choice Scarf (Fire).description: This is a sample set as we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Substitute + 3 Attacks (Rock).description:
Hisuian Arcanine makes for a strong offensive threat on Rock teams by virtue of its extremely strong STAB options in Flare Blitz and Head Smash, now freely spammable thanks to its Rock Head ability, which allows it to threaten various Pokemon that Rock teams can struggle with, like Corviknight, Skarmory, and Sinistcha. With Substitute, it takes advantage of passive Pokemon like Amoonguss and Articuno, which can give Hisuian Arcanine the potential to snowball through slower teams. Close Combat is useful coverage that threatens Steel- and Rock-types such as Hisuian Goodra, Heatran, and Tyranitar.

Choice Scarf Kleavor makes for a great teammate, being able to set up entry hazards with Stone Axe, threaten the likes of Ogerpon-H and Dragapult with its STAB and coverage, and pivot Hisuian Arcanine in on walls it struggles with, like Corviknight and Amoonguss, with U-turn. Glimmora can set up a wide array of entry hazards in Stealth Rock, Spikes, and Toxic Spikes while also spreading status and removing hazards with Mortal Spin in case Hisuian Arcanine loses its Heavy-Duty Boots. Ogerpon-C forms a great offensive pairing with Hisuian Arcanine, threatening Water-types such as Swampert and Primarina while appreciating Skarmory, Sinistcha, and Gholdengo being taken out in return. Choice Scarf Iron Boulder provides great speed control, and with its part-Psychic typing it threatens Fighting-types such as Iron Valiant, Sneasler, and Keldeo. Terrakion and Rhyperior make for great partners for Hisuian Arcanine, with Terrakion handling Toxapex and Archaludon while Rhyperior's colorful coverage threatens the likes of Scizor, Dragonite, and Landorus-T. Lastly, Hisuian Arcanine's wallbreaking opens up opportunities for Iron Boulder and Shell Smash Minior to clean late-game.

Choice Band (Fire).description:
Hisuian Arcanine makes a name for itself even among the intense firepower of Fire teams with its Rock Head ability and high base-power STAB moves in Flare Blitz and Head Smash, the former of which can break through even targets that resist it like Garchomp and Rotom-W when sun-boosted. Head Smash aids Hisuian Arcanine in matchups against types that resist Fire such as Water and Dragon, 2HKOing some of their bulkiest walls like Dondozo, Toxapex, and Garchomp. Hisuian Arcanine also nets OHKOs on Dragon threats such as Dragonite, aiding in the type matchup greatly. Extreme Speed allows Hisuian Arcanine to pick off weakened, faster foes like Iron Valiant and Greninja. Close Combat can hit bulky Rock-types such as Garganacl and Tyranitar, as well as Flash Fire Heatran. Wild Charge is used for consistent damage against bulky Water-types, often providing equal or greater damage to Head Smash while also not risking the shaky accuracy.

Sporting a Choice Band leaves Hisuian Arcanine vulnerable to Stealth Rock and Sticky Web so hazard control from the likes of Cinderace and Torkoal is greatly appreciated. Torkoal also sets up sun with its Drought ability, strengthening Hisuian Arcanine and its allies' Fire-type attacks and reducing the threat of incoming Water-type moves. Ninetales is an alternative Drought user with a much higher Speed tier and a pool of utility options like Healing Wish to further support Hisuian Arcanine. Ogerpon-H, Ninetales, and Cinderace can all work in tandem to overwhelm shared checks in bulky Water-types like Toxapex and Rotom-W and other Fire-resistant foes such as Garchomp, Heatran, and Raging Bolt. Ogerpon-H specifically makes use of its Grass-type STAB moves to threaten Water- and Rock-types and Mold Breaker to target Flash Fire Heatran. Volcanion provides a crucial immunity to Water, greatly improving the matchup against Water-types faster than Hisuian Arcanine such as Urshifu-R, Greninja, and Aqua Jet Azumarill. Rotom-H and Talonflame can pivot into Ground-type attacks, the latter of the two also serving as entry hazard control for Hisuian Arcanine and tackling threats like Iron Valiant and Ogerpon-W. Heatran is a crucial answer to Choice Specs Flutter Mane, which otherwise spells doom for any team with Drought granting it a Protosynthesis boost; specially defensive Heatran easily tanks hits from Flutter Mane and OHKO it with Heavy Slam while also setting up Stealth Rock and trapping passive nuisances like Toxapex with its combination of Magma Storm and Earth Power. Ceruledge can pivot into predicted Fighting-type moves for Hisuian Arcanine while also taking advantage of Hisuian Arcanine taking out opposing sweepers like Dragonite and weakened Greninja. Choice Scarf Iron Moth's Speed allows it to take on threats that are faster than and threaten to OHKO Hisuian Arcanine like Hydreigon and Iron Valiant.

Tentacruel.overview:
Poison

Tentacruel is a surprising option on Poison teams, as Toxapex's incredible bulk and longevity completely outclass it as a defensive wall in a majority of situations. However, Tentacruel has enough unique tools such that it could be worth considering over Toxapex should a more proactive Water-type threat be needed.
Tentacruel.comments:
Other Options

Water

Knock Off synergizes well with Tentacruel's entry hazard-stacking, as it removes Heavy-Duty Boots from users such as Dragapult and Brambleghast. However, some of Tentacruel's teammates like Hisuian Samurott commonly run Knock Off as well. Protect allows Tentacruel to scout moves from Choice-locked Pokemon like Greninja, Meowscarada, and Gholdengo, but this comes at the cost of sacrificing some of Tentacruel's valuable role compression. Haze allows Tentacruel to better deal with Primarina and Sinistcha, but the limited amount of specific foes Haze targets is small enough that it isn't worth running over its main moves.

Poison

Ice Beam can be used over Knock Off and Protect to give Tentacruel more offensive pressure, allowing it to check threats like Adamant Dragonite after chip damage and Gliscor. Toxic can be used with Tentacruel's Speed to spread poison before going down.

Real Squid [Rapid Spin] (Poison).description:
Tentacruel finds a niche on Poison teams thanks to a flurry of unique traits over its competition in Toxapex such as a vastly superior Speed stat and tools such as Rapid Spin, which makes Tentacruel the only form of entry hazard removal on Poison teams not weak to Steel-type attacks, allowing it to comfortably spin against foes such as Corviknight and Empoleon. Flip Turn allows Tentacruel to easily pivot out on foes such as Hisuian Samurott, Terapagos, and Gliscor. Knock Off is used in the final slot as a solid progress-making option, removing items from foes such as Skarmory and Gholdengo. However, Protect can be used to gain Black Sludge recovery and scout moves from foes. The defensive EVs for each spread provide different defensive benefits; the physically defensive spread with a Timid nature allows Tentacruel to survive an Earthquake from Gliscor and Dragonite, while the specially defensive spread with a Calm nature allows it to beat offensive Heatran and Iron Moth with Surf along with being able to reliably use Knock Off against Flutter Mane. The Speed EVs for both spreads allow Tentacruel to outspeed fully invested Pokemon with base 85 Speed such as Ceruledge, Terapagos, and Kleavor, allowing Tentacruel to reliably pivot out against them or threaten them with Surf and Knock Off.

Amoonguss serves as a solid defensive complement to Tentacruel, being able to handle Ground- and Electric-types such as Great Tusk, Sandy Shocks, and Rotom-W along with putting foes to sleep with Spore, allowing Tentacruel to come in safely and use Rapid Spin. Pecharunt provides solid defensive support by taking on powerful physical attackers like Azumarill, Gouging Fire, and Hisuain Arcanine. Overqwil enjoys Tentacruel's entry hazard removal not taking away Overqwil's hazards, and it supports Tentacruel by taking on threats such as Iron Boulder and Gallade. Alolan Muk handles special attackers such as Espathra, Flutter Mane, and Terapagos. Galarian Slowking can handle high-power special threats such as Zapdos, Latios, and Choice Specs Iron Moth. Iron Moth appreciates Tentacruel removing entry hazards and pivoting it in with Flip Turn; in response, it can handle threats such as Alolan Ninetales, Gholdengo, and Articuno. Galarian Weezing appreciates Tentacruel's Rapid Spin allowing it to drop Defog, and in return, it provides a proper Ground immunity with Levitate and can take on threats such as Garchomp, Dragonite, and Iron Hands with Will-O-Wisp and Strange Steam. Okidogi and Sneasler can threaten Steel- and Dark-types like Hisuian Goodra, Empoleon, Hisuian Samurott, and Hydreigon; Sneasler can pivot Tentacruel in safely via U-turn along with handling targets like Hoopa-U and Ogerpon-H, while Okidogi can use Bulk Up and beat threats such as Archaludon and Cloyster.

Rapid Spin (Water).description:
Tentacruel is one of Water's best forms of role compression, removing entry hazards thanks to its access to Rapid Spin, absorbing Toxic Spikes placed by Toxapex and indirectly by Glimmora with its Poison typing, and slow pivoting with Flip Turn. Aside from this, its great ability in Liquid Ooze allows it to punish the Ogerpon formes and Sinistcha, which target it with Horn Leech and Matcha Gotcha. Furthermore, its part-Poison typing gives Water teams an option against Grass- and Fairy-types such as Breloom and Azumarill. Toxic Spikes aids its more offensive-based teammates by afflicting status on incoming foes, and due to Tentacruel's great defensive typing, it finds many opportunities to set one layer of Toxic Spikes. Flip Turn allows it to serve as a great pivot, as with its rather low Speed, it is able to almost always get a teammate in safely. A Calm nature along with 240 Special Defense EVs allows it to survive 2 Earth Powers from Choice Scarf Enamorus and 2 Fickle Beams from Nasty Plot-boosted Hydrapple. Alternatively, a Bold nature along with 240 Defense EVs allows it to survive a Swords Dance-boosted Horn Leech from the Ogerpon formes and KO back, as well as 2 Flower Tricks from Meowscarada. 16 Speed EVs allow it to outspeed Adamant Breloom, effectively checking it.

Hisuian Samurott forms an entry hazard-stacking core with Tentacruel, placing Spikes with Ceaseless Edge while bypassing Taunt and threatening Dark- and Psychic-types that threaten Tentacruel such as Kingambit and Latios. In return, Tentacruel handles Fairy-types for Hisuian Samurott. Poison-types such as Sneasler, Pecharunt, and Toxapex can come in to absorb Tentacruel's Toxic Spikes. Hence, Greninja makes for a great teammate, checking those Poison-types while also threatening bulky Ground-types such as Great Tusk and Clodsire. When Tentacruel is running a physically defensive EV spread, it forms a great defensive pairing with specially bulky Pokemon such as Swampert and Primarina. Swampert provides an Electric immunity, Stealth Rock support, and pivoting via Flip Turn, while Primarina takes on Dragon-types such as Latios, Latias, and Roaring Moon. Alomomola forms a defensive core with Tentacruel, as well as providing Tentacruel recovery via Wish. Tentacruel's ability to spread status and slow pivot is appreciated by late-game sweepers such as Ogerpon-W, Keldeo, and Urshifu-R. Ogerpon-W takes on Landorus, while Keldeo and Urshifu-R break through Steel-types like Kingambit, Hisuian Goodra, and Empoleon. Rotom-W can switch in against Ground-types thanks to Levitate, and it also threatens common hazard removers like Corviknight and Great Tusk with its STAB moves.

Choice Band (Rock).description:
Choice Band lets Alolan Golem OHKO Kingambit with Brick Break.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Slowbro.comments:
Other Options

Psychic

Holding no item can be an option, as Slowbro is then able to wall Poltergeist and Knock Off users and has a better time checking them.

Physically Defensive (Psychic).description:
Slowbro is an essential pick for Psychic teams due to its physical bulk, which allows it to tank hits from Chien-Pao, Excadrill, and Meowscarada for the team. Body Press pairs nicely with Slowbro's Defense, dealing with Chien-Pao and Kingambit. Scald checks physical threats like Mamoswine and Excadrill while also having a chance to burn them in the process. Thunder Wave allows Slowbro to paralyze fast threats like Meowscarada, Roaring Moon, and Choice Scarf Kleavor that are troublesome to Psychic teams. Thunder Wave also synergizes with Scald, catching switches into potential Scald-resistant foes. Iron Defense can be run over Thunder Wave to help take on Gouging Fire better, but doing so means that Slowbro is unable to spread paralysis to troublesome foes. Colbur Berry is a great item, allowing Slowbro to tank a hit from a Dark-type attack, including +2 Crunch from Chien-Pao and +2 Kowtow Cleave from Kingambit with five Supreme Overlord boosts, and retaliate with Body Press. Eject Button can be used over Colbur Berry to allow Slowbro to act as a pivot for the team. Additionally, after using the Eject Button, Slowbro can take Poltergeist from Ceruledge and Knock Off from Roaring Moon. 248 HP EVs are used to allow Slowbro to get the best use out of Regenerator.

Choice Scarf Iron Boulder is a great teammate for Slowbro, outspeeding and taking out threats like the Ogerpon formes, Greninja, and Meowscarada with Mighty Cleave and Close Combat. Assault Vest Hoopa-U tanks special attacks from troublesome Ghost- and Dark-types like Flutter Mane, Gholdengo, and Greninja and takes them out with Knock Off and Drain Punch. Hatterene eases the matchup against Dark and Dragon teams with Draining Kiss while also preventing entry hazards and status from being set thanks to Magic Bounce. Hatterene can also run Nuzzle to spread paralysis to threats, which can let Slowbro opt for Iron Defense instead of Thunder Wave. Choice Band Metagross deals with Fairy-types like Flutter Mane, Enamorus, and Iron Valiant with Bullet Punch. Metagross also provides entry hazard support via Stealth Rock to break a potential Focus Sash held by Ceruledge. Choice Scarf Latias takes out Choice Specs Dragapult and Choice Specs Hydreigon with Draco Meteor and can also Choice lock walls with Choice Scarf via Trick. Gallade helps Slowbro by handling walls such as Hisuian Goodra, Alolan Muk, and Blissey with Sacred Sword. Indeedee-M provides an immunity to Ghost, an immunity to priority moves via Psychic Surge, and Healing Wish support that gives Slowbro a second chance to wall out physical threats. Indeedee-M also provides utility with Trick, as it can Choice lock walls like Sableye and Ting-Lu by giving them a Choice item. In return, Slowbro deals with Chien-Pao, Kingambit, and Excadrill, which Indeedee-M can't take on by itself. Espathra becomes a threatening wincon for Slowbro's team once Dark-types have been dealt with. Calm Mind Latios is a nice teammate for Slowbro, taking out threats like Landorus, Clodsire, and Ursaluna-B via Luster Purge and Ice Beam.

Nasty Plot (Psychic).description:
48 Speed EVs may be used if using Psychic to outspeed Toxapex.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Muk-Alola.comments:
Other Options

Dark

Rock Slide can be a solid option, removing Volcarona and Frosmoth, which prove problematic for Dark teams, but its shaky accuracy can be a deterrence, along with making it vulnerable to Steel-types like Heatran and Hisuian Goodra.

Poison

Rock Slide can be used over Poison Jab, as it can reliably check Volcarona and Frosmoth as well as threaten Zapdos without risking paralysis from Static.

Specially Defensive (Dark).description:
Alolan Muk is an amazing defensive part of Dark teams thanks to its part Poison typing, granting a solid neutrality to the Dark-type's weaknesses, which can provide comfort against Choice Specs threats like Iron Valiant and Flutter Mane. Poison Jab provides solid damage into the multitude of Fairy-types in the tier like Choice Specs Iron Valiant, Primarina, and Hatterene. Poison Jab also pairs nicely with Poison Touch, giving Alolan Muk an incredible chance to inflict poison against common switch-ins like Great Tusk and Rotom-W. Knock Off helps Alolan Muk to make progress against threats like Iron Moth and Kyurem. Drain Punch gives Alolan Muk both a form of recovery and a tool to break down Steel-type threats like Heatran and Hisuian Goodra while also preventing it from being set up on by Chien-Pao and Kingambit. Finally, Protect can allow for Alolan Muk to scout Choice-locked threats like Meowscarada and Latias while getting Black Sludge recovery.

Mandibuzz provides a solid complement to Alolan Muk, being able to come in on the Ground-types that naturally threaten Alolan Muk like Garchomp, Hippowdon, and Swampert thanks to its Flying typing along with using Defog to remove entry hazards so Alolan Muk can get the most out of its Black Sludge recovery. Mandibuzz also takes advantage of setup sweepers like Scizor and Ogerpon-W that can easily set up on Alolan Muk with Foul Play. Sableye also greatly benefits Alolan Muk by being able to handle the powerful physical Fighting-type threats like Great Tusk, Sneasler, and Zamazenta thanks to its Ghost typing and Will-O-Wisp. Both Mandibuzz and Sableye majorly appreciate Alolan Muk's ability to tank Moonblast from the likes of Iron Valiant and Flutter Mane, in addition to its Toxic immunity. Chien-Pao greatly benefits Alolan Muk, being able to outspeed and remove threats like non-Choice Scarf Sneasler, Clodsire, and Landorus with ease while appreciating Alolan Muk's Poison Jab hindering switch-ins with poison and Knock Off removing Heavy-Duty Boots from foes. Kingambit appreciates Alolan Muk's ability to take on Primarina and Choice Specs Iron Valiant, which majorly threaten Kingambit, along with Alolan Muk's ability to threaten poisoning bulky targets like Torkoal, putting them on timers. Alolan Muk complements Ting-Lu's hazard stacking capabilities by being able to remove Heavy-Duty Boots. Both Meowscarada and Greninja assist Alolan Muk by removing Ground-types like Hippowdon, non-Choice Scarf Great Tusk, and Ting-Lu. Meowscarada helps threaten out the several Water-type threats of the tier like Keldeo and Urshifu-R thanks to its powerful Flower Trick, along with catching several problematic Fighting- and Dragon-types like mixed Iron Valiant and Roaring Moon with Play Rough. Greninja's powerful Water-type STAB attacks can wash away problematic Fire-types like Choice Band Hisuian Arcanine and Choice Specs Iron Moth with minimal issues, and it can use Extrasensory to cleanly remove Okidogi and non-Choice Scarf Sneasler. Hydreigon can break past physical walls like Toxapex and Skarmory that are too bulky for Alolan Muk. Alolan Muk appreciates Hydreigon's Levitate making it able to easily come in against threats like Swampert and Hippowdon, while Hydreigon appreciates Alolan Muk's ability to deter Fairy-types like Enamorus and Alolan Ninetales.

Specially Defensive (Poison).description:
Alolan Muk serves a critical role on Poison teams thanks to its immense special bulk and Dark typing, allowing it to switch in and threaten out several Psychic- and Ghost-types like Espathra, Galarian Slowking, Flutter Mane, and Hisuian Zoroark with ease. Knock Off deals with the aforementioned Psychic- and Ghost-types while removing crucial held items from the likes of Blissey, Swampert, and Archaludon. Drain Punch provides Alolan Muk with a solid recovery tool and gives it coverage for Dark- and Steel-type threats such as Hydreigon, Greninja, and Heatran. Poison Jab provides a decently consistent option of spreading poison when paired with Poison Touch while dealing with foes such as Hatterene and Primarina reliably. Curse can be used to let Alolan Muk act as a win condition as well as allowing it to comfortably take on physical threats like Ceruledge. Rest provides a form of recovery, letting Alolan Muk stick around longer against bulkier teams. If it's running Rest, Sleep Talk can be used over Protect to prevent Alolan Muk from being too passive during its sleep turns.

Physically defensive Amoonguss is an incredible partner for Alolan Muk thanks to its Ground neutrality, Water resistance, and Grass-type STAB moves, as it can handle the Ground- and Water-type threats that would normally feast on Alolan Muk like Great Tusk, Gastrodon, and Urshifu-R without much worry. Galarian Weezing provides a crucial form of entry hazard removal, allowing Alolan Muk to get the most out of its Black Sludge recovery while also checking Dragon-type foes like Dragonite and Roaring Moon. Physically defensive Toxapex can handle threats such as Kleavor and Mimikyu thanks to Haze and Toxic. Overqwil can pair well with Alolan Muk, creating a Dark-type core for Poison teams, with Overqwil handling physical Ghost- and Psychic-type threats such as Ceruledge, Gallade, and Iron Boulder. Furthermore, Overqwil can set Spikes while Alolan Muk can use Knock Off to remove Heavy-Duty Boots, along with taking on special threats like Flutter Mane, Spectrier, and Indeedee. Both Galarian Slowking and Clodsire complement Alolan Muk as fellow special walls, as Assault Vest Galarian Slowking handles threats such as Enamorus, Iron Moth, and Latios as well as creating pressure with Future Sight, while Alolan Muk helps deal with the Ghost-types that would normally threaten it. Unaware Clodsire deals with setup sweepers like Gholdengo, Volcarona, and Sneasler while providing entry hazards, which can put pressure on them after Alolan Muk removes their Heavy-Duty Boots. Iron Moth can break past the Steel-type threats and physical walls that Alolan Muk is unable to dent such as Scizor, Skarmory, and Amoonguss. Okidogi and Sneasler strongly appreciate Alolan Muk's Psychic immunity, and in return, they handle threats such as Kingambit, Hisuian Goodra, and Ogerpon-C, which otherwise cause significant issues for Alolan Muk.

Shell Smash Sweeper (Ice).description:
Cloyster is one of Ice's best setup sweepers thanks to its access to Shell Smash in addition to its high Defense stat, which gives it opportunity to set up on the tier's physical attackers like Garchomp, Iron Treads, and Ceruledge. Icicle Spear targets opposing Flying-, Ground- and Dragon-type Pokemon such as Kilowattrel, Clodsire, and Walking Wake while breaking Focus Sash on Pokemon such as Breloom. Rock Blast benefits from Skill Link and threatens Fire-types like Ceruledge after a boost and other Ice-type Pokemon like Chien-Pao. Ice Shard is useful for revenge killing faster Choice Scarf Pokemon that are weakened like Flutter Mane, Meowscarada, and Roaring Moon. Hydro Pump is the alternative in order to not be walled by opposing Steel-types like Kingambit and Forretress. It is also beneficial for threatening Paldean Tauros-F, which is a significant issue to Ice teams, as well as Skeledirge and Torkoal, easing the Fire matchup. Maximum Speed investment with a Jolly nature allows +2 Cloyster to outspeed Choice Scarf users such as Walking Wake, Hydreigon and Indeedee; a Naive nature with the remaining 4 EVs going into Special Attack should be used if opting for Hydro Pump to not reduce its damage. Skill Link is the best ability to run on Cloyster since it guarantees Icicle Spear and Rock Blast hit 5 times. White Herb is Cloyster's preferred item, as it is able to offset the Defense drops of Shell Smash, which makes Cloyster harder to revenge kill. Focus Sash is the alternative to always guarantee one turn of setup from full health, but it is less preferred since Cloyster is harder to OHKO under snow or Aurora Veil.

Cloyster's best partner on Ice is Abomasnow. Abomasnow allows Cloyster to have an easier time to set up thanks to it setting snow, which, combined with Aurora Veil, allows it to set up on Pokemon that can usually threaten it out like offensive Great Tusk and Cinderace. Abomasnow also has Leech Seed support to improve Cloyster's longevity and handles Unaware Pokemon Quagsire and Dondozo with its STAB Giga Drain. Cloyster is able to threaten Fire's weather setter Torkoal after a boost, which benefits Abomasnow, as it can come back in to reset the weather for its teammates. Cloyster also appreciates Chien-Pao as an offensive partner, as Swords Dance sets are able to weaken its defensive checks like Toxapex, Kingambit and Rotom-W. Choice Scarf sets are also able to clean up late-game more easily thanks to Cloyster's sweeping. Baxcalibur is also one more offensive partner for Cloyster, as its ability to switch into Will-o-Wisp from Pokemon like Sableye and Rotom-W supports Cloyster's sweeping capabilities, while Cloyster offers additional support against the Dragon-types that threaten Baxcalibur like Dragonite, Roaring Moon, and Hydreigon. Choice Band Baxcalibur can also wear down defensive walls like Corviknight and Skeledirge, which gives Cloyster an easier sweep. Glaceon also pairs well with Cloyster, as it can threaten defensive Water-type Pokemon like Toxapex, Rotom-W, and Dondozo with Freeze-Dry. Avalugg can support Cloyster with its Rapid Spin to remove hazards, so Cloyster can come in easier and set up. Avalugg is also able to handle Cloyster's offensive checks like Great Tusk under snow. Froslass is Ice's only viable option for Spikes, which Cloyster appreciates, as defensive Pokemon like Hatterene and Iron Hands aren't able to check it properly after a boost.

Shell Smash (Water).description:
Blizzard targets Archaludon, which is OHKOed after at least 2 layers of Spikes at +2.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Gengar.overview:
Poison

Gengar's amazing Special Attack and Speed along with its solid Ghost typing give it a solid offensive role. However, it has major competition in Iron Moth, which has overall superior utility thanks to its higher bulk and Special Attack, usually performing better against most types.
Gengar.comments:
Other Options

Poison

Energy Ball provides solid coverage, allowing Gengar to remove Ground-types like Swampert, Hippowdon, and Mamoswine.

Choice Specs (Poison).description:
Gengar finds a niche on Poison teams thanks to its secondary Ghost typing and unique coverage, allowing it to serve as a solid alternative to Iron Moth. Shadow Ball threatens Ghost- and Psychic-type Pokemon like Gholdengo, Pecharunt, and Hatterene. Thunderbolt provides solid coverage by hitting dangerous Flying- and Water-types like Corviknight, Pelipper, and Primarina. Focus Blast allows Gengar to deal with Dark-, Normal-, and Steel-type threats in Hydreigon, Ursaluna-B, Heatran, and Archaludon, while Dazzling Gleam provides a less risky option to hit Dark-types along with Dragon-types like Walking Wake. Finally, Trick allows Gengar to disrupt special walls like Alolan Muk, Iron Hands, and Ting-Lu by granting them a useless Choice Specs, along with Choice locking Kingambit, which can prove problematic for Poison teams. Icy Wind, however, has the solid role of removing Landorus and Gliscor, which pose significant threats to Poison teams.

Amoonguss can take hits from Water- and Ground-types that Gengar cannot handle such as Ogerpon-W, Swampert, and Great Tusk, along with using Spore to grant Gengar safe entry. Amoonguss can also use Foul Play to remove threats to Gengar such as Dragapult and Mimikyu. Galarian Weezing threatens potent Dark-types like Meowscarada, Ting-Lu, and Roaring Moon thanks to its Fairy-type STAB move and Will-O-Wisp. Galarian Weezing can also use Defog to remove entry hazards, ensuring Gengar stays healthy. Toxapex can handle priority from threats like Scizor, Mimikyu, and Lokix attempting to remove Gengar, along with being able to handle threats like Chien-Pao and Barraskewda. Overqwil pairs nicely with Gengar with its immense physical bulk, being able to take hits from fast physical Ghost- and Psychic-types such as Ceruledge, Iron Boulder, and Gallade. Overqwil's entry hazards also provide utility in chipping down special walls such as Hisuian Goodra and Ting-Lu, which can both prove problematic to Gengar. In return, Overqwil appreciates Gengar's Ghost typing allowing it to block Rapid Spin from the likes of Forretress and Tentacruel. Alolan Muk can handle special attacking Ghost- and Dark-type threats like Flutter Mane, Spectrier, Greninja, and Darkrai. Galarian Slowking can switch into revenge killers Gengar can struggle with, such as Choice Scarf Latias and Choice Scarf Enamorus, and threaten them back with its strong coverage moves. Both Sneasler and Okidogi can handle Dark-types like Alolan Muk, Hisuian Samurott, and Kingambit while appreciating Gengar removing Ghost- and Psychic-types like Gholdengo, Hatterene, and Slowbro. Choice Scarf Sneasler can also blitz past problematic foes such as Hoopa-U, Hisuian Goodra, and Chien-Pao without worry. Okidogi, meanwhile, appreciates Gengar weakening physical walls like Galarian Weezing, Toxapex, and Sableye that prevent it from setting up safely. In response, Okidogi can handle Dark-type menaces like Kingambit, Meowscarada, and Roaring Moon without any issues.

Toxic Spikes Lead (Ghost).description:
Gengar's solid Speed tier and its access to Toxic Spikes, Taunt, and Destiny Bond allow it to have a niche as a lead on Ghost teams. Setting up Toxic Spikes is Gengar's main objective, as the extra chip damage helps wear down Pokemon that would otherwise give Ghost teams lots of trouble, such as Ting-Lu and Porygon2. Taunt is used to prevent opposing leads from setting up their own entry hazards, such as Skarmory, Swampert, and Tinkaton. Destiny Bond can be used in tandem with Taunt to force foes to attack and secure a trade. Sludge Bomb allows Gengar to not be completely passive, as well as having a 50% chance to OHKO Hatterene, dissuading it from trying to block Toxic Spikes.

Toxic Spikes greatly helps offensive teammates muscle through bulkier foes. Spectrier appreciates its would-be checks getting worn down by poison damage, such as Porygon2 and Hoopa-U. Additionally, Spectrier can utilize Hex's double-damage effect immediately rather than having to spend a turn using Will-O-Wisp. The same goes for Dragapult which notably secures an OHKO on poisoned Choice Specs Flutter Mane. Ceruledge appreciates Gengar preventing foes from setting entry hazards with taunt, thus keeping its Focus Sash intact. In turn, Ceruledge can handle the Steel-type Pokemon that Gengar is useless against. Gholdengo's ability, Good as Gold, blocks Defog from the likes of Braviary and Mandibuzz. It is also yet another Pokemon that can use Hex to its fullest potential without having to spend a turn using Thunder Wave. Both Froslass and Brambleghast can stack additional hazards in spikes, ensuring that even foes unaffected by Toxic Spikes will still take some hazard damage.

Physically Defensive (Poison).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Physically Defensive Defogger (Poison).description:
Galarian Weezing finds itself serving a key role on Poison thanks to its high physical bulk, wonderful support moves, and, most critically, Levitate giving it a critical Ground immunity to deal with both offensive and defensive Ground-types, such as Great Tusk, Clodsire, and Mamoswine, without much worry. Its secondary Fairy typing is also a major boon for Poison, making it immune to Dragon, which gives it utility in absorbing high-powered Dragon-type moves like Outrage from Dragonite and completely checking Garchomp. It also provides a helpful resistance to Dark, giving it added bulk against Dark-types like Alolan Muk and Meowscarada. Strange Steam is used for its STAB attack, dealing solid damage and threatening Dragon-, Fighting-, and Dark-types such as Dragonite, Great Tusk, and Roaring Moon. Defog is incredibly valuable, being the only consistent form of entry hazard removal on Poison, which Galarian Weezing can easily switch in and use thanks to its immunity to Spikes and neutrality to Stealth Rock. This also allows it to run Black Sludge to further increase its longevity. Pain Split acts as a form of recovery and offensive pressure, allowing it to drain away health from opposing walls such as Toxapex and Gliscor while healing itself back up. Will-O-Wisp threatens physical attackers like those that it walls such as Great Tusk and Dragonite and impairs others that do threaten it like Iron Treads and Corviknight, making them much easier to handle.

Alolan Muk and Assault Vest Galarian Slowking are amazing teammates for Galarian Weezing that cover Galarian Weezing's biggest weakness: low Special Defense. As specially bulky tanks, they can switch into strong special attacks, such as Choice Specs Greninja's Extrasensory, while majorly appreciating Defog from Galarian Weezing to maximize their longevity. Alolan Muk handles Psychic- and Ghost-type attacks from foes like Flutter Mane, Spectrier, and Espathra with ease thanks to its Dark typing and STAB Knock Off. Meanwhile, Galarian Slowking can soak up hits from Heatran, Regieleki, and Volcarona while responding back with its myriad of coverage, as well as create traps with Future Sight, which Galarian Weezing can exploit with Strange Steam or use as a chance to Defog safely. Toxapex's Water typing allows it to switch into and wall the many Steel-types of the tier like Scizor, Tinkaton, and Empoleon. It also handles other powerful threats such as Chien-Pao and Ceruledge, using Haze to stop their setup and Infestation or Surf to do damage. Toxapex is also a valuable Knock Off absorber in the Dragon, Dark, and Ice matchups, preventing Galarian Weezing from losing its Black Sludge from foes such as Cyclizar, Sableye, and Alolan Sandslash. Amoonguss appreciates Galarian Weezing taking the stress off it in the Ground matchup and allowing for it to have a much easier time taking on threats, such as Great Tusk, Iron Treads, and Mamoswine, after they have been burned. Amoonguss is also able to handle threats to Galarian Weezing like Gastrodon and Sandy Shocks. Thanks to Defog allowing Salazzle safe entry, it can threaten every Steel-type in the tier with a mix of its STAB Flamethrower and Toxic thanks to Corrosion, which puts Steel-types that try to threaten it, such as Heatran and Hisuian Goodra, on timers, and it means Galarian Weezing won't have to worry about them late-game. Glimmora can be used instead of Salazzle, as it also can use Toxic thanks to Corrosion, has Earth Power to hit Heatran, has Energy Ball to help out against Ground-types, such as Great Tusk and Gastrodon, and if its Air Balloon is still intact, it can inflict Toxic onto Clodsire with no fear. With Defog support, Choice Scarf Sneasler can come onto the field safely and fire off its strong STAB Close Combat and Dire Claw against threats like Kingambit, Chien-Pao, and Enamorus. Okidogi also works well as a Fighting-type that majorly appreciates burn being spread to have an easier time setting up before tearing into threats like Kingambit and Heatran with its STAB moves. Defog support will also allow safe entry for Iron Moth, which melts Steel-types with its powerful Fire-type STAB attacks, such as Gholdengo, Iron Treads, and Corviknight, as well as being able to eradicate Landorus if using Choice Specs with Overheat. Gengar is another solid Choice Specs user that can scare out Skeledirge, which otherwise uses Galarian Weezing for setup and can also deal with Landorus with Icy Wind.

Chansey.overview: Chansey is outclassed by Blissey as a special wall due to Chansey's inability to hold Heavy-Duty Boots. This vulnerability to entry hazards negates the extra bulk Chansey has over Blissey, making it a suboptimal choice for Normal teams.

Defensive.description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Bulk Up (Fighting).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Physically Defensive (Flying).description:
Gyarados finds a unique spot on Flying-type teams due to its unique combination of Intimidate, ability to spread paralysis, and ability to phaze. Intimidate allows Gyarados to safely switch into physical threats such as Barraskewda and Mamoswine. Dragon Tail punishes setup sweepers such as Kingambit, Ceruledge, and Gouging Fire by forcing them to switch out. Thunder Wave allows Gyarados to slow down Choice Scarf users such as Roaring Moon and Enamorus, essentially making their Choice Scarf useless. Rest is Gyarados's only form of recovery, and it also allows it to act as a status absorber against moves such as Gliscor and Salazzle's Toxic. 24 Speed EVs allow Gyarados to outspeed non-Choice Scarf Flutter Mane while it is paralyzed.

Entry hazard setters such as Gliscor, both Landorus formes, and Skarmory are great teammates for Gyarados, as Dragon Tail racks up hazard damage on unsuspecting Pokemon. Additionally, Gliscor and Landorus can switch into Electric-type attacks from Pokemon that would otherwise make quick work of Gyarados. Tornadus-T can use Knock Off to remove Heavy-Duty Boots from foes, so Gyarados can rack up damage on them via Dragon Tail paired with the aforementioned hazard setters. Articuno is a nice defensive complement to Gyarados, as Articuno can switch into special moves from Pokemon like Dragapult, Kyurem, and Greninja. Articuno can also use Haze to stop setup Pokemon that Gyarados cannot phaze with Dragon Tail, such as Hatterene and Primarina. Choice Scarf Enamorus can outspeed and KO Choice Scarf users such as Meowscarada and Roaring Moon when they have been paralyzed by Thunder Wave. It can also use Healing Wish to bring Gyarados back to full HP without having to be immobile for two turns. Corviknight not only provides a Rock-type neutrality but also can remove hazards with Defog if Gyarados loses its Heavy-Duty Boots. Adamant Dragonite appreciates Gyarados's Thunder Wave support, as it outspeeds and OHKOes paralyzed Choice Specs Flutter Mane after one Dragon Dance.

Dragon Dance (Flying).description:
Gyarados finds many opportunities to set up Dragon Dance and sweep on Flying teams thanks to its great bulk and ability to force out foes thanks to Intimidate. Substitute allows Gyarados to take advantage of passive walls like Toxapex so that it can set up freely on them, while Taunt shuts down attempts to both inflict status on it and remove its boosts with Haze. Earthquake provides coverage against Poison- and Steel-types such as Toxapex, Clodsire, and Hisuian Goodra. 248 HP and 8 Defense EVs ensure that Gyarados's Substitute does not get broken by Clodsire's Poison Jab.

Landorus and Gliscor pair well with Gyarados, as with their Electric immunity, they can take on foes like Raging Bolt, Magnezone, and Regieleki. Additionally, Gliscor spreads status with Toxic, sets up entry hazards to aid in Gyarados's sweeping, and matches up well against several hazard removers like Excadrill, Glimmora, and Regieleki. Skarmory also sets up Spikes to aid Gyarados, and it can set up its IronPress combination on physically offensive threats such as Dragon Dance Dragapult and Mamoswine. Due to Gyarados's vulnerability to Stealth Rock, it appreciates hazard removal from Corviknight so that it finds more opportunities to switch in; Corviknight can also pivot Gyarados in with U-turn and aids against Choice Specs Kyurem. In return, Corviknight appreciates Gyarados taking on Fire-types such as Heatran and Volcarona. Choice Scarf Enamorus provides valuable speed control for Flying teams, as it is able to outspeed and threaten speedy foes like non-Choice Scarf Iron Valiant and Greninja, and it also aids greatly in the Dragon matchup, taking on foes such as Dragapult, Hydreigon, and Garchomp. Additionally, Enamorus provides Healing Wish support to aid Gyarados in its sweeping. Enamorus greatly appreciates Gyarados covering Steel-types like Gholdengo, Iron Treads, and Scizor in return. Early-game wallbreakers like Choice Band Dragonite and Choice Specs Zapdos clear out bulky threats like Sinistcha and Corviknight so that Gyarados can find opportunities to sweep. Lastly, Gyarados can enable other sweepers like Galarian Moltres and Thundurus-T by clearing out foes like opposing Gliscor, so it can sweep late-game. Specifically, Thundurus-T provides an Electric immunity and aids against Water-types such as Rotom-W, Pelipper, and Ogerpon-W.

Choice Scarf Revenge Killer.description:
Thanks to Ditto's signature ability Imposter, which also copies enemy stat changes, Ditto is one of the best revenge killers in the tier. Ditto's presence alone scares off sweepers like Baxcalibur and Azumarill from setting up. Ditto does not copy the enemy HP stat, so 248 HP EVs are used to minimize damage taken from entry hazards before transforming while maximizing Ditto's HP stat, as well as allowing Ditto to use Struggle four times before it faints. 252 Defense EVs minimize the damage Ditto takes from opposing Ditto in the extremely rare mirror matchup. Finally, a Relaxed nature coupled with 0 Speed IVs guarantees that Imposter will never activate first, which ensures that Ditto will have more Transform PP in the aforementioned mirror match.

Ursaluna is a great teammate for Ditto, as it can switch into walls and begin applying immediate pressure. Ditto also appreciates Ursaluna's unrivaled ability to punch holes in the opposing team, making a late-game Ditto sweep much easier. If Ditto copies certain targets like Iron Valiant and a majority of the opposing team is weakened, Ditto can win the game. Indeedee is a good teammate for Ditto, as its Psychic Surge ability prevents Ditto from being picked off by priority moves. Blissey is a nice partner for Ditto, as it can absorb status moves that would otherwise cripple Ditto and then shrug them off via Natural Cure. Blissey can also use Thunder Wave to slow down opposing Choice Scarf users that would otherwise Speed tie with Ditto such as Meowscarada and Enamorus. Choice Specs Hisuian Zoroark is a powerful teammate that pairs well with Ditto, as Ditto can copy the stat boosts from setup sweepers that aim to take advantage of a Choice-locked Hisuian Zoroark. Maushold can use its high speed tier to lock Bulk Up users like Landorus-T that would otherwise be able to stall out Ditto. Additionally, Maushold is able to break down walls due to the sheer power of Population Bomb. Pivots are great teammates for Ditto because they can lure in targets for Ditto to copy. Choice Scarf Staraptor and Defensive Braviary are solid picks, as they can use U-turn to go right into Ditto. Braviary is also capable of using Defog to keep Ditto alive for longer.

Curse.description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Articuno.comments:
Other Options

Flying

Hurricane can be used over Substitute or U-turn as a way to make Articuno more threatening against foes such as Iron Valiant and Okidogi; however, it has poor accuracy and using it foregoes the generally greater utility of these two moves. An alternative EV spread of 240 HP / 84 SpD / 184 Spe allows Articuno to outspeed maximum Speed Pelipper, Frosmoth, and Hisuian Braviary while still avoiding a 2HKO from Choice Specs Greninja.

Specially Defensive (Flying).description:
Articuno's special bulk lets it serve as a special wall on Flying teams, dealing with threatening foes such as Kyurem, Greninja, and Galarian Moltres. Freeze-Dry lets Articuno handle Dragon-, Ground-, and Water-types such as Choice Specs Dragapult, Gastrodon, Landorus, Toxapex, and Primarina. Futhermore, it can be used against other Flying-types to counter threats like Enamorus and Gliscor. Substitute allows Articuno to avoid status conditions such as Toxic from Toxapex and Gliscor while also leveraging Pressure to PP stall special attackers. Alternatively, U-turn pairs well with its mediocre Speed stat, which can be used to pivot out and provide a safe switch to setup sweepers such as Dragonite and Gliscor. Haze is used to nullify special setup sweepers such as Calm Mind Hatterene and Nasty Plot Galarian Moltres. The provided EVs allow Articuno to outspeed Jolly Azumarill and uninvested Landorus-T.

Articuno pairs well with Gliscor, as it is immune to Electric-type moves, and it can switch into Knock Off to prevent any attempt to take out Articuno's Heavy-Duty Boots, provided it's already poisoned. Additionally, Gliscor can switch into Fire- and Steel-type attacks and hit foes back with Earthquake. Corviknight and Skarmory form a defensive core with Articuno, as they both serve as physical walls, and Articuno serves as a special wall. IronPress Corviknight and Skarmory easily take down physical threats such as Bisharp, Ogerpon-C, and Weavile. Corviknight also removes entry hazards using Defog in case Articuno's Heavy-Duty Boots have been removed. In return, Articuno checks special threats like Greninja and Kyurem. Landorus-T also enjoys Articuno's company, as Articuno can wall super effective Ice-type moves. In exchange, Landorus-T removes threats like Ceruledge and Empoleon. Tornadus-T also benefits from Articuno's ability to take out threats like Clodsire, Enamorus, and Primarina. Enamorus is a great partner for Articuno, as it can revenge kill Rock-types that beat Articuno such as Tyranitar, Kleavor, and Hisuian Arcanine.

SubRoost (Flying).description:
Zapdos, thanks to a solid Speed stat and offensive prowess, finds a slot on Flying teams as an incredible threat versus opposing Flying- and Water-types. Substitute can be used to take advantage of passive foes such as Corviknight and Klefki to safely pressure the opposing team. Discharge spreads paralysis against foes such as Heatran and Hoopa-U while dealing with Water- and Flying-types such as Primarina, Pelipper, and Corviknight. Hurricane deals with problematic Grass- and Ground-types that handle Zapdos's Discharge such as Amoonguss, Sinistcha, Gliscor, and Swampert. The primary EV spread prevents Gliscor's Knock Off from breaking Substitute while always OHKOing Urshifu-R and 2HKOing Corviknight after Stealth Rock damage. The second EV Spread can be used to allow Zapdos to always set up a Substitute against Toxapex and OHKO Skarmory.

Both Skarmory and Corviknight serve as excellent teammates to Zapdos, as their Steel typing allows them to take on threats such as Weavile, Mamoswine, and Ogerpon-C. Skarmory continues to assist Zapdos by being able to set entry hazards to chip down Zapdos's checks such as Swampert and Iron Treads, while Corviknight can pivot Zapdos in with U-turn. Gliscor and the Landorus formes appreciate Zapdos dealing with Water-types like Primarina and Keldeo, and Zapdos appreciates them being able to deal with Steel- and Electric-types such as Heatran, Hisuian Goodra, Magnezone, and Raging Bolt. Choice Scarf Enamorus handles Dragon-types such as Latios, Garchomp, and Kyurem that can threaten Zapdos. Articuno provides a solid special wall that is capable of removing Ground-types such as Gastrodon and Gliscor with Freeze-Dry. Dragonite can deal with special walls such as Galarian Slowking and Blissey that handle Zapdos and appreciates Zapdos removing physical walls such as Skarmory and Sinistcha. Tornadus-T can handle threats such as the Ogerpon formes and appreciates threats like Sneasler and Meowscarada getting paralyzed to help offset the low accuracy of Bleakwind, giving it a safer time to setup with Nasty Plot.

SubRoost (Electric).description:
Zapdos is a staple on Electric teams due to its immunity to Ground-type moves. Substitute in tandem with Pressure lets Zapdos PP stall foes that it outspeeds like Kyurem, Landorus-T, and non-Choice Scarf Hisuian Arcanine. Discharge is preferred over its other Electric-type STAB moves, since it allows Zapdos to spread paralysis among foes like Dragonite with much more ease, thus crippling them and preventing them from becoming long-term threats. Hurricane provides consistent damage against threats like Great Tusk, Zamazenta, and Volcarona, which can hamper the momentum of Electric teams significantly. Roost provides reliable recovery behind Substitute and solidifies its longevity on the field. 16 EVs invested in HP ensure that Zapdos can use Substitute four times consecutively while ensuring that Toxapex doesn't break its Substitute.

Iron Hands is a remarkable teammate for Zapdos, as it can take care of foes like Ogerpon-C, Tyranitar, Gliscor, and Landorus with Drain Punch and Ice Punch. In return, Zapdos acts as a switch-in to Ground-type moves and threatens foes like Sinistcha and Iron Valiant with Hurricane, which may be problematic for Iron Hands to handle alone. Rotom-W and Zapdos leverage their immunity to Ground-type moves together, with the former acting as a pivot with Volt Switch and spreading burn through Will-O-Wisp, thus making it easier for the latter to handle physical threats like opposing Iron Hands, Kingambit, and Dragonite. Sandy Shocks makes monumental contributions for Zapdos by not only setting entry hazards but also providing an Electric immunity, which makes it easier for the pair to handle threats like non-Air Balloon Raging Bolt and opposing Zapdos. Furthermore, Sandy Shocks acts as a vital pivot with the help of Volt Switch. Assault Vest Magnezone can deal with foes like Flutter Mane with considerable ease, which Zapdos may have trouble dealing with otherwise. Choice Scarf Pawmot not only takes out Hisuian Arcanine and Choice Specs Greninja for Zapdos, but it can also use Revival Blessing to grant Zapdos a second chance to wreak havoc, thus proving pivotal in the Fighting, Grass, and Bug matchups in particular. Lastly, Regieleki is a swift late-game sweeper owing to its extremely high Speed stat and strong STAB moves boosted by Transistor. Furthermore, it can remove hazards with Rapid Spin, which allows Zapdos to come in easily in case its Heavy-Duty Boots have been removed.

Choice Specs (Electric).description:
Choice Specs Zapdos is a potent wallbreaker for Electric teams, being able to threaten Pokemon that give its teammates a hard time such as Great Tusk, Gastrodon, specially defensive Iron Treads, and Landorus-T. Aside from that, its Flying typing provides Electric teams an immunity to Ground and a resistance to Fighting. Hurricane is Zapdos's strongest STAB move, being able to OHKO Sableye, Amoonguss, and possibly Quagsire, and also being able to 2HKO physically defensive Skeledirge and Ursaluna. Zapdos can also take advantage of matchups against rain teams by being able to spam Hurricane without fear of missing. Volt Switch allows Zapdos to bring in teammates safely against special walls like Assault Vest Iron Hands, Assault Vest Galarian Slowking, and Heatran. Heat Wave provides Zapdos great coverage, allowing it to 2HKO Magnezone, as well as Klefki under Light Screen and Iron Treads. Static has a chance to paralyze Pokemon that make contact with Zapdos such as Dragonite and Mimikyu.

Sandy Shocks makes for a great partner, being able to provide entry hazard support with both Stealth Rock and Spikes, as well as being able to threaten Heatran with Earth Power. Regieleki is another great partner, as it is able to remove hazards with Rapid Spin so that Zapdos can switch in more often without losing a good amount of its health to Stealth Rock. It is also able to outspeed Pokemon that outspeed Zapdos such as Flutter Mane and non-Choice Scarf Greninja. Pokemon with great special bulk such as Assault Vest Galarian Slowking and Tyranitar can be tough for Zapdos, with the latter being able to threaten it with Stone Edge. Hence, Iron Hands pairs well with Zapdos, as it is able to threaten Galarian Slowking with Earthquake and Tyranitar with Drain Punch. In return, Zapdos can switch into anticipated Ground-type attacks from the likes of Great Tusk and Iron Treads. Magnezone is another great partner, being able to threaten Hatterene and Flutter Mane, as well as potentially winning the Chien-Pao matchup. Lastly, Zapdos's wallbreaking opens up sweeping opportunities for fast sweepers such as Nasty Plot Rotom-W and Choice Scarf Pawmot. Both of them can beat Landorus-T with Hydro Pump and Ice Punch, respectively, and Pawmot has the added merit of potentially reviving Zapdos with Revival Blessing.

Offensive Pivot (Electric).description: This is a sample set as we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Choice Band (Fighting).description:
Galarian Zapdos makes for a great asset to Fighting teams by virtue of its part Flying typing, easing the Fighting, Ground, and Grass matchups. Brave Bird breaks through troublesome physical walls that Fighting teams struggle with such as Amoonguss, Sinistcha, and Zamazenta, while Close Combat targets Corviknight and Skarmory. Knock Off grants coverage against Ghost- and Psychic-types like Gholdengo and Iron Crown and removes items such as Black Sludge from Toxapex and Tentacruel. Alternatively, Drill Peck is a weaker but safer option against targets like Urshifu-R and Rillaboom, as it doesn't come with recoil damage. However, using it comes with the downside of not having coverage against targets that its teammates can struggle with. U-turn allows Galarian Zapdos to act as a pivot to bring a teammate in safely while OHKOing Hoopa-U.

Choice Scarf users such as Iron Valiant and Sneasler pair well with Galarian Zapdos, as the two of them can deal with Dragon- and Fairy-types that threaten it. Iron Valiant handles the likes of Dragapult, Walking Wake, and Latias, while Sneasler deals with opposing Iron Valiant and Enamorus. In return, they appreciate Galarian Zapdos OHKOing Gholdengo with Knock Off and bringing them in with U-turn. Great Tusk makes for another great teammate, setting up Stealth Rock to support Galarian Zapdos's wallbreaking potential, serving as an asset against Fire teams thanks to Protosynthesis helping it under sun, and taking on the likes of Gouging Fire, Ceruledge, and Hisuian Arcanine thanks to its bulk; it also provides hazard removal with Rapid Spin and an Electric immunity. Great Tusk also appreciates Galarian Zapdos handling Grass-types like Hydrapple and Amoonguss for it. Iron Hands, with its great special bulk, takes on Greninja and Flutter Mane while also forming a VoltTurn core with Galarian Zapdos, and Galarian Zapdos returns the favor by handling Great Tusk for it. Choice Scarf Keldeo threatens faster Fire- and Ground-types that can threaten Galarian Zapdos such as Choice Specs Iron Moth and Choice Scarf Landorus. Breloom immobilizes a threatening foe with Spore and deals with bulky Water-types such as Primarina and physically defensive Rotom-W. Lastly, Galarian Zapdos's wallbreaking opens up sweeping opportunities from late-game cleaners such as Hisuian Lilligant and Choice Band Zamazenta.

Moltres.comments:
Other Options

(Flying)

Brave Bird can be used over Flamethrower prevent Moltres from being forced out by Calm Mind users such as Spectrier. However, Flamethrower is generally the more consistent move, as Brave Bird is only called for in niche scenarios. Additionally, Scorching Sands is an option over Flamethrower, as it prevents Moltres from being walled by the likes of Heatran and Gouging Fire. However, this comes at the cost of Moltres being forced out by any Pokemon with a Ground immunity or resistance.

Physically Defensive (Flying).description:
Thanks to its ability and bulk, Moltres finds itself on Flying-type teams as a deterrent to threatening physical attackers such as Chien-Pao, Kingambit, and Gallade. Will-O-Wisp is used to guarantee a burn on prominent attackers such as Azumarill and Iron Hands while also negating Leftovers and Black Sludge recovery from passive Pokemon such as Ting-Lu and Toxapex without having to rely on Pressure. U-turn allows Moltres to pivot out of unfavorable situations and keep itself safe from harm. The given Speed EVs allow Moltres to outspeed Jolly Kingambit and the rare Jolly Azumarill to neutralize their setup with Will-O-Wisp.

Corviknight forms a great defensive core with Moltres, as they both cover each other's threats well. Corviknight is able to switch into threats such as Choice Band Excadrill and Glimmora for Moltres, while Moltres is able to cover Corviknight by switching into Ogerpon-H and Ninetales. Mandibuzz also makes for another great defensive addition for a defensive trio, as it shields Moltres from incoming Ghost-, Psychic-, and Dark-type attacks from Dragapult, Espathra, and Hydreigon while also threatening various physical attackers with Foul Play. Landorus-T is able to handle Fire-type Pokemon that wall and take advantage of Moltres, such as Heatran and unboosted Gouging Fire, while also being a deterrent to Electric-types such as Raging Bolt and Sandy Shocks. Additionally, Landorus-T and the aforementioned defensive trio all have access to U-turn, allowing Flying-type teams and Moltres in particular to retain momentum throughout a battle. In return, Moltres is able to soak up Ice-type attacks from Chien-Pao and Great Tusk. Choice Scarf Enamorus is also able to help Moltres deal with Heatran while also sweeping Dragon-, Steel-, and Fire-type teams with the appropriate coverage and providing Healing Wish support for Moltres should it need the immediate recovery. In return, Moltres can cover incoming Ice-type attacks from the aforementioned Chien-Pao and Great Tusk, as well as Steel-type attacks from Choice Scarf Roaring Moon and Scizor, both of which can threaten Enamorus's sweeping power. Dragonite is a great potential wincon with access to Dragon Dance and a colorful movepool, and it greatly appreciates Moltres wearing down troublesome physical walls such as Toxapex, Galarian Weezing, and Quagsire with Will-O-Wisp.

Nasty Plot (Flying).description:
Galarian Moltres is a powerful special attacker on Flying teams that keeps Ghost- and Psychic-type threats in check thanks to its access to Nasty Plot. Fiery Wrath serves as a way for it to deal damage and take down Ghost-types such as Dragapult and Gholdengo. Hurricane provides Galarian Moltres with a way to deal significant damage to foes like Zamazenta, Volcarona, and the Ogerpon formes, except Ogerpon-C. However, due to Hurricane's low accuracy, Substitute can be be used in place of it to protect Galarian Moltres from status conditions, such as Toxic from Toxapex and Clodsire. Agility lets Galarian Moltres outspeed threats like Latios and Gholdengo. Alternatively, Pain Split lets it recover and allows it to activate its Berserk ability to get multiple Special Attack boosts.

Skarmory is a great partner for Galarian Moltres, as it is a physical wall that can switch into Rock- and Ice-type moves from foes such as Iron Boulder, Kleavor, and Weavile. Corviknight removes entry hazards using Defog in case Galarian Moltres's Heavy-Duty Boots get removed; specially defensive Corviknight provides Galarian Moltres a safe switch-in to Ice-types moves such as Ice Beam and Freeze-Dry from foes like Kyurem, Greninja, and Alolan Ninetales. Gliscor pairs well with Galarian Moltres, as it is immune to Electric-type moves, and it can switch into Knock Off to hinder any attempt to remove Galarian Moltres's Heavy-Duty Boots, provided that it's already poisoned. Additionally, Gliscor can switch into Rock-type attacks from foes like Iron Boulder and Hisuian Arcanine and hit them back with Earthquake. The Landorus formes form an offensive core with Galarian Moltres by removing threats like Empoleon and Gouging Fire. Enamorus revenge kills Rock-types that beat Galarian Moltres such as Tyranitar, Kleavor, and Hisuian Arcanine with Superpower and Earth Power, along with providing Healing Wish support. Articuno synergizes well with Galarian Moltres, as Articuno serves as a special wall and Galarian Moltres serves as a special attacker, forming a special core that exterminates foes like Greninja, Landorus, Clodsire, and Spectrier. Zapdos provides Galarian Moltres a safe switch-in to Electric-type attacks and can paralyze Pokemon that make contact with it due to Static. It also acts as a pivot thanks to Volt Switch, allowing Galarian Moltres to come in safely. Galarian Moltres is greatly assisted by Nasty Plot Tornadus-T due to its ability to remove Steel-type threats like Hisuian Goodra, Heatran, and Archaludon with Focus Blast. Assault Vest Tornadus-T can switch into attacks like Thunderbolt and Power Gem from foes like Iron Valiant, Flutter Mane, and Heatran and subsequently use U-turn to bring Galarian Moltres in safely. Dragonite forms an offensive core with Galarian Moltres, as Dragonite acts as a physical setup sweeper taking out foes like Alolan Muk, Corviknight, Clodsire, and Toxapex, while Galarian Moltres acts as a special setup sweeper taking out foes such as Dragapult and Latios. Dragonite finishes off enemies weakened by Galarian Moltres with Extreme Speed.

Nasty Plot (Dark).description:
