With its respectable bulk, access to Nasty Plot and Agility, and a great ability in Berserk to further bolster its offensive prowess, Galarian Moltres makes for an incredible wallbreaker and setup sweeper for Dark teams, threatening Fighting- and Bug-types like Zamazenta and Volcarona. Hurricane OHKOes Fighting-types like Iron Valiant, Urshifu-R, and, when at +2, Assault Vest Gallade. It is also Galarian Moltres's strongest option for hitting Fairy-types, outright OHKOing Flutter Mane and Hatterene at +2 and OHKOing non-Assault Vest Primarina at +2 after minimal chip damage. Fiery Wrath is a more reliable STAB option, hitting Flying-resistant Pokemon like Heatran, Corviknight, and Zapdos. Agility allows Galarian Moltres to mitigate its low Speed, allowing it to outspeed would-be faster foes like Zamazenta and Flutter Mane and Choice Scarf users like Iron Valiant.

Ting-Lu provides entry hazard support and leverages its Electric immunity and Rock resistance to handle foes like Raging Bolt and Tyranitar. It can also break through special walls like Clodsire, Hisuian Goodra, and Alolan Muk. Grimmsnarl provides dual screens support for easier setup, potentially letting Galarian Moltres survive super effective moves like Iron Valiant's Moonblast and Iron Hands's Thunder Punch to activate both Berserk and its Weakness Policy. Grimmsnarl can also use Taunt to deny hazards from being set up and provide safe a switch in to Galarian Moltres using Parting Shot. Alolan Muk, with its Poison typing and excellent special bulk, can stave off Fairy-type attacks from foes like Choice Specs Flutter Mane and Choice Scarf Enamorus, threatening them back with Poison Jab. Bisharp serves an offensive answer to Fairy-, Ice-, and Rock-types, utilizing Sucker Punch to pick off Flutter Mane and Iron Boulder. Choice Band Meowscarada, Choice Specs Greninja, and Swords Dance Weavile can eliminate bulky Ground-types like Clodsire and Ting-Lu. Meowscarada and Greninja can help alleviate the Rock matchup for Galarian Moltres, with Meowscarada also threatening Water-types like Primarina and Dondozo. Meowscarada, Hoopa-U, and Weavile eliminate special walls like Blissey and Hisuian Goodra; Hoopa-U and Greninja also assist in Fighting and Fairy matchups. Sableye, with the combination of Will-O-Wisp and Knock Off, can wither down foes like Iron Hands and Dragonite, making it easier for Galarian Moltres to set up and eliminate them. Mandibuzz serves as a Defogger and can provide safe entry to Galarian Moltres using U-turn. Choice Scarf Darkrai can use its superb Speed tier and coverage options to revenge kill opposing Choice Scarf users like Iron Boulder, Meowscarada, and Greninja.

Dragonite.comments:
Other Options

Dragon Dance (Flying)

Encore can be used on threats such as Raging Bolt, Primarina, and Bisharp to lock them into setup moves while also allowing Dragonite to take advantage of Gliscor, Skarmory, and Toxapex on a predicted non-damaging or non-status move. A combination of Thunder Punch and Ice Spinner can be used to deal with opposing Flying teams with its perfect coverage, but such a set needs to have Iron Defense Skarmory removed prior.

Dragon Dance (Dragon).description:
Dragonite is a great setup sweeper boasting nearly unresisted coverage, a useful Flying typing, and a convenient ability in Multiscale, allowing for an easier time setting up. Outrage is preferred due to the lack of Fairy-types and its utter power, allowing Dragonite to sweep opposing Dragon teams with the help of Baxcalibur and Dragapult late-game. Earthquake allows Dragonite to nail Poison- and Steel-type switch-ins such as Toxapex, Clodsire, and Gholdengo. Alternatively, Fire Punch threatens would-be checks like Corviknight and Air Balloon Gholdengo. Extreme Speed picks off weakened threats such as Greninja and Iron Valiant attempting to revenge kill it, while Encore may be used to lock physical walls like Dondozo, Quagsire, and Ting-Lu into a move, either letting Dragonite deal extra chip damage or effortlessly set up in front of them. A Jolly nature allows Dragonite to outpace Dragapult after a Dragon Dance so that Dragonite can OHKO them with Outrage, at the cost of power.

Dragonite appreciates Baxcalibur's immunity to Will-O-Wisp from threats such as Sableye and Skeledirge, neutrality to Ice-type moves, and ability to threaten Ting-Lu. In return, Dragonite checks troublesome Fighting-types like Quaquaval and Slither Wing. Cyclizar's Shed Tail in conjunction with Multiscale grants Dragonite many chances to set up and prevents it from being affected by status effects inflicted by Toxapex, Amoonguss, and Skeledirge. Garchomp sets up entry hazards in the form of Stealth Rock and Spikes, chipping down Dragonite's switch-ins such as Forretress, Archaludon, and Quagsire. Dragapult breaks past walls such as Dondozo and Corviknight and prevents Rapid Spin users like Great Tusk and Iron Treads from clearing Garchomp's entry hazards. Dragalge's secondary Poison typing and commendable bulk allow it to check Fairy-types like Iron Valiant and Flutter Mane, and it supports Dragonite's sweeping with Toxic Spikes, notably wearing down Ting-Lu, Slowbro, and Quagsire. Choice Scarf Roaring Moon is a great revenge killer and method of speed control, as it outpaces and deals with Choice Scarf Latias and Choice Specs Greninja. Walking Wake is another plausible Choice Scarf user due to its ability to threaten Weavile and singlehandedly sweep Fire teams.

Choice Band (Flying).description:
Dragonite is a terrifying wallbreaker on Flying teams by virtue of its high Attack stat further boosted by Choice Band as well as its great coverage moves. Furthermore, a great ability in Multiscale allows it to survive super effective attacks from the likes of Iron Valiant and Hydreigon. Extreme Speed allows Dragonite to serve as a sweeper, easily sweeping through frail foes that don't resist it, and it also revenge kills boosted, albeit weakened, setup sweepers such as Volcarona. Earthquake targets Steel- and Poison-types like Iron Treads, Bisharp, Heatran, and Toxapex. Fire Punch allows Dragonite to threaten foes that resist Outrage and are immune to Earthquake like Corviknight, Skarmory, and Air Balloon Gholdengo.

Corviknight is an essential teammate for Dragonite, since it handles Rock-, Fairy-, and Ice-types like Ogerpon-C, Hatterene, and Weavile with Iron Head, pivots it in with U-turn, and uses Defog to remove Stealth Rock that would otherwise wear Dragonite down over time and break Multiscale. In return, Corviknight appreciates Dragonite handling the aforementioned Fire-types as well as Electric-types like Magnezone and Raging Bolt. Skarmory and Gliscor set up entry hazards to help Dragonite in its wallbreaking. Additionally, Skarmory can wall physical attackers like Bisharp and Iron Boulder with Iron Defense and threaten them back with Body Press, while Gliscor aids in the Electric matchup thanks to its Ground typing. Zapdos makes for a great partner, as it can pivot Dragonite in with Volt Switch and take care of physically bulky threats like Amoonguss and Iron Defense Corviknight. Dragonite handles Iron Treads and Clodsire in return. Choice Scarf Enamorus is great speed control, as it takes care of faster threats that can threaten Dragonite like Dragapult, Garchomp, and Choice Specs Greninja. In return, Enamorus appreciates Dragonite taking out Steel-types like Gholdengo and Iron Treads with Earthquake and Fire Punch. Landorus, with its colorful coverage, takes out threats to Dragonite like Choice Band Hisuian Arcanine, Kyurem, and Archaludon. Dragonite's wallbreaking is appreciated by late-game sweepers like Galarian Moltres that take advantage of Dragonite removing its checks like Clodsire and Toxapex to set up and sweep.

Choice Band (Dragon).description:
Equipped with a Choice Band, Dragonite makes for a strong wallbreaker on Dragon teams with its great coverage. With Extreme Speed, Dragonite not only revenge kills weakened threats, but it also serves as a cleaning option against foes that lack the proper physical bulk to deal with it. Earthquake breaks through bulky Poison- and Steel-types such as Toxapex, Alolan Muk, non-Air Balloon Heatran, and Hisuian Goodra. Fire Punch handles Grass- and Ice-types like Amoonguss and Frosmoth, as well as foes that can otherwise ignore Dragonite's other moves like unboosted Corviknight and Skarmory.

Dragonite appreciates entry hazard support from the likes of Archaludon and Garchomp. Additionally, Archaludon's great physical bulk allows it to switch in on physical attackers it easily shrugs off hits from like the Ogerpon formes, Meowscarada, and Kleavor, while Garchomp has to potential to set up and sweep late-game with Swords Dance and Scale Shot. In return, Dragonite handles Volcarona for Archaludon, while Garchomp appreciates the removal of Corviknight and Skarmory. Dragapult with Will-O-Wisp pairs well with Dragonite, as it weakens physical attackers such as Bisharp and Iron Hands so that Dragonite deals with them more easily, and Dragonite removes Alolan Muk for Dragapult in return. Hisuian Goodra makes for a great defensive partner, as with its great special bulk, it shrugs off attacks from the likes of Greninja and Flutter Mane, and it threatens Fairy-types like the aforementioned Flutter Mane. Hisuian Goodra also has access to Knock Off to remove items like Leftovers and Black Sludge from their holders so that Dragonite can threaten them more easily. Choice Scarf Roaring Moon provides great speed control, and with its colorful moveset, it threatens Ghost- and Fairy-types like Dragapult, Spectrier, non-Choice Scarf Flutter Mane, and Iron Valiant and brings Dragonite in safely with U-turn. In return, Roaring Moon appreciates Dragonite handling Bug- and Fighting-types like Scizor, Volcarona, and Okidogi. Choice Scarf Latias is another great form of speed control, as it handles fast Dragon- and Fighting-types like Choice Specs Dragapult, Iron Valiant, and Great Tusk and it can use Trick to shut down walls like Amoonguss and Skarmory so Dragonite can more easily deal with them. Additionally, it provides Healing Wish support to not only give Dragonite another chance at wallbreaking also restore its Multiscale. Dragonite's wallbreaking opens the door for late-game sweepers such as Swords Dance Garchomp, Calm Mind Raging Bolt, and Calm Mind Latios to set up and start their own sweep.

Dragon Dance (Flying).description:
Dragonite is the premier setup sweeper on Flying teams thanks to its access to Dragon Dance and diverse movepool. Outrage or Dragon Claw are the STAB attacks of choice, hitting Dragon-type threats such as Dragapult, Latios, and Kyurem, while Earthquake provides solid coverage, removing Steel-types like non-Air Balloon Heatran and Gholdengo along with hitting Fire- and Rock-types such as Hisuian Arcanine and Glimmora. Extreme Speed provides utility in allowing Dragonite to clean up weakened threats along with catching Choice Scarf threats that outspeed it even after a Dragon Dance such as Meowscarada. Alternatively, Fire Punch hits both Skarmory and Corviknight, which could otherwise wall Dragonite, while Roost provides a way to keep Dragonite healthy, regain Multiscale, and safely tank resisted hits from the likes of Barraskewda. An Adamant nature is preferred, allowing Dragonite to remove Raging Bolt without a boost, while Jolly is an option to outspeed threats like Dragapult and Flutter Mane at +1.

Corviknight and Skarmory both make great support for Dragonite, with both handling Ice- and Rock-type threats like Weavile, Mamoswine, and Tyranitar. Corviknight can continue to support Dragonite by using U-turn to provide safe entry and Defog to remove Stealth Rock should Dragonite lose its Heavy-Duty Boots, while Skarmory supports Dragonite with entry hazards to chip down bulky walls such as Galarian Weezing, Corviknight, and opposing Skarmory, which can prove problematic. Gliscor and the Landorus formes remove Electric- and Rock-type threats such as Raging Bolt, Regieleki, and Iron Boulder along with using Stealth Rock to provide additional entry hazard support. Choice Scarf Enamorus removes Dragon- and Dark-type threats like Latios, Dragapult, and Sableye, giving Dragonite safer sweeping opportunities, and provides Healing Wish support to reactivate Multiscale, allowing Dragonite another chance to set up. Tornadus-T forms a solid wallbreaking core, with its powerful special attacks removing physical walls such as Galarian Weezing and Great Tusk, along with taking on foes like Ogerpon-H, which can pose challenges to Dragonite.

Nasty Plot.description:
With Nasty Plot and a myriad of coverage options, Mew finds a solid place as a special wallbreaker for Psychic teams. Life Orb Vacuum Wave OHKOes Bisharp after Stealth Rock damage and, at +2, has a good chance to OHKO Meowscarada and Greninja. Flamethrower targets Steel- and Bug-types like Gholdengo, Scizor, and Frosmoth. Ice Beam threatens Dragon-, Flying-, and Ground-types like Latios, the Landorus formes, and Hippowdon. Draining Kiss, on the other hand, provides Mew with a way to handle Dark- and Dragon-types such as Sableye and Kyurem and provides a form of recovery to offset Life Orb recoil.

Deoxys-S makes an excellent partner for Mew, providing entry hazard support to secure OHKOs on targets like Meowscarada and Skarmory. Additionally, it sets dual screens for easier setup and lets Mew survive super effective moves like Roaring Moon's Knock Off and Gholdengo's Shadow Ball, allowing it to KO them back with the appropriate move. Hoopa-U serves as a physical wallbreaker, eliminating Skeledirge, special walls like Hisuian Goodra and Galarian Slowking, and, when equipped with a Choice Scarf, even faster Ghost-types like Flutter Mane and Spectrier, which pose serious problems for Psychic teams. Hatterene answers bulky Dark- and Dragon-types, and it provides hazard and speed control thanks to Magic Bounce and Nuzzle. Choice Scarf Iron Boulder serves as a revenge killer, removing Dark-, Bug-, and Fire-types like Roaring Moon, Volcarona, and Gouging Fire. It can also handle special walls like Heatran and Hisuian Goodra. Choice Specs Latios threatens bulky foes like Gouging Fire and Primarina. Galarian Slowking and Slowbro provide Thunder Wave support. Galarian Slowking can also provide a safe entry for Mew with Chilling Reception, while Slowbro can handle physical attackers like Gouging Fire and Excadrill with its combination of Scald and IronPress, and it can even deal with Ceruledge if Slowbro is not holding any items. Metagross can handle Fairy-types, most notably removing Flutter Mane with Bullet Punch and providing Stealth Rock support.

Belly Drum Sweeper (Fairy).description:
Azumarill stands as Fairy's premier sweeper thanks to Huge Power and Belly Drum, allowing it to easily clean defensive Poison and Steel teams when positioned well. Aqua Jet makes up for Azumarill's low Speed, enabling it to deal with threats such as Volcarona, Sneasler, and the Landorus formes. Play Rough complements Aqua Jet and breaks through sturdier targets that can survive Aqua Jet such as Pelipper and Hisuian Goodra. Alternatively, Liquidation can OHKO Galarian Weezing and Hippowdon, dealing with them before they can neutralize Azumarill with Will-O-Wisp and Whirlwind. Knock Off handles targets Azumarill cannot deal with using its STAB moves such as Toxapex and Water Absorb Clodsire.

Klefki provides near essential dual screens support, enabling Azumarill to safely use Belly Drum in front of threats such as Regieleki and Choice Band Scizor along with setting Spikes to wear down targets such as Okidogi, Archaludon, and Meowscarada. Klefki also provides a valuable Poison immunity that helps against Poison Jab Toxapex, and it can check Scizor thanks to Foul Play. Choice Specs Flutter Mane is an incredible wallbreaker capable of easily tearing through several physical walls like Skarmory, Archaludon, and Pecharunt, allowing Azumarill to easily clean up late-game. Iron Valiant appreciates Azumarill handling its checks such as Gholdengo and Galarian Slowking. In return, Iron Valiant can threaten checks to Azumarill such as Articuno and Kyurem with its powerful Close Combat. Hatterene provides entry hazard control thanks to Magic Bounce, preventing Azumarill from taking hazard damage. Assault Vest Primarina can use Flip Turn to safely bring in Azumarill. Calm Mind Primarina enjoys Azumarill removing special walls such as Hisuian Goodra and Blissey, and in return, it can deal with physical walls such as Galarian Weezing and Gyarados. Tinkaton can provide Stealth Rock support along with spreading paralysis with Thunder Wave, allowing Azumarill to outspeed foes like Archaludon and Sinistcha.

Choice Band (Fairy).description:
Choice Band Azumarill, when paired with Huge Power, turns into an effective wallbreaker that can deal great damage to Fire and Ground teams. Aqua Jet can OHKO Landorus and Focus Sash Ceruledge after Stealth Rock damage and is a strong priority option. Liquidation hits bulky threats like Ursaluna, Hippowdon, and Heatran. Superpower enables it to clear out weakened foes such as Archaludon and Blissey, while Knock Off can be used to eliminate Ghost-types such as Pecharunt and Gholdengo. 140 Speed EVs allow Azumarill to outspeed threats like Corviknight and Iron Hands, and the remaining 116 EVs in HP increase its survivability.

Klefki is a great partner for Azumarill. It sets Spikes on the field, provides a safe switch from Poison-type attacks, slows foes such as Iron Valiant and Archaludon down with Thunder Wave, and disrupts setup sweepers like Scizor with Foul Play. In return, Azumarill takes out Fire- and Ground-types that threaten Klefki like Ninetales, Cinderace, Landorus and Gliscor. Hatterene prevents entry hazards with Magic Bounce and threatens foes like Amoonguss and Toxapex with Psyshock. Azumarill forms an offensive core with Iron Valiant and Flutter Mane. The latter two eliminate threats such as Sinistcha, Kyurem, Raging Bolt, and Skarmory, and in exchange, Azumarill wipes out Gholdengo and Hisuian Goodra. Choice Scarf Enamorus helps get rid of faster threats such as non-Choice Scarf Meowscarada, Greninja, and Iron Treads. Clefable sets Stealth Rock, which puts Pokemon like Ceruledge and Landorus into OHKO range of Azumarill's Aqua Jet. Primarina also synergizes with Azumarill, as they form an offensive core. Primarina defeats threats like Unaware Clodsire, while Azumarill shuts down threats like Alolan Muk and Hisuian Goodra.

Unaware Wall (Water).description:
Quagsire is a decent choice on Water teams thanks to its good bulk, access to Recover, useful typing, and ability to get Spikes up against threats that it walls, like Iron Defense + Body Press Zamazenta, Dragon Dance Roaring Moon, and Iron Hands. Toxic lets Quagsire force progress on defensive Pokemon and offensive switch-ins such as Meowscarada, Latios, and the Ogerpon formes, which in conjunction with Spikes racks up a significant amount of chip damage on opposing teams over time. Spikes can wear down threatening special attackers that force out Quagsire like Ursaluna-BM and Choice Specs Flutter Mane. Alternatively, Stealth Rock can be run if Quagsire has no teammates setting it up. Heavy-Duty Boots lets Quagsire ignore treacherous entry hazards such as Spikes and Toxic Spikes, which can easily wear it down over the course of a game. Leftovers let Quagsire passively regenerate HP, which can help it conserve Recover PP. Alternatively, Rocky Helmet lets Quagsire punish common physical attacks, such as IronPress Zamazenta's Body Press and Choice Scarf Roaring Moon's U-turn, and wear down said opponents over time in conjunction with Toxic and Spikes.

Toxapex is a good teammate for Quagsire, as it complements Quagsire's defensive typing well, being able to take on Grass-types like Meowscarada while Quagsire handles Electric-types like Iron Hands. Ogerpon-W and Greninja appreciate Quagsire giving them extra chip damage to force progress against answers like Archaludon and Iron Hands, respectively, with Spikes. Primarina and Keldeo appreciate Quagsire being able to scare off Poison-types like Alolan Muk, allowing them to set up, while Spikes forces very handy damage onto their answers. In return, Keldeo can take on Kingambit and Chien-Pao, two physical attackers that can overpower Quagsire, while Primarina can switch in on Dragon-types like special attacking Dragapult. Empoleon provides a nice Grass neutrality and Fairy resistance to the team, letting it take on threats like Hydrapple and Hatterene, alongside being a specially defensive tank that pairs nicely with Quagsire's Electric immunity and physical bulk. It also sets up Stealth Rock to form an entry hazard-stacking core alongside Quagsire.

Unaware Wall (Ground).description:
Quagsire is an excellent option for Ground teams due to its physical bulk and Unaware, checking a wide range of physical attackers like Chien-Pao and Baxcalibur. Earthquake in conjunction with Toxic wears down Pokemon like Dragonite as well as Quaquaval and Brambleghast, as they commonly switch in to remove Quagsire's entry hazards. Stealth Rock or Spikes wear down threats like Greninja, Iron Valiant, and Scovillain. Body Press is a viable alternative to deal more damage to Chien-Pao, Baxcalibur, and Kingambit.

Quagsire's ability to wall setup sweepers like Dragonite, Azumarill, and Mimikyu is heavily appreciated by its teammates. Water Absorb Clodsire switches into attacks from Greninja, Meowscarada, and Kilowattrel. Iron Treads is an invaluable teammate to remove entry hazards with Rapid Spin and checking Fairy-types like Hatterene and Flutter Mane. Great Tusk, Garchomp, and Sandy Shocks value Quagsire's entry hazards, as it aids in their wallbreaking. Choice Scarf Great Tusk checks Choice Specs Flutter Mane, Chien-Pao, and Greninja and removes held items from Sableye, Corviknight, and Amoonguss to make them more susceptible to Quagsire's entry hazards. Garchomp threatens Grass-types like Amoonguss, Toedscruel, and Brambleghast with its Fire-type coverage and wears down walls such as Toxapex. Sandy Shocks is valued as a Water-type answer, threatening Pelipper, Dondozo, and Slowking as well as Corviknight. Furthermore, it beats Fire teams with Power Gem by taking advantage of sun with Protosynthesis.

Slowking-Galar.comments:
Other Options

Poison (Specially Defensive)

Shuca Berry can be an alternative held item to allow Galarian Slowking to survive a Ground-type attack that would otherwise KO it such as a +2 Landorus's Earth Power or Choice Scarf Landorus-T's Earthquake from full health and OKHO in response with Ice Beam.

Specially Defensive (Poison).description:
With a pair of Heavy-Duty Boots, Galarian Slowking can provide itself with an entry hazard immunity while still preforming its role as a special tank for Poison teams, capable of switching into threats like Choice Specs Latios. Future Sight can handle threats such as Toxapex, Pecharunt, and Great Tusk that can prove problematic for Poison teams and helps to break stalemates against more passive teams. Ice Beam hits Flying- and Dragon-type threats such as Landorus, Zapdos, Enamorus, and Latios. Chilly Reception allows Galarian Slowking to pivot in frail teammates such as Sneasler and Iron Moth safely and, when paired with Future Sight, allows for said teammates to get through checks such as Toxapex and Clodsire, respectively. Alternatively, Toxic can pressure threats such as Raging Bolt and Volcarona, while Thunder Wave provides a speed control option for Poison teams against Pokemon such as Tornadus-T.

Sneasler and Okidogi appreciate Galarian Slowking pivoting them in with Chilly Reception and using Future Sight to nail would-be checks in Toxapex, Hippowdon, and Rotom-W. In return, Sneasler and Okidogi can remove special walls and Dark-types like Hisuian Goodra, Alolan Muk, and Hisuian Samurott. Iron Moth appreciates Galarian Slowking giving it safe switches with Chilly Reception, and its Future Sight support allows Iron Moth to break past special walls such as Clodsire; In return, Iron Moth can handle threats like Gholdengo, Metagross, and Sinistcha. Amoonguss provides a solid answer to powerful physical Water- and Ground-type threats like Barraskewda, Urshifu-R, and Great Tusk. Pecharunt's high Defense allows it to take on threats like Azumarill, Iron Hands, and Kleavor, along with using Parting Shot to create a bulky pivot core with Galarian Slowking. Thanks to levitate and its Fairy typing, Galarian Weezing provides a solid check to Dragon-, Ground-, and Dark-type threats such as Roaring Moon, Garchomp, and Ting-Lu, along with providing Defog support, should Galarian Slowking lose its Heavy-Duty Boots. Alolan Muk helps to check special Ghost- and Psychic-types that threaten to overwhelm Galarian Slowking such as Flutter Mane, Spectrier, Indeedee, and opposing Galarian Slowking. Overqwil can check physical Ghost- and Psychic-type threats such as Ceruledge, Dragapult, and Gallade, and it can set Spikes to pressure threats attempting to switch into Galarian Slowking's attacks such as Gholdengo. Clodsire can provide Stealth Rock support and can take on special threats such as Raging Bolt and Flutter Mane that can overwhelm Galarian Slowking.

Assault Vest (Poison).description:
Galarian Slowking is a solid defensive piece for Poison teams with its incredible Special Defense, especially with an Assault Vest, able to shrug off hits from threats such as Heatran, Latios, and Raging Bolt. Future Sight is used to create pressure and helps to break opposing teams by nailing threats like Toxapex, Great Tusk, and Amoonguss that may want to switch in against Galarian Slowking's physical teammates like Sneasler and Okidogi for high amounts of damage. Sludge Bomb gives a much more consistent STAB option and helps to nail Fairy-type threats like Enamorus, Iron Valiant, and Primarina. Ice Beam stops threatening Dragon- and Flying-type threats like Latias, Raging Bolt, and Landorus. Flamethrower serves as a solid coverage option, melting problematic Steel-types like Corviknight, Skarmory, and Gholdengo that can otherwise shrug off Galarian Slowking's attacks, along with acting as a lure for Heatran. Finally, Earthquake gives Galarian Slowking a good way to break Heatran, which Poison teams detest, once its Air Balloon pops.

Sneasler and Okidogi benefit from Galarian Slowking immensely, as they can deal with threats attempting to take Galarian Slowking's Future Sights like Articuno, Blissey and Alolan Muk thanks to their high-powered Fighting-type STAB moves. Galarian Slowking, meanwhile, benefits from them removing dangerous Dark-type threats like Ting-Lu, Kingambit, and Hisuian Samurott. Amoonguss complements Galarian Slowking by being a physical wall capable of handling physical attacks from the likes of Great Tusk and Iron Treads with its Grass-type STAB moves and Foul Play, along with creating openings with Spore so Galarian Slowking can pivot in to heal and set Future Sight. Galarian Weezing provides similar support thanks to Levitate and its ability to handle threats like Garchomp, Dragonite, and Mamoswine with Strange Steam and Will-O-Wisp as well as remove entry hazards thanks to Defog. Toxapex completes the Regenerator core while also handling high-powered physical attacks from the likes of Scizor, Chien-Pao, and Ceruledge. Alolan Muk handles Ghost- and Psychic-type threats attempting to overwhelm Galarian Slowking like Flutter Mane, Spectrier, and Latias with Knock Off. Overqwil, with its far higher physical bulk and Intimidate, checks physical Ghost- and Psychic-type threats such as Ceruledge and Iron Boulder and sets Spikes to make Galarian Slowking's answers, Alolan Muk and Hisuian Goodra, take considerable chip damage. Iron Moth enjoys Galarian Slowking's ability to handle Heatran, which allows it to deal with the Steel-types like Corviknight and Gholdengo that would otherwise sit on Galarian Slowking and use its lacking Flamethrower as setup bait, along with melting Chien-Pao and Iron Treads if it is using a Choice Scarf. Salazzle similarly appreciates the removal of Heatran and helps out Galarian Slowking by inflicting Toxic onto special walls such as Hisuian Goodra and Alolan Muk with Corrosion, putting them on timers. Glimmora provides similar Toxic support with Corrosion while also setting entry hazards, chipping at switch-ins like Alolan Muk, Ting-Lu, and Hisuian Goodra when they come to stop Galarian Slowking.

Specially Defensive (Psychic).description:
Galarian Slowking finds a niche on Psychic teams thanks to its incredible solid Special Defense and strong support moves such as Toxic Spikes. Sludge Bomb can spread Poison along with dealing with Fairy-type threats like Primarina and Enamorus. Ice Beam deals with Flying- and Dragon-type threats such as Zapdos, Tornadus-T, Latios, and Raging Bolt. Chilly Reception allows Galarian Slowking to safely pivot into its teammates. Finally, Thunder Wave slows down faster targets such as Volcarona and Greninja, allowing a teammate to comfortably remove them. Heavy-Duty Boots allows Galarian Slowking to safely come in; however, Black Sludge can be used to gain passive recovery.

Slowbro is a solid partner for Galarian Slowking, providing a Regenerator core for Psychic teams, with Slowbro being able to take on physical threats like Great Tusk, Barraskewda, and Cinderace, which threaten Galarian Slowking, while Galarian Slowking handles foes such as Primarina and Zapdos. Latios and Iron Boulder appreciate Galarian Slowking's Chilly Reception to safely pivot them in against threats like Kyurem and Iron Moth. Meanwhile, Galarian Slowking appreciates Latios removing threats such as Landorus, Gouging Fire, and Overqwil, along with Choice Scarf Iron Boulder emoving threats like Flutter Mane, Volcarona, and Tyranitar. Hoopa-U is appreciated for its ability to handle Ghost-type threats like Gholdengo, Spectrier, and Hisuian Zoroark and can use Knock Off to remove Heavy-Duty Boots from foes like Blissey to make Galarian Slowking's Toxic Spikes more potent. Galarian Slowking appreciates Hatterene's ability to block entry hazards along with its ability to take on Dark-type threats such as Hydreigon and Hisuian Samurott.

Forretress.comments:
Other Options

Bug

Toxic Spikes is an alternative to Spikes, providing poison chip and putting threats on a timer. However, with a majority of types having a relevant Poison-type threat to absorb Toxic Spikes, they can be a struggle to keep up. Counter is an option with Heavy-Duty Boots, making use of Sturdy to provide a Hail Mary against powerful setup sweepers such as Ogerpon-W, which Bug would otherwise crumple to. Ice Spinner is an option to catch threats like Dragonite and Gliscor and remove them. Thunder Wave can find utility in slowing down threats like Latios and Dragonite, allowing them to be removed by a fellow teammate.

Hazard Support (Bug).description:
Forretress finds a solid role on Bug teams thanks to its secondary Steel typing and solid support movepool. Spikes provides chip against switch-ins such as Hisuian Arcanine and Gholdengo. Rapid Spin provides support by removing hazards, allowing teammates like Lokix, Slither Wing, and Kleavor to come in safely. Gyro Ball hits Rock- and Ice-types like Iron Boulder, Ogerpon-C, and Alolan Ninetales. Finally, Volt Switch provides safe entry for its teammates thanks to Forretress's low Speed, while Body Press makes use of Forretress's high Defense to put offensive pressure on Steel-types such as Bisharp and Excadrill. Forretress prefers holding Rocky Helmet, which provides chip to contact attackers like Roaring Moon and Sneasler, thanks to its solid Defense. Alternatively, Heavy-Duty Boots allows Forretress to safely come in and spin, which pairs well with Sturdy, and Leftovers provides healing, allowing Fortress to stick around longer.

Choice Scarf Kleavor complements Forretress with Stone Axe by providing Stealth Rock, along with checking Fire- and Flying-type threats including Volcarona, Ogerpon-H, Zapdos, and Tornadus-T. Araquanid, thanks to its powerful Water-type STAB moves, can similarly threaten Fire-types like Heatran, Cinderace, and Iron Moth, along with foes trying to burn Forretress such as Galarian Weezing and Skeledirge. Scizor, with Forretress, creates a Steel-type backbone for Bug teams, with Scizor helping to deal with Rock- and Ice-type threats such as Glimmora, Minior, and Kyurem, which can overwhelm Forretress otherwise. Lokix, thanks to its Dark-type STAB moves, can deal with Ghost-types attempting to stop Rapid Spin like Gholdengo, Pecharunt, and Sinistcha. Both can use their powerful priority in Bullet Punch and First Impression, respectively, to catch weakened targets like Garganacl, Iron Boulder, and Ogerpon-W. Volcarona can threaten Steel-type foes like Gholdengo, Corviknight, and Skarmory, which could otherwise freely set up on Forretress. Frosmoth majorly appreciates Forretress being able to remove Rock-type threats and in response can deal with Flying- and Dragon-type foes like Gliscor, Dragonite, and Garchomp.

Scizor.comments:
Other Options

Bug (Swords Dance)

In teams with solid hazard control, Leftovers can be used to provide Scizor with passive recovery, notably letting it win its duel against Toxapex.

Swords Dance Scizor (Bug).description:
Thanks to its Steel typing, powerful STAB priority, and decent coverage moves, Scizor punches holes in the Fairy, Ice, Rock, Ghost, and Steel matchups. Technician-boosted Bullet Punch is Scizor's most spammable attack, serving as a priority STAB move to revenge kill sweepers like Belly Drum Azumarill and Flutter Mane. Close Combat answers Steel teams and OHKOes slower walls like Ting-Lu and Corviknight at +2 after Stealth Rock chip. Knock Off deals with Gholdengo, while Dual Wingbeat improves the Fighting and mirror matchups and lets it deal with Toxapex. Trailblaze allows Scizor to outspeed threats like Great Tusk and Urshifu-R at +1 Speed and hits Swampert, Gastrodon, and Primarina hard. Metal Coat enhances the power of Bullet Punch without drawbacks, while Life Orb secures OHKOs on Primarina and Porygon2 after a Swords Dance. Heavy-Duty Boots is another option in the event the team has poor entry hazard removal support. The EV spread allows Scizor to reach 324 Speed at +1 to outspeed Urshifu-R and makes it naturally faster than Adamant Azumarill.

With its impressive physical bulk and wide variety of support options, Forretress makes for an excellent partner, providing entry hazard support as well as Rapid Spin and a slow pivot to help Scizor. Due to its lackluster Speed, Scizor pairs well with Sticky Web setters like Araquanid and Galvantula. Thanks to its solid special bulk and Water Bubble, Araquanid provides both an offensive and defensive presence, checking and KOing opposing Volcarona and Ninetales. Alternatively, Galvantula can improve the Water matchup thanks to its access to Grass-type coverage moves, easily pressuring foes such as Toxapex and Pelipper. Offensively, Scizor greatly appreciates other wallbreakers that can remove or weaken its answers such as Kleavor, Volcarona, and Lokix. Choice Scarf Kleavor provides utility in Stone Axe and helps deal with Fire-types like Volcarona, Ceruledge, Ninetales, and Cinderace. Bulky Quiver Dance Volcarona can set up on physical walls that can prove troublesome to Scizor such as IronPress Zamazenta and Skarmory while removing Gholdengo and opposing Scizor. Lokix synergizes well with Scizor, as they both benefit from the holes they create in the opposing team: Scizor appreciates Lokix's ability to deal with Gliscor and Gholdengo, while Lokix enjoys Scizor taking on Fairy-type threats like Iron Valiant and Hatterene. Finally, Frosmoth can take most special sweepers such as Walking Wake, Greninja, and Raging Bolt head-on in Scizor's place, letting it crush Rock-type threats like Iron Boulder and Kleavor.

Swords Dance (Steel).description:
With Swords Dance, Scizor is an adept wallbreaker for Steel teams, removing the likes of Empoleon and Swampert. With Bullet Punch, Scizor also serves as a cleaner, easily picking off faster threats like Chien-Pao, Iron Valiant, and Iron Boulder. Close Combat allows Scizor to threaten Normal-, Steel-, and Dark-types like Ursaluna-B, Blissey, specially defensive Heatran, Hisuian Goodra, Kingambit, and Alolan Muk. Trailblaze threatens Water- and Ground-types like the aforementioned Swampert, Gastrodon, and Primarina. With 216 Speed EVs, Scizor outspeeds and threatens Hisuian Goodra and Archaludon.

Archaludon and Skarmory provide entry hazard support to aid Scizor in its wallbreaking. Skarmory and Corviknight both provide a Ground immunity for Steel teams, and their physical bulk coupled with access to Iron Defense and Body Press allows them to wall out physical attackers and sweepers such as Choice Scarf Hoopa-U and Barraskewda. Corviknight also removes hazards for Scizor via Defog. Scizor is easily forced out by Fire-types such as Volcarona and Skeledirge. Hence, Heatran makes for a great partner, as it walls those Fire-types thanks to Flash Fire, and it is also able to handle walls Scizor struggles with such as Amoonguss. In return, Scizor deals with Water-types that Heatran struggles with like Gastrodon and Swampert. Hisuian Goodra is a great teammate that can cover Scizor against special attackers like Choice Scarf Heatran and Choice Specs Greninja. Choice Scarf users like Gholdengo and Iron Treads provide speed control, with Gholdengo handling Hex Dragapult while Iron Treads removes Choice Specs Iron Moth. In return, Gholdengo appreciates Scizor removing Kingambit, while Iron Treads appreciates the removal of Iron Valiant. Scizor forms a scary offensive partnership with Kingambit, with Scizor threatening Fairy-types like Iron Valiant and Enamorus, while Kingambit handles Ghost-types that can wall Scizor such as Gholdengo and Pecharunt.

Choice Band (Steel).description:
Scizor utilizes a Choice Band to provide immediate pressure, OHKOing threats such as Mamoswine and Kyurem with Bullet Punch. Close Combat breaks through targets such as Porygon2, Iron Treads, and Archaludon that could otherwise take on Scizor's Bullet Punch. Knock Off smacks Ghost-types like Gholdengo and Pecharunt and allows Scizor to make progress against Skarmory and Gouging Fire. Finally, U-turn allows Scizor to pivot out while dealing immense damage to threats like Hydrapple and Ogerpon-W. The chosen EV spread allows Scizor to outspeed and easily remove Adamant Azumarill and uninvested Heatran while enabling it to reliably survive an Ogerpon-W's Ivy Cudgel after entry hazard damage.

Heatran is a crucial ally for Scizor, being able to come in on Fire-types that wall it such as Iron Moth, Volcarona, and Skeledirge and remove threats that can handle Scizor like Skarmory and Toxapex. Gholdengo appreciates Scizor removing Flutter Mane, and in response, Gholdengo can handle Fighting-types like Iron Hands and Zamazenta and Body Press users like Archaludon and Skarmory with ease. Skarmory provides Spikes, enabling Scizor to break through checks such as Pecharunt and Okidogi, and can use IronPress to beat Ground- and Fighting-types like Excadrill and Great Tusk. Iron Treads provides entry hazard removal with Rapid Spin, can remove Electric-types that resist Scizor's Bullet Punch such as non-Air Balloon Raging Bolt and Sandy Shocks, and can KO Landorus with Ice Spinner. Archaludon provides Stealth Rock support and can check foes such as Gouging Fire and Urshifu-R, which would otherwise easily remove Scizor. Hisuian Goodra can easily take on special attackers such as Greninja, Zapdos, and Sinistcha, which threaten Scizor.

Choice Band (Bug).description:
With a Choice Band, Scizor becomes a potent wallbreaker and revenge killer for Bug teams, providing immediate power to remove threats like Choice Scarf Iron Boulder and specially defensive Heatran while also proving to be a valuable asset against Rock teams. Bullet Punch targets Rock-, Fairy-, and Ice-types like Ogerpon-C, Flutter Mane, and Kyurem. It also serves as a countermeasure against setup sweepers like Unburden Sneasler, Dragon Dance Dragapult, and Belly Drum Azumarill. Close Combat smashes Steel-types like Archaludon and the aforementioned Heatran and 2HKOes specially defensive Corviknight after Stealth Rock damage. Knock Off threatens Ghost-types like Gholdengo while also messing with defensive switch-ins like Toxapex, Corviknight, and Great Tusk by removing their Heavy-Duty Boots or Leftovers. U-turn allows Scizor to gain momentum against switch-ins like Skarmory and Gouging Fire, bringing in teammates like Volcarona and Choice Scarf Kleavor. On the other hand, Dual Wingbeat handles Fighting-types like Urshifu-R and Great Tusk, while also dealing with bulkier targets like Amoonguss and Primarina.

Scizor's teammates benefit from its ability to remove Rock-types like Choice Scarf Iron Boulder and Ogerpon-C. Choice Scarf Kleavor leverages its Rock typing and Stone Axe to threaten Fire- and Flying-types like Gouging Fire, Ogerpon-H, and Zapdos while setting Stealth Rock. Volcarona eliminates Steel-types such as Skarmory and Corviknight as well as Toxapex when using Psychic. Additionally, its bulky sets can punish physical attackers like Dragonite and Iron Hands with its Flame Body and Will-O-Wisp while also absorbing Will-O-Wisp from foes like Sableye and Moltres. Araquanid boasts a valuable Fire resistance, allowing it to stave off threats like Volcarona and offensive variants of Heatran; it also offers a Will-O-Wisp immunity and Sticky Web, which allows Scizor to outspeed foes like Choice Band Hisuian Arcanine and Iron Treads. Frosmoth can dispatch bulky Ground- and Flying-types like Hippowdon, Gliscor, and Mandibuzz. Forretress complements Scizor's wallbreaking capabilities by setting entry hazards, which also synergizes with Scizor's Knock Off to wear down the opposing team. Forretress also provides hazard removal with Rapid Spin and can bring Scizor in safely with Volt Switch. Teammates like Lokix, Heracross, and Slither Wing value Scizor's removal of Fairy-types like Iron Valiant and Flutter Mane; in return, Lokix threatens Ghost-types like Gholdengo and Pecharunt, while Heracross and Slither Wing can break through walls like Toxapex, Rotom-W, and Skarmory.

Heracross.overview:
Bug

Heracross finds a niche as a physical wallbreaker, leveraging its Fighting typing and Guts to alleviate Rock and Steel matchups while also dismantling Poison team cores with its combination of Swords Dance + Guts-boosted Facade; however, due to that same typing and its below average Speed, it struggles against common Fairy- and Psychic-types like Iron Valiant and Latios and is a less-than-ideal choice. Furthermore, Heracross faces direct competition for its role from Life Orb Slither Wing, which also has U-turn and has access to reliable recovery. Heracross is also outclassed by other physical attackers like Scizor and Lokix, both possessing crucial priority options, with Scizor also being more adept at handling Rock and Fairy teams. Lastly, Volcarona, with its Fire typing and access to Quiver Dance, serves as a powerful special wallbreaker, outclassing Heracross as an answer to Steel-types barring Heatran.

Guts Attacker (Bug).description:
Heracross is a niche wallbreaker for Bug teams by virtue of its high Attack, Fighting typing, Swords Dance, and the ability Guts, capable of easing Rock, Steel, and Poison matchups. Close Combat eliminates Rock- and Steel-types like Tyranitar and Heatran and, when at +2, allows Heracross to break through walls like Skarmory, Mandibuzz, and Great Tusk. Facade complements Close Combat by targeting Flying-, Fairy-, and Poison-types, outright OHKOing Gliscor and Primarina at +2 and OHKOing Galarian Weezing and Toxapex at +2 after minimal chip damage. Knock Off threatens Ghost- and Psychic-types like Gholdengo and Slowbro, and it removes Leftovers and Heavy-Duty Boots from the aforementioned walls, wearing them down, which is especially helpful if Heracross opts to use Trailblaze as its fourth move. Trailblaze allows Heracross to outspeed faster foes like Ogerpon formes, Latios, and Choice Scarf Heatran, making it an excellent late-game cleaner. However, without Swords Dance, Heracross struggles to break walls like Toxapex, Galarian Weezing, and Iron Defense Skarmory.

Choice Scarf Kleavor is an essential teammate, serving as a revenge killer and utilizing its Rock typing to eliminate pesky Fire- and Flying-types like Ogerpon-H, Gouging Fire, Tornadus-T, and Dragonite, which pose a serious threat to Bug teams, while simultaneously setting Stealth Rock with Stone Axe. Araquanid provides Sticky Web support, which allows Heracross to outspeed would-be faster foes like the Ogerpon formes, Dragapult, and, when at +1, even Choice Scarf users like Meowscarada and Greninja. Araquanid can also take advantage of its superb special bulk and Fire resistance provided by Water Bubble to take on Fire-types like Volcarona and Iron Moth. Additionally, Araquanid can use Mirror Coat to get a surprise OHKO on foes like Choice Specs Latios and Flutter Mane. Scizor and Lokix cover Heracross's weaknesses; Scizor eliminates Fairy-types like Flutter Mane and Iron Valiant, while Lokix threatens Psychic- and Ghost-types like Latios and Dragapult; both teammates also deal with faster Rock-types like Iron Boulder and Ogerpon-C, which Heracross might struggle against. In return, Heracross can handle physical walls like Archaludon, Toxapex, and Mandibuzz. Forretress sets entry hazards, provides safe entry to Heracross with its slow Volt Switch, and removes hazards with Rapid Spin. Heracross's ability to break through special walls like Alolan Muk, Heatran, and Hisuian Goodra is greatly appreciated by teammates like Volcarona and Frosmoth. In return, Volcarona can spread burns to weaken physical attackers like Dragonite and Zamazenta, and Frosmoth can eliminate Flying-, Ground-, Dragon-types like Zapdos, Hippowdon, and Dragonite.

Skarmory.comments:
Other Options

Flying

Whirlwind can be used to force out threats like Archaludon, Dragonite, and Okidogi, only removing their boosts but also forcing them to take even more damage from Skarmory's entry hazards. Iron Head can be run on teams lacking Corviknight to deal with Fairy-types such as Iron Valiant and Mimikyu along with allowing Skarmory to hit Ghost-types.

Steel

Heavy-Duty Boots is an option for teams that lack entry hazard removal.

IronPress (Steel).description:
Skarmory provides a lot of utility for Steel-type teams, acting as a Spikes setter, a Ground-immune Pokemon, and an immovable physical wall. Skarmory's incredible defense stat, alongside its phenomenal defensive typing, allows it to check some of the most threatening physically oriented offensive threats in the tier such as Great Tusk, Roaring Moon, Sneasler, and Excadrill. Skarmory thrives by setting Spikes in front of Pokemon that can't touch it and have to switch out to make progress. Iron Defense allows Skarmory to remain on an even playing field if opposing setup sweepers such as Iron Defense Zamazenta and Dragonite attempt to set up. Body Press deals huge damage to opposing Steel-, Dark-, and Ice-type Pokemon such as Kingambit, Iron Treads, Chien-Pao, Hisuian Samurott, and Mamoswine. Rocky Helmet allows Skarmory to deal more passive damage to physical threats such as Kingambit and Iron Hands, as well as dissuading the use of pivot moves like U-turn and Flip Turn.

Skarmory's Spikes support is greatly appreciated by offensive teammates, as it allows them to have an easier time dealing with defensive staples such as Toxapex, Archaludon, Ursaluna-B, and Dondozo. Swords Dance Kingambit is able to have an easier time dealing with defensive staples such as Toxapex, Swampert, and Alolan Muk, as the entry hazard damage makes it very difficult for them to switch in. Choice Scarf Gholdengo also pairs nicely with Skarmory, as it can block both Defog and Rapid Spin, ensuring that Spikes remain on the field. Gholdengo can also deal with Flutter Mane and mixed mttacking Iron Valiant, two threats to Skarmory. In return, Skarmory is able to deal with Gholdengo's counters in Chien-Pao, Excadrill, and Kingambit. Archaludon is another great teammate for Skarmory, as the two form a threatening entry hazard-stacking core with Archaludon's Stealth Rock. Archaludon also handles physical Fire-type attackers such as Hisuian Arcanine and Ogerpon-H that Skarmory struggles with, as well as handling Dragon-type Pokemon via Draco Meteor. Iron Treads is able to switch into Electric-type attacks that would otherwise make quick work of Skarmory, as well as being able to remove hazards via Rapid Spin. Iron Treads is also capable of beating mixed Garchomp and Landorus. Air Balloon Heatran and Skarmory form a nice pair, as Heatran can switch into Fire-type attacks, while Skarmory can switch into Ground-type attacks to preserve Heatran. Heatran aids greatly in the Steel mirror match by taking out Gholdengo while also providing additional hazard support with Stealth Rock. Empoleon is capable of switching in to protect Skarmory from Fire- and Water-type attacks. Empoleon also has the additional benefit of being able to remove Heavy-Duty Boots from the opposing team with Knock Off. Additionally, Empoleon can use Flip Turn to get Skarmory in safely, provide additional hazard support via Stealth Rock, and recover HP with Roost. Hisuian Goodra is another great special wall, able to switch into Electric-type attacks that would otherwise make quick work of Skarmory. Hisuian Goodra is also capable of removing Heavy-Duty Boots from foes thanks to Knock Off. Additionally, Hisuian Goodra has a wide array of moves that make it capable of beating potent special attackers such as Dragapult, Landorus, and Gholdengo. Other sweepers such as Swords Dance Scizor, Lucario, and Iron Crown are all excellent teammates for Skarmory, as the extra damage from entry hazards goes a long way.

Physically Defensive (Flying).description:
Skarmory is an incredible defensive tool for Flying teams with its Steel typing coupled with incredible physical bulk, which makes it an excellent wall neutral to physical Rock- and Ice-type attacks commonly thrown at Flying teams. Rocky Helmet and Body Press let it handle common powerful physical attackers such as Chien-Pao, Kleavor, and Kingambit. Iron Defense allows it to comfortably shrug off hits from threats like Iron Hands, Zamazenta, and Baxcalibur. Spikes and Stealth Rock pressure threats like Gholdengo, Raging Bolt, and Toxapex, with the former being used if another teammate is running Stealth Rock.

Gliscor serves as an excellent partner for Skarmory, being able to effortlessly handle incoming Electric-type attacks from the likes of Regieleki and Sandy Shocks along with dealing with powerful Fire-type types like Gouging Fire, Heatran, and Ceruledge; additionally, Gliscor can run a Swords Dance set if Skarmory is running Stealth Rock. Corviknight complements Skarmory incredibly well as a special wall to deal with threatening special attacks from the likes of Flutter Mane, Iron Valiant, and Kyurem along with using Defog to give Skarmory safe entry. Articuno with its high special bulk serves as solid deterrence to threatening special attackers such as Greninja, Dragapult, and Keldeo. Gyarados, thanks to its Water typing, Intimidate, and phazing tools can deter threats such as Gouging Fire, Ceruledge, Chien-Pao, and Barraskewda. Landorus's Ground typing and high offensive stats make it an excellent threat against notable Electric-, Fire-, and Poison-types such as Raging Bolt, Gouging Fire, and Toxapex. Enamorus and Dragonite benefit immensely from Skarmory's hazard support to soften up walls like Alolan Muk, Hippowdon, and Hisuian Goodra so they can effortlessly break through them along with Skarmory's ability to take Ice Shard from the likes of Chien-Pao, Mamoswine, and Baxcalibur. Zapdos serves as a solid Electric neutrality along with threatening out opposing bulky Flying-types like Corviknight, Moltres, and Skarmory as well as Water-types like Urshifu-R and Pelipper. Tornadus-T can handle the Ogerpon formes with its Hurricane and remove HeavyDuty Boots from threats like Amoonguss and Sableye with Knock Off, making Skarmory's Spikes even more potent. Mandibuzz gives a solid Ghost resistance against threats like Dragapult and Ceruledge and can also use Knock Off to remove Heavy-Duty Boots. Galarian Moltres can take advantage of Spikes and threaten Ghost-types like Gholdengo and Pecharunt with its Fiery Wrath.

Kingdra.comments:
Other Options

Water

Scald is an alternative choice of Water-type STAB move that sacrifices some power compared to Surf, but in exchange, it can potentially hinder common switch-ins like Articuno and Hisuian Goodra with its burn chance, making them shakier checks later on. Ice Beam is an option to hit Water Absorb Clodsire super effectively, but it fails to score a 2HKO, making it hard to justify without heavy entry hazard support.

Choice Specs (Water).description:
Kingdra is a solid choice of rain sweeper for Water teams, notably helping the type improve its difficult Dragon matchup; its part-Dragon typing also helps the team deal with problematic Grass- and Electric-types like Meowscarada and Raging Bolt. Draco Meteor is an incredibly powerful STAB attack, outright OHKOing the vast majority of Dragon-types and dealing massive neutral damage to other Water-type switch-ins such as Ogerpon-W and Volcanion, both of which are OHKOed after minimal chip damage. Dragon Pulse is a more spammable STAB move that's especially useful for cleaning up weakened teams thanks to its excellent neutral coverage; it's also powerful enough to KO many opposing Dragon-types, such as Latios and Roaring Moon, without prior chip damage, letting Kingdra avoid the exploitable Special Attack drop from Draco Meteor. Surf is the default choice of Water-type STAB move for its reliability, boasting perfect accuracy and still being boosted to obscene levels by rain and Choice Specs; however, Hydro Pump is also quite useful for its extra power against specific targets. For instance, Hydro Pump in rain will always OHKO Kingambit and Choice Specs Flutter Mane as well as 2HKO Articuno and Slowbro, while Surf will never do the same. Hydro Pump is valuable enough that it can viably be run alongside Surf, but the last moveslot has other useful options as well: Hurricane is a useful tool against Grass-types like Amoonguss, Meowscarada, and Ogerpon-W, OHKOing all three after Stealth Rock without incurring the exploitable Special Attack drop from Draco Meteor. Flip Turn is another useful option to pivot out against walls like Blissey and Toxapex, giving Kingdra's teammates easy entry against them. A Timid nature is the default choice for Kingdra, letting it outspeed Regieleki and fast Choice Scarf users like Meowscarada and Roaring Moon in rain, but Modest is a viable option if these threats are sufficiently covered on the defensive side, and a Modest Kingdra is still fast enough to outspeed most Choice Scarf users in rain, notably getting the jump on Latias.

Pelipper is a mandatory teammate for Kingdra, as Kingdra is a fairly mediocre attacker outside of rain. Pelipper's U-turn is also great for pivoting into Kingdra and its other powerful teammates. Several types, such as Normal, Dragon, Psychic, and Ground, rely solely on dedicated special walls like Blissey, Hisuian Goodra, Galarian Slowking, and Water Absorb Clodsire to prevent a Kingdra sweep, so teammates that can deal with these Pokemon are great assets to it. Swords Dance Urshifu-R is a standout example, threatening all of these walls with its powerful Close Combat and coverage options; it can also help deal with Kingambit, which threatens to beat Kingdra in an endgame scenario. Swords Dance Ogerpon-W is another great setup sweeper that can also lure Toxapex and Clodsire with Zen Headbutt, making it far easier for Kingdra to clean up after it. On extremely aggressive rain teams, Barraskewda is potentially useful to form a double Swift Swim core with Kingdra, beating the aforementioned special walls with its powerful Choice Band-boosted attacks; it especially enjoys Kingdra being able to annihilate Grass-types with Hurricane or a Dragon-type move. Stealth Rock support is a must-have for Kingdra, as many of its important damage benchmarks rely on its chip damage. Swampert and Empoleon are both reliable Stealth Rock setters that also provide a ton of defensive utility: the former threatens Poison-type walls and reduces the pressure on Kingdra to deal with Electric-types, and the latter switches into Fairy-type revenge killers like Flutter Mane and Alolan Ninetales for it. Both of these Pokemon can also use Knock Off to remove Heavy-Duty Boots from common walls like Toxapex, and their access to Flip Turn lets them pivot into Kingdra easily. Choice Scarf Hisuian Samurott is a welcome teammate for Kingdra thanks to its great coverage and utility; Ceaseless Edge generates entry hazard pressure and scares Galarian Slowking, Knock Off removes Leftovers and Heavy-Duty Boots from various walls, and Sacred Sword threatens problematic Kingdra checks like Kingambit, Blissey, and Hisuian Goodra. While having a Choice Scarf user alongside a Swift Swim user may seem redundant, it's useful as a backup form of speed control for when rain isn't active. Since Kingdra has a tendency to get worn down by hazards if the game doesn't wrap up quickly, Rain Dish Tentacruel can be a useful teammate for the Rapid Spin support it provides, and its excellent special bulk also makes it a great answer to threats like Flutter Mane and Hydrapple. Although it's hard to fit and shares some checks with Kingdra, Choice Specs Greninja is a massive threat that's helpful for overloading special walls alongside it, threatening to 2HKO Clodsire and Galarian Slowking with Ice Beam and Dark Pulse, respectively, and it can put major pressure on Fairy-types like Clefable and Azumarill with Sludge Wave.

Physical Defensive.description:
Porygon2 is an amazing physical wall on Normal teams due to its good bulk and access to Eviolite. Discharge threatens Flying- and Water-types like Corviknight, Gyarados, and Barraskewda. Ice Beam checks Ground-, Flying-, and Dragon-types like the Landorus-T, Dragonite, and Garchomp. Foul Play is a great anti-setup move that dissuades physical sweepers like Scizor, Ceruledge, and the Ogerpon formes from setting up. Substitute can be run over Foul Play, as it allows Porygon2 to block status from Toxapex and Amoonguss while also protecting itself from incoming threats like Great Tusk or Keldeo. However, doing so will make Porygon2 vulnerable into setup sweepers like Ogerpon-H and Gouging Fire due to not having Foul Play. Trace is the ideal ability for Porygon2 to copy Regenerator and Poison Heal from Toxapex and Gliscor, respectively. Trace also allows Porygon2 to copy Sword of Ruin, which helps it take hits from Chien-Pao better. Download can be run over Trace to make Porygon2 a bulky wallbreaker, making it notably effective in the Flying matchup by taking out Corviknight and Skarmory with ease.

Blissey is the ideal partner for Porygon2, forming a strong defensive core by providing a switch-in to special threats like Flutter Mane, Dragapult, and Choice Specs Greninja, while also spreading paralysis with Thunder Wave. Blissey also provides utility in setting up Stealth Rock. Braviary provides entry hazard removal with Defog for Porygon2 while also checking Sneasler, Ogerpon-W, and Breloom with Brave Bird. In return, Porygon2 deals with Iron Boulder and Ceruledge for Braviary with Foul Play. Choice Specs Hisuian Zoroark is a nice teammate due to its Fighting immunity, and it can threaten important targets like Urshifu-R, Gholdengo, non-Choice Scarf Heatran, and Pecharunt with Shadow Ball and Focus Blast. Calm Mind Ursaluna-B is a great wallbreaker, KOing defensive threats like Galarian Weezing, Gouging Fire, and Heatran at +1. Ursaluna-B is also a Knock Off absorber for Porygon2 due its bulk and access to Moonlight. Choice Scarf Indeedee is a great revenge killer, taking out Fighting- and Poison-types like mixed Iron Valiant, Zamazenta, and Clodsire, and it can use Healing Wish to bring Porygon2 back to full health if it gets weakened. Ditto becomes a great reverse sweeper for Porygon2 by transforming into sweepers like Gouging Fire and Chien-Pao. Cinccino not only removes hazards and boosts its stats with Tidy Up, but also threatens a lot of specially bulky Pokemon with Bullet Seed, Rock Blast, and Triple Axel for Porygon2, most notably Articuno and Swampert. Cinccino can also run a Choice Band set to potentially wallbreak, letting it OHKO Clodsire with Triple Axel. Terapagos can run an offensive utility set with Rapid Spin for Porygon2, but it can also become a fierce setup sweeper with Calm Mind and Tera Starstorm. Terapagos notably threatens Steel-types like Excadrill and Heatran with Earth Power, which Porygon2 appreciates.

Entry Hazard Setter.description:
Thanks to Smeargle's nearly endless movepool, it finds a place in the metagame as the premier entry hazard setter for hyper offensive Normal teams. Ceaseless Edge and Stone Axe are able to set up Spikes and Stealth Rock, ignoring Magic Bounce from Hatterene. Sticky Web support is the driving force behind hyper offensive Normal teams, as the Speed reduction greatly helps its powerful wallbreakers such as Terapagos and Ursaluna. Spore, in tandem with Focus Sash, allows Smeargle to immobilize a foe for a few turns, giving Smeargle an opportunity to set up hazards.

Hisuian Zoroark is a great teammate for Smeargle, as its Ghost typing blocks Rapid Spin; it also appreciates the wide range of entry hazards Smeargle can provide, which aids its wallbreaking capabilities. With Sticky Web set up, Hisuian Zoroark is able to outspeed Choice Scarf Great Tusk and Choice Scarf Gholdengo, stopping them from revenge killing it. Terapagos is another incredibly strong wallbreaking teammate that thrives with entry hazard support. Tera Starstorm turns from a 3HKO to a 2HKO on Pokemon such as Clodsire and Swampert. Terapagos also has a lot of great coverage moves, such as Earth Power for Steel- and Fire-types like Heatran and Ceruledge and Ice Beam for Flying-types such as Landorus and Gliscor. Braviary is a strong physical attacker that takes advantage of Smeargle's Sticky Web support, as its Defiant ability punishes Defog. Indeedee is also a great teammate, as its Psychic-type support helps greatly in the Poison and Fighting matchups. Psychic Terrain also protects its teammates against priority moves, blocking foes such as Kingambit and Scizor from revenge killing setup sweepers. Ditto can take advantage of Sticky Web, having an easier time coming in for revenge kills against Choice Scarf users such as Meowscarada and Great Tusk.

Defensive.description:
With the highest HP stat in all of Pokemon, an extremely impressive Special Defense stat, and access to important utility moves, Blissey is one of the best special walls in the entire tier, as well as being Normal's best Stealth Rock setter. Seismic Toss is the best move for Blissey to deal consistent damage and not be a completely passive Pokemon despite being ineffective against Ghost-types. Shadow Ball can be used over Seismic Toss in order to not be completely useless against Ghost-types. Stealth Rock helps Blissey's offensive teammates like Ursaluna and Maushold have an easier time getting KOs. Thunder Wave is used to slow down opposing Pokemon so that Blissey's slower, wallbreaking teammates, such as Ursaluna, have an easier time making progress. Alternatively, Healing Wish can be used over Thunder Wave in order to heal one of Blissey's teammates to full health, gaining momentum and making an end-game sweep easier.

Wallbreakers like Ursaluna and Choice Specs Hisuian Zoroark are great teammates for Blissey, as they are capable of dealing with the defensive Pokemon that Blissey is unable to beat, such as Sableye, Toxapex, and Dondozo. In return, Blissey can switch into attacks to keep the wallbreakers safe. Ditto and Blissey make a great pair, as, thanks to Natural Cure, Blissey is able to switch in to status moves that would otherwise cripple Ditto, such as Will-O-Wisp from Sableye, Skeledirge, and Rotom-W, as well as Thunder Wave from Gholdengo, then get rid of the status via Natural Cure. Ditto is also capable of dealing with setup sweepers that would otherwise threaten Blissey such as Baxcalibur and Dragonite. Thunder Wave is also a great option to use on opposing Choice Scarf users like Iron Valiant and Meowscarada so Ditto will not have to worry about Speed ties. Hisuian Zoroark is a great teammate for Blissey, as the immunity to Fighting-type moves is extremely valuable. Hisuian Zoroark is also able to burn opposing physical threats like Urshifu-R and Dragonite, which would otherwise make quick work of Blissey, as well as dealing with Ghost-type Pokemon which Blissey cannot damage without Shadow Ball. Hisuian Zoroark's Knock Off can also help Blissey wear down targets by making them vulnerable to entry hazards and removing Leftovers and Black Sludge recovery. Moreover, Hisuian Zoroark can disguise itself as Blissey and catch foes such as Iron Hands, Zamazenta and Sneasler off guard. Cyclizar is a good teammate for Blissey, as Blissey can switch into the fast special attackers that would otherwise threaten Cyclizar such as Flutter Mane and Choice Scarf Walking Wake. Cyclizar also carries Knock Off, which, as mentioned previously, works well with Blissey. Choice Specs Cyclizar outspeeds and threatens to OHKO non-Choice Scarf Iron Valiant, which would otherwise threaten Blissey, with Hyper Voice. Finally, Braviary and Staraptor can function as alternative switch-ins to Fighting-type Pokemon like Quaquaval and Great Tusk and retaliate with their STAB-boosted Brave Bird. Braviary uses Defog to keep Blissey and teammates safe from hazards, while Staraptor is a more offensive Choice Scarf user able to threaten Fighting-type Pokemon.

Suicune.overview: Suicune is generally outclassed as a Calm Mind user—offensively by Keldeo and defensively at times by Primarina. Keldeo requires less setup, becoming immediately threatening at +1 with Secret Sword and Vacuum Wave, while Primarina boasts a better defensive typing, which is valuable in Dragon and Fighting matchups. With Draining Kiss and Psychic Noise, Primarina can also more proactively handle threats like Zamazenta and Clodsire. However, Suicune is overall bulkier than these two options, and Pressure, combined with Substitute and Protect, makes it an extremely frustrating defensive win condition, stalling out Pokemon reliant on low-PP moves like Latios, Gholdengo, and Sneasler.

Calm Mind.description:
Calm Mind Suicune is a terrifying defensive win condition due to its sheer bulk, coupled with Scald's burn chance, allowing Suicune to whittle down Flying, Steel, and Fighting teams lacking Pokemon that 2HKO it. Protect and Substitute allow Suicune to scout and PP stall foes, and when paired with Pressure, it can achieve seemingly impossible feats, such as depleting Bleakwind Storm, Luster Purge, Seismic Toss, and Earthquake from Tornadus-T, Latios, Blissey, and Clodsire, respectively. Scald is preferred due to the burn chance, massively reducing the number of physical attackers that can come in to overwhelm Suicune before it accrues too many boosts. For instance, if Iron Hands gets burned, its Thunder Punch will not be able to break Suicune's Substitute in one hit. The given EV spread provides Suicune enough bulk for its Substitute not to break in one hit against Earthquake from Gliscor or fixed damage moves such as Seismic Toss or Night Shade. 216 Speed EVs lets it outspeed Adamant Mamoswine, OHKOing it with Scald after Stealth Rock damage and a Calm Mind boost.

As Suicune is reliant on Leftovers for recovery, it is ruined by Toxic Spikes. Hence, Poison-types such as Toxapex and Tentacruel are a must-have due to their ability to passively remove them. Toxapex also checks setup sweepers that can overwhelm Suicune, such as Iron Defense Zamazenta and Dragon Dance Gouging Fire, while Tentacruel is able to spin away other entry hazards to preserve Suicune's health. Greninja deals with the Ogerpon formes and Sinistcha that overwhelm Suicune and can use a Choice Scarf set to deal with runaway setup sweepers like Hisuian Lilligant, Trailblaze Ogerpon-H, and Scale Shot Garchomp. Electric-immune teammates such as Gastrodon and Swampert are useful for dealing with Choice Specs users locked into Thunderbolt such as Flutter Mane and Dragapult that do too much damage against Suicune; they also can set up entry hazards to chip down Suicune's checks. These teammates, in turn, benefit from Suicune's ability to scout the next move, preventing them from taking unnecessary damage from the coverage moves of these threats. Empoleon checks Kyurem and Hatterene and sets Stealth Rock. Swords Dance Hisuian Samurott also sets entry hazards with Ceaseless Edge and cleans up opposing teams after Suicune has worn them down. Walking Wake is decent for dealing with Dragon-types like Gouging Fire and Hydrapple, which use Suicune as setup fodder and tears up Fire teams with its Protosynthesis-boosted Hydro Steam.

Tyranitar.comments:
Other Options

Rock

If Stealth Rock is covered by a different teammate, Tyranitar has a myriad of options such as Thunder Wave, Ice Punch, and Fire Blast to slow down opposing teams or lure in and weaken Gliscor or Skarmory. A specially attacking Tyranitar with Fire Blast, Earth Power, and Ice Beam can be viable, as it catches switch-ins and general nuisances to Rock teams like Skarmory, Archaludon, and Gliscor off-guard. However, Tyranitar has to then use a more offensive EV spread of 252 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with a Mild or Modest nature, which lets Choice Specs Flutter Mane OHKO it with Moonblast. Alternatively, an EV spread for a specially attacking Tyranitar of 16 HP / 236 SpA / 92 SpD / 164 Spe lets it survive an attack from Choice Specs Flutter Mane while still outspeeding Kingambit, but this leaves it outsped and easily OHKOed by Archaludon's Body Press.

Sand Setter (Rock).description:
Tyranitar finds a spot on Rock teams thanks to its incredible stat spread and invaluable ability, Sand Stream, to set up sand for its teammates. Heavy Slam allows Tyranitar to make use of its incredible weight to check Fairy-types like Flutter Mane and Hatterene. Low Kick handles Steel- and Dark-type targets such as Heatran, Kingambit, and Hydreigon. Knock Off allows Tyranitar to remove crucial items from physically bulky threats such as Archaludon, Toxapex, and Skarmory, along with threatening Ghost- and Psychic-types like Ceruledge and Espathra. The given EV Spread allows Tyranitar to outspeed Adamant Kingambit while maximizing its special bulk to survive two Moonblasts from Choice Scarf Flutter Mane.

Tyranitar greatly appreciates the support of Choice Scarf Iron Boulder, which can deal with Fighting-types such as Sneasler, Iron Valiant, and Breloom, along with handling faster threats like Ogerpon-H and Enamorus. Hisuian Arcanine handles Grass- and Steel-type threats such as Amoonguss, Scizor, and Corviknight. Ogerpon-C can check problematic Water- and Ground-types such as Keldeo, Swampert, and the Landorus formes while appreciating Tyranitar's sand to help it set up in front of special attackers like Hydrapple and Primarina. Glimmora provides support by removing entry hazards with Mortal Spin, along with being able to use a Choice Scarf to handle threats such as Iron Valiant with Sludge Wave and Great Tusk with Energy Ball. Rhyperior appreciates Tyranitar's sand patching up its Special Defense and allowing it to take hits such as Landorus's Earth Power; in return, Rhyperior leverages its bulk to remove threats like Skarmory, Gliscor, and Excadrill. Both Minior and Garganacl majorly appreciate Tyranitar setting up sand and Stealth Rock, providing them with safety as they set up. Choice Scarf Kleavor can provide support with Stone Axe freeing up Tyranitar to run a different utility option instead of Stealth Rock, and it is able to threaten Dark- and Grass-types such as Hoopa-U, Choice Band Meowscarada, and Ogerpon-W.

Specially Defensive (Dark).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Swampert.comments:
Other Options

Water

Yawn lets Swampert threaten to put foes to sleep while forcing switches, a rarity for Water teams aside from fringe options like Politoed. Ice Punch can surprise Ground-resistant switch-ins with super effective damage, notably 2HKOing Latios after Stealth Rock, but finding a moveslot for it is difficult. Mirror Coat can grab a surprise OHKO on problematic targets like Flutter Mane, but its reliance on prediction makes it inconsistent. Heavy-Duty Boots can be worthwhile on some teams, since Swampert struggles against some Spikes-stacking teams like Flying and Poison, but this leaves it without any recovery and thus more easily worn down by direct damage.

Defensive Pivot (Water).description:
Swampert is the best offensive Stealth Rock setter available to Water teams thanks to its great bulk and access to Flip Turn. Its partial Ground typing is also excellent, granting it an Electric immunity which notably lets it block Volt Switch from common threats such as Zapdos, Iron Treads, and Iron Hands. STAB Earthquake strikes fear into the heart of bulky Pokemon that often annoy Water such as Clodsire, Alolan Muk, and Gouging Fire while boasting decent neutral damage even with low investment. Alternatively, Earth Power deals less neutral damage but allows Swampert to lure annoying physical tanks like Archaludon, Torkoal, and Pecharunt and surprise them with a 2HKO. Flip Turn allows Swampert to pivot out of common switch-ins like Amoonguss, Skarmory, and Latios and act as a pivot for frailer teammates. Flip Turn's damage also shouldn't be underestimated; boosts from it being a STAB move, rain, and potentially Torrent can make it a nasty parting gift. As an example, a Flip Turn with all of those multipliers active has a chance to OHKO Gliscor after Stealth Rock. Swampert can set up Stealth Rock itself, providing critical entry hazard support for a type with somewhat limited options for the role; this also lets it break Focus Sash on major threats that use it such as Breloom. Since its STAB combination is excellent on its own, Swampert is free to run a utility move of choice in the last moveslot: Roar lets it rack up passive damage against the opposing team after setting up Stealth Rock and phaze some setup sweepers that it can't threaten to KO, such as Calm Mind Primarina and IronPress Skarmory. Protect lets Swampert make the most of Leftovers recovery while scouting Choice item users such as Choice Band Chien-Pao and Choice Specs Flutter Mane, making them easier to play around. Knock Off gives Swampert extra coverage against foes like Latios and lets it remove Heavy-Duty Boots from its switch-ins, forcing them to take Stealth Rock damage and thus making them easier to outlast. The given EV spread maximizes Swampert's ability to take special hits, achieving such feats as avoiding a 2HKO from Choice Specs Iron Valiant's Moonblast after Stealth Rock and surviving 4x super effective hits like Hydrapple's Giga Drain. 24 Attack EVs guarantee that Earthquake will always 2HKO Garganacl after Stealth Rock damage, as well as OHKO Excadrill, and 2HKO bulky Gouging Fire. On Earth Power sets, use a Calm nature and move the Attack EVs into Special Attack.

Since its typing and Stealth Rock make it universally useful to Water, Swampert is highly flexible in what teams it can fit on. Swords Dance Ogerpon-W is a quintessential teammate that enjoys entry hazard support to wear down its checks before a sweep. Empoleon is great for checking Grass-type attackers that threaten Swampert, like Amoonguss and Abomasnow, and discouraging Freeze-Dry spam from Kyurem and Alolan Ninetales; its STAB Flash Cannon also threatens Hatterene and Galarian Weezing, both of which can frustrate Swampert's attempts to set up Stealth Rock. Toxapex is an even sturdier Grass-type check that can deal with Meowscarada and Ogerpon formes, and it stacks hazards with Swampert in the form of Toxic Spikes. Choice Scarf Hisuian Samurott can check some threats that annoy Swampert like Slowbro, Latios, and Air Balloon Gholdengo while also contributing Spikes. Calm Mind Primarina is a potent wincon that can deal with offensive Dark- and Dragon-types like Chien-Pao and Dragonite, which tend to overwhelm Swampert, and it enjoys Swampert pressuring common special walls, most notably Clodsire. Choice Specs Greninja especially can tear massive holes in the opposing team with help from Swampert's Stealth Rock, and its coverage threatens common hazard-control options like Hatterene, Great Tusk, and Brambleghast. Keldeo can threaten some Rapid Spin users that Swampert has trouble with like Great Tusk, Avalugg, and Alolan Sandslash, and it enjoys Flip Turn support to hit the field safely; other frail offensive threats like Greninja, Barraskewda, and Cloyster love Swampert's reliable ability to pivot as well. Other pivots like Rotom-W, Pelipper, Barraskewda, and Urshifu-R can form an oppressive VoltTurn core with Swampert, continuously wearing down foes in conjunction with entry hazards. Volcanion can punish Grass- and Ice-types similarly to Empoleon while discouraging Corviknight and Forretress from spending a turn on hazard removal with its Fire-type STAB move.

Choice Specs (Water).description:
With Choice Specs, Pelipper can serve as a scary offensive force while providing rain support. Hurricane's perfect accuracy in rain allows Pelipper to use its strongest STAB move reliably, enabling it to remove Grass- and Fighting-types like Amoonguss, non-Focus Sash Breloom, and Okidogi. Surf consistently pressures threats like Corviknight and Alolan Muk. Knock Off hinders targets that can handle Pelipper such as Rotom-W and Water Absorb Clodsire by removing their Leftovers and Black Sludge, respectively. Finally, U-turn allows Pelipper to safely pivot out of unfavorable matchups and into wallbreakers such as Barraskewda. The given EV spread helps it outspeed Adamant Breloom and Bisharp while letting it survive a Flower Trick from a Choice Band Meowscarada at full health.

Barraskewda complements Pelipper by removing targets like Choice Specs Flutter Mane and Blissey. Close Combat helps Barraskewda beat Hisuian Goodra and in return, Barraskewda appreciates Pelipper enabling Swift Swim and eliminating physical walls like Skarmory and Pecharunt. Ogerpon-W appreciates Pelipper handling opposing Grass-types like Sinistcha and Amoonguss, which would otherwise wall it, and in return, Ogerpon-W can remove Water- and Rock-types that can cause issues for Pelipper such as Primarina, Rotom-W, and Glimmora. Swampert acts like a bulky Electric immunity capable of removing targets like Sandy Shocks and Raging Bolt while providing Stealth Rock support to wear down checks like Latios and Kyurem. Swampert can also use Flip Turn to bring Pelipper in safely, forming a pivot core. Toxapex provides a solid Grass neutrality and Fairy resistance, capable of handling foes like Meowscarada, Mimikyu, and Enamorus.
