Choice Scarf Urshifu-R acts like a fast threat, breaking through Pelipper's checks like Empoleon and Choice Specs Iron Moth. Furthermore, rain enables Urshifu-R to OHKO Ogerpon-H. Hisuian Samurott grants support by setting up Spikes with Ceaseless Edge to chip down would-be checks to Pelipper, like Assault Vest Iron Hands and Water Absorb Clodsire. It can also use Sucker Punch to check foes like Dragapult and Latios. Quaquaval and Tentacruel both provide entry hazard removal. Additionally, Quaquaval can break Hisuian Goodra, while Tentacruel provides a soft check to the Ogerpon formes with Liquid Ooze. Empoleon is a solid teammate capable of providing Stealth Rock and pivoting with Flip Turn. It can also use Flash Cannon to nail Ice- and Fairy-type threats like Kyurem, Alolan Ninetales, and Hatterene.

Rain Setter (Flying).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Rain Setter (Water).description:
Pelipper provides rain for Water teams, which enables Barraskewda and wallbreakers like Azumarill and Walking Wake. Hurricane is the STAB move of choice, bypassing the accuracy check in rain while nailing Water-resistant Grass-types, such as Amoonguss, Meowscarada, and Breloom. Roost allows Pelipper to come in multiple times throughout the match to re-set rain if need be. U-turn let's it slow pivot into threats such as Quaquaval and Barraskewda. Knock Off cripples foes, while Surf gives a secondary STAB move boosted by rain, allowing Pelipper to wear down Pokemon like Gholdengo and Kingambit. Heavy-Duty Boots allows it to switch in and set rain even if Stealth Rock is up. An alternative EV spread of 248 HP / 48 Def / 212 Spe with a Timid nature can be used to outspeed Adamant Breloom.

Barraskewda is the obvious partner choice thanks to its ridiculous Speed with Swift Swim in rain. It also appreciates Pelipper's slow pivoting with U-turn due to its lack of bulk. Walking Wake is another great rain attacker, since its STAB Dragon-type moves hit most Water-resistant and immune foes, such as opposing Gastrodon and Amoonguss, hard. Quaquaval appreciates Pelipper's slow pivoting to come in safely and can potentially snowball through teams with rain-boosted Aqua Step and Moxie. Quaquaval can also get rid of entry hazards should Pelipper get hit by Knock Off, provided it has Rapid Spin. Gastrodon and Quagsire are also really good partners thanks to their Electric immunities. Both also provide entry hazards, pressuring opponents, and Pelipper can use hazard removal turns to pivot out with U-turn or heal with Roost. Rotom-W can form a VoltTurn core with Pelipper, allowing the team to gain momentum easily and bring in Pokemon fairly safely. Rotom-W can also switch into opposing Electric-types like Magnezone, Iron Hands, and Sandy Shocks if necessary. Toxapex provides a Fighting resistance, a Grass neutrality, and another pivot thanks to its ability, Regenerator. Slowking checks threats such as Indeedee and Walking Wake, and it's another slow pivot thanks to Chilly Reception and Regenerator, bringing Pelipper in safely to set the rain. Both Toxapex and Slowking can also easily pivot into Pelipper with Eject Button, since Regenerator means they won't lose too much health from an attack. Azumarill can take advantage of rain with priority in Aqua Jet, as well as bringing a very strong Water-type STAB move.

Choice Specs (Psychic).description:
Choice Specs Gardevoir is a niche wallbreaker on Psychic teams. With Moonblast, it can OHKO Dark-types such as Mandibuzz and Sableye, as well as shutting down Dragon-type threats such as Latios, Kyurem, and Raging Bolt. Psyshock beats specially defensive walls such as Blissey and Articuno. Focus Blast provides coverage against Steel-type foes, letting Gardevoir OHKO Archaludon and Heatran. Thunderbolt lets it handle Flying- and Water-types like Skarmory, Pelipper, and Alomomola. Trick can be used as a niche pick to neutralize threats such as Gouging Fire, Dragonite, and Alolan Muk. Vacuum Wave lets Gardevoir finish off fast weakened foes like Choice Scarf Weavile and Excadrill in sand; with a Modest nature, Gardevoir can OHKO Kingambit after Stealth Rock. Timid Gardevoir can outspeed threats such as Adamant Dragonite and Timid Heatran. Trace lets it shut down Pokemon that rely on their ability such as Kingambit, Cinderace, and Greninja.

Gardevoir requires Stealth Rock in order to OHKO many Pokemon; for this purpose, Jirachi and Metagross can easily set Stealth Rock, as well as covering most of each other’s weaknesses. Gardevoir also faces problems with Ghost-type Pokemon; for this, Hoopa-U and Indeedee are the best partners for it, as Hoopa-U takes neutral damage from Ghost-type attacks and can reliably take care of Flutter Mane and Gholdengo. Indeedee is immune to Ghost and sets Psychic Terrain for the team, which boosts the power of Gardevoir's Psychic-type moves and protects it from priority moves from Pokemon like Scizor and Kingambit. Gardevoir also forms a wallbreaking core with Choice Scarf Iron Boulder, allowing Gardevoir to handle foes like Archaludon and Skarmory, while Iron Boulder deals with foes like Gouging Fire, Hisuian Goodra, and Choice Specs Flutter Mane. Deoxys-S is an incredible partner for Gardevoir, as it can set Spikes to boost Gardevoir's wallbreaking potential and use Teleport to grant it safe entry. Latios and Latias form a wallbreaking core with Gardevoir, with Latias providing additional aid through Healing Wish, which allows Gardevoir to battle at full potential once again. Espathra is a late-game sweeper that complements Gardevoir role as a wallbreaker.

Focus Sash (Fighting).description:
Breloom fulfills a variety of roles for Fighting teams, with Spore immobilizing threats like Corviknight, Pelipper, and Toxapex and operates as a revenge killer with Mach Punch. Swords Dance further boosts its great Attack and lets Breloom take advantage of forcing foes out after they have been afflicted with Spore to set up. Bulldoze can be used in place of Spore or Swords Dance to handle Poison-types that would otherwise give it problems like Okidogi and Toxapex. However, Spore and Swords Dance are usually preferred, since the former grants Breloom great utility while the latter can potentially turn it into a setup sweeper. Bullet Seed is a strong STAB move that threatens Ground-types like Clodsire and Great Tusk as well as breaking Ogerpon-C's Sturdy and OHKOing it outright after a Swords Dance boost. Mach Punch, when boosted with Swords Dance, turns Breloom into a setup sweeper, taking on faster threats like Hoopa-U, Kyurem, and Excadrill.

Offensive Great Tusk is one of Breloom's best teammates, as it sets up Stealth Rock to bolster Breloom's breaking and sweeping capabilities, removes entry hazards with Rapid Spin to preserve Breloom's Focus Sash, and handles sun teams thanks to Protosynthesis. In return, Breloom handles Water-types that threaten Great Tusk such as Greninja and Primarina. Keldeo and Urshifu-R not only handle Fire-types like Heatran and Ceruledge, but Keldeo also outpaces and threatens non-Choice Scarf Landorus, while Urshifu-R can revenge kill weakened sweepers and cleaners like Volcarona, Choice Scarf Iron Valiant, and Flutter Mane with Aqua Jet. Choice Scarf Sneasler and Assault Vest Iron Hands make for great teammates, as they handle Fairy-types like Flutter Mane and Enamorus for Breloom thanks to their great special bulk and, in the case of the former, its Poison typing. Additionally, Sneasler can potentially spread status with a combination of Poison Touch and Dire Claw and pivot Breloom in with U-turn, while Iron Hands handles Flying-types like Corviknight, Mandibuzz, and Articuno thanks to its Electric typing. Choice Scarf Iron Valiant, with its colorful coverage, threatens a multitude of pesky threats such as Dragapult, Latios, and physically defensive Gyarados. Lastly, Breloom's wallbreaking enables sweepers like Victory Dance Hisuian Lilligant and Unburden Sneasler to sweep late-game.

Focus Sash (Grass).description:
Breloom is a great late-game cleaner for Grass teams by virtue of its great Attack stat, access to Swords Dance to increase it further, and great ability in Technician boosting many of its attacks. Spore allows Breloom to incapacitate a threat to open up opportunities for it to set up Swords Dance. Mach Punch boosted by Technician allows Breloom to not only revenge kill fast cleaners like Meowscarada, Greninja, and Barraskewda but also sweep through teams that lack a check to it like Dark and Ice. Rock Tomb provides great coverage, targeting Fire- and Flying-types that switch in on an anticipated Bullet Seed such as Ogerpon-H, Talonflame, and Zapdos. Close Combat is more powerful than Mach Punch, making it suited for slower foes such as Archaludon, while Bulldoze allows Breloom to handle one of its biggest counters in Gholdengo. Bullet Seed is Breloom's strongest wallbreaking STAB option thanks to Technician boosting each of its hits. A Swords Dance + 3 attacks variant can be used as well to further Breloom's role as a sweeper. However, Spore is preferred, since it helps Breloom find chances to set up.

Breloom appreciates entry hazard support from Toedscruel and Brambleghast wearing down foes, as well as breaking Ogerpon-C's Sturdy so Breloom can immediately OHKO it with Mach Punch. Additionally, the two of them provide entry hazard removal with Rapid Spin so that Breloom's Focus Sash does not break. Amoonguss is a great defensive partner that threatens Fairy-types such as Enamorus and Iron Valiant, and it can also run Spore so that Breloom can choose to run Swords Dance instead. Meowscarada appreciates Breloom immobilizing threats with Spore and removing Toxapex and Ting-Lu, and in return, it handles Ghost- and Psychic types such as Gholdengo, Sinistcha, and Latios. Ogerpon-H and Ogerpon-C appreciate Breloom handling their checks such as Greninja, Barraskewda, and Ogerpon-W for them. In return, Ogerpon-H handles bulky Grass-types such as Sinistcha and Amoonguss, while Ogerpon-C threatens Flying-types such as Articuno and Moltres. Abomasnow sets up Aurora Veil to make Breloom harder to take down, allowing it to find more opportunities to set up and sweep.

Choice Band (Grass).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Stallbreaker (Dark).description:
Sableye is a good pick for Dark teams thanks to its Fighting immunity, spinblocking prowess, and ability to pester opposing teams with a wide array of status moves. Night Shade provides a consistent form of damage, preventing Sableye from being too passive, as well as letting it deal with Zamazenta one-on-one. Prankster Will-O-Wisp shuts down Physical attackers, such as Sneasler, Excadrill, and Urshifu-R, regardless of their Speed. Encore locks foes into passive moves, such as Recover and Roost, as well as setup moves such as Dragon Dance and Iron Defense, usually forcing a switch thereafter. Thunder Wave is an alternative option that can be used to slow down opposing Pokemon in order to make Dark's threatening breakers, such as Choice Specs Greninja, outspeed faster foes, such as Dragapult and Choice Scarf Enamorus.

Ting-Lu is a great teammate for Sableye, as it can supply a multitude of entry hazards in the form of Spikes and Stealth Rock. Coupled with Sableye's Rapid Spin immunity, some teams will have a very difficult time removing entry hazards as long as Sableye is around. Alolan Muk is another fantastic teammate for Sableye, as its Poison typing is key when it comes to dealing with Fairy-types, such as Hatterene and Primarina. Bisharp can utilize Swords Dance to help deal with bulkier Pokemon, such as Galarian Weezing and Toxapex, and pick off Flutter Mane via Sucker Punch. Bisharp can prevent hazard removal as well, as its Defiant ability will make foes think twice about using Defog. Strong wallbreakers such as Choice Specs Greninja, Darkrai, and Hydreigon are good teammates, as are Choice Scarf Hoopa-U and Meowscarada; the pressure applied by entry hazards makes it incredibly difficult for defensive Pokemon, such as Clodsire and Archaludon, to switch in repeatedly. Furthermore, they can deal with Pokemon that Sableye is largely ineffective against, such as Hatterene, Gholdengo, and opposing Dark-types. In return, Sableye can switch in on threatening Fighting-type attacks from Pokemon such as Zamazenta, Skarmory, and Corviknight.

Sun Setter.description:
Torkoal is an excellent choice for sun-based Fire teams thanks to its valuable role compression that consists of setting up sun and Stealth Rock, removing entry hazards, and tanking physical attacks. Lava Plume provides decent damage and a high chance to burn, which proves particularly useful against physical attackers like Zamazenta, Ogerpon-W, and Iron Hands. Body Press allows Torkoal to make use of its high Defense to heavily damage the likes of Kingambit, Blissey, and Tyranitar as well as preventing Roaring Moon from setting up freely and Heatran from switching in freely. Heavy-Duty Boots greatly increases Torkoal's longevity, while Heat Rock provides more turns of sun for setup allies to benefit from, such as Morning Sun Volcarona. If using Heavy-Duty Boots, getting fewer turns of sun also allows Fire teams to better manage opposing Protosynthesis sweepers, such as Flutter Mane or Walking Wake.

Gouging Fire is an amazing teammate, as it is a near-unstoppable wallbreaker in conjunction with Torkoal’s sun and entry hazard removal support. Ogerpon-H is another excellent wallbreaker under sun that greatly threatens Water. Thanks to its ability to wallbreak past Dondozo due to Mold Breaker, Ogerpon-H pairs well with Gouging Fire, which is often stopped cold by Dondozo. Ceruledge provides valuable speed control with Shadow Sneak, allowing it to deal with troublesome threats to Fire teams such as Flutter Mane and Choice Scarf Iron Boulder. These sweepers also greatly appreciate Torkoal’s Stealth Rock support. Volcarona benefits from Torkoal’s sun support, as the additional healing with sun-boosted Morning Sun and weakening of Water-type moves from Greninja and Keldeo greatly eases its ability to set up; in return, Volcarona deals with walls such as Toxapex and non-Stone Edge Zamazenta. Flame Body can also be useful to cripple threats like Great Tusk and Azumarill. Choice Scarf Iron Moth is an excellent check to Walking Wake and Great Tusk with a Speed boost from Protosynthesis; it can also be an excellent late-game cleaner against Steel and Fairy once checks such as Heatran and Primarina are removed. Cinderace can aid Torkoal in keeping off hazards with Court Change. Pyro Ball under sun also forces a lot of switches, which allows Cinderace to use U-turn to safely pivot in wallbreakers. Torkoal appreciates Rotom-H, as its Ground immunity combined with Volt Switch allows it to easily switch in for Torkoal and safely pivot in a sweeper.

Other Options

Yawn can be used over Body Press to force switches, allowing Torkoal to freely bring a teammate that can benefit from sun.

Stealth Rock (Psychic).description:
By virtue of its great bulk and defensive typing, Metagross makes for great entry hazard support for Psychic teams, dealing well with common hazard controllers like Hatterene and Tentacruel. Psychic Fangs threatens the aforementioned Tentacruel as well as other Poison- and Fighting-types such as Sneasler and Okidogi; it also eases the Fairy and Ice matchups due to breaking dual screens. Knock Off threatens Ghost- and Psychic-types such as Gholdengo, Brambleghast, and Indeedee while also removing items from foes that are reliant on them like Heavy-Duty Boots from Dragonite and Leftovers from Corviknight. Bullet Punch can be run over Psychic Fangs or Knock Off to revenge kill faster threats such as Iron Valiant, Flutter Mane, and Chien-Pao. However, most of Metagross's teammates provide great speed control, and running a second Steel-type STAB move on Metagross restricts its number of potential targets. Heavy Slam threatens Fairy- and Ice-types such as Hatterene, Alolan Ninetales, and Articuno. 96 Speed EVs allow Metagross to outspeed Adamant Azumarill.

Wallbreakers such as Choice Band Hoopa-U and Choice Specs Latios appreciate Metagross setting entry hazards to help them wallbreak. Hoopa-U also takes on Dark-, Ghost-, and Steel-types such as specially defensive Ting-Lu, Gholdengo, Heatran, and Hisuian Goodra, while Latios provides a Ground immunity and handles Steel- and Ground-types like Archaludon, Corviknight, Gliscor, and Great Tusk. Deoxys-S forms a hazard-stacking core with Metagross thanks to Spikes, appreciating it running Stealth Rock so it can run another utility option such as Taunt. Hatterene is a potential wincon for Psychic teams that appreciates entry hazards wearing down incoming foes such as Choice Band Dragonite and Choice Scarf Enamorus, and it is a useful asset in the Dark and Dragon matchups to deal with threats such as Sableye, Hydreigon, Garchomp, and Raging Bolt. Additionally, Hatterene provides hazard control thanks to Magic Bounce. Choice Scarf Latias appreciates Metagross taking out Fairy-types like Hatterene and Iron Valiant, and in return, it provides a Ground immunity to switch into and deal with Great Tusk and Landorus, as well as Choice-locking walls like Ting-Lu and Corviknight by giving them its Choice Scarf with Trick. Lastly, late-game sweepers such as Agility Iron Crown, Agility Gallade, and Choice Scarf Iron Boulder appreciate Metagross setting entry hazards, weakening walls with Knock Off, and revenge killing boosted sweepers with Bullet Punch to start a sweep of their own. Additionally, Iron Boulder threatens the likes of Ogerpon-H, Hisuian Arcanine, Volcarona, and Meowscarada.

Choice Band (Psychic).description:
With a Choice Band, Metagross becomes a devastating wallbreaker for Psychic teams thanks to its incredible Attack stat, immunity to Intimidate, and incredible priority move. Heavy Slam makes full use of Metagross's immense weight to deal with threats like Azumarill. Alternatively, Meteor Mash allows Metagross to OKHO heavier targets like Kyurem and Tyranitar along with getting a possible Attack boost at the cost of some accuracy. Bullet Punch provides a solid form of priority to deal with faster targets such as Flutter Mane, Alolan Ninetales, Weavile, and weakened Hoopa-U. Knock Off allows Metagross to force progress against targets that can otherwise handle it like Skarmory and Corviknight by removing crucial held items; it also threatens Ghost-types such as Air Balloon Gholdengo and Sinistcha. Finally, Earthquake hits Steel- and Electric-type threats like Hisuian Goodra, Magnezone, and Raging Bolt. The EV Spread used allows Metagross to outspeed Adamant Azumarill while surviving hits such as Modest +1 Raging Bolt's Thunderbolt.

Choice Specs Latios, when paired with Metagross, forms a devastating wallbreaker core; Latios cleanly removes physical walls such as Skarmory, Corviknight, and Hippowdon, while Metagross can remove threats Latios struggles against such as Hisuian Goodra, Blissey, and Flutter Mane. Deoxys-S provides solid entry hazard stacking capabilities, further increasing Metagross's wallbreaking capabilities. Choice Scarf Iron Boulder provides a solid form of speed control along with dealing with Fire-type threats such as Iron Moth, Volcarona, and Ogerpon-H. Assault Vest Hoopa-U can deal with problematic Ghost-types that handle Metagross like Gholdengo and Hisuian Zoroark with ease. Slowbro supports Metagross by dealing with Fire- and Ground-types like Cinderace, Great Tusk, and Mamoswine along with providing Thunder Wave support, allowing Metagross to outspeed threats such as Heatran and Cinderace. Choice Scarf Latias can support Metagross by dealing with threats such as Gouging Fire and non-Choice Scarf Dragapult and provides Healing Wish support to heal Metagross. Hatterene provides utility in Magic Bounce to prevent entry hazards along with dealing with Dark-type threats such as Sableye, Mandibuzz, and Roaring Moon, which otherwise threaten Metagross. Armarouge deals with Steel-type threats such as Scizor, Archaludon, and Skarmory that handle Metagross.

Latias.comments:
Other Options

Dragon

Latias is able to carry a plethora of coverage if it wishes to, such as Thunderbolt and Ice Beam to easily dispatch of Water- and Flying-types such as Gliscor and Enamorus after Stealth Rock. Aura Sphere is another move that Latias can utilize to bait in and knock out opposing Kingambit and Chien-Pao in conjunction with Spikes. Latias can even use Thunder Wave in a pinch to slow down threats such as Choice Scarf Enamorus and Flutter Mane for its teammates.

Choice Scarf (Dragon).description:
Latias is a great Choice Scarf user on Dragon teams, offering a wide variety of of both offense and support. Latias's typing and ability coupled with its great defenses grant it the ability to switch into many common moves, such as Landorus-T's Earthquake and Sneasler's Close Combat, and retaliate with STAB Draco Meteor. Psychic allows it to take care of the many Poison-types that can trouble its teammates Dragapult and Dragonite, such as non-Choice Scarf Sneasler, Amoonguss, and Galarian Weezing. Psyshock is an alternative to more easily take care of specially defensive Clodsire as well as 2HKO Assault Vest Iron Hands after Spikes from Garchomp. Trick is another option to provide utility by crippling foes such as Kingambit, Alolan Muk, and Heatran. Lastly, with Healing Wish, Latias gains the ability to grant a second life to its teammates when it is in a pinch. The given EV spread allows Latias to survive a Flutter Mane Moonblast and retaliate with Psyshock, KOing it after Spikes damage.

Pivot Dragapult is a great partner to cripple the opposition with status and easily pivot in Latias with U-turn, while offensive Choice Specs Dragapult aids Latias in bombarding foes with a barrage of Draco Meteors as well as being able to take care of Ghost-types such as Skeledirge and Sinistcha. Baxcalibur is another amazing offensive partner that appreciates the removal of Fighting-types such as Zamazenta and Urshifu-R as well as the likes of Porygon2 and Skarmory being hampered by Latias's Trick, letting it safely set up a Swords Dance or Dragon Dance to sweep. Gouging Fire also heavily appreciates Latias breaking down Poison teams that may disrupt it with Toxic, and in return it beats the Steel-types that wall Latias, such as Kingambit and Heatran. Latias is also able to heal Baxcalibur and Gouging Fire with Healing Wish in case they have suffered damage or status. Hisuian Goodra and Archaludon are able to easily dispatch of Fairy-types as well as Choice Scarf Meowscarada and Chien-Pao, which are threatening to Dragon teams. Archaludon is also able to set Stealth Rock, allowing Latias to break through opposition more easily. Garchomp is another great partner for setting both Stealth Rock and Spikes, as well as phazing threats such as Calm Mind Ursaluna-B with Dragon Tail. Raging Bolt and Choice Specs Kyurem have a great matchup against Water and Flying teams. Raging Bolt is also able to beat Kingambit with Thunderclap. Lastly, Dragonite is the biggest beneficiary of Latias's Healing Wish, reinstating its Multiscale if it doesn't carry Roost, making it extremely threatening with its ease of setup. Kommo-o is a great partner by virtue of its defensive sets being able to KO Chien-Pao with Vacuum Wave and set up Stealth Rock and offensive sets being able to mow through Dark-, Steel-, and Ice-types, such as Kingambit, Empoleon, and Mamoswine. Latias holding Choice Scarf also allows other common Choice Scarf teammates, such as Walking Wake and Roaring Moon, to run an alternative item, such as Choice Specs and Choice Band, respectively.

Choice Scarf (Psychic).description:
Choice Scarf Latias makes for great speed control on Psychic teams, outspeeding and threatening the likes of non-Choice Scarf Dragapult, Choice Specs Greninja, and +1 Gouging Fire. Draco Meteor is a powerful attack that takes out Latios, Sableye, and Ursaluna-B. Trick allows it to greatly weaken foes that are reliant on their items, such as Heavy-Duty Boots users such as Amoonguss and Dragonite as well as Leftovers and Black Sludge users like Corviknight, Archaludon, and Alolan Muk. Healing Wish allows Latias to sacrifice itself to cure status and restore HP to a weakened teammate. 8 Special Defense EVs allow Latias to survive Choice Scarf Flutter Mane's Moonblast from full health.

Indeedee makes for a great partner, as it sets up Psychic Terrain to boost its teammates' Psychic-type STAB moves. Furthermore, Indeedee's part-Normal typing makes it a great asset in the Ghost matchup, performing well against threats like Spectrier and Choice Specs Flutter Mane. Slowbro is a good defensive partner, walling the likes of Mamoswine, Kingambit, and Chien-Pao and taking them out with Scald and Body Press. It also spreads paralysis with Thunder Wave so Latias is able to outspeed faster threats such as Choice Scarf Iron Valiant and Dragapult. Metagross and Deoxys-S both set up entry hazards to aid Latias, and Deoxys-S can act as a suicide lead, able to take out speedy threats such as Choice Scarf Iron Valiant and Sneasler. Metagross and Iron Crown both appreciate Latias handling Ground-types they don't like matching up against such as Choice Scarf Great Tusk and Landorus. In return, Iron Crown takes out Corviknight, Hatterene, and Clefable. Choice Band Hoopa-U beats bulky threats that Latias struggles with such as Hisuian Goodra, Blissey, and Gholdengo, and it appreciates Latias’s removal of Pecharunt in return. Hatterene provides hazard control through Magic Bounce, and with its part-Fairy typing, it takes on Dark-types like Mandibuzz, Roaring Moon, and Meowscarada. In return, Latias handles Poison-types that threaten Hatterene such as Choice Specs Iron Moth and Pecharunt. Iron Boulder forms a great offensive pairing with Latias, with Iron Boulder dealing with the likes of Choice Scarf Iron Valiant and Enamorus, while Latias handles Dragapult and Archaludon.

Latios.comments:
Other Options

Psychic (Choice Specs)

Latios can use Flip Turn to keep up momentum against the many switches it forces and bring in teammates to better answer the incoming threat. Psychic Noise is an option to better counter defensive walls such as specially defensive Articuno and RestTalk Dondozo, denying their recovery and decreasing their longevity overtime. Psychic Noise also has the added benefit of shutting down Draining Kiss Primarina completely. Energy Ball can be used to more easily counter Water/Ground types such as Gastrodon and Swampert.

Psychic (Calm Mind)

Shadow Ball is an alternative that allows Latios to surprise would-be checks such as Gholdengo and Hatterene that can switch into its STAB moves. Psyshock is another option that can be used to target Pokemon that are bulky on the special side but frail on the physical side, OHKOing Volcarona and Frosmoth after one Calm Mind boost. Psychic Noise can deal with Primarina. Dragon Pulse is another option for a Dragon-type STAB move that is more accurate than Draco Meteor and does not require Latios to switch out after using it.

Choice Specs (Dragon).description:
Choice Specs Latios is a dangerous wallbreaker thanks to its good Speed tier, array of high-powered options, and solid coverage to hit potential checks. Luster Purge obliterates Fighting- and Poison-types like Great Tusk, Iron Hands, and Toxapex for teammates like Roaring Moon. Its Special Defense drop chance also allows Latios to take on neutral targets like Clefable. Thunderbolt hits bulky Flying- and Water-types like Corviknight and Empoleon. Draco Meteor is Latios's strongest STAB move, most notably annihilating threats like Archaludon, Ursaluna-B, and Kyurem. Ice Beam forms a deadly BoltBeam core with Thunderbolt and allows Latios to hit Ground-types like Gliscor and Ursaluna-B without its Special Attack dropping. Aura Sphere can be run over Ice Beam to hit Steel-types like Heatran. Trick allows Latios to majorly hinder defensive staples like Assault Vest Galarian Slowking and Rest Hisuian Goodra that can take it on.

Gouging Fire is a great partner for Latios thanks to their ability to break down each other's checks. It can take on Steel-types like Kingambit and Gholdengo that could otherwise trouble Latios, stomaching Moonblast from Choice Scarf Iron Valiant and healing off the damage via Morning Sun. Archaludon functions as a wonderful teammate for Latios, as it can take on Kingambit and other Dark-types like Ting-Lu with Body Press and Stamina. It also provides entry hazard support in the form of Stealth Rock. In return for both, Latios can switch in on Ground-type attacks, like Earthquake from the likes of Choice Scarf Great Tusk and Choice Band Excadrill, thanks to Levitate; this also allows Latios to find opportunities to fire off its strong attacks. Utility Dragapult is another great teammate, as it can outspeed threatening foes that outspeed Latios, like Choice Specs Flutter Mane and mixed Iron Valiant, and ruin them with Thunder Wave. Garchomp is yet another good teammate, as it sets entry hazards to make Latios's wallbreaking job easier while scaring off Steel-types such as Heatran and Gholdengo lacking Air Balloon and Kingambit with its powerful Earthquake. Kommo-o pairs well alongside Latios since it can defeat Dark-types like Kingambit and Chien-Pao with Vacuum Wave. Raging Bolt finds its place alongside Latios, removing threats like Choice Scarf Enamorus and Choice Scarf Iron Valiant with Thunderclap at +1. Choice Scarf Roaring Moon provides speed control for Latios and takes care of troublesome threats like Choice Scarf Gholdengo, Choice Specs Flutter Mane, and Galarian Slowking.

Calm Mind (Psychic).description:
Calm Mind Latios is a strong sweeper on Psychic teams by virtue of its Speed, access to Soul Dew, and great movepool. In addition, it provides a Ground immunity thanks to Levitate. Draco Meteor is a powerful nuke that allows Latios to remove the likes of Sableye and bulky Gouging Fire, and when boosted with Calm Mind, it can OHKO physically defensive Archaludon and potentially 2HKO Alolan Muk. Luster Purge is a strong Psychic-type STAB move that can potentially 2HKO Gholdengo. Thunderbolt gives Latios coverage that takes out Flying- and Water-types such as Corviknight and Empoleon, 2HKOing the latter after a Calm Mind boost. Recover can be used over Thunderbolt to grant Latios longevity, giving it more opportunities to sweep. Ice Beam can be used as well, and it is especially effective against slower Dragon-types, such as Garchomp and Dragonite, to remove Latios's need to switch out after using Draco Meteor. Ice Beam can also surprise the likes of both Landorus formes and Gliscor.

Deoxys-S is a great sacrificial lead by virtue of its Speed, access to both Stealth Rock and Spikes, and ability to prevent Defog with Taunt. Offensive variants of Deoxys-S, such as Choice Specs and Nasty Plot sets, can also clean late-game once Latios is finished wallbreaking. Hatterene can prevent entry hazards being placed thanks to Magic Bounce, and with its Fairy typing, it can switch into a predicted Dragon-type attack that would threaten Latios. Hatterene is also able to run Nuzzle to paralyze Pokemon that are faster than Latios, and it can support the team with Healing Wish. In return, Latios is able to threaten Corviknight and Empoleon with Thunderbolt. Latios gets easily outsped and forced out by faster Pokemon such as Dragapult, Meowscarada, and Greninja; hence, it appreciates speedy teammates that can deal with them like Choice Scarf Latias for Dragapult and Choice Scarf Iron Boulder for Meowscarada and Greninja. Gholdengo and Hatterene easily hinder any sweeping attempts from Latios, so checks to them, such as Hoopa-U and Iron Crown, make for great teammates. Choice Scarf Hoopa-U is also able to outspeed and threaten the likes of Flutter Mane and Spectrier, while Iron Crown appreciates Latios KOing Garchomp for it. Indeedee is another great teammate that provides a Ghost immunity as well as support with Healing Wish. Gallade is able to anticipate Sucker Punch from Kingambit and remove it with Upper Hand, and it can handle the likes of Hisuian Goodra, Alolan Muk, and Blissey. Slowbro and Galarian Slowking are two great defensive partners for Latios, with the former tanking attacks from Choice Band Excadrill as well as spreading paralysis with Thunder Wave so Latios outspeeds faster Pokemon. On the other hand, Galarian Slowking can wall out Iron Valiant and remove it with Sludge Bomb while acting as a slow pivot with Chilly Reception and an entry hazard setter with Toxic Spikes. Both Slowbro and Galarian Slowking can also wall Ceruledge after they use their Eject Button or Chien-Pao and Kingambit when they're using a Colbur Berry.

Choice Specs (Psychic).description:
Boasting amazing offenses, Latios cements itself as a formidable threat on Psychic teams. With Choice Specs, Latios can drop powerful Draco Meteors and pulverize foes such as Gliscor and Gouging Fire that may otherwise trouble Psychic teams. Luster Purge can punish any switch-ins to Draco Meteor and plow through the likes of defensive Articuno and Gholdengo after a Special Defense drop. Latios has a plethora of coverage options, Ice Beam lets it threaten common Ground- and Flying-type threats like specially defensive Gliscor, while Thunderbolt lets it threaten Water-types like Empoleon. Latios can utilize Aura Sphere to counter Steel-types like Kingambit and Heatran without help from teammates. Latios can also hamper the opposition with Trick, being able to cripple foes like Hisuian Goodra, Kingambit and Ting-Lu.

Latios appreciates support from Deoxys-S, being able to easily spread entry hazards and help Latios OHKO foes more easily. Alternatively, offensive Deoxys-S appreciates Latios punching holes in the opposition so that it can clean up later with its massive Speed tier. Galarian Slowking and Jirachi are great partners that can pivot Latios in with Chilly Reception and U-Turn, respectively, and take care of Fairy-types such as Iron Valiant and Hatterene that Latios is weak to. Specially defensive Jirachi can also set up Stealth Rock and pressure Ice-types such as Alolan Ninetales as well as spread paralysis against the likes of Zamazenta and Greninja, allowing Latios to outspeed them. Choice Scarf Iron Boulder is a great partner that can clean up after Latios has been KOed and outspeed and threaten to OHKO other Choice Scarf users such as Meowscarada, Greninja, and Iron Valiant as well as Dragon Dance +1 Gouging Fire. Choice Scarf Hoopa-U is a good partner to beat Ghost-types such as Skeledirge, Gholdengo, and Dragapult. Assault Vest Hoopa-U can also deal with bulky Gholdengo and break apart defensive cores alongside Latios. Stored Power Espathra can act as a wincon once Latios has weakened the opposition. Gallade and Hatterene are good choices for countering Dark-types that are extremely threatening to Psychic teams such as Chien-Pao and Kingambit. Indeedee-M also notably provides a Ghost immunity alongside Healing Wish, giving Latios a second chance late-game. Eject Button Slowbro can provide a safe switch-in against Ceruledge and spread paralysis against or finish off weakened Chien-Pao and Kingambit, easing the burden on Latios.

Jirachi.comments:
Other Options

Psychic

Jirachi may use Healing Wish as a cleric option to give sweepers like Deoxys-S, Iron Crown, and Espathra second chances to threaten foes; however, it is typically situational and means Jirachi has to give up more standard utility options.

Specially Defensive (Psychic).description:
Jirachi is a great support Pokemon on Psychic teams due to its great bulk, wide array of utility options, and ability to maintain pressure via U-turn and Serene Grace-boosted Iron Head. Iron Head in conjunction with Serene Grace allows Jirachi to annoy Pokemon like Alolan Muk, Articuno, and Clefable. Body Slam punishes switch-ins like Great Tusk and Quagsire by having a notable chance to paralyze them due to Serene Grace. Alternatively, Thunder Wave may be used to have a higher chance of paralysis and affect Ghost-types, while Wish enables Jirachi as a cleric, synergizing well with U-turn. U-turn preserves momentum and permits Jirachi to escape unfavorable situations against Quagsire, Gholdengo, Skarmory, and Gliscor. Protect may be used instead to capitalize on Leftovers recovery and scout for super effective moves from foes, playing around Choice-locked users; however, the lack of U-turn means Jirachi can't maintain momentum. Stealth Rock is useful to wear down pivots and offers additional pressure in difficult matchups such as Dark, Ghost, and Water. The given EV spread maximizes Jirachi's special bulk, notably letting it survive a Shadow Ball from Choice Specs Flutter Mane as well as outpace Adamant Mamoswine.

Slowbro forms a great defensive core with Jirachi, walling threats such as Gouging Fire, Cinderace, and non-Choice Band Excadrill while also checking Ceruledge if Slowbro has no item. Furthermore, Slowbro is capable of luring in and beating Dark-type Pokemon like Chien-Pao, Kingambit, and Roaring Moon via Body Press in conjunction with a Colbur Berry. In return, Jirachi offers a Poison immunity and is capable of switching into special attackers like Alolan Ninetales and Choice Specs Latios. Hoopa-U threatens Pokemon like Gholdengo, Spectrier, and Pecharunt while also providing Knock Off support, removing Heavy-Duty Boots from foes to capitalize on Jirachi's Stealth Rock. In exchange, Jirachi offers pivoting via U-turn and utility moves like Stealth Rock and Thunder Wave to improve Hoopa-U's wallbreaking. Latios boasts a much-needed Ground immunity and breaks through threats like Gouging Fire, Archaludon, and Keldeo. Hatterene prevents opposing entry hazards from being set and threatens Dark-types such as Roaring Moon and Hydreigon via Draining Kiss. Indeedee sets up Psychic Terrain, making it harder for Azumarill to break out of Jirachi's Iron Head and paralysis spam, as well as offering a Ghost immunity to fend off Spectrier and Hisuian Zoroark. Iron Boulder is a great option for speed control and removes Fire-types such as Ogerpon-H, Hisuian Arcanine, and Volcarona with Mighty Cleave. Espathra appreciates Stealth Rock and Thunder Wave support from Jirachi easing its sweeping process late-game. At +2, Deoxys-S paired with BoltBeam coverage threatens a plethora of threats to Jirachi like Choice Specs Greninja, the Landorus formes, and Gliscor.

Choice Scarf (Psychic).description:
Jirachi plays a niche role as a late-game sweeper or fast support Pokemon on Psychic teams. Iron Head, in tandem with Choice Scarf, provides an opportunity to win endgames with consecutive flinches. Furthermore, Choice Scarf allows it to outspeed and KO foes like Choice Specs Flutter Mane and non-Choice Scarf Iron Valiant, both of which can prove to be troublesome for Psychic teams. Trick can be used to punish defensive switch-ins like Skarmory and Toxapex, forcing them to hold Choice Scarf and rendering them effectively null, thus allowing Psychic teams to make valuable progress against Steel, Flying, Water, and Poison teams. U-turn helps Jirachi function as a fast pivot after luring in common checks like Kingambit and Archaludon, thus retaining momentum. Healing Wish gives it the opportunity to operate as a fast support Pokemon. Alternatively, Ice Punch can be used to reliably check Gliscor and non-Choice Scarf Landorus.

Hoopa-U's neutrality to Ghost-type moves and great special bulk allows it to function as a viable partner for Jirachi, checking foes like Gholdengo and Spectrier that it isn't able to deal with otherwise. Teammates like Deoxys-S can set Spikes to punish Jirachi's checks like Gholdengo and Heatran and aid its late-game sweep. Alternatively, Choice Specs Deoxys-S in tandem with Psychic Terrain can prove to be a valuable wallbreaker with Expanding Force. Hatterene provides a switch-in to Dark-type foes like Darkrai, Hydreigon, and Hisuian Samurott, which may prove troublesome for Jirachi. Furthermore, Hatterene prevents foes from setting entry hazards thanks to Magic Bounce, thus deterring their attempts to get chip damage on Jirachi. Choice Scarf Iron Boulder acts as an incredible wallbreaking partner, checking foes like Ogerpon-H, Volcanion, Volcarona, and Moltres. In addition to that, it can also forego its Choice Scarf and opt to use Swords Dance, since Jirachi takes up the role of the late-game sweeper. Latias and Latios leverage their phenomenal wallbreaking potential to aid Jirachi by checking Dragon-type foes like Archaludon and Gouging Fire. In exchange, Jirachi deals with annoying Fairy-type foes like Iron Valiant and non-Choice Scarf Flutter Mane. Indeedee leverages its immunity to Ghost-type moves to help Jirachi while also setting Psychic Terrain to protect its teammates from Kingambit's Sucker Punch. In exchange, Jirachi's access to Healing Wish allows teammates like Latias and Indeedee to free a moveslot. Gallade pairs well with Jirachi, as it checks troublesome Poison-types like Toxapex and Amoonguss with Psycho Cut while also hitting Steel-types like Kingambit and Heatran with Sacred Sword. In exchange, Jirachi forces a Choice Scarf on walls like Toxapex and Skarmory using Trick, preventing them from recovering and allowing Gallade to perform a more comfortable sweep. Slowbro and Galarian Slowking form a strong defensive core, with the former being able to switch into Excadrill and Landorus-T, while the latter can switch into foes like Galarian Moltres and Hydreigon. Furthermore, itemless Slowbro can conveniently check Ceruledge's Poltergeist, which is extremely troublesome for Jirachi. Lastly, Espathra and Jirachi form a strong late-game sweeper core, with Espathra leveraging Speed Boost and Calm Mind to spam Stored Power, while Jirachi attempts to chip away at those immune to or resistant to Espathra's Stored Power, like Alolan Muk and Hisuian Goodra.

Choice Scarf (Steel).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Deoxys-Defense.overview:
Psychic

Deoxys-D is outclassed as a stallbreaker by other Psychic-types such as Gallade and Hoopa-U that can provide the team with more offensive pressure. With its stallbreaking capabilities, its best suited for more passive teams such as Flying. The trait that Deoxys-D provides is Pressure stalling foes out while wearing down their HP with Night Shade and making use of Recover to shrug off damage after boosting its stats with Cosmic Power. Physically defensive Deoxys-D has competition from teammates like Slowbro, as it offers Regenerator and Scald; however, Deoxys-D has a more utility-condensed moveset notably consisting of Teleport and Spikes and takes on foes like the Ogerpon formes. Using this forme also restricts usage of Deoxys-S, a desirable wallbreaker and revenge killer that has access to the same utility moves, albeit it's more frail.
Deoxys-Defense.comments:
Other Options

Psychic

Stallbreaker Deoxys-D can alternatively run Stored Power, becoming a threat if there are no Dark-types on the field. Covert Cloak can be run to cancel out secondary effects. Physically defensive Deoxys-D may opt for Rocky Helmet allowing for passive chip damage alongside Spikes, punishing multi-hit moves like Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes and pivot moves such as U-turn from Cinderace and Landorus-T, as well as Flip Turn from Barraskewda.

Stallbreaker (Psychic).description:
With its phenomenal defenses, Deoxys-D can make a great impact for Psychic teams as a stallbreaker that takes advantage of more passive teams such as Flying. Cosmic Power makes it able to handle wallbreakers and Choice-locked Pokemon. With 176 Speed EVs, Deoxys-D is able to outspeed and use Cosmic Power against Choice Band Dragonite and Mamoswine and most Gliscor sets, allowing Deoxys-D to block its entry hazards and Toxic with Taunt. Taunt also stops walls such as Blissey, Skarmory, and Toxapex from spreading status and setting hazards while limiting their longevity. Night Shade is Deoxys-D's most consistent form of damage dealing.

Gallade is a powerful secondary wallbreaker in conjunction with Deoxys-D, making use of its Fighting-type STAB attacks to remove Dark-type threats that Deoxys-D can't handle on its own such as Ting-Lu, Alolan Muk, and Greninja. Espathra can set up once Deoxys-D removes walls. Hoopa-U complements. Deoxys-D as a threat to Ghost-types such as Gholdengo and Flutter Mane. Iron Boulder, with its phenomenal Speed, can pair greatly with Deoxys-D to remove Dark-, Bug-, and Fire-type threats such as Meowscarada, Volcarona, and Ogerpon-H. Choice Specs Latios appreciates Deoxys-D stalling out special walls such as Hisuian Goodra and Ting-Lu and, in return, handles threats such as Hydreigon. Hatterene provides entry hazard control in case Deoxys-Dis not able to outspeed and use Taunt while also providing great bulk and Fairy-type coverage to deal with Dragon-types such as Garchomp and Kyurem. Jirachi can pair excellently with Deoxys-D to be not only a defensive pair but also a Stealth Rock setter. Alternatively, Metagross can set Stealth Rock while also posing a threat to Fairy-types such as Flutter Mane and Mimikyu.

Physically Defensive.description:
Deoxys-D boasts impeccable defensive stats and a wide range of utility moves, benefiting Psychic as a bulky pivot and entry hazard setter. Night Shade prevents Deoxys-D from being too passive and deals decent chunks of damage over time. Alternatively, Knock Off may be used to accentuate Spikes usage by removing Heavy-Duty Boots from Toxapex and Sableye, forcing progress and easing the jobs of wallbreaker teammates. Teleport allows for slow and safe pivoting for offensive teammates such as Iron Boulder, Indeedee-M, and Latios, while Taunt prevents opposing defensive Pokemon like Archaludon and Mandibuzz from setting up Stealth Rock and using Toxic, respectively. Spikes wears down threatening foes such as Flutter Mane, Greninja, and Ogerpon-H, building up passive damage alongside Night Shade. Thunder Wave may also be used to paralyze quicker targets such as Ogerpon formes with Horn Leech, which can negate Night Shade damage, Roaring Moon, and Greninja. Heavy-Duty Boots allows Deoxys-D to repeatedly use Teleport and get swapped in without having to worry about hazards; however, Leftovers may be used to better sponge attacks due to passive recovery.

Hoopa-U is greatly appreciated by Deoxys-D, as it threatens Ghost-type Pokemon like Gholdengo, Sinistcha, and Pecharunt. In exchange, Hoopa-U values getting brought in by Teleport and Spikes wearing down switch-ins such as Ting-Lu and Archaludon. Galarian Slowking forms a defensive core with Deoxys-D, taking on special attackers like Latios, Iron Moth, and Primarina, while Deoxys-D walls Iron Treads, Swampert, and Iron Boulder. They also both form a pivot core due to Galarian Slowking's access to Chilly Reception, preserving a lot of momentum for the rest of the team. Hatterene aids in preventing the setting of entry hazards via Magic Bounce while combating Dark-types such as Hydreigon, Darkrai, and Roaring Moon. Iron Boulder pressures offensive threats like Volcarona, Weavile, and Tornadus-T, valuing Spikes and Teleport support in return. Latios appreciates Deoxys-D setting up Spikes and providing slow pivoting with Teleport while Latios pressures Dragon teams, notably removing Hydreigon. Choice Scarf Indeedee-M picks off wallbreakers such as Swords Dance Urshifu-R and Sneasler while also providing a Ghost-type immunity and Healing Wish support should Deoxys-D get low on health or inflicted by a status. Metagross contributes to the hazard stack via Stealth Rock and pressures faster threats such as Flutter Mane and Weavile with Bullet Punch.

Deoxys-Speed.comments:
Other Options

Deoxys-S can use Energy Ball to reliably hit Water- and Rock-types such as Swampert, Gastrodon, and Rhyperior. However, it is not worth sacrificing either its STAB moves or its key BoltBeam coverage. Superpower with 4 Attack EVs and a neutral nature can also be used to target Normal-, Dark-, and Steel-types such as Blissey, Tyranitar, Kingambit, and Heatran. However, Superpower is only useful in those specific scenarios, and it is essentially useless outside of them.

(Entry Hazard Support)

Deoxys-S can run Thunder Wave, taking advantage of its almost unmatched Speed tier by paralyzing pesky threats and potential setup sweepers like the Ogerpon formes, Choice Specs Flutter Mane, and Dragonite. However, Deoxys-S wouldn't want to sacrifice either of its entry hazards or its attacking moves.

Nasty Plot.description:
With Nasty Plot, great coverage in BoltBeam, and a Speed tier that makes it lightning fast outspeeding the entire unboosted metagame as well as boosted threats like +1 Volcarona, +1 Dragonite, and Choice Scarf Urshifu-R, Deoxys-S makes for a great setup sweeper. Thunderbolt threatens the likes of Corviknight, offensive Pelipper, and Choice Specs Greninja. Ice Beam allows Deoxys-S to take on Gliscor, Hydrapple, and the Landorus formes.

Indeedee is a valuable partner, as it sets up Psychic Terrain to both boost Deoxys-S's Expanding Force and prevent it from being revenge killed by Kingambit's Sucker Punch, Dragonite's Extreme Speed, and Lokix's First Impression. Furthermore, Indeedee's part-Normal typing and access to Shadow Ball make it a great asset in the Ghost matchup. Jirachi and Metagross provide great entry hazard support with Stealth Rock, and Jirachi also provides pivoting with U-turn. In return, they appreciate Deoxys-S taking on Ground-types such as Great Tusk and Garchomp. Slowbro is a great physical wall that takes on Kingambit with Body Press, and it also spreads status with Thunder Wave so Deoxys-S outspeeds Choice Scarf users like Iron Valiant and Enamorus. Hatterene provides hazard control for Psychic teams thanks to Magic Bounce, and with its Fairy typing, it takes on Dark- and Dragon-types such as Hydreigon, Meowscarada, and Raging Bolt. Choice Specs Latios and Choice Band Hoopa-U wallbreak early-game so that Deoxys-S can clean late-game. Latios breaks through Sableye and Skeledirge, while Hoopa-U threatens Blissey, specially defensive Ting-Lu, and Heatran. Choice Scarf Iron Boulder handles threats faster than Deoxys-S such as Choice Scarf Iron Valiant, Choice Scarf Meowscarada, and Choice Scarf Hisuian Arcanine. In return, Deoxys-S handles Ground-types such as Landorus and Gliscor.

Entry Hazard Support.description:
Deoxys-S makes for a great entry hazard lead thanks to its access to both Stealth Rock and Spikes. Low Kick threatens Dark- and Steel-types such as Kingambit and Hisuian Goodra. Knock Off can be used to remove Heavy-Duty Boots from holders like Volcarona, Articuno, and Corviknight so Deoxys-S's entry hazards can affect them, as well as reduce the wallbreaking power of Choice item users like Choice Specs Flutter Mane and Choice Band Dragonite. Alternatively, Taunt can be used to further Deoxys-S's role as a lead, shutting down opposing entry hazard support and also preventing Defog attempts. Ice Beam targets Ground-, Flying-, and Dragon-types such as Gliscor, Landorus, and Dragonite. Alternatively, Psycho Boost can transform Deoxys-S into a suicide lead, taking out strong leads like Froslass and Galvantula with it before sacrificing itself. Rocky Helmet punishes physical attackers like Hoopa-U and the Ogerpon formes, notably breaking Ogerpon-C's Sturdy, while Focus Sash guarantees that Deoxys-S places at least one entry hazard. 236 Speed EVs allow it to outspeed +1 Garchomp and Choice Scarf Landorus.

Iron Crown and Metagross make for great partners, as they both threaten Hatterene, which can swap in on Deoxys-S and block its entry hazards. Additionally, Iron Crown threatens Flying-types such as Gyarados, Corviknight, and Skarmory with Volt Switch, while Metagross revenge kills weakened sweepers such as Dragapult and Flutter Mane with Bullet Punch. Slowbro is a great defensive partner, as it can potentially bring Deoxys-S in safely with Eject Button, and thanks to the item's consumability, it can wall Ceruledge once it's been used. Wallbreakers such as Hoopa-U and Latios appreciate the entry hazards Deoxys-S provides, wearing down walls for them to exploit. They also have colorful coverage to threaten a multitude of threats, with Hoopa-U taking on Flutter Mane, Gholdengo, and Hisuian Goodra, while Latios targets Archaludon, Corviknight, and Primarina. Hatterene makes for another great partner, threatening Dark- and Dragon-types. Late-game sweepers such as Espathra, Choice Scarf Iron Boulder, and Agility Iron Crown appreciate the entry hazards Deoxys-S provides so they can pick off foes more easily. Psycho Boost Deoxys-S appreciates Psychic Terrain support from Indeedee which also provides a Ghost immunity to match up well against the likes of Spectrier and Hisuian Zoroark.

Dual Screens.description:
With its great Speed, Deoxys-S makes for great dual screens support, greatly aiding in the survivability of its teammates. Ice Beam can be run over Psycho Boost to threaten Ground- and Flying-types such as Gliscor, Landorus, and Dragonite. Spikes can be run over Stealth Rock when a teammate is already running it, and its ability to be stacked thrice makes it more potent against grounded foes in the long run. However, Stealth Rock should be prioritized when none of Deoxys-S's teammates is running it, since it can wear down threats that don't run Heavy-Duty Boots .

Metagross makes for a great partner, as its access to Stealth Rock allows Deoxys-S to run Spikes instead, and it revenge kills weakened sweepers such as Dragon Dance Dragapult and Choice Scarf Flutter Mane with Bullet Punch. Hoopa-U appreciates dual screens, as it boosts its subpar Defense and further boosts its great Special Defense. Notably, Hoopa-U now survives a boosted Sucker Punch from Swords Dance Kingambit and OHKOes it back with Drain Punch. Hatterene is a great form of hazard control thanks to its access to Magic Bounce, and its part Fairy typing makes it a great asset in the Dragon matchup and allows it to be more threatening in the Dark and Fighting matchups under dual screens. Iron Crown and Latios threaten common Defog users that threaten to remove Deoxys-S's screens such as Mandibuzz and Corviknight thanks to their access to Volt Switch and Thunderbolt, respectively. Additionally, they also remove Sableye, which can hinder dual screens setup. Late-game sweepers such as Choice Scarf Iron Boulder, Espathra, and Agility Gallade appreciate being behind screens, which make them harder to revenge kill. Indeedee provides Psychic Terrain support to further boost Deoxys-S's Psycho Boost.

Shell Smash (Grass).description:
Torterra finds its place on Grass teams as a Shell Smash sweeper with a great STAB combination and convenient Speed tier, being able to outpace most of the unboosted metagame after a Shell Smash and break through Pokemon that trouble Grass teams such as Toxapex and Clodsire. Bullet Seed, alongside Loaded Dice, gives Torterra an incredibly strong STAB combination when paired with Headlong Rush and hits things Seed Bomb cannot KO such as Walking Wake and Air Balloon Glimmora. Seed Bomb is a less powerful alternative but comes with the upside of not having to run Loaded Dice for reliability. Headlong Rush allows Torterra to hit Steel- and Poison-types such as Heatran and Amoonguss. Rock Blast is also boosted by Loaded Dice and hits Flying-types, such as Talonflame, Dragonite, and Zapdos, that can ignore Torterra's STAB moves as well as hitting Bug-types such as Volcarona. Alternatively, Heavy Slam provides Torterra with a way to hit Galarian Weezing to secure the Poison matchup alongside being a good option into Fairy teams as a whole. An Adamant nature is preferred to gain as much extra power as possible, but a Jolly nature can outspeed slower Choice Scarf users such as Great Tusk and Hisuian Samurott. Soft Sand is an alternative to Loaded Dice if Seed Bomb and Heavy Slam are run, which lets Torterra's Headlong Rush have a favorable roll to OHKO Amoonguss with a Shell Smash boost.

Ogerpon-H is a great teammate for Torterra, as it can remove Corviknight, an otherwise large barrier for Torterra's sweeping attempts. In return, Torterra breaks through Toxapex, which inhibits Ogerpon-H's sweeping attempts. Choice Scarf Meowscarada provides speed control for Torterra while removing crucial defensive items such as Leftovers and Heavy-Duty Boots from Corviknight and Amoonguss respectively in order to wear them down faster. Additionally, Meowscarada can threaten Dragon-types, such as Choice Scarf Roaring Moon and Walking Wake, that can halt Torterra's sweep by outspeeding it. In return, Torterra easily destroys bulkier team compositions, such as Poison, that Meowscarada struggles to make meaningful progress against. Amoonguss provides opportunities for Torterra to set up thanks to Spore, which Torterra can struggle with finding otherwise. Abomasnow provides Aurora Veil support to aid Torterra in its sweeping efforts, offers a way to beat Dragon teams, and provides an Ice neutrality, allowing it to take a few hits from Chien-Pao, while Brambleghast can remove entry hazards to let Torterra switch in and take advantage of passive switch-ins more readily. Breloom can also put foes to sleep with Spore, while using Mach Punch to remove Choice Scarf users such as Roaring Moon and threaten Baxcalibur, which can each end Torterra's sweeping attempts quickly. Hisuian Lilligant and Rotom-C can also help in the Flying matchup, where Torterra struggles thanks to Ice Spinner and Electric-type STAB moves, respectively, while also being able to scare out Corviknight. Sinistcha is another good teammate for Torterra thanks to Heatproof.

Infernape.comments:
Other Options

Fire

Thunder Punch and Knock Off are other options Infernape can choose to run over Close Combat or Flare Blitz. Thunder Punch allows Infernape to threaten several bulky Water-types. It can 2HKO mixed defensive Toxapex most of the time and OHKO Pelipper and Gyarados. With Knock Off, Infernape can not only threaten Ghost-types, such as Skeledirge, but it can also remove key items, such as Heavy-Duty Boots, from the likes of Pelipper, Ninetales, and Baxcalibur to make them susceptible to entry hazards. However, Close Combat is generally more useful due to the amount of targets it can remove like Ursaluna-B and Ting-Lu, benefiting Fire teams. Fire Punch can be run over Flare Blitz. Although weaker, using Fire Punch doesn't result in Infernape taking recoil damage, improving its longevity. However, Flare Blitz is more reliable despite its recoil damage, and the recoil damage can be solved when running Ninetales thanks to the its access to Healing Wish. Choice Scarf is another option for Infernape, as this can allow it to outspeed and threaten would-be faster Pokemon, such as Flutter Mane, but this trades away its ability to win one-on-one against more bulky Pokemon like Ursaluna-B.

Choice Band (Fire).description:
Infernape is a great wallbreaker and cleaner on Fire teams. Its Fighting typing grants Infernape and Fire teams a better matchup against Dark teams, being able to threaten the likes of Hydreigon and Chien-Pao while also resisting Kingambit's Sucker Punch, and with Flare Blitz, it can threaten Landorus. Close Combat is Infernape's primary Fighting-type STAB move, massively threaten the likes of Ursaluna-B and Baxcalibur. With U-turn, Infernape can safely pivot out of its switch-ins, such as Dondozo, into a teammate that can threaten them. Infernape is also able to serve as a great revenge killer thanks to its access to an Iron Fist-boosted Mach Punch, being able to pick off weakened sweepers such as Baxcalibur, Choice Scarf Hisuian Arcanine, Greninja, and Chien-Pao.

Ninetales and Torkoal make for great partners for Infernape, as the two of them up sun to further boost Infernape's Flare Blitz. Ninetales also commonly uses Solar Beam, allowing it to OHKO threats to Infernape, such as physically defensive Quagsire, and can heal Infernape with Healing Wish, while Torkoal can remove entry hazards for Infernape with its access to Rapid Spin. Torkoal and Heatran can set Stealth Rock in order to wear down foes for Infernape to pick off. For example, Infernape is guaranteed a 2HKO on Galarian Weezing after Stealth Rock damage. In return, Infernape can OHKO Landorus with Flare Blitz under sun as well as both Ursaluna-B and Mamoswine without sun. Cinderace is another noteworthy teammate, as not only can it remove hazards with Court Change, but it is also able to revenge kill faster Ghost-types Infernape cannot such as Dragapult and Speed-boosted Ceruledge with Sucker Punch. In return, Infernape's Fighting-type STAB move frees up a moveslot for Cinderace, as the latter no longer needs High Jump Kick. Volcanion is another great teammate, as it provides Fire teams an immunity to Water, and in return, Infernape is able to threaten the likes of Iron Treads and Landorus for it. Talonflame and Moltres provide a Ground immunity, Will-O-Wisp support, and they can bring Infernape in via U-turn. The two of them are also able to lure bulky Pokemon like Ursaluna-B and Ting-Lu for Infernape to break. Talonflame also provides Defog support, while Moltres's bulk allows it to take on Dragonite, which Infernape greatly appreciates. Infernape's wallbreaking enables other wallbreakers and sweepers such as Ogerpon-H, Volcarona, and Ceruledge to clean late-game. In particular, Infernape can remove Alolan Muk and Heatran to enable a sweep from Volcarona.

Empoleon.comments:
Other Options

Water

Flip Turn is a good option to help Empoleon's wallbreaking teammates come in safely.

Specially Defensive (Water).description:
Empoleon's access to a nice batch of utility options such as Stealth Rock, Roar, and Defog allows it to support its team with entry hazards, phaze foes, and deter Defog. Empoleon acts as a great special wall, being able to deal with foes such as Choice Specs Walking Wake, Greninja, and Hatterene. Flash Cannon gives Empoleon an easier time dealing with Fairy-type Pokemon such as Flutter Mane, Hatterene, and Alolan Ninetales, as well as hitting Ice-types like Kyurem. Empoleon also takes neutral damage from Freeze Dry from Alolan Ninetales and Articuno, which have to be extremely wary of Flash Cannon and Knock Off, respectively. Roar is a great option for Empoleon to get rid of setup sweepers such as Manaphy, Volcarona, and Spectrier, as well as applying more Stealth Rock damage to the Pokemon that are forced in. Lastly, Knock Off allows Empoleon to put itself in a better position to take hits from offensive Pokemon such as Greninja, Flutter Mane, and Basculegion-F, as well as crippling defensive Pokemon that rely heavily on their item, such as Articuno, Corviknight, and Alolan Muk. Leftovers synergizes well with Empoleon's Stealth Rock resistance, and it also appreciates the extra longevity Leftovers provides. However, Heavy-Duty Boots is a better option for teams with no entry hazard removal, as Empoleon is prone to getting worn down by Spikes from repeated switching. 60 Speed EVs allow Empoleon to outspeed uninvested Corviknight and 2HKO it with +2 Surf, helping prevent hazard removal.

Toxapex forms a nice defensive core with Empoleon, as the support from Toxic Spikes helps whittle down Pokemon that would otherwise beat Empoleon, such as Zamazenta, Meowscarada, and Urshifu-R. Empoleon can also switch into the Psychic-type attacks that would make quick work of Toxapex, and Toxapex can switch in on Fighting-type attacks for Empoleon. Physically defensive Rotom-W provides a valuable Ground-type immunity as well as a slow Volt Switch to help Empoleon get in more easily. Will-O-Wisp support from Rotom-W also allows Empoleon to stand up to a physically attacking foe that it might not otherwise be able to, such as Iron Treads or Alolan Muk. Quagsire is another excellent complement to Empoleon, as it provides a valuable Electric-type immunity, as well as helping chip down walls with Spikes and Toxic support. Quagsire also helps versus Zamazenta, a setup Pokemon that Empoleon struggles to phaze, and Empoleon can in turn take on Sinistcha, a setup Pokemon that tears through Quagsire. The physically defensive prowess of Quagsire and the specially defensive power of Empoleon form an incredibly potent defensive pairing. Hisuian Samurott can set Spikes via Ceaseless Edge and stack hazard damage in tandem with Stealth Rock from Empoleon. Empoleon is also capable of switching into Fairy-type attacks from Pokemon such as Flutter Mane that would otherwise plague Hisuian Samurott. Manaphy is also a strong teammate, as Empoleon's entry hazard and Knock Off support allows it to set up and secure KOs more easily. Empoleon can also switch into foes that wish to poison Manaphy, such as Toxapex. Ogerpon-W is a great physical wallbreaking teammate for Empoleon. Empoleon's entry hazard support from Empoleon, whittles down Pokemon that would otherwise switch into it, and in return Ogerpon-W smashes Ground-type Pokemon that would otherwise beat Empoleon, such as Great Tusk and Gliscor. Choice Specs Greninja is also a great wallbreaking teammate, as it outspeeds and OHKOes many Ground-type Pokemon that would otherwise give Empoleon trouble, such as Landorus, Garchomp, and Quagsire. Empoleon is also able to safely switch into Fairy-type attacks from Pokemon like Hatterene and Flutter Mane. Urshifu-R thrives with Empoleon's hazard support, as almost nothing will be safe from a +2 Surging Strikes or Close Combat. If Empoleon is not using Heavy-Duty Boots, Quaquaval is a fantastic teammate. Their Fighting and Steel typings have nice synergy, as Quaquaval can take care of Dark-types like Bisharp, as well as removing entry hazards via Rapid Spin. Azumarill can deal with Fighting-type Pokemon such as Kommo-o, Zamazenta, and Great Tusk, while Empoleon can handle Poison-type Pokemon such as Galarian Weezing, Glimmora, and Iron Moth. Pelipper is capable of setting rain for Empoleon, as well as taking on Grass-type Pokemon such as Hisuian Lilligant and Meowscarada with it's perfectly accurate Hurricane. Basculegion-F's Normal-type immunity means that Empoleon's Stealth Rock and Hisuian Samurott's Spikes cannot be removed via Rapid Spin.

Specially Defensive (Steel).description:
Empoleon has a wide array of utility moves such as Knock Off, Flip Turn, and Roost that allow it to be a valuable support piece on Steel teams. It acts as a phenomenal special wall, easily shrugging off attacks from potent special attackers such as Flutter Mane, Greninja, Walking Wake, and Hisuian Zoroark. Surf is Empoleon's best way of dealing consistent damage as well as taking care of Fire-type Pokemon such as Talonflame, Iron Moth, and Heatran. Knock Off allows Empoleon to soften up defensive staples such as Toxapex, Slowbro, Galarian Weezing, and Porygon2 and remove Choice items from the aforementioned special attackers. Flip Turn is a great pivoting option that allows Empoleon to provide safe switches for wallbreaking teammates such as Bisharp and Choice Specs Gholdengo. Competitive deters opponents from removing hazards via Defog, as the +2 boost to Surf allows Empoleon to deal huge damage.

Thanks to Competitive deterring Defog and Knock Off to remove Heavy-Duty Boots, Empoleon thrives on Steel teams that rely on entry hazards, so hazard-setting teammates such as Archaludon and Skarmory are great picks. Skarmory and Archaludon are also able to use their incredible Defense stats to stand up to physical attackers that Empoleon is unable to deal with, such as Ogerpon-W, Bisharp, and Sneasler. Skarmory is also able to switch into Ground-type attacks that would otherwise threaten Empoleon. Bisharp is a powerful teammate for Empoleon, as the entry hazard damage and removal of items from Pokemon like Choice Specs Walking Wake and Greninja and Heavy-Duty Boots from Pokemon like Quagsire and Toxapex make Bisharp's job a lot easier. Empoleon is also capable of switching into Fire-type attacks, Matcha Gotcha from Sinistcha, and Will-O-Wisp from Dragapult, as well as threatening to remove their Leftovers. Gholdengo is a great teammate for Empoleon, as it can safely switch into Fighting-type attacks that threaten Empoleon. Gholdengo can also take advantage of the hazards on the field, as its checks, such as Alolan Muk, Ting-Lu, and Heatran, are weakened by them as they switch in. Iron Treads is able to remove hazards via Rapid Spin, which protects Empoleon in case its Heavy-Duty Boots get removed by Knock Off. Air Balloon Iron Treads is also capable of providing as a Ground immunity, albeit temporarily, and threatening foes like Gliscor and Landorus with a strong Ice Spinner. Excadrill is a strong physical attacker that appreciates Empoleon's ability to grant it safe switches with Flip Turn. Excadrill is able to fire off very powerful attacks like Earthquake and Iron Head, all while the opposing team takes chip damage from entry hazards. Both Iron Treads and Excadrill are able to switch into Electric-type attacks from Pokemon like Zapdos, Thundurus-T, Choice Specs Flutter Mane, and Rotom formes while threatening them back with Ice Spinner, Rock Slide, Iron Head, and Mold Breaker Earthquake, respectively. Corviknight can switch into Ground-type attacks as well and is also capable of attacking Fighting- and Grass-type Pokemon such as Sneasler, Great Tusk, Ogerpon-W, and Meowscarada with STAB-boosted Brave Bird. Empoleon can form a nice core with Heatran to help stop Fire-type Pokemon such as Volcanion, Volcarona, and Ninetales. Hisuian Goodra is another formidable special wall that forms a nice core with Empoleon, further helping improve the Fire matchup. Its Dragon Tail also forces foes to switch out, thus racking up more hazard damage.

Kamikaze (Normal).description:
A great addition to Normal-type teams, Staraptor checks threats such as Choice Band Breloom, Great Tusk, Quaquaval, and non-Choice Scarf Iron Valiant and provides muscle power against Steel- and Dragon-type teams. Brave Bird makes short work of the aforementioned Fighting-types, as well as bulky Grass-types like Wo-Chien and Amoonguss, and threatens specially defensive Toxapex and Skeledirge with a 2HKO if they switch into it. Close Combat is what gives Staraptor its amazing wallbreaking potential, OHKOing Kingambit, Chien-Pao, Greninja, and Cyclizar while KOing Baxcalibur after Stealth Rock damage and threatening Iron Treads with a 2HKO. Final Gambit, boosted by 28 HP EVs, OHKOes targets Staraptor wouldn't otherwise beat, such as Rotom-W, physically defensive Toxapex, Hatterene, Klefki, and Forretress after Stealth Rock damage—denying dual screens and/or entry hazards from the last two. Alternatively, Double-Edge threatens checks like Rotom-W and Kilowattrel. Finally, U-turn allows this reckless bird to pivot into a teammate, if there really is nothing else it can do, such as against Gholdengo or Corviknight. Equipping a Choice Scarf will let it outspeed Greninja, Flutter Mane, and Walking Wake, which otherwise force it out, and threaten them instead.

A great partner for Staraptor is Hisuian Zoroark. When it uses Illusion to disguise as Staraptor, pairing its Fighting immunity with Staraptor's Ground immunity, an apparent "Staraptor" could be immune to either type. This uncertainty completely dismantles Great Tusk. Furthermore, disguised as Staraptor, it can bait in an unsuspecting Corviknight, Gholdengo, or Dondozo to cripple or OHKO it. Maushold is another great partner thanks to Tidy Up, which keeps both Stealth Rock and Reflect off the field for Staraptor to not worry about. Also, its Population Bomb can break through Ting-Lu and non-Rocky Helmet Toxapex for Staraptor. A less prominent partner that also provides hazard removal, as well as Knock Off support, is Cyclizar. With Stealth Rock breaking Sturdy and further advancing Staraptor's wallbreaking, Blissey is another highly appreciated teammate to set it up, provide Healing Wish and Heal Bell support, and check both Sandy Shocks and Choice Scarf Greninja for Staraptor. Indeedee, likewise, offers Healing Wish support, as well as checking Poison-types like Toxapex and Glimmora that Staraptor struggles with. Lastly, making good use of Staraptor's U-turn, Ditto is a teammate that can turn a bleak situation into a winning one, copying setup sweepers such as Dragonite and Chien-Pao to reverse sweep opponents.

Gastrodon.comments:
Other Options

Water

Clear Smog helps Gastrodon stop Primarina, which can otherwise set up easily on it. Storm Drain has some utility at blocking certain Pokemon, notably Rotom-W variants with just Hydro Pump and Discharge along with Calm Mind Primarin using Surf into Gastrodon. However, this makes Gastrodon weak to Trick and Knock Off from the likes of Iron Valiant, Gholdengo, and Alolan Muk.

The Slug (Ground).description:
Gastrodon's great bulk, typing, and ability allow it to function as a sturdy mixed wall and check to Water-types for Ground teams, letting Clodsire use Unaware. Earth Power targets Gholdengo, Iron Moth, and Skeledirge, while Earthquake deals more damage to Clodsire and Flutter Mane. Ice Beam hits Dragonite, Garchomp, and Kilowattrel. Alternatively, Clear Smog may be used to prevent Espathra and Dondozo from setting up, while Chilling Water eases matchups against physical attackers such as Quaquaval, Scizor, and Iron Treads. Stealth Rock and Spikes are interchangeable depending on what its teammate Ting-Lu is using. Gastrodon prefers maximum Defense investment to check Pokemon like Barraskewda and Quaquaval; however, an EV spread of 252 HP / 68 Def / 188 SpD with a Bold nature can be used to prevent a 2HKO from Choice Specs Greninja's Ice Beam.

Gastrodon's immunity to Water-type attacks and ability to set entry hazards is heavily appreciated by Clodsire, Great Tusk, and Garchomp. Clodsire completes the hazard stack core with Toxic Spikes and answers threats such as Meowscarada and Flutter Mane as well as setup sweepers like Hydreigon, Volcarona, and Gholdengo due to Unaware. Choice Scarf Great Tusk outpaces and deals with threats such as Choice Specs Flutter Mane, Baxcalibur, and Gallade; furthermore, Great Tusk removes Heavy-Duty Boots from common users like Sableye, Amoonguss, and Brambleghast with Knock Off, enhancing Gastrodon's hazard stacking. Garchomp's Fire-type coverage is valued for threatening roadblocks such as Corviknight, Amoonguss, and Breloom, and Sandy Shocks checks Water-types like Pelipper, Quaquaval, and Slowking as well as Corviknight. Iron Treads removes hazards with Rapid Spin, easing Gastrodon's pivoting if its held item were removed, and checks Fairy-types like Flutter Mane, Mimikyu, and Giga Drain Hatterene. Ting-Lu aids in setting hazards and wears down common pivots with Ruination and Whirlwind, taking advantage of both Pokemon's hazards.

Specially Defensive (Ground).description: This is a sample set as we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Specially Defensive (Water).description:
Gastrodon carves out a solid role on Water teams thanks to its secondary Ground typing, which grants it an Electric immunity and a unique set of tools. Earth Power and Earthquake are its main Ground-type STAB moves of choice with both providing solid utility. Earth Power is able to take advantage of Gastrodon's superior Special Attack to chunk foes like Toxapex, Arcahludon, and Pecharunt with ease, while Earthquake helps to ease matchups against specially bulky targets like Hisuian Goodra and Calm Mind Raging Bolt. Ice Beam grants Gastrodon a way to threaten Ground-immune targets like Landorus and scare away Dragon- and Flying-type threats like Dragapult, Dragonite, and Zapdos. Stealth Rock and Spikes provide pressure to threats like Meowscarda and Breloom that can come in to easily scare Gastrodon out. Sticky Hold is Gastrodon's ability of choice, preventing it from having its item removed from Trick and Knock Off from threats like Iron Valiant, Gholdengo, and Alolan Muk.

Toxapex serves as an incredible complement as a physical wall, being able to stave off Grass-type attacks from the likes of Amoonguss and Meowscarada. Toxapex also helps Gastrodon by spreading poison, which complements the chip damage from Gastrodon's entry hazards. Tentacruel can provide similar support to Toxapex while also being able to remove its foes' Heavy-Duty Boots via Knock Off and check the Ogerpon formes, which majorly threaten Gastrodon. Both strongly appreciate Electric-types like Raging Bolt, Regieleki, and Zapdos being dealt with effectively. Empoleon complements Gastrodon's Spikes by running Stealth Rock along with threatening Defoggers with a potential Competitive boost. Empoleon also helps by dealing with Freeze-Dry from the likes of Kyurem, Articuno, and Alolan Ninetales. Choice item users Keldeo and Greninja have their attacks greatly benefit from Gastrodon's hazards chipping down their switch-ins like Alolan Muk, Blissey, and Corviknight. In return, Keldeo provides Vacuum Wave as a way to deal with threats like Chien-Pao and Meowscarada, while Greninja provides Sludge Wave to remove the Ogerpon formes, which take advantage of Gastrodon. Primarina assists Gastrodon by taking on powerful Dark- and Dragon-types like Hisuian Samurott, Roaring Moon, and Dragapult. Ogerpon-W appreciates Gastrodon's hazards chipping down its switch-ins like Skarmory, and it also has access to Encore to stop setup from Kingambit and Raging Bolt, as they attempt to take advantage of Gastrodon's passivity.

Specially Defensive (Poison).description:
Skuntank fills a very important role on Poison teams by packing a much-desired Psychic immunity, which allows it to switch into Psychic-type moves from many common threats such as Greninja, Flutter Mane, and Hatterene. It proceeds to force them out with its hard hitting Poison Jab-which can spread poison around, while Sucker Punch picks them off should they be weakened enough. Protect is also very valuable in scouting their coverage moves, letting Skuntank accumulate Black Sludge recovery, and stalling out poison damage. Aftermath punishes contact attackers like Kingambit and Azumarill, which allows teammates such as Toxicroak to safely come in and finish them off. Skuntank can run Play Rough to threaten common Dark-types of the metagame, such as Chien-Pao and Hydreigon.

Physically defensive Amoonguss and Toxapex are valuable teammates that deal with the physical attackers that threaten Skuntank, like Mimikyu, Quaquaval, and Dondozo. Amoonguss also deals with threatening Ground-types such as Great Tusk, Quagsire, and Sandy Shocks thanks to its good bulk, Grass-type STAB move, and Ground neutrality. Toxapex, on the other hand, deals with threats like Chien-Pao, Cloyster, and Scizor with Infestation and Haze while laying down Toxic Spikes. Specially defensive Clodsire complements Skuntank by dealing with special attackers it can't handle by itself, such as Gholdengo, Magnezone, and Volcarona. Iron Moth deals with the multitude of Steel-types like Gholdengo, Iron Treads, and Corviknight that Skuntank can't do much against.
