Heatran appreciates Corviknight as a teammate, as it offers an immunity to Ground and a neutrality to Fighting while also granting Heatran a safe entry onto the field with its slow U-turn. Other Ground-immune teammates, like Skarmory, and Air Balloon users, like Gholdengo, find themselves alongside Heatran to pivot into Ground-type attacks for Heatran in the event that Heatran's Air Balloon gets popped. Skarmory and Gholdengo also create a great entry hazard-stacking core with Heatran, as Skarmory provides Spikes and Gholdengo blocks Defog and Rapid Spin. Archaludon and Hisuian Goodra offer a Water resistance for Heatran, the former of which appreciates Heatran using Stealth Rock to free up a moveslot of its own. Choice Scarf Iron Treads offers much-needed speed control and an immunity to Electric-type attacks from the likes of Zapdos and Thundurus-T. Furthermore, Iron Treads takes out threats to Heatran like Landorus and Choice Band Hisuian Arcanine with Ice Spinner and Earthquake, respectively. Setup sweepers like Kingambit and Scizor appreciate Heatran weakening bulky walls like Haze Toxapex and Unaware Quagsire to facilitate a sweep.

Specially Defensive (Steel).description:
Specially defensive Heatran is an invaluable part of any Steel team. It is a fantastic check to many metagame staples that Steel would greatly struggle to otherwise deal with, such as Volcarona, Corviknight, Skeledirge, Zapdos, and Iron Moth. It serves Steel teams consistently well even outside of these problem matchups due to its great natural bulk, plethora of useful resistances including a crucial immunity to Fire via Flash Fire, and utility for its team through its access to Stealth Rock and capacity to spread burns.

Lava Plume is Heatran’s primary attacking move, which not only hits neutral targets hard due to Heatran’s naturally good Special Attack but also has a 30% chance to burn foes. Fire’s nature as an attacking type that has no natural immunities means Heatran can use Lava Plume many times throughout the course of a game to generate progress with minimal risk. The burn chance of Lava Plume makes Heatran incredibly risky for foes to switch into, as physical attackers such as Great Tusk that could threaten a KO on Heatran do not want to risk the possibility of being burned and having their offensive power crippled. Furthermore, walls such as Toxapex also fear being burned, as the passive damage will affect their longevity over the course of a game. Earth Power is the only coverage necessary for Heatran, giving it the capability to easily break through foes such as Skeledirge and Iron Moth. It is notable that an EV spread including 56 Special Attack EVs will allow Heatran to OHKO offensive opposing Heatran with Earth Power. Heatran serves as an excellent setter of Stealth Rock due to its propensity to easily force switches against Pokemon such as Corviknight, Gholdengo, and Amoonguss. Protect rounds out Heatran’s moveset, not only giving it the chance to extend its longevity via Leftovers and accumulate burn damage on foes but also the capability to scout foes’ movesets, which can be especially useful when facing off against foes using Choice items. One should be careful when using Protect not to fall into predictable patterns and give foes the chance to set up on Heatran, however. Magma Storm can be used instead of Lava Plume to trap and eliminate foes such as Toxapex and force damage against bulky threats such as Iron Hands; the passive damage synergizes well with Protect, but Magma Storm's low PP and accuracy makes it less consistent throughout longer games. Taunt is an option that can be used place of Stealth Rock that synergizes particularly well with Magma Storm, preventing foes from using recovery moves, getting entry hazards up, or setting up on Heatran. However, a lack of Speed investment means it will have somewhat limited utility. As another option to Stealth Rock, Power Gem easily OHKOes Moltres, which walls Heatran otherwise, and prevents bulky Volcarona sets from outlasting Heatran. Alternatively, Will-O-Wisp can be used over Stealth Rock in conjunction with an investment of 40 Speed EVs to allow Heatran to outspeed and burn maximum Speed Adamant Kingambit. If desired, it is also possible to run one of the aforementioned alternative options of Taunt, Power Gem, or Will-O-Wisp instead of Protect, but this comes at the cost of significantly impacting Heatran's longevity and foregoing Protect's scouting utility.

Heatran serves as one of the three pillars of Steel’s “immunity trinity” along with Corviknight and Gholdengo; combined, these three offer immunities to Steel’s core weaknesses of Fire, Ground, and Fighting, forming an excellent defensive backbone for any Steel team. Corviknight is Heatran’s most important partner, being able to nullify Ground-type moves targeted at Heatran while Heatran in turn blocks Fire-type moves aimed at Corviknight. Furthermore, Corviknight can also threaten prominent Fighting-types in the metagame such as Great Tusk, Iron Valiant, and Sneasler with its STAB Brave Bird. With a physically defensive pivot set, Corviknight further synergizes with specially defensive Heatran by being able to soak up physical hits while Heatran takes special ones, having the ability to remove opposing Stealth Rock and Spikes to prevent Heatran from being worn down by entry hazards over the course of a game and providing Heatran with opportunities to switch in safely via U-turn. Bulk Up Corviknight appreciates Heatran too, as Stealth Rock and burn support can increase its sweeping potential. Gholdengo completes the immunity trinity by voiding Fighting moves aimed at Heatran. Gholdengo can further support Heatran by blocking Corrosion Toxic from Glimmora thanks to Good as Gold; this ability combined with Gholdengo's Ghost typing also lets it completely prevent the removal of Heatran's Stealth Rock, as Gholdengo blocks both Rapid Spin and Defog. With an Air Balloon, Gholdengo can block Ground-type moves and use Nasty Plot to break through walls, both of which Heatran appreciates. Alternatively, using a Choice Scarf, Gholdengo can switch into Enamorus and outspeed and OHKO it in return, and it can use Trick to cripple opposing special walls such as Toxapex and Blissey or lock sweepers such as Dragon Dance Dragonite into setup moves to prevent them from exploiting Heatran. Outside of the immunity trinity, Hisuian Goodra also makes a good pairing with Heatran due to its unique Water resistance on Steel and capacity to threaten opposing Water-types such as Basculegion-F and Greninja with Thunderbolt. Hisuian Goodra can also check Hydreigon and Walking Wake, which both wall and exploit Heatran. Moreover, Hisuian Goodra can act as a switch-in to opposing Heatran and threaten it with Earthquake, and it is able to survive an Earth Power from Landorus and OHKO it in return with Ice Beam if necessary. Iron Treads can spin away hazards for Heatran without removing Heatran’s Stealth Rock, set Stealth Rock itself to free Heatran to use other moves if desired, and serve as an offensive check to Sandy Shocks with its STAB Earthquake as well as Landorus with Ice Spinner, which Heatran’s other teammates can struggle to handle. Physical sweepers such as Kingambit and Scizor are grateful for Heatran’s ability to absorb Will-O-Wisp for them, and they can clean up teams Heatran has worn down with Stealth Rock and chip damage. Klefki can complement Heatran's Stealth Rock with its own Spikes while taking advantage of Heatran's Fire immunity, which can help break down opposing teams faster as they switch around to deal with the immunity trinity. It should be noted that this is by no means an exhaustive list of potential teammates for Heatran; all Steel-type Pokemon in the metagame appreciate Heatran’s Fire immunity, and no Pokemon currently competes with Heatran in this regard.

Manaphy.comments:
Other Options

Manaphy may use Energy Ball to hit opposing Water-types that otherwise aren't much affected by its coverage such as Hisuian Samurott. Alluring Voice is an alternative to Ice Beam as coverage for Dragon-types, although if Manaphy forgoes Psychic or Ice Beam, it can no longer hit Water Absorb Clodsire effectively. Manaphy can also use Rest in conjunction with Hydration to increase its longevity tenfold in the face of passive foes. Heavy-Duty Boots allow a more offensive Manaphy spread to safely enter the field successively.

Offensive Setup Sweeper.description:
Manaphy is an incredibly potent wallbreaker for Water teams, making use of the highly coveted Tail Glow in tandem with its great bulk and coverage to blast through bulky Water answers. Ice Beam targets Dragon-types like Dragonite and Roaring Moon and Grass-types like Hydrapple and Sinistcha. Psychic allows Manaphy to break through many Pokemon troublesome for Water teams, such as Toxapex, Amoonguss, and Clodsire. The given defensive EVs let Manaphy use Substitute safely in front of Alolan Muk as well as other passive foes like Toxapex and Blissey. The remaining speed lets Manaphy outpace the likes of Adamant Dragonite and Mamoswine.

Manaphy's wallbreaking powers greatly aid speedy sweepers like Greninja, Urshifu-R, and Swift Swim Pokemon like Barraskewda and Kingdra, which can be slowed down by the aforementioned Water answers like Toxapex and Water Absorb Clodsire as well as other special walls like Articuno. Manaphy appreciates Electric-immune teammates like Swampert and Quagsire, both of which can set up entry hazards to support Manaphy's wallbreaking. Since Ogerpon-W can very easily pivot into Manaphy and pose a huge threat to it and its teammates, offensive checks to it are a necessity for Manaphy to succeed, such as Sludge Wave Greninja, Choice Scarf X-Scissor Hisuian Samurott, and Hurricane Pelipper. In return, Manaphy opens up holes in the opponent's defenses for these faster teammates to clean up late-game. Grass-neutral teammates like Toxapex, Tentacruel, and Ogerpon-W all help shore up Manaphy’s weaknesses as well. Tentacruel provides great hazard control with both Toxic Spikes and Rapid Spin, and with Rain Dish it can stay quite healthy in the Rain. Ogerpon-W outspeeds powerful threats to Manaphy like Landorus and Thundurus-T and can KO them with rain-boosted Ivy Cudgel. Should Manaphy be paired with Drizzle Pelipper, the Rain allows Manaphy's Hydration to shrug off status effects, making it impossible to wear down with poison or slow down with paralysis.

Darkrai.comments:
Other Options

Dark

Choice Specs makes Darkrai a threatening wallbreaker, aiding Dark teams against Fighting, Fairy, Steel, and opposing Dark matchups with Psychic, Sludge Bomb, and Focus Blast. However, it's susceptible to being revenge killed by faster threats like Dragapult and Choice Scarf users like Sneasler, Iron Valiant, and Enamorus, so partners like Choice Scarf Meowscarada and Greninja are a necessity.

Choice Scarf (Dark).description:
Choice Scarf Darkrai is an incredible revenge killer for Dark teams due to its colorful coverage options and an incredible Speed stat, allowing it to outspeed common Choice Scarf users like Meowscarada, Iron Boulder, Sneasler, and Greninja. Sludge Bomb is a crucial coverage move, threatening Fairy-types like Iron Valiant, Hatterene, and Primarina while also hitting the Ogerpon formes. Psychic lets Darkrai handle Fighting-types like Sneasler, Urshifu-R, and Okidogi, while Ice Beam deals with Ground- and Dragon-types like the Landorus formes, Garchomp, and Dragonite. Trick lets Darkrai hinder walls like Clodsire, Corviknight, and Ting-Lu, which switch into it. Alternatively, Focus Blast targets Dark- and Steel-types like Kingambit, Roaring Moon, Archaludon, and Heatran.

Physical attackers like Weavile, Meowscarada, and Roaring Moon can eliminate special walls like Clodsire, Swampert, and Hisuian Goodra; Choice Specs Greninja can also weaken foes like Archaludon, Corviknight, and Toxapex as well as aid against Fighting- and Fairy-types with Extrasensory and Sludge Wave, respectively, allowing Darkrai to clean up late-game. In return, Darkrai can deal with faster threats like non-Choice Scarf Dragapult and common Choice Scarf users like Iron Valiant, Meowscarada, and Sneasler that threaten them. Alolan Muk and Kingambit threaten Fairy-types like Flutter Mane, Clefable, and Primarina, while Darkrai can handle Ground-types such as the Landorus formes, Hippowdon, and Gliscor with Ice Beam. Sableye provides a Fighting immunity and can cripple foes like Zamazenta, Iron Hands, and Gallade with Will-O-Wisp. Ting-Lu is a great partner, setting entry hazards, wearing down bulky foes, and enabling Darkrai to OHKO threats like Hydreigon, Kyurem, Great Tusk, and Enamorus. Mandibuzz provides entry hazard removal and safe entry to Darkrai using U-turn, along with checking threats such as Scizor and Belly Drum Azumarill.

Nasty Plot.description:
Darkrai, with its access to Nasty Plot, great offensive stats, and a colorful coverage pool, makes for a very threatening wallbreaker, being faster than common Pokemon that threaten Dark teams such as Greninja, Iron Valiant, and Tornadus-T. Darkrai has three main choices when selecting a coverage move. At +2, Psychic primarily helps against Fighting-type Pokemon such as Iron Hands and Iron Valiant, while Focus Blast defeats Steel-type Pokemon that can otherwise stomach its potent attacks such as Kingambit and Hisuian Goodra. Alternatively, Ice Beam can help alleviate the Ground and Flying matchups, notably being able to OHKO Gliscor. Substitute allows Darkrai to add an extra layer of protection against predicted switches by Pokemon such as Klefki and non-Choice Scarf Gholdengo. Hypnosis can be used over Substitute in order to give Darkrai a free turn to do as it pleases while also neutering slower foes such as Articuno and Alolan Muk. Focus Sash can be used over Leftovers in order to guarantee that Darkrai is able to use Hypnosis against faster threats such as Zamazenta.

Choice Specs Greninja and Air Balloon Kingambit make a fantastic offensive core when paired with Darkrai. Greninja can help alleviate the Flying and Ground matchups if Darkrai decides to forego Ice Beam and Psychic while also being able to add pressure against Fighting and Fairy teams thanks to its access to coverage such as Extrasensory and Sludge Wave. In return, Darkrai is able to weaken common checks such as Articuno and Hisuian Goodra after a Nasty Plot. Kingambit helps Darkrai by switching in and forcing out Pokemon that can revenge kill Darkrai such as Choice Scarf Iron Treads and Excadrill under sand. Sableye and Ting-Lu form a defensive core for Darkrai, as Sableye is able to wear down specially defensive Pokemon such as Clodsire and Corviknight with access to Knock Off and Will-O-Wisp while also being able to use Encore against threatening setup sweepers such as Zamazenta and Gouging Fire, all while providing an invaluable Fighting immunity. Ting-Lu is able to switch into strong special attackers such as Flutter Mane, Enamorus, and Hatterene while threatening them back with Heavy Slam; it is also able to set a wide array of entry hazards, which makes Darkrai's job of wallbreaking or sweeping easier. Alternatively, Alolan Muk can switch into Fairy-type attacks while also providing further utility with Knock Off and Poison Touch. Mandibuzz provides entry hazard removal, which keeps Darkrai's Focus Sash intact if it is being used while also providing a Ground immunity. Lastly, Choice Scarf Meowscarada is able to revenge kill faster threats such as Dragapult, Choice Scarf Gholdengo, and opposing Choice Scarf Greninja.

Swords Dance (Dark).description:
Hisuian Samurott serves as an excellent offensive presence on Dark teams with its great secondary Water typing and access to Swords Dance, which enables it to break through otherwise annoying threats for Dark teams like Hatterene and Archaludon. Sacred Sword enables Hisuian Samurott to check problematic Steel- and Dark-types like Archaludon and Weavile. Aqua Cutter easily breaks through Ground- and Fire-types such as Ting-Lu, Heatran, and bulky Gouging Fire. Ceaseless Edge provides Spikes support while dealing solid damage to targets like Water Absorb Clodsire and Gholdengo. Sucker Punch helps to offset Hisuian Samurott's average Speed, enabling it to remove foes like Dragapult, Flutter Mane, and Excadrill after Swords Dance and Spikes chip damage.

Meowscarada serves as an excellent teammate to Hisuian Samurott, threatening Water-types that wall it like Primarina and Urshifu-R with Choice Band Flower Trick and checking foes like Choice Scarf Enamorus with Choice Scarf Triple Axel. Ting-Lu provides solid defensive support by handling Electric-types such as Raging Bolt and Sandy Shocks as well as strong special attackers like Terapagos. Hydreigon assists Hisuian Samurott by providing a Grass resistance and using its powerful special attacks to blow through physical walls like Archaludon and Rotom-W. Choice Specs Greninja complements Hisuian Samurott thanks to its incredible coverage allowing it to check Fighting-types like Iron Valiant and Sneasler with Extrasensory or Grass-types like the Ogerpon formes with Sludge Wave. Sableye's immunity to Fighting-type attacks enables it to handle Skarmory and Hisuian Lilligant. Sableye also acts as a spinblocker against foes such as Great Tusk, ensuring that Hisuian Samurott's Spikes from Ceaseless Edge stay up throughout a game. Alolan Muk supports Hisuian Samurott with its high Special Defense and Poison typing that enables it to take on Fairy- and Grass-types like Flutter Mane and Hydrapple. Additionally, Alolan Muk can use Knock Off to remove Heavy-Duty Boots from the likes of Amoonguss and Forretress, making them susceptible to chip damage from Hisuian Samurott's Spikes. Bisharp can remove dangerous Fairy-types like Clefable and Galarian Weezing and punishes Defog from Mandibuzz attempting to remove Hisuian Samurott's Spikes. If Hisuian Samurott does not run Ceaseless Edge, Mandibuzz can provide Defog support, which is especially helpful if Hisuian Samurott loses its Heavy-Duty Boots. Additionally, Mandibuzz can use U-turn to bring Hisuian Samurott in safely.

Swords Dance (Water).description:
Hisuian Samurott serves as crucial role on Water teams, with its Dark typing and powerful offensive capabilities allowing it to serve as an incredible late-game cleaner against teams such as Ghost and Dragon teams. Ceaseless Edge provides both Spikes support and enables Hisuian Samurott to break through targets like Water Absorb Clodsire, Gholdengo, and Toxapex after a Swords Dance boost. Sacred Sword enables Hisuian Samurott to OHKO Archaludon after a Swords Dance boost and Spikes chip damage, which is otherwise a major issue for Water teams, along with safely KOing Bisharp. Alternatively, Aqua Cutter provides a reliable option to hit foes like Great Tusk and Klefki. Finally Sucker Punch provides crucial speed control for Water teams, enabling Hisuian Samurott to handle Latios and Choice-locked Dragapult as well as Flutter Mane after a Swords Dance boost.

Swampert and Empoleon serve as great defensive partners for Hisuian Samurott, as both are able to Stealth Rock and use their slow Flip Turn to safely pivot Hisuian Samurott in. Swampert can also help Hisuian Samurott thanks to its key Electric immunity that enables it to beat Raging Bolt and Sandy Shocks, while Empoleon's Steel typing allows it to check Fairy-type threats like Hatterene and Galarian Weezing reliably. Toxapex appreciates Hisuian Samurott removing Psychic-types like Hoopa-U and Latios and in return handles Grass- and Fighting-types like Meowscarada, Sneasler, and Keldeo. Choice Specs Greninja uses its solid coverage and Protean to handle foes like the Ogerpon formes and Iron Valiant with Sludge Wave and Okidogi and Quaquaval with Extrasensory, while Hisuian Samurott can remove special walls like Blissey and Hisuian Goodra for Greninja. Primarina assists by being able to deal with Fighting- and Dragon-types like Zamazenta, Keldeo, and Roaring Moon and appreciates the Spikes set by Hisuian Samurott wearing down checks like Hisuian Goodra and Alolan Muk. Pelipper provides rain support with Drizzle, increasing the threat level of Hisuian Samurott's Aqua Cutter and enabling it to consistently 2HKO foes like Galarian Weezing and Skarmory. Pelipper can also use Knock Off to remove Heavy-Duty Boots off of foes like Empoleon and Amoonguss, increasing the potency of Hisuian Samurott's Spikes, and its Drizzle grants teams access to rain sweepers like Barraskewda and Kingdra, which can help in breaking through targets Hisuian Samurott can't; Barraskewda outspeeds and removes Flutter Mane and offensive Zapdos, while Kingdra cleans through Raging Bolt and Roaring Moon. Ogerpon-W helps Hisuian Samurott by handling Water-types like Urshifu-R and Rotom-W, and its Grass typing enables it to check Electric-types like Sandy Shocks.

Choice Scarf (Water).description:
Hisuian Samurott is one of Water’s best options for a Choice Scarf user. This is owed to its great STAB combination, of which both types are resisted by only a scant few Pokemon in the metagame, higher power than what is initially apparent due to Sharpness bolstering its slicing moves, a good Speed tier that allows it to outspeed and revenge kill key threats such as Chien-Pao, Flutter Mane, Dragapult, and Choice Scarf Gholdengo, and unique progress-making utility for Water in the form of Ceaseless Edge and Knock Off.

Ceaseless Edge is Hisuian Samurott’s most important move, allowing it not only to threaten and KO foes with the raw power of a Sharpness-boosted Dark-type STAB move but also set up a layer of Spikes with each use, putting pressure on opposing teams and potentially opening up holes in defensive cores for its teammates to exploit. It is important to note that Spikes laid by Ceaseless Edge cannot be reflected by Magic Bounce, meaning Hisuian Samurott can safely click Ceaseless Edge against Hatterene and still get Spikes up. Hisuian Samurott’s secondary STAB move is a choice between Aqua Cutter and Razor Shell. Aqua Cutter is generally preferred for its consistency due it not making contact with the opponent and its perfect accuracy, allowing Hisuian Samurott to safely deal with Volcarona and Moltres. However, Razor Shell is guaranteed to OHKO Flutter Mane and provides Hisuian Samurott with more wallbreaking capability due to its 50% chance to reduce Defense if the user is willing to tolerate the risk of missing. Sacred Sword serves as an excellent coverage option, allowing Hisuian Samurott to eliminate foes such as Chien-Pao, Kingambit, and opposing Hisuian Samurott. Finally, Knock Off provides Hisuian Samurott with a secondary utility in the form of item removal, which can cripple Leftovers users such as Rotom-W, Corviknight, and Toxapex and open up Heavy-Duty Boots users such as Amoonguss to being chipped down by entry hazards, making Hisuian Samurott even riskier for foes to switch into.

In terms of teammates, physically defensive Rotom-W is an excellent partner for Choice Scarf Hisuian Samurott, checking several of Hisuian Samurott’s bad matchups such as Azumarill, Garchomp, and Scarf Great Tusk and providing Hisuian Samurott with safe opportunities to come in via Volt Switch. Toxapex is another great teammate for Hisuian Samurott, being able to switch into and take hits repeatedly from faster Choice Scarf users such as Sneasler, Enamorus, and Iron Valiant thanks to its defensive typing coupled with Regenerator and Recover. Moreover, Toxapex can serve as an answer to Urshifu-R and can compound on the pressure of Hisuian Samurott’s Spikes with its own Toxic Spikes, while benefitting itself from Hisuian Samurott’s Spikes punishing foes switching around. Gastrodon or Quagsire can absorb Electric-type moves for Hisuian Samurott and set up Stealth Rock to compliment Hisuian Samurott’s Spikes. Wallbreakers such as Urshifu-R, Greninja, Basculegion-M, and Walking Wake as well as sweepers such as Basculegion-F also synergize well with Hisuian Samurott, with Spikes support allowing them to more easily break through enemy teams and the speed control from Choice Scarf meaning potential revenge killers can be removed ahead of time. The speed control from Choice Scarf is still useful even on rain teams even when accompanied by Swift Swim Pokemon such as Basculegion-F, as rain will not always be present on the battlefield. Furthermore, either forme of Basculegion can serve as a spinblocker to prevent the removal of Hisuian Samurott’s Spikes.

Entry Hazard Lead (Dark).description: This is a sample set as we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Excadrill.overview: Excadrill is typically overshadowed by the same-typed Iron Treads, but Excadrill finds a niche on Steel-type teams as a Choice Scarf user. Iron Treads provides more utility, as well as being able to OHKO Landorus with Ice Spinner, while Excadrill provides more immediate power and has fewer switch-ins thanks to Mold Breaker. Excadrill is a valuable revenge killer and is able to spam Earthquake without being worried about Levitate users such as Latios, Rotom-W, and Galarian Weezing.

Choice Scarf (Steel).description:
Excadrill makes use of its high Attack and Speed to serve as a solid Choice Scarf user for Steel teams. Mold Breaker, alongside Earthquake, notably eases the Dragon matchup, as Excadrill can ignore Levitate from the likes of Latios, Latias, and Hydreigon. Iron Head allows Excadrill to hit Fairy- and Ice-types such as Flutter Mane, Iron Valiant, and Kyurem. Rock Slide allows Excadrill to threaten Flying-types such as Zapdos and Dragonite that would hope to switch into Earthquake. Since Iron Treads is typically replaced by Excadrill, Rapid Spin is a logical last move and is the best way for Steel team to remove entry hazards from only their side of the field.

Gholdengo is a solid teammate for Excadrill, as not only can it switch into Fighting-type attacks, but it can use Thunder Wave to slow down opposing Choice Scarf users to ensure Excadrill outspeeds them, such as Greninja, Hisuian Samurott, and Latios. Gholdengo also appreciates the removal of Hisuian Goodra and Alolan Muk so that it can spam Shadow Ball without worry. Skarmory has a Ground immunity and provides entry hazard support in the form of Spikes, which makes Excadrill's job easier. Archaludon is also capable of using Thunder Wave, targeting Pokemon such as Ogerpon-H and Ceruledge, and it can provide additional entry hazard support in the form of Stealth Rock. In return, Excadrill can remove faster Fairy-type threats that would otherwise check Archaludon, such as Choice Specs Flutter Mane. Air Balloon Heatran can act as a temporary Ground immunity, as well as being able to safely switch into Fire-type attacks that would otherwise make quick work of Excadrill. Empoleon and Hisuian Goodra procide Knock Off support to remove Heavy-Duty Boots from Pokemon such as Dragapult and Darkrai and resist Water. Empoleon also has the added benefit of deterring Defog via Competitive, as well as being a slow pivot option via Flip Turn.

Choice Band (Ground).description:
Sand Rush, in tandem with a colossal Attack stat, makes Excadrill a terrifying attacker on sand-based Ground-type teams, outspeeding even Choice Scarf Meowscarada while sand is active. Earthquake 2HKOes some of the bulkiest Pokemon in the metagame, such as Primarina and Amoonguss, as well as 2HKOing Slowbro and Garchomp after some hazard support. Iron Head hits Ice- and Fairy-type Pokemon such as Kyurem, Enamorus, and Galarian-Weezing, as well as Pokemon with Levitate such as Latias. Rock Slide helps target Flying-type Pokemon such as Zapdos, Dragonite, and Talonflame. Poison Jab can be used to hit pesky Grass-type Pokemon that would otherwise be a major nuisance to Ground-type teams such as Ogerpon-W, Ogerpon-H, and Meowscarada. Alternatively, X-Scissor can be used to hit Psychic-, Dark-, and some Grass-type Pokemon such as Slowbro, Latios, Hydreigon, and Serperior.

Hippowdon is a mandatory teammate for Excadrill, as not only does it provide sand, but it also provides entry hazard support in the form of Stealth Rock. It also provides Excadrill a safe switch via Eject Button. Hippowdon is also capable of taking on physically oriented threats such as Bisharp, Iron Hands, and Garchomp. Landorus-T and Gliscor are great teammates, as they can both switch into the Fighting- and Ground-type attacks that make quick work of Excadrill. Landorus is also capable of using Gravity to enable Excadrill's Earthquake to hit absolutely everything. Mamoswine is a great teammate to help Excadrill deal with Flying-type Pokemon that it cannot deal with, such as Gliscor and Corviknight. It also deals with Choice Scarf users and faster threats that Excadrill cannot outspeed when sand is not present, such as Dragapult, Enamorus, and Meowscarada, thanks to Ice Shard. Excadrill pairs nicely with Swords Dance Garchomp, as Excadrill takes care of the Ice- and Fairy-types that would otherwise get in the way of Garchomp's sweep. Teammates that provide Water immunities, such as Storm Drain Gastrodon and Water Absorb Clodsire, are great teammates, as they can switch into threats that Excadrill cannot OHKO, such as Primarina, Urshifu-R, Keldeo, and Barraskewda. Teammates that provide entry hazard support work well with Excadrill, such as Ting-Lu, Quagsire, and Clodsire.

Swords Dance (Ground).description:
Excadrill's Swords Dance, paired with its great offensive capabilities in its near-unwallable STAB combination and Sand Rush, makes it an excellent sweeper for Ground-type teams. Swords Dance aids Excadrill in OHKOing prominent targets that would otherwise threaten it such as Primarina, Meowscarada, and Kyurem. Iron Head in tandem with Earthquake forms a fantastic STAB move combination that is resisted by very few Pokemon. Rapid Spin allows Excadrill to remove entry hazards that can prove troublesome to Ground-type teams, such as Spikes and Toxic Spikes, while also providing it with a boost to its Speed, which can make it a potent sweeper even outside of sand. Soft Sand is the preferred item over other damage-boosting items such as Life Orb, as it allows Excadrill to retain HP while landing OHKOs on the aforementioned Primarina, as well as Swampert after a Swords Dance boost.

Hippowdon is a mandatory teammate, as it sets sand for Excadrill to take advantage of. Additionally, it acts as a great physical wall that can switch into Pokemon that threaten Excadrill, such as Great Tusk and Landorus-T, while also providing entry hazard support. In return, Excadrill can handle the aforementioned Primarina and Meowscarada for Hippowdon. Landorus is another great teammate, as it is a very potent wallbreaker that handles physical walls that Excadrill struggles against, such as opposing Hippowdon, as well as Corviknight and Skarmory if it has set Gravity, which Excadrill can also take advantage of. In return, Excadrill takes care of Pokemon that can wall Landorus, like Chansey and Articuno. Another great defensive teammate is Clodsire, which provides a Water immunity with Water Absorb, as well as great utility with its access to a wide array of entry hazards, which further aid in Excadrill's sweeping and wallbreaking capabilities. Mamoswine is another appreciated teammate, as it has access to Thick Fat, which allows Ground teams to have a relatively safe pivot into Pokemon such as Kyurem and Greninja Choice-locked into Ice-type moves, which both outspeed Excadrill outside of sand. Additionally, it threatens a myriad of Pokemon that prove troublesome to Excadrill such as Gliscor, Amoonguss, and Zapdos with its Ice-type STAB moves, as well as revenge killing Dragon-types such as Dragonite and Dragapult, making Excadrill's job of sweeping much easier.

Whimsicott.overview:
Grass

Whimsicott finds niches with its Fairy typing, allowing it to take on Dragon-types, along with Prankster boosting its great utility movepool such as Encore, which enables it to lock targets like Gouging Fire and Skarmory into undesirable moves. However, Whimsicott's low stats outside of Speed leave much to be desired in terms of power, and its utility movepool can often be stifled by opposing Grass-types and bulky Dark-types such as Ogerpon-H and Alolan Muk, which will happily remove it.

Offensive Disruptor (Grass).description:
Whimsicott finds a niche on Grass with its Fairy typing and vast support movepool boosted by Prankster to act as a disruptor against threats such as Gouging Fire and Volcarona. Encore allows Whimsicott to lock otherwise game-winning sweepers like Victory Dance Hisuian Lilligant and Dragon Dance Dragapult into their setup options, enabling Whimsicott or its teammates to remove them. Moonblast provides a form of offense for Whimsicott, allowing it to threaten Dragon- and Dark-type threats such as Archaludon, Roaring Moon, and Sableye. Stun Spore grants Whimiscott a vital form of speed control, slowing down foes like Sneasler, Gouging Fire, and Dragapult. Alternatively, Tailwind provides long term speed control and is useful to use before Whimsicott is KOed. Heavy-Duty Boots allows Whimsicott to safely enter the field, while Pixie Plate enables it to 2HKO Archaludon.

Ogerpon-H serves as a vital ally, being able to handle Poison- and Steel-types that beat Whimsicott such as Alolan Muk, Amoonguss, Heatran, and Gholdengo. Ogerpon-H also appreciates Whimiscott paralyzing Sneasler and Tornadus-T so it can check them. Alternatively, Ogerpon-C can be used to nail Fire- and Flying-types such as Ninetales, Ogerpon-H, and Gouging Fire that cause Whimsicott trouble while also appreciating Tailwind to outspeed +1 Volcarona and Gouging Fire with a Speed boost from Protosynthesis. Choice Scarf Meowscarada provides an incredible form of speed control, being able to check threats such as Choice Specs Flutter Mane and Choice Scarf Gholdengo that cause Whimsicott issues; it also benefits from Stun Spore, enabling it to outspeed Choice Scarf Dragapult. Amoonguss provides a solid defensive pivot for Whimsicott, as it can absorb Toxic Spikes should Whimsicott opt for Pixie Plate along with using Foul Play on a setup threat such as Swords Dance Ceruledge to remove it once hit with Encore. Amoonguss can also use Sludge Bomb to take on Fairy-types like Hatterene that can deflect Whimsicott's utility via Magic Bounce. Lilligant and Breloom appreciate Whimsicott's Encore, granting safe setup opportunities and can use their Fighting-type STAB moves to deal with Ice- and Steel-types such as Kyurem, Alolan Sandslash, and Hisuian Goodra in return. Hydrapple appreciates Whimsicott removing Dragon-types like Roaring Moon and Raging Bolt and, in return, can use its Fire neutrality and Earth Power to take on Fire-types like Heatran, Hisuian Arcanine, and Iron Moth. Sinistcha similarly provides a Fire neutrality along with a Poison neutrality, enabling it to take on threats such as Sneasler, Clodsire, and Zamazenta with Calm Mind and Strength Sap.

Victory Dance (Fighting).description:
Hisuian Lilligant is a strong choice on Fighting teams because of its ability to clean up games thanks to its signature move, Victory Dance, and being a great asset in the Ground, Water, and Flying matchups, which Fighting teams can struggle against. Leaf Blade 2HKOes Toxapex at +1 and threatens Water's two Unaware Pokemon, Dondozo and Quagsire. Close Combat hits Ice- and Steel-types trying to switch into Hisuian Lilligant's Grass STAB move, as well as having a favorable roll to OHKO both Corviknight and Hisuian Goodra at +1. Finally, Ice Spinner hits Dragon- and Flying-types such as Dragonite and Thundurus-T, as well as Unaware Clodsire on Ground. Wide Lens is used to reduce the accuracy drop from Hustle. Sleep Powder can be run to give Hisuian Lilligant more setup opportunities, but the loss of coverage in Ice Spinner or STAB in Close Combat is notable.

Great Tusk is a great teammate for Hisuian Lilligant, as it threatens out Skeledirge, Gholdengo, and the Poison-types that can stop a Hisuian Lilligant sweep. Great Tusk can soften up Hisuian Lilligant's checks by setting Stealth Rock. In return, Hisuian Lilligant uses Water-types such as Hisuian Samurott and Quagsire, which threaten Great Tusk, as setup opportunities. Iron Valiant can break through common checks to Hisuian Lilligant such as the aforementioned Skeledirge and Gholdengo thanks to either Shadow Ball on special sets or Knock Off on mixed ones. Sneasler is a secondary sweeper that can also threaten Fairy-types such as Enamorus-T. Its Choice Scarf set can also beat Volcarona, which can use Hisuian Lilligant as setup fodder, with Rock Slide and use Switcheroo to hinder defensive walls trying to switch in. Iron Hands uses its insane bulk, bolstered by Assault Vest, to sponge special attacks very easily from Pokemon such as Zapdos and Hatterene. It also hits Flying-types hard with its Electric STAB moves, and can pivot Hisuian Lilligant in with Volt Switch. In return, Hisuian Lilligant breaks the Ground-types that threaten both Iron Hands and Sneasler. Finally, Zamazenta takes physical attacks well with Dauntless Shield and can threaten Ghost-types that Hisuian Lilligant struggles to break with Crunch. Its Iron Defense sets also do well against Steel, where Hisuian Lilligant is less effective.

Victory Dance Sweeper (Grass).description:
Hisuian Lilligant is a solid late-game sweeper for Grass teams thanks to Victory Dance in conjunction with Hustle. It can deal out considerable damage to some of the meta's bulkiest Pokemon such as Corviknight and Iron Hands and is the best wincon on Grass in order to beat Flying. Ice Spinner allows Hisuian Lilligant to threaten opposing Dragon- and Flying-types like Enamorus, Galarian Zapdos, and Dragapult, as well as opposing Ground-types like Clodsire and Great Tusk if it does not run Leaf Blade. Sleep Powder is often preferred over Leaf Blade to give Hisuian Lilligant an easier chance to set up, and the combination of Ice Spinner and Close Combat still targets a good portion of the metagame. However, Leaf Blade can be used to target Pokemon that resist Ice Spinner and Close Combat such as Toxapex and Azumarill. Wide Lens allows Hisuian Lilligant to offset the accuracy drop of its attacks due to Hustle and it also boosts the accuracy of Sleep Powder, making it a more consistent option to use in order to set up safely.

Choice Scarf Meowscarada is a great teammate that threatens faster Dragon-types like Dragapult and Walking Wake, while Hisuian Lilligant is able to beat bulky Steel-types like Hisuian Goodra and Corviknight that Meowscarada often lures in. Amoonguss is Hisuian Lilligant's best defensive partner, as its Poison typing helps it deal with opposing Fairy-types like Azumarill, Enamorus, and Iron Valiant and also removes Toxic Spikes. Amoonguss appreciates Hisuian Lilligant's ability to dispatch opposing Flying-types like Corviknight, which can render it setup fodder, and can also assist Hisuian Lilligant's setup using Spore. Iron Leaves is another offensive partner for Hisuian Lilligant that can threaten opposing Poison-types which Lilligant cannot break through like Toxapex. Iron Leaves appreciates Hisuian Lilligant being able to threaten opposing Dark-type Pokemon like Ting-Lu and Kingambit. Brambleghast offers hazard support with Spikes, allowing Hisuian Lilligant to have secure KOs on Pokemon like Alolan Muk. Furthermore, Brambleghast offers hazard removal with Rapid Spin, which improves Hisuian Lilligant's longevity by giving it more opportunities to switch in. Zarude is also an offensive partner that is able to threaten Gholdengo and also Skeledirge, which gives Grass teams a tough time in the Ghost matchup. Furthermore, its ability to threaten Poison's defensive staples like Clodsire, Toxapex, and Alolan Muk after a boost is appreciated. Rotom-C helps Hisuian Lilligant threaten key members Water teams if it opts not to use Leaf Blade, like Pelipper and Basculegion, while Hisuian Lilligant can threaten Thundurus-T so Rotom can threaten Flying teams easier.

Swords Dance (Ghost).description:
With a Swords Dance set, Hisuian Zoroark becomes a surprising threat for Ghost teams, removing problematic walls such as Ting-Lu and Blissey. At +2, Poltergeist can allow Hisuian Zoroark to deal with troublesome foes such as Clodsire, Gliscor, and Swampert. Low Kick threatens the Normal- and Dark-types that can take on Poltergeist such as Blissey, Ursaluna, and Ting-Lu. Shadow Sneak allows Hisuian Zoroark to pick off weakened and faster threats such Tornadus-T, Flutter Mane, and Dragapult. Life Orb enables Hisuian Zoroark to reliably OHKO specially defensive Ting-Lu at +2 with Low Kick after entry hazard chip damage and gives a solid 50% chance to OHKO Flutter Mane with an unboosted Shadow Sneak. Spooky Plate is less powerful than Life Orb but doesn't cut into Hisuian Zoroark's health, allowing it to be more convincing with its Illusion.

Flutter Mane serves as a crucial ally in supporting Hisuian Zoroark with its Choice Specs Moonblast and blazing Speed, dealing with Dark- and Dragon-types that Hisuian Zoroark cannot handle like Mandibuzz, Greninja, and Archaludon. Gholdengo can provide Thunder Wave support, slowing down faster targets like Tornadus-T and Iron Valiant while also absorbing Will-O-Wisp from the likes of Galarian Weezing and Sableye. Pecharunt serves as a physical wall that can pivot Hisuian Zoroark in with Parting Shot along with putting physically bulky targets like Porygon2 and Mandibuzz on a timer with Malignant Chain. Sinistcha can check bulky Ground- and Water-types that could handle Hisuian Zoroark such as Hippowdon, Great Tusk, Choice Scarf Urshifu-R, and Alomomola. Dragapult provides an incredibly useful Speed tier and a powerful Dragon-type STAB move such as Dragon Darts to remove problematic targets like Roaring Moon, Dragonite, and Kyurem for Hisuian Zoroark. Mimikyu can come in on Dark-types like Hisuian Samurott and Bisharp attempting to deal with Hisuian Zoroark with Sucker Punch and handle them with Drain Punch thanks to Disguise. Froslass and Brambleghast provide Spikes support, wearing down physical walls such as Toxapex, Iron Hands, and Archaludon. Froslass can also prevent entry hazards from the likes of Garchomp and Skarmory and use Destiny Bond to remove problematic walls like Moltres, while Brambleghast provides hazard removal to keep Hisuian Zoroark healthy.

Choice Scarf (Ghost).description:
Hisuian Zoroark's combination of high Special Attack and Speed, incredible typing, and an excellent ability makes it an important asset of Ghost-type teams. Shadow Ball pairs well with Illusion against Ghost teams, as it is immune to Ghost-type attacks and can attack back with Shadow Ball, knocking out foes like Dragapult and Gholdengo. Focus Blast allows it to deal with Dark-types such as Choice Scarf Hisuian Samurott and Choice Specs Greninja, which threaten it. Flamethrower lets it handle Steel-types such as Scizor and Skarmory. Alternatively, Grass Knot can be used to keep Ground- and Water-types such as Hippowdon, Swampert, and Urshifu-R in check. U-turn benefits from Hisuian Zoroark's high Speed stat allowing it to deal chip damage and safely pivot out while also eliminating threats like Choice Scarf Hoopa-U and Choice Band Meowscarada. Trick can be used in place of U-turn and allows Hisuian Zoroark to neutralize threats such as Alolan Muk, Dragon Dance Dragonite, Iron Hands and Toxapex.

Hisuian Zoroark's high stats and immunity to Ghost-type moves allow it to be a great partner for all Ghost-types. Gholdengo is a great partner for Hisuian Zoroark, as its Speed tier and typing allow Hisuian Zoroark to use Illusion to its advantage. Gholdengo also serves as a great wallbreaker, eliminating foes such as Primarina and Iron Boulder and providing Hisuian Zoroark with a safe switch-in from incoming Thunder Wave from Pokemon like Blissey and Klefki. Choice Specs Flutter Mane and Mimikyu pair well with Hisuian Zoroark, as they take care of Dragon-type foes such as Roaring Moon and Hydreigon. Dragapult synergizes well with Hisuian Zoroark, forming an offensive core as Choice Scarf Dragapult takes out foes such as Hoopa-U, Kyurem, and Dragonite, which otherwise trouble Hisuian Zoroark, while Hisuian Zoroark eliminates threats like Gholdengo, Mamoswine, and Archaludon. Froslass provides Spikes support to Hisuian Zoroark. Pecharunt assists Hisuian Zoroark by spreading poison and using Parting Shot to bring Hisuian Zoroark in safely. Ceruledge appreciates Hisuian Zoroark, as it clears Ceruledge's enemies such as Toxapex and Air Balloon Heatran, which limit its sweeping capabilities.

Utility (Ghost).description:
Hisuian Zoroark is essential on Ghost teams due to its immunity to opposing Ghost-type moves, favorable Speed, and unique ability. It is an incredible asset in the Ghost matchup, as it allows you to play mind games against an opponent using Flutter Mane and Dragapult by disguising itself as Gholdengo and takes advantage of Substitute by forcing a lot of switches. Hex in conjunction with Will-O-Wisp deals superb damage against threats like Flutter Mane, Amoonguss, and Quagsire and negates passive recovery on walls such as Corviknight, Toxapex, and Ting-Lu. Furthermore, Will-O-Wisp lets you play around Sucker Punch users like Hisuian Samurott and burns other physical attackers such as Scizor that pose a threat to teammates like Flutter Mane and Mimikyu. Knock Off further cripples the aforementioned walls and removes Heavy-Duty Boots from foes, enhancing Brambleghast's Spikes, while Nasty Plot allows Hisuian Zoroark to capitalize on Substitute and use passive walls such as Toxapex, Brambleghast, and Dragalge as setup fodder. Leftovers and 252 HP EVs let Hisuian Zoroark take full advantage of Substitute and potentially sustain a few neutral attacks.

Flutter Mane appreciates Hisuian Zoroark luring in walls like Clodsire, Gastrodon, and Amoonguss and wearing them down with Hex and Will-O-Wisp. In return, it removes threatening Dark-types like Choice Scarf Hydreigon, Greninja, and Iron Jugulis. Dragapult checks Hydreigon, Baxcalibur, and Gholdengo and pivots into Hisuian Zoroark with U-turn. Gholdengo threatens Fairy-types such as Iron Valiant, Hatterene, and Flutter Mane and supports Hisuian Zoroark's Hex with Thunder Wave. Hisuian Zoroark also likes to disguise itself as the previously mentioned Dragapult and Gholdengo due to them also using Substitute and Hex, potentially tricking opponents and forming a very formidable Hex spam core. Mimikyu aids against Dark-types like Darkrai and Roaring Moon and provides useful priority in Shadow Sneak. Additionally, Mimikyu appreciates Hisuian Zoroark withering down and burning the majority of opposing teams, letting Mimikyu clean up late-game without any complications. Brambleghast helps Hisuian Zoroark chip down opposing teams with Spikes, removes entry hazards with Rapid Spin, and checks Water-types such as Rotom-W, Slowking, and Barraskewda. Skeledirge walls setup sweepers such as Volcarona and Mimikyu as well as general threats like Iron Valiant, Scizor, and Magnezone.

Choice Specs (Normal).description:
Hisuian Zoroark is a crucial member of any good Normal team, offering good power along with an invaluable immunity to Fighting, letting it take attacks such as Choice Band Breloom's Mach Punch and Choice Scarf Iron Valiant's Close Combat that would otherwise threaten the type. Additionally, it can win the Ghost matchup with good prediction, which is a type that Normal teams usually struggle against. Trick lets Hisuian Zoroark ruin defensive answers, such as Toxapex and Ting-Lu, that would otherwise take its attacks with ease. Flamethrower allows Hisuian Zoroark to hit Steel-types like Corviknight and Iron Treads more reliably than Focus Blast, while Grass Knot hits Dondozo, which would otherwise take Hisuian Zoroark's attacks. Focus Blast lets Hisuian Zoroark eliminate troublesome Dark-types such as Hydreigon and Ting-Lu. Illusion lets Hisuian Zoroark bait in defensive answers to other threats, such as Corviknight and Toxapex switching into Maushold, and hinder them with Trick while also giving it a safe opportunity to switch into Fighting-type attacks.

Maushold greatly appreciates Hisuian Zoroark's ability to remove Ghost- and Steel-types, alongside its ability to hinder and remove Rocky Helmet from Pokemon such as Toxapex and Corviknight, to enable it to clean up with Population Bomb. In return, Maushold can remove entry hazards with Tidy Up and break through answers to Hisuian Zoroark such as the aforementioned Toxapex and Ting-Lu. Choice Scarf Staraptor is another great partner, as it provides a safe switch-in to Choice Scarf Great Tusk, which tends to lock into Headlong Rush, while dealing high amounts of damage itself to enable Hisuian Zoroark to clean up the rest of an opponent's team. It also provides a form of speed control against faster threats such as Dragapult. Cyclizar also provides a safe switch-in with Shed Tail while keeping hazards off the field with Rapid Spin. In return, Hisuian Zoroark can use these switch-in opportunities to hit the aforementioned Steel-types hard. Ditto can turn setup attempts on a Choice-locked Hisuian Zoroark on their heads, while Blissey can take strong special hits such as Sandy Shocks's STAB moves. Indeedee provides Psychic Terrain support to improve Hisuian Zoroark's matchup against Bisharp and it can also use a Choice Scarf to deal with fast threats such as Choice Specs Iron Valiant and Choice Scarf Flamigo and provide Healing Wish support.

Tidy Up.description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Calm Mind.description:
44 Spe EVs lets it outspeed Toxapex. It has no item to counteract Poltergeist and Knock Off.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Amoonguss.comments:
Other Options

Grass

Stun Spore can be run over Spore in order to slow down foes like Meowscarada to a point where they can be picked off by Ogerpon-H while keeping the ability to put foes to sleep through teammates' sleep-inducing moves, but the noticeable comparative lack of setup opportunities is usually not worth it. Red Card allows Amoonguss to phase out threatening sweepers like the ones mentioned above in order to deny them sweeping attempts.

Poison

Energy Ball trades the recovery of Giga Drain for a solid boost in power, allowing Amoonguss to hit much harder, notably being able to consistently OKHO Great Tusk after it uses Headlong Rush and break the Substitute of Bulk Up Landorus. Stomping Tantrum can be used over Foul Play, providing a strong physical coverage option that can stomp Poison-types like Alolan Muk, Clodsire, and Glimmora. Stomping Tantrum also pairs well with Amoonguss's status spreading options, as attempting to spread status on a foe twice will boost its power, notably hitting bulkier threats like Toxapex and Gholdengo hard. However, Stomping Tantrum renders Amoonguss unable to hit Flying-types and Bug-types for unresisted damage. Stun Spore provides a speed control option for Poison teams, slowing threats like Iron Valiant, Iron Boulder, and Iron Treads down and allowing offensive threats like Sneasler and Iron Moth to outspeed and remove them without having to risk them waking up; however, Stun Spore does not provide the same free turns as Spore. Rocky Helmet provides chip damage against contact attacks from the likes of Iron Hands, Meowscarada, and Great Tusk; however, using it gives up the reliable entry Heavy-Duty Boots provides, which Amoonguss enjoys having for the Ground matchup.

Physically Defensive (Poison).description:
Amoonguss is a vital part of Poison teams, with its secondary Grass typing allowing Poison teams some breathing room against the multitude of Earthquakes in the tier. Giga Drain is Amoonguss's way to handle threatening Ground- and Water-types like Great Tusk, Swampert, and Urshifu-R. Foul Play gives Amoonguss a tool that not only hits Grass-resistant foes like Dragapult, Dragonite and Ogerpon-W but is also a form of offense that turns their Attack stats against them. Spore allows Amoonguss to pressure threats like Dragonite, Iron Treads, and Scizor by forcing them out of commission, along with creating opportunities to safely position its fellow teammates with free entry.

Alolan Muk complements Amoonguss by being a specially defensive tank capable of handling Ghost- and Psychic-type attacks thrown at Amoonguss from the likes of Flutter Mane, Spectrier, and Hatterene and threatening those foes back with Knock Off. Galarian Slowking helps deal with other specially offensive threats such as Latios, Enamorus, and Iron Moth with its wide array of tools like Ice Beam and Future Sight. Toxapex complements Amoonguss by being another physically defensive Regenerator wall able to handle Ice- and Fire-type attacks from the likes of Dragon Dance Kyurem, Cinderace, and Talonflame. Galarian Weezing provides a full-on Ground immunity, helping out against Ground-types Amoonguss cannot deal with on its own like Clodsire, Mamoswine, and Garchomp. Galarian Weezing also provides Will-O-Wisp support, weakening threats considerably and allowing Amoonguss to take hits from the likes of Mamoswine, and Defog support should Amoonguss lose its Heavy-Duty Boots. Pecharunt is a physical wall, being able to stave off attacks from the likes of the Ogerpon formes and Gliscor, along with appreciating Amoonguss's Spore, which can be used to power up Pecharunt's Hex.Iron Moth melts through Ice-types giving Amoonguss trouble like Articuno, Alolan Ninetales, and Alolan Sandslash, along with just cleaning Gliscor and Landorus with Choice Specs Overheat, and it similarly appreciates Amoonguss's absorption of Water- and Ground-type attacks. Salazzle provides Fire-type assistance, melting Ice-types like Froslass and Alolan Sandslash with ease. Both provide Corrosion Toxic support, wearing down bulky threats like Alolan Muk, Hisuian Goodra, and opposing Amoonguss that can easily switch in and wall Amoonguss. Amoonguss appreciates Glimmora nailing threats like Torkoal, Talonflame, and Articuno with Power Gem. Salazzle and Glimmora also appreciate Amoonguss taking Water- and Ground-type attacks for them. Okidogi and Sneasler enjoy punching holes in monsters like Heatran and Hisuian Goodra and appreciate Amoonguss giving them free turns with Spore, allowing them to set up safely.

Mixed Wall (Grass).description:
Amoonguss is a good defensive stopgap on Grass teams thanks to its good natural bulk, reliable recovery methods in Synthesis and Regenerator, and great typing allowing it to take Fairy- and Poison-type attacks from the likes of Choice Specs Flutter Mane, Iron Valiant, and Sneasler. Foul Play is a great option in order to hit threats like Swords Dance Scizor and Dragon Dance Dragapult, which may try to take advantage of Amoonguss's passive playstyle. Sludge Bomb hits the aforementioned Fairy-types, as well as threatening Grass-types like Hisuian Lilligant and Hydrapple. Spore lets Amoonguss facilitate dangerous setup sweeper teammates, like Nasty Plot Hydrapple, Victory Dance Hisuian Lilligant, and Swords Dance Ogerpon-H. The given EV spread lets Amoonguss survive one Ice Beam from Choice Specs Greninja from full health and retaliate by putting it to sleep.

Spore benefits all of Amoonguss's teammates in terms of giving them free turns to attack or set up. Hydrapple is a great teammate for Amoonguss thanks to its natural defensive synergy—it can take on Fire-type attacks from the likes of Heatran and retaliate with Earth Power, while Amoonguss can take problematic Fairy-type attacks from the likes of Iron Valiant and Enamorus for Hydrapple. They also form a Regenerator core, allowing them to keep each other healthy by switching into threats that the other cannot deal with. Swords Dance Ogerpon-H crushes troublesome Ice- and Steel-types like Articuno, Mamoswine, and Gholdengo that can take advantage of Amoonguss. Hisuian Lilligant is another threatening setup sweeper that hits Ice- and Steel-types like Kyurem, Heatran, and Archaludon incredibly hard, as well as hitting Gliscor, which Amoonguss struggles to make progress against, with Ice Spinner. Breloom is another Fighting-type that can use Swords Dance to break holes in the opposing team, with Mach Punch to hit Dark-types like Greninja and Meowscarada. In exchange, Amoonguss removes Enamorus for both Breloom and Hisuian Lilligant while freeing both up to run more useful coverage moves, like Rock Tomb for Breloom and Ice Spinner for Hisuian Lilligant, over their respective sleep-inducing moves. Meowscarada can remove items, mainly Leftovers, in order to let Amoonguss more effectively outlast other bulky cores. It also punishes Psychic- and Ghost-type Pokemon that try to take advantage of Amoonguss, like Hoopa-U, Deoxys-S, and Dragapult, with Knock Off and U-turn. Sinistcha does very well against passive Pokemon that can engage Amoonguss in a stalemate, like Toxapex or Clodsire. Brambleghast removes entry hazards with Rapid Spin while setting its own with Spikes. It also hits troubling Psychic- and Ghost-types like Galarian Slowking and Flutter Mane with Poltergeist and Shadow Sneak. Ogerpon-C is another dangerous Swords Dance sweeper that effectively threatens Flying- and Fire-types like Articuno, Volcarona, and Dragonite at +2. Iron Moth makes a great teammate checking Steel-types such as Gholdengo and Corviknight.

Defensive.description:
Alomomola's colossal HP, solid Defense, and incredible ability allow it to act as a great pivot option for bulkier Water teams. The combination of Wish and Flip Turn allows Alomomola's teammates to safely switch in and restore a substantial amount of HP. Scald is Alomomola's best way of dealing damage, as well as having the added benefit of being able to burn opposing Pokemon such as Excadrill and and Okidogi. Protect allows Alomomola to stall out a turn and recover its own HP using Wish. Alternatively, Alomomola can utilize its low Special Defense stat to bait strong special attackers, such as Choice Specs Flutter Mane and Latios, into hitting it with a special attack, then turn the tables via Mirror Coat.

Alomomola is almost exclusively seen on stall teams due to its passivity. Teammates without reliable recovery, such as Dondozo and Swampert, are excellent partners for it. Dondozo can switch into dangerous setup sweepers, such as Azumarill and Gouging Fire, that Alomomola struggles in the face of. Meanwhile, Swampert is immune to Electric-type attacks, which threaten Alomomola, and can utilize Flip Turn to help get Alomomola in for safe Wishes. Special walls such as Empoleon, Swampert, and Toxapex are able to cover Alomomola's low Special Defense stat by switching into Pokemon like Dragapult and Gholdengo. Additionally, Toxapex and Alomomola form an incredibly tough-to-break Regenerator core that breaks down opposing teams via poison and burn, all while restoring HP naturally. Pokemon that can provide hazard support such as Gastrodon, Quagsire, and Hisuian Samurott are great teammates for Alomomola, as they form a hazard-stacking core and are capable of wearing down foes across the course of long games. Greninja and Urshifu-R can beat Pokemon such as Ogerpon-H and Landorus, both of which massively threaten slower-paced Water teams. Additionally, Greninja and Urshifu-R are great recipients of Alomomola's Wish passing, which allows them to remain healthy and continue to provide offensive pressure for their team.

Galvantula.comments:
Other Options

Electric

Volt Switch can be used instead of Energy Ball to provide a pivoting move after setting up Sticky Web, but the loss of Energy Ball means that Galvantula can't hit Ground-types, especially Great Tusk.

Entry Hazard Lead (Bug).description:
Sticky Web Galvantula is a decent lead on Bug teams due to its ability to set Sticky Web up, allowing teammates such as Volcarona and Scizor to sweep more easily. Thunder, combined with the accuracy boost from Compound Eyes, is Galvantula's strongest move, which hits Water-types such as Toxapex and deters Flying-type Defoggers such as Corviknight. Thunder Wave allows Galvantula to cripple faster threats such as Chien-Pao and Flutter Mane. Energy Ball gives Galvantula coverage against Ground-types such as Quagsire and Great Tusk, Great Tusk in particular being another Pokemon that can remove Sticky Web. Volt Switch can be used instead of Energy Ball to provide a pivoting move after setting up Sticky Web, but the loss of Energy Ball means that Galvantula can't hit Ground-types, especially the aforementioned Great Tusk. Focus Sash gives Galvantula a guaranteed Sticky Web, attack, or chance to paralyze. The given EV spread with a Timid nature allows Galvantula to get up Sticky Web consistently while also maximizing its Special Attack in order to deal the most damage possible.

Pokemon that benefit from Galvantula's Sticky Web are ideal partners for it. The aforementioned Volcarona and Scizor both appreciate their threats being slowed down so they can set up with Quiver Dance and Swords Dance, respectively. Scizor is able to take out Hisuian Arcanine, Glimmora, and Galarian Weezing, while Volcarona outspeeds faster threats like Greninja and Iron Valiant under Sticky Web. Slither Wing and Lokix also appreciate Sticky Web, as it helps them wallbreak and revenge kill against normally faster threats, such as Ogerpon-H, Gholdengo, and Choice Specs Iron Moth. Choice Scarf Kleavor is a great teammate for Galvantula because it can deal with Fire-types such as Ogerpon-H and Moltres. Kleavor's Stone Axe also pairs nicely with Galvantula's Sticky Web, as more entry hazards further help the sweepers and wallbreakers on the team, while also breaking Ceruledge's Focus Sash, which is a huge problem for Bug teams. Forretress removes entry hazards with Rapid Spin, provides a strong physical wall on Bug teams, and is a slow pivot for Galvantula with Volt Switch to ensure its safe entry.

Sticky Web (Electric).description:
With its high base Speed, Galvantula is an excellent lead due to it being the only consistent Sticky Web setter on Electric teams. Thunder, combined with the accuracy boost from Compound Eyes, is Galvantula's strongest move, which hits Water-types such as Toxapex and deters Flying-type Defoggers such as Corviknight. Bug Buzz is used to hit Pokemon that resist Thunder like Hydreigon and Latios, while Thunder Wave allows Galvantula to cripple faster threats such as Chien-Pao and Flutter Mane. Energy Ball gives Galvantula coverage against Ground-types such as Quagsire and Great Tusk, which is valuable, as Great Tusk can remove Sticky Web. Focus Sash gives Galvantula a guaranteed chance to set Sticky Web, attack, or paralyze the opponent.

Pokemon that can take advantage of Sticky Web are great teammates for Galvantula. Rotom-W and Zapdos both benefit from Sticky Web, as they can outspeed threats such as Iron Valiant and the Ogerpon formes at -1 while also providing a Ground immunity. Raging Bolt especially benefits from Sticky Web, as its underwhelming Speed tier holds it back, and it appreciates the Speed drop from Sticky Web so it can set up and wallbreak more easily. Sandy Shocks pairs well with Galvantula, forming an entry hazard-stacking core combining Sticky Web with its Stealth Rock and Spikes. Regieleki provides hazard removal for Electric teams with Rapid Spin and pivoting with Volt Switch so wallbreakers like the aforementioned Raging Bolt can come in repeatedly. Although Iron Hands doesn't really benefit from Sticky Web, it is still a great teammate due to its high bulk and can take out threats that wall Galvantula, such as Tyranitar, Hisuian Goodra, and Blissey. In return, Galvantula takes out Quagsire and Great Tusk for Iron Hands.

Entry Hazard Lead (Ghost).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Bisharp.overview:
Dark

Bisharp's Steel typing makes it an inviting piece for Dark teams looking to ease the Fairy matchup, as Bisharp can take on powerful Fairy-types such as Flutter Mane and Hatterene. In addition, its Defiant deters Defog from the likes of Corviknight and Galarian Weezing. However, Bisharp's middling Speed tier and mediocre bulk make it unable to switch into Fairy-type threats such as Enamorus and Mimikyu, and it needs a Swords Dance boost to reliably OHKO them. It is also helpless against Iron Valiant and other fast Fighting-types. The Defog users that Bisharp wishes to check like the aforementioned Corviknight and Galarian Weezing can similarly threaten Bisharp on a predicted switch with Body Press and Will-O-Wisp, respectively.

Swords Dance (Dark).description:
Bisharp serves a niche role on Dark teams with its secondary Steel typing and Defiant ability enabling it to take on the bulky Calm Mind Fairy-types of the tier such as Primarina and Clefable and punish Defog from the likes of Mandibuzz or Sticky Web from Araquanid or Galvantula, respectively. At +2 Attack, Iron Head can OHKO Fairy-types such as Hatterene, Galarian Weezing, and Clefable. Throat Chop enables Bisharp to dish out immense damage to the likes of Skarmory and Toxapex. Lastly, Sucker Punch helps mitigate Bisharp's low Speed, allowing it to check threats such as Flutter Mane and Iron Moth. Life Orb gives Bisharp a much desired power boost; however, Black Glasses can be used to allow Bisharp to stick around for a bit longer while still OHKOing Flutter Mane with Sucker Punch after entry hazard chip damage.

Greninja and Darkrai support Bisharp by being able to remove physical walls such as Skarmory, Archaludon, and defensive Great Tusk along with using their Psychic-type coverage to threaten Fighting-types such as Keldeo and Iron Valiant. Sableye provides a crucial Fighting immunity, enabling it to handle threats such as Gallade, Sneasler, and Iron Hands along with being able to burn Skarmory, preventing Bisharp from getting OHKOed by Body Press. Ting-Lu provides entry hazards to wear down physically bulky targets such as Archaludon and Hippowdon. Alolan Muk is also not weak to Fairy and can reliably take on foes such as Enamorus and Primarina along with handling other special attackers like Kyurem. Choice Scarf Meowscarada provides an incredible Speed tier and supports Bisharp by taking out threats such as Quaquaval and Great Tusk while using Protean Play Rough or Triple Axel to handle Dragon-types such as Roaring Moon and Raging Bolt. Mandibuzz is immune to Ground and can safely bring Bisharp in with U-turn and clear hazards with Defog.

Swords Dance (Steel).description:
Bisharp serves as an incredible offensive threat on Steel teams thanks to its Dark typing and strong priority in Sucker Punch, which can enable Bisharp to handle threats such as Dragapult and Hoopa-U. Throat Chop pressures Ghost- and Psychic-types such as Gholdengo, Sinistcha, and Galarian Slowking. Low Kick allows Bisharp to deal with opposing Bisharp along with dealing solid damage to Ting-Lu. Alternatively, Iron Head can be used to deal with Fairy-types like Primarina and Galarian Weezing. Life Orb is used to provide Bisharp a crucial boost, enabling it to OHKO Flutter Mane with Sucker Punch, but Black Glasses can be used to enable Bisharp to stick around longer over the course of a game while still maintaining its ability to 2HKO threats like Toxapex with a +2 Throat Chop.

Bisharp greatly appreciates support from Skarmory, which can come in on Ground- and Fighting-types such as Excadrill, Great Tusk, and Iron Hands and can easily take them on with a combination of Iron Defense and Body Press. Skarmory can also set Spikes, enhancing Bisharp's breaking capabilities by allowing it to power through threats such as Archaludon and Hippowdon. Gholdengo can easily take on Fighting-types like Sneasler, Iron Hands, and Breloom thanks to its Ghost typing along with being able to remove Fairy-types like Iron Valiant and Galarian Weezing. In return, Bisharp can remove opposing Ghost-types such as Flutter Mane and opposing Gholdengo. Heatran's Fire immunity lets it handle Fire-types such as Iron Moth, Ninetales, and Volcarona, and it is able to remove physically bulky walls such as Archaludon and Skarmory. Archaludon provides Stealth Rock support along with being able to use Thunder Wave, enabling for Bisharp to outspeed targets such as the Ogerpon formes. Iron Treads provides entry hazard removal to give Bisharp safe entry while being able to remove threats such as Raging Bolt, Heatran, and Okidogi. Hisuian Goodra provides a solid special wall that can take on threats such as Hydreigon and Primarina that can handle Bisharp.

Physically Defensive (Normal).description:
Braviary serves as good entry hazard removal for Normal teams due to its good bulk and Fighting neutrality, which let it comfortably use Defog in front of foes like Sneasler and Meowscarada. Brave Bird is Braviary's strongest STAB move, threatening to OHKO foes like the Ogerpon formes and Sinistcha. U-turn helps keep momentum going and damage common switch-ins like Ting-Lu and Iron Boulder. Close Combat can be used instead of U-turn to check Steel-, Rock-, and Normal-types like Excadrill, Hisuian Goodra, Tyranitar, and Blissey. Doing so, however, means that Braviary would lack the momentum it gets from U-turn, which is crucial for Normal teams. The EVs above allow Braviary to outspeed Adamant Azumarill while also comfortably taking attacks from Garchomp and Ogerpon-H. The given EVs also let Braviary survive an Icicle Crash from unboosted Chien-Pao when Braviary is at full HP.

Blissey is a great teammate, as it can tank special hits from Choice Specs users like Greninja, Flutter Mane, and Kyurem while also being able to set up Stealth Rock and spread paralysis with Thunder Wave. Braviary returns the favor by dealing with Choice Scarf users like Galarian Zapdos and Great Tusk for Blissey. Porygon2 is a nice defensive wall when paired with Braviary, being able to wall Ice-types like Weavile and Mamoswine and stop setup users like Scizor and Ceruledge with Foul Play. Choice Scarf Ditto is an excellent revenge killer, using its ability to flip the script on sweepers like Ogerpon-W, Dragonite, and Keldeo late-game. Choice Specs Hisuian Zoroark provides a Fighting immunity for the team while being able to check Ghost- and Steel-types like Gholdengo and Corviknight. Braviary can remove hazards for Hisuian Zoroark while taking out Bisharp and Choice Scarf Hisuian Samurott. Choice Scarf Indeedee is another option, which provides more support in the Fighting and Poison matchups due to its part-Psychic typing and ability to set up Psychic Terrain for the team. Indeedee can also blast away threats, such as Urshifu-R, mixed offense Iron Valiant, and Clodsire,in Terrain with Expanding Force. Calm Mind Terapagos, with its colorful moveset, can be a good teammate to pressure defensive Pokemon like Corviknight and Quagsire for Braviary.

Physically Defensive (Dark).description:
Mandibuzz is a decent supportive piece for Dark teams with its ability to pivot into physical attackers like Ceruledge, Garchomp, and Excadrill due to its great bulk and U-turn to position its other teammates into favorable matchups. Foul Play punishes strong physical attackers like Ogerpon-W, Dragonite, and Scizor. If the reader feels that Toxic is enough to keep physical setup sweepers at bay, Knock Off allows Mandibuzz to remove key items from Archaludon, Hisuian Goodra, and Toxapex to help Mandibuzz's teammates have an easier time overwhelming these walls. U-turn lets Mandibuzz act as a pivot to escape common switch-ins like Gliscor, Clodsire, and Gholdengo to maintain the offensive momentum of its team. Toxic greatly cuts the longevity of threats like Keldeo and Volcarona, which otherwise switch in and set up on Mandibuzz. Defog lets Mandibuzz prevent its teammates from getting worn down over the course of the match, and if paired with Toxic, lets Mandibuzz pressure entry hazard setters like Great Tusk and Ting-Lu. Overcoat is vital for checking Excadrill on sand-based Ground teams. 23 Speed IVs coupled with a Relaxed nature let Mandibuzz underspeed Skarmory, allowing Mandibuzz to safely bring in a teammate to deal with Skarmory while also breaking its Sturdy with U-turn. Alternatively, an Impish nature with 16 Speed EVs lets Mandibuzz outspeed and use Foul Play against Adamant Azumarill, checking it after it has used Belly Drum. Heavy-Duty Boots lets Mandibuzz get in freely to remove Stealth Rock if running Defog without much issue, but Rocky Helmet racks up chip damage against threats like Choice Scarf Urshifu-R, Excadrill, and Meowscarada and also punishes U-turn users like Sneasler and Roaring Moon.

Mandibuzz's ability to pivot for its teammates greatly benefits wallbreakers like Darkrai, Bisharp, Hisuian Samurott, and Choice Specs Hoopa-U, as it gives them more room to set up or punch holes in opposing teams. Nasty Plot Darkrai, for instance, can start wreaking havoc on Flying, Steel, and Dragon teams after a Nasty Plot, as it forces out Gliscor, Skarmory, and Archaludon, which Mandibuzz lures in. On the other hand, Swords Dance Bisharp benefits from being put in against Toxapex and Clodsire, allowing it to set up and clean weakened Poison and Ground teams, while Hisuian Samurott trades a Poison immunity for the ability to stack Spikes with Ceaseless Edge to eventually overpower Dragon teams late-game. Choice Specs Hoopa-U deals with Ursaluna, Toxapex, and Archaludon and sports a great natural Special Defense to trade with Choice Scarf Iron Valiant and Enamorus in the worst-case scenario. Hoopa-U can also use a Choice Scarf to surprise threats like Flutter Mane and Keldeo, which take advantage of Mandibuzz. Choice Scarf Meowscarada forms a decent pivoting core with Mandibuzz and can clean up against types like Ground, Flying, Fairy, and Dragon late-game. Greninja provides more wallbreaking power, dealing with Toxapex, Clodsire, and Ogerpon-H if using a Choice Specs set, or acts as a revenge-killer that outspeeds and eliminates Choice Scarf Enamorus and Sneasler, which can overwhelm Mandibuzz. Ting-Lu complements Mandibuzz, as these complete a defensive core for Dark teams, with Ting-Lu being able to deal with Raging Bolt, Gholdengo, and Flutter Mane while also providing entry hazards. While Mandibuzz slightly overlaps with Sableye due to their role as a physical wall, Sableye is still greatly appreciated thanks to its ability to check IronPress Skarmory, burn Urshifu-R and Barraskewda to let Mandibuzz check these threats safely, and use Encore on setup sweepers like Keldeo, Primarina, and Volcarona, which take advantage of Mandibuzz.

Defog (Flying).description:
Mandibuzz finds a niche on Flying teams thanks to its unique secondary Dark typing and stellar defensive stats, allowing it to run either a specially or physically defensive set to give it a solid role. Foul Play makes use of the high Attack stat of threats like Swords Dance Excadrill, Metagross, and Scizor for its offense. U-turn can be used to threaten Dark-types like Meowscarada and Hoopa-U while also allowing Mandibuzz to pivot into a teammate. Toxic provides solid utility in putting threats like Gouging Fire, Landorus, and Latios on a timer. Defog supports its fellow Flying-types by removing Stealth Rock along with helping Mandibuzz itself, should Heavy-Duty Boots be knocked off. Both EV spreads have good utility, with the specially defensive spread being better at handling threats such as Choice Specs Dragapult and Spectrier, while the physically defensive spread can more reliably check foes like Ceruledge and Gallade. Both spreads check mixed threats like Hoopa-U. The 16 Speed EVs are used to outspeed Azumarill and check it with Foul Play.

Gliscor and Landorus help immensely by being able to threaten Poison-types like Toxapex and Alolan Muk coming in on Mandibuzz's Toxic, and they can also threaten Electric-types attemping to remove Mandibuzz such as Raging Bolt. Gliscor also appreciates Mandibuzz running Toxic, allowing it to run a different support move such as Taunt. Both Skarmory and Corviknight can threaten Ice- and Rock-types like Chien-Pao, Mamoswine, and Iron Boulder. Skarmory with Body Press can also check Dark-types like Meowscarada, Roaring Moon, and Kingambit thanks to its high Defense. Corviknight with Iron Head can check Fairy-type threats like Flutter Mane, Alolan Ninetales, and Hatterene along with being able to run Defog, allowing Mandibuzz to run Toxic in its moveset. Articuno can threaten problematic Water-types like Primarina, Pelipper, and Rotom-W while enjoying Mandibuzz's ability to threaten physical attackers like Barraskewda and Scizor, should Mandibuzz be physically bulky. Choice Scarf Enamorus appreciates Mandibuzz's ability to remove hazards and threaten Toxic onto walls, including Articuno, that could otherwise shrug off its attacks, enabling Enamorus's sweeping capability. In response, Enamorus can support Mandibuzz by removing Dark-types like Roaring Moon and Kingambit that can easily set up in front of Mandibuzz.

Choice Specs (Dark).description:
Paired with Choice Specs, Hydreigon becomes a threatening wallbreaker capable of dismantling common bulky Pokemon such as Corviknight, Clodsire, and Heatran. Coverage moves in Earth Power and Flamethrower work together to hit walls that aren't bothered much by Dark Pulse and Draco Meteor. Earth Power hits specially defensive Pokemon such as the aforementioned Clodsire and Heatran, as well as Kingambit. Flamethrower makes up for the scenarios in which Earth Power cannot be used such as against specially defensive Corviknight and Air Balloon Kingambit. U-turn can be used over Dark Pulse as a way to retain momentum if Dark Pulse is not needed.

Choice Scarf Greninja helps form a strong offensive core with Hydreigon, as it can help in the Flying, Fighting, and Fairy matchups with its colorful coverage. With access to Ice Beam, Extrasensory, and Sludge Wave, Greninja can aid in taking down Pokemon that prove troublesome to Hydreigon such as Landorus, Zamazenta, the Ogerpon formes, and Primarina. Futhermore, it can provide utility in Toxic Spikes or form a pivot core with Hydreigon if they both opt to run U-turn instead. Sableye is a necessary teammate on Dark teams, as it provides an invaluable Fighting immunity and can help make progress against bulkier Pokemon such as Corviknight and Tornadus with Knock Off, in tandem with Will-O-Wisp. Furthermore, it can stop setup sweepers in their tracks with Encore, such as Gouging Fire and Dragapult. Ting-Lu alleviates pressure off Hydreigon, as it can sponge a plethora of special attacks such as Ice Beam from Greninja and Focus Blast from Tornadus-T. It also has access to both Stealth Rock and Spikes, making Hydreigon's job of wallbreaking much easier because it can 2HKO physically defensive Toxapex after either of the entry hazards are set. Kingambit appreciates Hydreigon weakening teams, giving it little trouble winning late-game with Supreme Overlord-boosted Sucker Punch while also being capable of handling Fairy- and Ice-types with Iron Head. Choice Scarf Meowscarada can provide more pivoting support with U-turn as well as threaten opposing Dark- and Fairy-types such as Greninja, Hydreigon, and Flutter Mane.
