Lastly, Alolan Muk is strong for Dark teams, as it is able to take on virtually any special attacking Fairy-type with its naturally high Special Defense stat and threaten them out with Poison Jab while also providing utility in Knock Off and Poison Touch.

Nasty Plot (Dragon).description:
Hydreigon's great stats, unresisted coverage, and useful ability let it serve as an excellent wallbreaker on Dragon teams, checking threats like Gholdengo, Iron Treads, and Toxapex. Dark Pulse targets Ghost- and Psychic-types such as Gholdengo, Gengar, and Armarouge. Flamethrower threatens Steel-types like Iron Treads, Corviknight, and Kingambit, while Earth Power aids in the Poison matchup, hitting Clodsire, Skuntank, and Toxapex. Alternatively, Flash Cannon may be used to threaten Fairy-types like Flutter Mane, Iron Valiant, and Gardevoir behind Substitute. Substitute alongside Leftovers makes Hydreigon difficult to revenge kill and offers more setup opportunities against passive Pokemon such as Amoonguss, Klefki, and Forretress. Alternatively, Taunt prevents Ting-Lu from phazing Hydreigon with Whirlwind as well as obstructing Clodsire, Dondozo, and Gastrodon's recovery attempts. Draco Meteor is a niche option to OHKO opposing Dragon-types like Baxcalibur and Dragalge; however, Draco Meteor negates Nasty Plot boosts and requires Hydreigon to give up useful utility.

Hydreigon's ability to break past physical walls such as Quagsire, Skeledirge, and Dondozo is heavily appreciated by Baxcalibur and Dragonite. In return, Baxcalibur checks Clodsire, Dragonite, and opposing Hydreigon, while Dragonite threatens Quaquaval and Cinderace. Cyclizar sets up Shed Tail for non-Substitute Hydreigon, allowing for more setup opportunities and freeing up a moveslot for Hydreigon. Furthermore, Cyclizar removes Stealth Rock off the field with Rapid Spin, preserving Hydreigon's ability to set up. Dragapult combats Flutter Mane, Gallade, and opposing Dragon-types, while Hydreigon forces Kingambit off the field and switches into Shadow Sneak from Brambleghast and Ceruledge. Garchomp sets up entry hazards to enhance Hydreigon's wallbreaking capabilities and helps to take care of Clodsire and Volcarona. Dragalge is valued as a check to Fairy-types like Flutter Mane and Iron Valiant as well as an entry hazard setter, aiding in the Dark and Fairy matchups with Toxic Spikes.

Choice Scarf (Dragon).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Nasty Plot (Dark).description:
Due to Hydreigon's wonderful movepool, terrifying Special Attack stat, and useful ability, it's an easy-to-fit wallbreaker on Dark teams that is a huge asset in the Steel, Poison, Ground, and Water matchups. Draco Meteor provides nuclear power after a Nasty Plot, removing threats like Urshifu-R, Baxcalibur, and Great Tusk, while Dark Pulse is a great alternative due to its accuracy, good Base Power, and synergy with Flamethrower or Earth Power. Flamethrower hits Steel-types like Corviknight, Kingambit, and Iron Treads; however, Earth Power hits Hisuian Goodra, Toxapex, and Alolan Muk. Stealth Rock is appreciated to allow Ting-Lu to use Spikes while also capitalizing on the many switches Hydreigon forces. Alternatively, Substitute raises Hydreigon's potency as a wallbreaker, providing safety in front of passive Pokemon like Amoonguss, defensive Rotom-W, and Gastrodon as well as putting lots of pressure on more offensive types like Ground and opposing Dark teams.

Chien-Pao and Hydreigon form a formidable wallbreaking core due to Chien-Pao's ability to threaten Unaware Clodsire, Enamorus, and Roaring Moon. In return, Hydreigon uses Toxapex and Quagsire as setup fodder. Sableye provides a Fighting-type immunity and Will-O-Wisp support, discouraging Choice Scarf Great Tusk, Sneasler, and Quaquaval from using their STAB moves. Meowscarada and Greninja are great in the Grass and Water matchups, eliminating Quaquaval, Ice Beam Gastrodon, and Azumarill. Additionally, Meowscarada threatens Dragapult and Choice Scarf Gholdengo, while Greninja breaks past Unaware Clodsire. Kingambit checks Fairy-types like Hatterene and Flutter Mane while also picking off faster threats like Dragapult, Spectrier, and Barraskewda after a few Supreme Overlord boosts. In return, Kingambit values Hydreigon's ability to remove roadblocks like Great Tusk and Urshifu-R. Ting-Lu provides entry hazards and phazing with Whirlwind to wear down defensive checks, while Alolan Muk is an additional asset in the Fairy and Dragon matchup, taking on Enamorus, Iron Valiant, and Walking Wake. Choice Scarf Hoopa-U threatens Chien-Pao, Clodsire, and hinders Hydreigon's checks with Trick while appreciating Alolan Muk's removal in return.

Volcarona.comments:
Other Options

Bug (Bulky Quiver Dance)

Fiery Dance can be more beneficial over Flamethrower, being able to potentially provide a Special Attack boost while on the offensive against bulky targets like Galarian Slowking. Will-O-Wisp can be used over Psychic to hinder physical attackers that threaten Volcarona such as Landorus-T and Dragonite.

The Original Moth (Bug).description:
Volcarona makes for a threatening late-game sweeper on Bug teams by virtue of its high Special Attack, great Speed, and decent special bulk, ability to boost these with Quiver Dance, and great array of coverage. After a Quiver Dance boost, Flamethrower targets Steel- and Ice-types like Corviknight, Gholdengo, and Alolan Ninetales. At +1, Psychic threatens both Poison- and Fighting-types like Pecharunt, Iron Valiant, and Zamazenta. Morning Sun provides a great form of longevity, as it gives Volcarona additional opportunities to set up and sweep. Alternatively, Giga Drain can be used to threaten Water- and Rock-types such as Swampert, Primarina, and Rhyperior.

Volcarona appreciates entry hazard support from both Kleavor and Forretress that aid it in its sweep. Additionally, Choice Scarf Kleavor handles Flying- and Fire-types such as Dragonite, Ogerpon-H, non-Choice Scarf Hisuian Arcanine, and Gouging Fire, while Forretress can remove hazards with Rapid Spin if Volcarona's item is removed and can bring it in safely with Volt Switch. Araquanid and Galvantula can stack further hazards stack by placing Sticky Web to allow Volcarona to outspeed Choice Scarf users such as Iron Valiant and Sneasler after one Quiver Dance boost. Additionally, Araquanid's great ability in Water Bubble eases the Fire matchup, while Galvantula threatens common Water- and Flying-types like Toxapex, Gyarados, and Talonflame. In return, Araquanid appreciates Volcarona dealing with problematic Grass-types such as Rillaboom, Meowscarada, and Amoonguss. Scizor pairs well with Volcarona, as it can switch into a predicted Toxic and deal with troublesome Rock-types like Ogerpon-C, Iron Boulder, and Kleavor. In return, Scizor appreciates Volcarona's ability to switch into a predicted Will-O-Wisp as well as deal with Zamazenta. Slither Wing and Lokix make for great revenge killers, as their powerful First Impression allows them to deal with Dark- and Psychic-types like Greninja, Choice Scarf Hoopa-U, and Iron Boulder. Additionally, Slither Wing takes on special walls such as Hisuian Goodra, Blissey, and Heatran, while Lokix's access to Sucker Punch allows it to deal with a myriad of sweepers and cleaners such as Dragapult, Flutter Mane, and Gouging Fire. In return, the two of them appreciate Volcarona handling Indeedee, which can block their priority moves with Psychic Terrain.

Bulky Setup (Bug).description:
Deciding to forgo an offensive EV spread on Volcarona and instead opting for investment into its Defenses can comfortably let it take hits from the likes of Clodsire and Ting-Lu while it sets up with Quiver Dance. Flamethrower provides easy removal of problematic Steel-types like Corviknight, Skarmory, and Gholdengo. Psychic provides solid coverage, hitting troublesome Poison- and Fighting-types like Toxapex, Glimmora, Okidogi, and Iron Hands along with allowing Volcarona to hit Fire- and Water-types that resist Flamethrower. Morning Sun provides Volcarona a form of healing, making its setup far easier against targets that cannot threaten it out like Galarian Slowking and Iron Hands. The EV spread maximizes Volcarona's bulk while still allowing it to outspeed Zamazenta after a Quiver Dance and land an OHKO on Keldeo with Psychic.

Volcarona greatly appreciates Scizor removing problematic Rock-types like Kleavor, Ogerpon-C, and Iron Boulder, which all threaten Volcarona immensely. Kleavor helps Volcarona by providing Stealth Rock with Stone Axe, along with removing Fire-types like opposing Volcarona, Ogerpon-H, and Ninetales. Scizor and Kleavor, in return, benefit from Volcarona removing the physically bulky threats that wall them such as Toxapex and Skarmory. Slither Wing aids Volcarona in removing bulky special walls like Heatran, Hisuian Goodra, and Alolan Muk thanks to its Fighting-type STAB move. Forretress provides a form of entry hazard removal, being able to remove Stealth Rock should Volcarona lose its Heavy-Duty Boots, and it can also set up Spikes to chip switch-ins like Heatran, Tyranitar, and Galarian Slowking. Forretress also provides Volcarona a safe entry thanks to Volt Switch. Galvantula threatens Water-types that can take on Volcarona, including Hisuian Samurott, Pelipper, and Primarina. Ribombee can threaten Dragon-types like Garchomp and Walking Wake that could handle Volcarona. Araquanid can threaten Fire-types that would otherwise wall Volcarona's Fire-type attacks like Heatran, Iron Moth, and Ceruledge. Galvantula, Ribombee, and Araquanid also provide support by laying Sticky Web, allowing Volcarona to outspeed otherwise faster threats such as Choice Scarf Glimmora and Sand Rush Excadril after a single Quiver Dance. Lokix can remove dangerous Choice Scarf threats like Iron Boulder and Roaring Moon thanks to its powerful priority, preventing them from revenge killing Volcarona.

Quiver Dance (Fire).description:
By virtue of its access to Quiver Dance and its colorful coverage, Volcarona serves as a great setup sweeper on Fire teams. Giga Drain can be used over Flamethrower, as it grants Volcarona a recovery option and allows it to threaten Water- and Ground-types such as Primarina, Swampert, and Gastrodon. Alternatively, Morning Sun provides larger recovery for Volcarona than Giga Drain, giving it more opportunities to set up. Flame Body allows Volcarona to potentially punish revenge killers such as Dragonite with burns.

Torkoal and Ninetales are great partners for Volcarona, as their sun boosts Volcarona's Flamethrower. Additionally, Torkoal can set up Stealth Rock to aid Volcarona in its sweeping, while Ninetales provides Will-O-Wisp support so that Volcarona can run Swarm and punish physical attackers and Healing Wish support to grant Volcarona another opportunity at sweeping. Cinderace can clear entry hazards with Court Change and potentially gain screens set by users like Klefki and Alolan Ninetales to make Volcarona harder to take down. Choice Scarf variants can also deal with speedy threats such as Greninja, Kleavor, and Iron Valiant thanks to its colorful movepool combined with Libero boosts. Talonflame's immunity to Ground allows it to ease that matchup, and Brave Bird in tandem with Gale Wings allows it to deal with threats such as the Ogerpon formes and Choice Scarf Sneasler. Volcanion is great in the Water matchup thanks to its decent physical bulk and access to Water Absorb, and with its great attacking options, it can handle Fire-, Fairy-, and Poison-types such as opposing Volcarona, Azumarill, and Toxapex. Volcarona appreciates the presence of wallbreakers such as Ogerpon-H, Choice Band Hisuian Arcanine, and Choice Specs Iron Moth to break through bulky threats so it can sweep more easily. Ogerpon-H deals with Water-types such as Primarina, Swampert, and Rotom-W when Volcarona chooses to forego Giga Drain. Hisuian Arcanine deals with Flying-types such as Moltres, Tornadus-T, and Mandibuzz, and it appreciates Volcarona taking on Fighting-types such as Iron Valiant and Breloom in return. Iron Moth has access to a wide range of coverage tools to deal with a myriad of threats like Toxapex, Pelipper, and Sableye.

Bulkarona (Bulky Quiver Dance) (Fire).description:
With a defensive spread, Volcarona can address the lack of good defensive options available to Fire teams while remaining dangerous offensively with Quiver Dance, threatening physical foes such as IronPress Zamazenta and Assault Vest Iron Hands. Fiery Dance brings a spammable STAB move that can easily allow Volcarona to snowball. Psychic offers valuable coverage, hitting Water- and Dragon-types that resist Fiery Dance like Toxapex, Pelipper, Garchomp, and Dragapult, on top of dealing with Fighting-type foes such as IronPress Zamazenta and Iron Hands. Alternatively, Will-O-Wisp provides a consistent way of spreading burns to attackers such as Excadrill, Dragonite, and Gallade, further enhancing Volcarona's defensive capabilities. Morning Sun improves Volcarona's durability, helping it set up on Fighting- and Dragon-types such as IronPress Zamazenta, Assault Vest Iron Hands, and Dragapult. The EV spread allows Volcarona to outspeed IronPress Zamazenta after a Quiver Dance.

More so than its offensive counterpart, sun lets defensive Volcarona shine by increasing Morning Sun's healing rate, reducing the damage received from Water-type moves, and boosting Fiery Dance, allowing Volcarona to set up on Water-type foes such as Choice Specs Greninja and Keldeo. Therefore, it is highly recommended to pair Volcarona with a Drought user. Ninetales comes with utility options in the form of Healing Wish and Encore, helping Volcarona stay healthy and come safely on the field, and it can also use Solar Beam to punish Gastrodon and Swampert. Torkoal offers utility in a different way by setting Stealth Rock, removing entry hazards with Rapid Spin, and putting foes to sleep with Yawn. Cinderace provides support with Court Change and can get rid of foes weak to Dark-type moves such as Latios and Dragapult with Sucker Punch. With its defensive role, Volcarona has many synergies with the powerful wallbreakers of the type. Ogerpon-H deals with Flash Fire Heatran as well as Water- and Ground-types foes such as Primarina, Swampert, and Clodsire while appreciating Volcarona's ability to check IronPress Zamazenta and Iron Valiant. Gouging Fire helps out in Dragon and Flying matchups by deleting Dragon Dance Dragonite, Gliscor, Tornadus-Therian, and opposing Gouging Fire. Lastly, Air Balloon Heatran is a great partner for Volcarona, nullifying Poison-type moves, absorbing Dragon-type moves, and dealing with both Flutter Mane and Gouging Fire.

Choice Band (Rock).description:
Choice Band Terrakion is one of Rock's best physical wallbreakers thanks to its high Attack, good Speed, and Fighting-type STAB moves, which allow Rock teams to threaten opposing Steel-types like Archaludon and Heatran. Close Combat threatens opposing Dark- and Steel-types such as Ting-Lu, Kingambit, and Corviknight. Earthquake complements Terrakion's Rock-type STAB attacks and targets bulky threats like Toxapex, Clodsire, and non-Air Balloon Gholdengo. Upper Hand allows Terrakion to handle priority moves that it is weak to from Pokemon like Scizor and Breloom while dealing considerable damage to them. Sacred Sword is also an option as a secondary Fighting-type STAB move that doesn't have the drawback of dropping Terrakion's defenses and can ignore Defense boosts from Pokemon like Archaludon. Rock Slide also can be used as a secondary Rock-type STAB option due to its higher accuracy than Stone Edge and chance of flinching.

Hisuian Arcanine is a good teammate for Terrakion, as both Pokemon work well offensively in dismantling Steel-type teams' defensive cores. Terrakion's Close Combat can OHKO Heatran and Archaludon, and Arcanine's Flare Blitz OHKOes Gholdengo and does significant damage to Corviknight and Skarmory. Tyranitar offers a Special Defense boost to Terrakion via its ability Sand Stream, allowing it to tank special attacks it is weak to like Enamorus and non-Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast, letting Terrakion OHKO them in return. In conjunction with entry hazard support in Stealth Rock, Tyranitar's sand is able to chip down opposing walls like Pecharunt, which is 2HKOed by Earthquake after Stealth Rock and sand damage. Terrakion also appreciates Tyranitar's Psychic immunity, which allows it to check threats to Terrakion such as Espathra, Indeedee, and Deoxys-S. Ogerpon-C is an essential teammate, threatening opposing Water- and Ground-types like Toxapex, Hippowdon, and Great Tusk thanks to its Grass typing. Glimmora offers Spikes support, which enables Terrakion to break defensive walls like the aforementioned Hippowdon and Great Tusk more easily. Its Poison typing also assists in getting rid of Toxic Spikes, improving Terrakion's longevity, and its Mortal Spin helps Terrakion stay healthy throughout the game, allowing it to switch in without the worry of taking damage from Spikes. Terrakion appreciates Iron Boulder's Speed tier, which threatens Pokemon like Meowscarada, Ogerpon-H, and Choice Scarf Enamorus that Terrakion is slower than and OHKOed by. Iron Boulder also threatens opposing Fighting-types like Sneasler and Keldeo thanks to its Psychic typing. Choice Scarf Kleavor is able to set up Stealth Rock without fear of Magic Bounce using Stone Axe, which helps helps Terrakion deal more damage, and it is able to outspeed threats to Terrakion like Flutter Mane. Kleavor's U-turn can also bring in Terrakion safely. Minior offers a Ground immunity thanks to its Flying typing, and it appreciates Terrakion's ability to break through its checks like Toxapex so it can set up and sweep late-game with Shell Smash.

Swords Dance (Rock).description:
Swords Dance Terrakion is an immensely strong wallbreaker for Rock teams thanks to its incredible STAB combination in conjunction with its good Speed that lets it outspeed common threats to Rock teams such as Iron Treads, Garchomp, and Landorus. Stone Edge allows Terrakion to nail Primarina and Gliscor that could otherwise take on Close Combat. Close Combat complements Stone Edge perfectly and is Terrakion strongest STAB attack, allowing it to target Steel-types such as Archaludon and Iron Treads. Upper Hand lets Terrakion circumvent priority such as Breloom's Mach Punch, Scizor's Bullet Punch, and Keldeo's Vacuum Wave, with +2 Upper Hand OHKOing Scizor and Keldeo after Stealth Rock damage and always OHKOing Breloom. Alternatively, Earthquake can be used over Upper Hand, allowing Terrakion to more easily threaten Gholdengo, Toxapex, and Clodsire super effectively. Life Orb allows Terrakion to clock important OHKOs, such as on Corviknight and Galarian Weezing with Close Combat and Stone Edge, respectively, after Stealth Rock chip damage and a Swords Dance boost.

Hisuian Arcanine forms a potent wallbreaking core with Terrakion against Steel teams. Hisuian Arcanine can also threaten physically defensive Grass-types such as Amoonguss and Sinistcha for Terrakion; In return, Terrakion can weaken some of its checks like Archaludon, Swampert, and Gliscor. Ogerpon-C can threaten Ground- and Water-type Pokemon for Terrakion, such as Hippowdon, Great Tusk, and Primarina, as well as being able to beat common shared checks with Terrakion, such as Toxapex and Landorus-T. Iron Boulder can deal with Poison- and Fighting-types for Terrakion; such as Pecharunt, Okidogi, and Keldeo. Iron Boulder can also use a Choice Scarf to revenge kill faster Pokemon that would otherwise outspeed Terrakion such as Iron Valiant, Meowscarada, and Sneasler. Tyranitar can set hazards up as well as check Psychic-type Pokemon such as Latios and Latias for Terrakion. In return, Terrakion can deal with common Steel-types such as Archaludon and Iron Treads for it. Glimmora can scare out Fairy- and Grass-types such as Hatterene, Clefable, and Hydrapple while also providing Toxic Spikes, which can chip down targets such as Iron Hands and Garchomp, as well as hazard remova, which helps Terrakion not get worn down by hazards. Garganacl can switch into most walls such as Corviknight, Amoonguss, and Toxapex and force progress against them with Salt Cure. Purifying Salt lets it absorb status effects that may be aimed at Terrakion, such as Toxic from Clodsire and Will-O-Wisp from Sableye and Dragapult. Shell Smash users such as Drednaw and Minior appreciate Terrakion's ability to punch holes into the opposing team so that they can sweep more effectively.

Swords Dance (Fighting).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Tornadus-Therian.comments:
Other Options

Bleakwind Storm provides a slightly safer STAB option that hits targets like Iron Valiant more reliably than Hurricane, but its weaker power makes it miss out on crucial KOs, notably being unable to kill any of the Ogerpon formes without prior chip. Sludge Wave provides an attack that doesn't have to worry about accuracy, making it good for picking off weakened targets like Iron Valiant, Enamorus, and Alolan Ninetales. However, it comes with the drawback of making Tornadus-T unable to hit Steel-types for good neutral damage. Focus Blast's high power is great at KOing monsters like Archaludon and Kingambit, buts its low accuracy makes it very risky.

Nasty Plot.description:
Tornadus-T makes for a great late-game cleaner by virtue of its access to Nasty Plot, its great coverage, and its Speed allowing it to outspeed the likes of Cinderace, Keldeo, and Volcarona. Nasty Plot-boosted Bleakwind Storm OHKOes the likes of Iron Defense Zamazenta, Great Tusk, and Ogerpon-H. Focus Blast threatens the likes of Archaludon, Heatran, and Hisuian Goodra, OHKOing the former and 2HKOing the latter two after a boost. Knock Off removes essential items such as Black Sludge from Toxapex and Clodsire, as well as Heavy-Duty Boots from Gouging Fire and Volcanion. U-turn allows Tornadus-T to act as a great pivot while OHKOing Hoopa-U. However, Focus Blast is usually the preferred move due to its coverage and being boosted by Nasty Plot. Heat Wave covers threats that the other moves can't cover, such as Gholdengo and Articuno.

Tornadus-T appreciates entry hazard support from the likes of Skarmory and Gliscor to wear down Clodsire and Ting-Lu. In addition, Gliscor spreads status with Toxic and, with its part Ground typing, acts as a great switch-in against Electric-types such as Magnezone and Sandy Shocks, while Skarmory handles physical attackers like Roaring Moon and Chien-Pao with Iron Defense and Body Press. Tornadus-T handles problematic threats for them such as Keldeo for Gliscor and Ogerpon-H for Skarmory. Corviknight removes hazards for Tornadus-T with Defog in case its Heavy-Duty Boots is removed, and it is able to pivot Tornadus-T into the likes of Zamazenta and Archaludon safely with U-turn. Tornadus-T can handle Fire-types that threaten Corviknight like Heatran and Ogerpon-H in return. Articuno is another great defensive partner, easily brushing off hits from the likes of Choice Scarf Enamorus and Hydreigon thanks to its high special bulk. Articuno also handles Water-types like Keldeo with Freeze Dry, as well as pivot Tornadus-T in with U-turn. Choice Scarf users such as Enamorus and Landorus-T provide great speed control for the team, handling speedy threats that can force Tornadus-T out. In particular, Enamorus handles fast Dragon- and Dark-types such as Dragapult and Choice Specs Greninja, while Landorus-T threatens not only fellow Choice Scarf users like Excadrill, Hisuian Arcanine, and Heatran, but also Gouging Fire, Alolan Muk, and Regieleki. Early-game wallbreakers like Landorus and Choice Band Dragonite can punch holes in the opposing team, removing problematic walls like Toxapex and Clodsire to ease Tornadus-T's late-game cleaning. Dragonite also picks off faster threats with Extreme Speed. Gyarados forms a great cleanup core with Tornadus-T, with Gyarados being able to sweep Fire and Steel teams, while Tornadus-T handles Grass, Fighting, and Dark teams.

Assault Vest.description:
Assault Vest Tornadus-T serves a key role on Flying teams as a great defensive piece thanks its solid bulk, especially when paired with Regenerator. Hurricane is Tornadus-T's main STAB move of choice, since its solid damage output is able to remove threats like Iron Valiant, Urshifu-R, and Ogerpon formes with ease. Heat Wave allows Tornadus-T to handle Steel-types that would otherwise wall it like Gholdengo and Corviknight while also dealing solid damage to Ice-types such as Alolan Ninetales. Knock Off allows Tornadus-T to remove items on incoming special walls such as Hisuian Goodra and Blissey along with special attackers like Latios and Dragapult. Finally, U-turn allows for Tornadus-T to deal chip damage as it pivots out along with being able to escape from trapping moves from the likes of Toxapex, Heatran, and Pecharunt. Tornadus-T's Special Attack investment is required to KO Ogerpon-W and Ogerpon-H consistently, and the rest of its EV investment goes into HP and Speed to give it as much bulk as possible and outspeed Iron Valiant.

Tornadus-T majorly appreciates Corviknight being able to remove Stealth Rock, which allows it to get the most out of Regenerator. Corviknight also helps Tornadus-T by taking out threats like Greninja and Flutter Mane, while Corviknight appreciates the removal of its foes' held items like Rocky Helmet. Skarmory also appreciates Tornadus-T removing Rocky Helmets, allowing Body Press to do as much damage as possible against Ice- and Rock-types that threaten Tornadus-T like Chien-Pao and Iron Boulder. Skarmory can also set entry hazards to help with Tornadus-T's offense. Gliscor's Ground typing and Poison Heal ability allow it to soak up both Electric-type attacks and status moves from the likes of Regieleki, Sandy Shocks, and Clodsire and easily remove them with Earthquake, making Tornadus-T's pivoting much safer. Dragonite appreciates Tornadus-T's ability to soften up teams by removing key threats like Ogerpon-H while staying healthy, which can allow for Dragonite to have an easier time sweeping with Dragon Dance late-game to remove dangerous targets like Raging Bolt. Choice Scarf Enamorus supports Tornadus-T by being able to check faster threats like Dragapult, Walking Wake, and Greninja with ease.

Nasty Plot (Electric).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Thundurus-Therian.comments:
Other Options

Flying

Nasty Plot can be used over Volt Switch to increase Thundurus-T's wallbreaking power, allowing it to easily break Water- and Flying-type teams. Psychic, Sludge Wave, and Thunder Wave are all options that can be used over Focus Blast to achieve different results. Psychic allows Thundurus-T to hit Clodsire and Amoonguss, Sludge Wave can check Hydrapple and Clefable, and Thunder Wave provides Flying teams with a form of speed control by slowing down foes like Dragonite and Gouging Fire. U-turn can be used over Volt Switch to allow Thundurus-T to reliably pivot against foes with an Electric immunity.

Offensive Pivot (Flying).description:
Thundurus-T finds a solid niche on Flying teams thanks to its incredible Special Attack, solid Speed, and Electric immunity that allows it to find safe entry against Electric-type moves. Thunderbolt is able to threaten Water- and Flying-types such as Toxapex, Pelipper, and Assault Vest Tornadus-T. Volt Switch helps it pivot out on threats attempting to handle it, such as Hisuian Goodra and Blissey. Grass Knot allows Thundurus-T to hit Ground-types like Swampert, Great Tusk, and Ursaluna that would otherwise wall it. Finally, Focus Blast remove Steel- and Rock-types like Iron Treads, Archaludon, and Tyranitar.

Skarmory and Gliscor provide excellent support to Thundurus-T, being able to deal with Rock-types such as Iron Boulder, Kleavor, and Terrakion reliably, as well as setting entry hazards to chip down threats like Hisuian Goodra and Archaludon. Skarmory can also support Thundurus-T by dealing with Ice-types like Weavile and Mamoswine with Body Press. Corviknight can similarly check Ice- and Rock-types with Iron Head and Body Press, use Defog to remove Stealth Rock if Thundurus-T loses its Heavy-Duty Boots, and give Thundurus-T safe entry with U-turn. Articuno provides a comfortable answer to Ground-types like Gliscor and Landorus, which can handle Thundurus-T's Grass Knot. Furthermore, Articuno can come in on special threats such as Kyurem and Greninja that Thundurus-T cannot handle. Dragonite acts a physical wallbreaker, handling specially defensive walls like Blissey, Hisuian Goodra, and Clodsire, while appreciating Thundurus-T's ability to eliminate physically defensive walls such as Galarian Weezing and Sableye. Choice Scarf Enamorus can threaten Dragon-type foes attemping to handle Thundurus-T, such as Dragapult, Kyurem, and Choice Band Roaring Moon. Landorus forms a special wallbreaking core, removing Fire-types like Gouging Fire, Hisuian Arcanine, and Heatran with ease. Landorus can also run a Choice Scarf and use U-turn to create a VoltTurn core with Thundurus-T while also OHKOing the Ogerpon formes with Sludge Wave after Stealth Rock damage.

Nasty Plot (Electric).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Wallbreaker (Ground).description:
Landorus is a ferocious wallbreaker on Ground teams, as it boasts great stats, a destructive ability, and a wide array of coverage moves, making it a crucial Pokemon to have in the Dark and Fairy matchups. Landorus's preferred ability, Sheer Force, in conjunction with Life Orb raises its offensive potency to great heights, allowing it to 2HKO nearly every wall in the metagame, including Ting-Lu, Rotom-W, and Corviknight with Focus Blast. Sludge Wave hits Grass-types like Rotom-C and Breloom as well as easing the Fairy matchup alongside Iron Treads and Clodsire, while Psychic threatens Urshifu-R and Air Balloon Glimmora and pops Gholdengo's Air Balloon, as Landorus is walled by it otherwise. Nasty Plot renders Landorus completely unwallable, notably letting it OHKO Corviknight. Alternatively, Rock Slide can be used to catch Volcarona, Zapdos, and Frosmoth off guard; however, it forces Landorus to use the suboptimal Naive nature and should only be used if teammates don't have answers for the listed targets. Substitute is a great option on Landorus because of the amount of switches it forces as well as making Kingambit's Sucker Punch easier to outplay.

Landorus appreciates Water Absorb Clodsire and Storm Drain Gastrodon switching into Water-type Pokemon like Barraskewda, Walking Wake, and Basculegion-F. Choice Scarf Great Tusk threatens Pokemon with Ice-type coverage like Latios and Greninja. Iron Treads provides support in the Fairy matchup and provides pivoting with Volt Switch, luring switch-ins like Corviknight and Volcarona for Landorus to take advantage of. Furthermore, Iron Treads removes Stealth Rock with Rapid Spin and enhances Landorus's wallbreaking with Knock Off, removing recovery items like Leftovers and Black Sludge from Rotom-W and Amoonguss. Additionally, Choice Scarf Iron Treads is a great asset in the Fairy matchup and threatens Ice-types like Weavile. Sandy Shocks is a great teammate in the Flying and Water matchups, providing Gravity support and additional pivoting with Volt Switch. Quagsire is able to check Gouging Fire as well as providing entry hazards and chip damage with Toxic. Ting-Lu provides entry hazards and phazing to wear down the opponent's team for Landorus and appreciates the removal of Fighting-types. Ursaluna can switch into Ghost-type moves from faster opponents like Dragapult, Flutter Mane, and Hisuian Zoroark as well as aiding in heavily denting teams alongside Landorus. In return, Landorus provides a Fighting-type resistance and threatens Fighting-types with Psychic.

Choice Scarf (Ground).description:
Access to Sheer Force, a variety of coverage moves, and a phenomenal Speed tier thanks to Choice Scarf make Landorus an elite revenge killer on Ground teams, taking out Choice Specs Greninja and all Ogerpon formes after entry hazard damage. Focus Blast tears apart Dark-types and Ground-immune Steel-type Pokemon such as Chien-Pao, Hydreigon, and Orthworm. Psychic makes the Fighting matchup a lot easier, OHKOing Great Tusk, Urshifu-R, and Iron Valiant, as well as taking out Galarian Weezing after Stealth Rock damage, making the Poison matchup extremely one sided. Sludge Bomb aids in the Fairy matchup, OHKOing Iron Valiant, Enamorus, and Azumarill, and helps greatly against Grass-type Pokemon that Ground-type teams would otherwise struggle to break, taking out prominent threats such as Breloom and Hisuian Lilligant. U-turn is a great pivot option for Landorus, gaining momentum by scaring out Pokemon it threatens while inflicting damage on the replacement and getting switch initiative.

Landorus cowers in fear at the thought of a single snowflake, which is why Quagsire is a great teammate for it. Quagsire is able to stand up to terrifying Ice-type move users such as Swords Dance Weavile, Swords Dance Urshifu-R and Azumarill without Trailblaze as well as providing entry hazard support via Spikes and Stealth Rock and spreading Toxic to soften foes up for Landorus. Iron Treads forms a wonderful core with Landorus as well, switching in on foes that attack with Ice-type moves, such as Articuno, Frosmoth, and Alolan Ninetales, and hitting back with a very powerful Heavy Slam or Iron Head. Iron Treads can also remove Stealth Rock via Rapid Spin and remove items via Knock Off, increasing Landorus's longevity and wallbreaking capabilities. Ice Spinner is also an option to take out opposing Landorus and Gliscor. In turn, Landorus can switch into a weakened Ogerpon-H as well as Ground- and Fighting-type attacks that would make quick work of Iron Treads. Landorus also appreciates Pokemon such as Water Absorb Clodsire and Storm Drain Gastrodon, as they can switch in to Water-type attacks from Pokemon such as Walking Wake, Barraskewda, and Basculegion-F. Clodsire is a very good special wall, while Gastrodon takes neutral damage from Ice Beam as well as walling Choice Scarf Greninja and providing a myriad of hazard support. Both Ursaluna and Ursaluna-B complement Landorus nicely, as they are able to switch into Ghost-type attacks from Pokemon that Landorus would otherwise struggle against, such as Flutter Mane and Air Balloon Gholdengo. Ursaluna-B is also capable of picking off weakened Dark-type Pokemon such as Kingambit, Greninja, and Chien-Pao with Vacuum Wave. In turn, Landorus can switch in on the Fighting-type attacks that would trouble Ursaluna and Ursaluna-B, and threatening the foe with Psychic. Gliscor is another great teammate for Landorus, as it is able to whittle down opponents via Knock Off and Toxic. Mamoswine is able to take down the Flying-type Pokemon that Landorus would otherwise be ineffective against and can also make use of its Thick Fat ability to tank some additional Ice-type moves. Sandy Shocks not only can set hazards but also can pivot around with Volt Switch, allowing Landorus to come in on an easy target.

All-out Attacker (Flying).description:
All-out attacker Landorus is a deadly wallbreaker for Flying teams, effortlessly shredding through troublesome Steel-, Rock-, and Poison-types like Heatran, Archaludon, and Galarian Weezing, as well as causing major havoc in the Dragon and Fire matchups. Earth Power eviscerates the aforementioned Steel- and Rock-types and hits troublesome Electric-types like Iron Hands as a bonus, while Focus Blast complements it well by whacking Dark-types like Ting-Lu as well as foes like Rotom-W and Skarmory that are immune to Earth Power. Psychic allows Landorus to become a major threat to Poison-teams, as it 2HKOes Galarian Weezing, the only Pokemon immune to Earth Power on such teams. It also annihilates Fighting-types like Breloom after its Focus Sash is broken as well as Zamazenta and pops Gholdengo's Air Balloon. Nasty Plot amps up Landorus's power level to astonishing levels, allowing it to easily rip through bulkier defensive cores on types like Water, while Rock Slide alongside 20 Attack IVs allows Landorus to lure in and OHKO Articuno and Frosmoth, major roadblocks to its wallbreaking exploits. Rock Slide also targets Volcarona.

Enamorus is a great partner for Landorus, as the two genies partner up to beat the other's checks. Enamorus provides speed control for Landorus against the likes of unboosted Chien-Pao and Dragapult as well as Healing Wish support to allow Landorus a second chance at breaking through depleted defensive cores, while Landorus breaks through problematic Steel-types like Gholdengo and Archaludon for Enamorus. Corviknight appreciates Landorus taking advantage of Electric-type attacks to come in; in return, it can remove Stealth Rock to give Landorus more longevity, give it a slow pivot in with U-turn, and check miscellaneous threats like Flutter Mane that Landorus cannot handle. Gyarados deals with Chien-Pao while spreading paralysis to help Landorus outspeed and OHKO otherwise faster threats like Roaring Moon. Dragonite is a potentially game-ending threat or great wallbreaker that appreciates Landorus removing Steel-types for it. Skarmory sets entry hazards to soften up Landorus's few defensive answers, letting it break through teams far more easily, while soft-checking Chien-Pao and Kingambit. Articuno provides a great special wall for Landorus, most notably taking on threats like Alolan Ninetales and Greninja that outspeed and threaten out Landorus. Gliscor is another entry hazard setter with great longevity, and it can take on the more powerful Fighting-types like Choice Band Zamazenta that Landorus gets quickly worn down by. Tornadus-T is another good partner, as it both outspeeds troublesome foes like Ogerpon-W and Iron Valiant and removes Assault Vest and Shuca Berry for Landorus to rip through bulky teams.

Swords Dance (Ground).description:
Swords Dance Landorus-T is a strong wallbreaker that greatly eases the matchup against balance Flying teams, one of Ground's worst matchups. Smack Down knocks down airborne Pokemon like Skarmory, Corviknight, Gliscor, and Galarian Weezing, allowing Landorus-T to muscle through them with boosted Earthquakes. Gravity removes Ground immunities from the opponent's whole team for a few turns at the cost of Landorus-T's own. Taunt shuts down walls like Gliscor and Skarmory, letting Landorus-T use them as setup fodder. Substitute blocks status conditions and can also protect Landorus-T from a revenge killer like Bisharp, although it doesn't block phazing like Skarmory's Whirlwind. Lum Berry should be used if Taunt is used in the final slot to heal off a status condition from moves like Alomomola's Scald, Spectrier's Will-O-Wisp, or Pecharunt's Malignant Chain. Leftovers should be used with Substitute to replenish the HP lost through its use.

Both Clodsire and Sandy Shocks appreciate Landorus-T providing a Ground immunity for them; Clodsire provides a Water immunity while setting up entry hazards, whereas Sandy Shocks breaks through Mandibuzz and Dondozo for Landorus-T. Furthermore, Sandy Shocks also brings Landorus-T in safely with Volt Switch. Fast cleaners like Choice Scarf Great Tusk, Swords Dance Garchomp, and Sand Rush Excadrill all greatly appreciate Landorus-T's wallbreaking talents, especially the luring and removal of Corviknight and Skarmory. They can check Dragon-types like Latios and Kyurem, which Landorus-T struggles with. Choice Band Mamoswine can aid in crushing balance Flying teams, and it helps against the bulky Grass-types that wall Landorus-T's set like Hydrapple and Sinistcha. Mamoswine's Thick Fat ability also gives it a resistance to the Ice-type moves Landorus-T is 4x weak to, while Landorus-T resists the Fighting-type moves Mamoswine is weak to. Offensive Iron Treads can outrun and threaten out Landorus and Kyurem with the threat of Ice Spinner and Iron Head, respectively, which this Landorus-T set can struggle with.

Bulk Up (Ground).description:
Landorus-T's unique set of attributes allow it to aid greatly in the Poison, Steel, and Flying matchups, making it a valuable member of Ground teams. Substitute allows Landorus-T to set up on passive Pokemon such as Corviknight, Amoonguss, and Clodsire. Bulk Up makes it nearly impossible for all physical attackers to break Landorus-T's Substitute. Gravity, in tandem with Earthquake, allows Landorus-T to threaten Ground-immune Pokemon such as Corviknight and Skarmory. The given EV spread allows Landorus-T to survive a -1 Ice Shard from Chien-Pao, guarantee that Amoonguss's Giga Drain will not break its Substitute, and speed tie with maximum Speed Adamant Tyranitar.

Landorus-T's Flying typing makes it immune to Ground, which helps cover for Ground-weak teammates such as Excadrill and Iron Treads. Landorus-T's Gravity also greatly benefits Excadrill, allowing it to freely spam Earthquake in sand. Excadrill and Iron Treads can deal with the Ice-type Pokemon that make quick work of Landorus-T, such as Kyurem and Chien-Pao, while Excadrill is in sand. Ursaluna-B is a great special attacker that can deal with physically bulky Unaware walls such as Skeledirge, Dondozo, and Quagsire. In return, while behind a Substitute, Landorus-T is easily capable of breaking through Pokemon that Ursaluna-B struggles to beat, such as Corviknight and Articuno. Choice Scarf Great Tusk is able to outspeed and KO Pokemon that impede Landorus-T's ability to set up, such as Dragapult, Latios, and Choice Scarf Gholdengo. Quagsire is a great teammate for Landorus-T, as it can beat Urshifu-R, whose Surging Strikes will always ignore the Defense boost from Bulk Up. Additionally, Water-immune teammates such as Clodsire and Gastrodon are also appreciated on Ground-type teams, and they provide utility in the form of a myriad of entry hazards, which further assist Landorus-T's ability to break through teams.

Choice Scarf (Ground).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Substitute + Bulk Up (Flying).description:
With its great natural bulk and decent defensive typing, Landorus-T finds many opportunities to set up with Bulk Up and wallbreak. At +1, it notably OHKOes specially defensive Toxapex and physically defensive Amoonguss, the latter after taking Stealth Rock damage. Substitute allows Landorus-T to take advantage of passive threats such as Blissey, Archaludon, and Amoonguss to set up. Smack Down hits Flying-types like Articuno, and it removes the Ground immunity from the likes of Corviknight, Skarmory, and Rotom-W so that they can be taken out with Earthquake. The given EV spread ensures that Landorus-T's Substitute isn't broken by Foul Play or Giga Drain from Amoonguss. 12 Speed EVs allow it to Speed tie with Adamant Tyranitar with maximum Speed EVs.

Gliscor and Skarmory provide entry hazard support to aid Landorus-T's wallbreaking. Additionally, Gliscor can either remove crucial items with Knock Off or spread status with Toxic, while Skarmory can handle Dark- and Ice-type physical attackers like Kingambit, Weavile, and Mamoswine with IronPress. In return, Skarmory appreciates Landorus-T taking on Fire- and Electric-types such as Heatran, Cinderace, and Regieleki. Corviknight also appreciates the removal of said Fire- and Electric-types, and in return, it removes hazards with Defog and can pivot Landorus-T in on them. Articuno can take hits such as Pelipper's Water-type STAB moves and Greninja and Kyurem's Ice Beam, threatening the former back with Freeze-Dry. Physically defensive Gyarados can spread paralysis with Thunder Wave so that Landorus-T can outspeed and threaten would-be faster foes like the Ogerpon formes and Gouging Fire. In return, both Articuno and Gyarados appreciate Landorus-T providing an Electric immunity to take on Regieleki and non-Air Balloon Raging Bolt. Choice Scarf Enamorus provides speed control for Flying teams, outpacing and taking out the likes of Dragapult, Choice Specs Greninja, and non-Choice Scarf Iron Valiant, and Landorus-T takes out Steel-types like non-Air Balloon Gholdengo, Heatran, and Iron Crown in return. Setup sweepers such as Tornadus-T, Galarian Moltres, and Dragonite appreciate Landorus-T's wallbreaking against the likes of Raging Bolt and Hisuian Goodra, so they can freely set up and sweep late-game.

Pivot (Flying).description:
Outspeeds Glimmora.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Choice Scarf (Flying).description:
Choice Scarf Landorus-T provides solid utility to Flying-type teams thanks to a solid Speed tier and excellent Attack, allowing it to check threats such as Raging Bolt and Ogerpon-H while serving as a solid pivot. Earthquake deals with threats such as Hisuian Goodra and Flutter Mane with ease. Stealth Rock makes use of the free turns Landorus-T can create to set up entry hazards safely. U-turn is used to pivot out along with checking threats such as Hoopa-U. Stone Edge is used to hit Flying-type threats such as Zapdos and Enamorus attempting to come in on an Earthquake, along with dealing with Ice-types like Frosmoth and Articuno. Alternatively, Outrage can be used to deal with Dragon-type threats such as Latios, Choice Band Roaring Moon, and Kyurem.

Corviknight can handle Ice-type threats such as Alolan Sandslash and Froslass, use Defog to remove Stealth Rock, and pivot Landorus-T in with U-turn; it can also be used to form a pivot core. Zapdos and Thundurus-T provide support by dealing with the Flying- and Water-types that handle Landorus-T such as Corviknight, Gyarados, and Urshifu-R. Skarmory and Gliscor provide solid utility by being able to set Spikes to pressure threats trying to handle Landorus-T like Zamazenta, Meowscarada, and Ogerpon-W. Skarmory can also deal with Ice-type threats such as Weavile and Mamoswine. Articuno supports Landorus-T by switching into special attacks from the likes of Porygon2, Sinistcha, and Galarian Moltres, along with threatening Water-types like Primarina and Greninja with Freeze-Dry. Landorus-T appreciates Choice Band Dragonite's Extreme Speed to pick off faster targets such as Choice Scarf Darkrai and Choice Scarf Ninetales.

Kyurem.comments:
Other Options

Ice

Focus Blast can be used over Earth Power to OHKO Tyranitar, giving Kyurem an edge in the otherwise difficult Rock matchup. The move also 2HKOes Blissey after slight chip damage or Stealth Rock if its Heavy-Duty Boots can be removed, although its shaky accuracy means these advantages are easily undermined by bad luck. Running Focus Blast also leaves Kyurem completely walled by Gholdengo and Jirachi. Dragon Pulse gives Kyurem a more spammable Dragon-type STAB option, but the combined strength and coverage of its standard moves leave little reason for Kyurem to spam anything else. Ancient Power allows Kyurem to effectively lure Articuno for itself, but its low base power and overlapping coverage with Kyurem's other moves leave few other use cases for it.

Dragon

Flash Cannon is an alternative option for Kyurem, allowing it to take on Fairy-types that resist both its STAB options such as Klefki and Alolan Ninetales. However, most Fairy-type targets of Flash Cannon would outspeed and force Kyurem out.

Choice Specs (Dragon).description:
Kyurem makes for an exceptional special wallbreaker on Dragon teams by virtue of its high Special Attack further boosted by Choice Specs and a strong STAB combination. Ice Beam shreds through defensive Pokemon such as Skarmory, Ting-Lu, Clodsire, and Amoonguss. Freeze-Dry, despite being weaker than Ice Beam, still hits the same walls with the added benefit of taking out Water-types such as Swampert, Toxapex, and Primarina. Focus Blast is strong coverage that targets Steel-types that resist both of its STAB moves such as Heatran and Kingambit, as well as Rock-types such as Tyranitar and Garganacl. Alternatively, Earth Power hits the same targets as Focus Blast along with non-Air Balloon Gholdengo and Poison-types such as Alolan Muk, Galarian Slowking, and Okidogi.

Kyurem appreciates entry hazard support from the likes of Archaludon and Garchomp to wear down foes into OHKO range of one of its attacks. Notably, Kyurem now has a great chance of OHKOing mixed defensive Toxapex sets after Stealth Rock and one layer of Spikes damage and a chance to outright OHKO physically defensive Ting-Lu after one layer of Spikes damage. In return, Archaludon and Garchomp appreciate Kyurem threatening entry hazard removers such as Great Tusk, Gliscor, and Mandibuzz. Thanks to their Steel typing and great bulk, Archaludon and Hisuian Goodra take on Fairy-types; Archaludon takes on Mimikyu and Azumarill, while Hisuian Goodra handles Flutter Mane, Choice Specs Iron Valiant, and Enamorus. Choice Scarf Dragapult spreads paralysis with Thunder Wave, and its faster U-turn allows it to threaten the likes of Choice Scarf Hoopa-U and Choice Scarf Meowscarada, the latter of which can be especially threatening to Dragon teams with its Protean-boosted Play Rough, while Choice Scarf Latias handles Fighting-types such as non-Choice Scarf Iron Valiant and Zamazenta. Dragapult and Latias appreciate Kyurem taking out Ting-Lu and Primarina in return. Choice Scarf Roaring Moon provides great speed control, outspeeding and threatening the likes of Flutter Mane, Iron Valiant, Choice Scarf Latias, Gholdengo, and Enamorus while providing pivoting with U-turn. In return, Kyurem deals with Great Tusk, Ting-Lu, Skarmory, and Amoonguss. Late-game sweepers such as Gouging Fire, Swords Dance Garchomp, and Dragonite appreciate Kyurem's wallbreaking that enables their sweep.

Old Man Winter [Choice Specs] (Ice).description:
Kyurem's high offensive stats, access to Freeze-Dry, and surprisingly solid defensive profile make it an unparalleled special wallbreaker for Ice teams, with its resistances and coverage letting it pull its weight against Fire and Water teams by giving it good matchups against the likes of Ogerpon-H and Dondozo among others. STAB Draco Meteor is already a fearsome tool for Kyurem to wield unboosted, but with Choice Specs equipped, it becomes downright nuclear, OHKOing common neutral targets such as Archaludon, Slowbro, and Ursaluna-B. Ice Beam is the default secondary STAB move for its reliability, giving Kyurem an extremely strong attack that's also spammable; it importantly deals massive neutral damage to many common Draco Meteor switch-ins, securing 2HKOs on Clefable, Hatterene, Corviknight, and Galarian Weezing. Blizzard is a stronger alternative to Ice Beam that achieves incredible damage benchmarks, securing a guaranteed OHKO on Clodsire and 2HKO on Hisuian Goodra after Stealth Rock, two feats that Ice Beam never achieves; however, Blizzard relies on snow being active to be consistent, forcing Kyurem's snow-setting teammate to either run Icy Rock or play far more conservatively than they would otherwise. Freeze-Dry is arguably the most important tool in Kyurem's arsenal, letting it carry the Water matchup on its back by undermining would-be checks like Primarina, Toxapex, and Tentacruel and scoring harder hits on otherwise neutral targets like Quagsire, Rotom-W, and Dondozo. Earth Power rounds out Kyurem's moveset nicely by giving it coverage for the Steel-types that resist its STAB combination, notably OHKOing Kingambit and Metagross after Stealth Rock while handily 2HKOing dedicated walls like Empoleon and non-Choice Scarf Jirachi. Earth Power also scores a super effective hit on bulky Poison-types like Alolan Muk, which can give Kyurem a hard time otherwise. A Timid nature is an absolute requirement on Kyurem, since its crowded Speed tier would leave a Modest variant outsped by common threats to it such as Glimmora, Excadrill, and non-Choice Scarf Great Tusk, among others.

Alolan Ninetales is a crucial partner for Kyurem, enabling Blizzard spam and boosting its bulk to ludicrous proportions with snow and Aurora Veil; Kyurem becomes so staggeringly bulky in these conditions that a revenge killing tool as strong as Choice Band Scizor's Bullet Punch will not even 2HKO it after Stealth Rock. Alolan Ninetales's part-Fairy typing is also useful for discouraging Dragon-type revenge killers like Latios, Dragapult, and Walking Wake with Moonblast. Since Kyurem cannot use Heavy-Duty Boots on this set, it must rely on entry hazard removal to maintain its longevity; Alolan Sandslash is a standout choice here thanks to Rapid Spin and its secondary Steel typing, allowing it to switch into common revenge killers like Iron Boulder, Dragapult, and Flutter Mane, as well as threatening Rock- and Fairy-type attackers with its STAB moves. Slush Rush also lets it provide speed control that Kyurem needs to help against threats like Flutter Mane and Chien-Pao. Mamoswine brings Stealth Rock to make Kyurem even harder to switch into, Ice Shard to help with speed control, and an Earthquake that shakes most Steel-types and special walls into Kyurem's KO range or out of the game altogether, notably OHKOing Gholdengo, Klefki, and Hisuian Goodra after Stealth Rock. Froslass can provide further entry hazard support with Spikes, speed control with Thunder Wave, and spinblocking utility while also switching into Fighting-type attacks for Kyurem, and Destiny Bond lets it trade with a problematic target such as Ogerpon-H. Chien-Pao is another strong physical attacker that also threatens Gholdengo and boasts an amazing Speed tier, letting it clean up weakened teams with a Choice Band or Swords Dance set after Kyurem has weakened them; Chien-Pao also loves Kyurem's ability to threaten Primarina and Azumarill with Freeze-Dry. Weavile is similar to Chien-Pao and contributes a powerful Knock Off to remove Heavy-Duty Boots or Eviolite from certain walls that rely on them such as Articuno and Porygon2, respectively. Avalugg is another hazard removal option that provides a much sturdier fallback against physical revenge killers compared to Alolan Sandslash and serves as a secondary wincon with an IronPress set, but this comes at the cost of being agonizingly slow and useless against most Fairy-types.

Keldeo.comments:
Other Options

Fighting (Choice Specs)

Air Slash provides Keldeo coverage against Grass-types such as Amoonguss and Sinistcha; however, the two of them are the only real targets of Air Slash, and Grass teams usually find ways to play around Keldeo.

Fighting (Calm Mind)

Black Belt is an alternative, granting an OHKO versus Meowscarada after a Calm Mind with Vacuum Wave. It can also OHKO 252 HP Hoopa with +1 Sacred Sword and Choice Scarf Iron Treads with +1 Vacuum Wave after Stealth Rock chip, making it a very difficult Pokemon to revenge in the Steel and Dark matchups.

Choice Specs (Water).description:
Choice Specs Keldeo is a formidable wallbreaker for Water teams, easily dismantling Flying and Steel defensive cores without setup, which makes it terrifying from the get-go. Hydro Pump 2HKOes popular walls such as specially defensive Corviknight and Gholdengo. Surf is an alternative that ensures consistency against Pokemon with Pressure. Secret Sword sets Keldeo apart from other Water-type attackers by allowing Keldeo to OHKO specially defensive targets such as Hisuian Goodra and to 2HKO Articuno and Alolan Muk. Vacuum Wave can pick off weakened foes such as Roaring Moon, Excadrill, and Meowscarada. Lastly, Icy Wind targets Dragonite and prevents popular Choice Specs users like Dragapult and Latios from switching into Keldeo.

Keldeo appreciates entry hazard setters such as Swampert and Gastrodon, as they bolster Keldeo's attacking prowess and are immune to Electric. Swampert can also run utility moves such as Knock Off and Flip Turn, which makes it the ideal partner to maintain pressure. Toxapex provides a useful Fairy-resistant option for Flutter Mane's Moonblast, removes Toxic Spikes from the field, and has access to utility options such as Toxic, Toxic Spikes, and Haze to support Keldeo. Hisuian Samurott can set up Spikes, provides a useful Psychic immunity, and can remove foes such as Dragapult and Latios with Sucker Punch, which reduces the need for prediction on Keldeo's part. Other excellent offensive teammates include Ogerpon-W and Greninja; Ogerpon-W can deal with Water Absorb Clodsire, Azumarill, and Primarina against which Keldeo is powerless, and Greninja can address any issue Keldeo faces thanks to its huge offensive movepool. Greninja's Sludge Wave hits Grass- and Fairy-types that handle Keldeo like the Ogerpon formes, Primarina, and Iron Valiant, while Extrasensory and Ice Beam can deal with Poison-, Flying-, and Dragon-types. Finally, Keldeo appreciates rain from Drizzle Pelipper, as it allows Hydro Pump to OHKO defensive Gholdengo and Corviknight, while Pelipper's Hurricane can deal with Grass-type foes such as Rillaboom and Amoonguss.

Calm Mind (Water).description:
With Calm Mind, Keldeo turns into a great sweeper that can threaten foes both physically and specially. Vacuum Wave is a strong STAB priority option to pick off faster albeit weakened threats like Meowscarada, Chien-Pao, and Choice Scarf Hydreigon. Surf is highly accurate, targeting slower threats like non-Choice Scarf Landorus and Gliscor, while Hydro Pump, although it has lower accuracy, brings more power, notably 2HKOing physically defensive Corviknight. Secret Sword threatens special walls that Keldeo's other moves do not; it OHKOes Assault Vest Hisuian Goodra and 2HKOes Alolan Muk after a Calm Mind boost. Heavy-Duty Boots allows Keldeo to switch in safely regardless of entry hazards, while Leftovers grants Keldeo a small form of longevity.

Swampert and Gastrodon make for good teammates, as they set up entry hazards that can help Keldeo sweep, and they also both provide an immunity against Electric-types like Magnezone and Regieleki. In return, Keldeo threatens Choice Specs Kyurem for them. Toxapex is another great defensive partner, threatening Fairy-types like Iron Valiant and Enamorus with Sludge Bomb; it also absorbs Toxic Spikes for Keldeo when Keldeo isn't running Heavy-Duty Boots. In return, Keldeo handles Ground-types that threaten Toxapex such as Ursaluna-B and Landorus. Choice Scarf Hisuian Samurott outspeeds Pokemon that can shrug off Keldeo's STAB moves, such as Latios and Dragapult, while easily setting up Spikes with Ceaseless Edge. Greninja makes for another great partner, as it outspeeds and threatens the likes of Iron Valiant, Primarina, and the Ogerpon formes with Sludge Wave. In return, Keldeo threatens Hisuian Goodra for it. Ogerpon-W forms an offensive core with Keldeo. It checks Water Absorb Clodsire, Azumarill, and Primarina, while Keldeo threatens Archaludon.

Choice Specs (Fighting).description:
Equipped with Choice Specs, Keldeo makes for a strong wallbreaker on Fighting teams, threatening the likes of Great Tusk and Gliscor with Hydro Pump and outspeeding both Landorus formes and Garchomp. With Secret Sword, Keldeo is able to threaten foes physically and specially; thus, walls that would normally switch into one of Keldeo's other attacks, such as Alolan Muk, Hisuian Goodra, and Articuno, take high damage from it. Vacuum Wave serves as a strong revenge killing option for Keldeo, picking off faster weakened threats like Chien-Pao and Excadrill and KOing Meowscarada after Stealth Rock damage with ease. Icy Wind grants Keldeo coverage against Dragon-types, and with the Speed drop, it is able to counter Dragon Dance attempts from Garchomp. Surf is a great Water-type STAB move that, although weaker than Hydro Pump, has greater accuracy.

Great Tusk is an almost-universal choice for a partner for Keldeo, both setting up Stealth Rock to wear down incoming foes and removing entry hazards with Rapid Spin so Keldeo can switch in safely. Great Tusk also provides an Electric immunity for Keldeo, and it can take out the likes of Iron Hands, Toxapex, and Water Absorb Clodsire. Iron Hands grants Fighting teams coverage against Flying teams, and with its bulk and movepool, it is able to remove the likes of Gyarados, Tornadus-T, and Enamorus. Iron Valiant is another great teammate for Keldeo, outspeeding the likes of Choice Specs Dragapult, Choice Band Roaring Moon, and non-Choice Scarf Meowscarada when equipped with a Choice Scarf. Its mixed sets work well with Keldeo, softening each other's checks while wearing down shared checks like Toxapex. Choice Scarf Sneasler is a fast pivot for Fighting teams with U-turn, and it can aid Keldeo in its wallbreaking with its great status spreading abilities thanks to a combination of Dire Claw and Poison Touch. Sneasler can also take out faster threats that annoy Keldeo such as Meowscarada, the Ogerpon formes, and Iron Valiant. In return, Keldeo is able to remove the Ground-types that annoy Sneasler such as Unaware Clodsire and Great Tusk. Gallade is another great teammate due to its ability to break down Poison teams. Lastly, Keldeo's wallbreaking abilities open up room for sweepers like Zamazenta and Iron Valiant to clean late-game, the two of them also appreciating Keldeo removing walls such as Corviknight.

Calm Mind (Fighting).description:
With Calm Mind; Keldeo can break through the bulkiest of threats such as Archaludon while also dealing heavy damage on Gouging Fire and Ursaluna-B. Keldeo is also able to outspeed Landorus. Secret Sword is Keldeo's best way to break through even the bulkiest of the metagame such as Blissey and Hisuian Goodra, and Keldeo can take advantage of Secret Sword by boosting it with Calm Mind and hitting them on their physical defensive side. Surf threatens Ground-types such as Landorus, Ursaluna-B, Gliscor, and Hippowdon while dealing with physical walls like Skarmory, which Fighting has a difficult time facing. Along with breaking through bulky Pokemon such as Corviknight, Ting-Lu, and Heatran. Vacuum Wave gets rid of faster threats that outspeed Keldeo such as Chien-Pao and Meowscarada. Heavy-Duty Boots keeps Keldeo safe from getting chipped by entry hazards, as removal is very difficult for Fighting.

Great Tusk is an amazing defensive teammate for Keldeo, providing an Electric immunity and the ability to not only set up Stealth Rock but also use Taunt opposing Defoggers, allowing its entry hazards to chip foes. Great Tusk can take out opposing threats to Keldeo such as Iron Hands, Toxapex, and Clodsire. Assault Vest Iron Hands grants coverage against Flying. With its high HP stat and tremendous bulk; it can remove the likes of Enamorus, Gyarados, and Tornadus-T. Choice Scarf Iron Valiant can outspeed Choice Scarf Latias, Choice Specs Greninja, and non-Choice Scarf Dragapult. Iron Valiant can also run a mixed set that gives more coverage to further assist Keldeo by outspeeding the Ogerpon formes and picking up suprise KOs by not being locked into a single move. Choice Scarf Sneasler is an alternative option to pair with Keldeo, as it can use U-turn against threats such as Gliscor and Great Tusk that Keldeo can take advantage of. With Dire Claw, Sneasler can potentially spread status on problematic foes such as Hatterene and Flutter Mane. Sneasler also outspeeds threats to Keldeo such as the Ogerpon formes and Iron Valiant. Choice Band Zamazenta can assist in breaking through faster Pokemon like Choice Specs Greninja and Choice Specs Latios, while its Substitute + Iron Defense set can safely set up and break down teams. Gallade is a unique teammate for Keldeo as well, as it's able to break down Poison teams, a matchup where Keldeo struggles quite a lot.

Choice Specs (Normal).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Greninja.comments:
Other Options

Dark (Scarf)

Extrasensory can be used on Greninja over a different coverage option, as it allows for a clean OHKO on Sneasler; it also eases the Fighting matchup in general and can even sweep said matchup in the proper conditions.

Choice Scarf (Dark).description:
With access to colorful coverage, Greninja makes itself a great revenge killer and potential sweeper when paired with a Choice Scarf. Ice Beam allows Greninja to muscle through opposing Ground- and Flying-type Choice Scarf users such as Great Tusk and Enamorus. Low Kick lets Greninja hit targets that can easily take its other coverage such as Kingambit and Hisuian Goodra. Gunk Shot allows Greninja to defeat Hatterene, Iron Valiant, and the Ogerpon formes after entry hazard damage, while Switcheroo lets Greninja give its Choice Scarf away to neuter defensive Pokemon such as Articuno and Gouging Fire. U-turn can be used as an alternative to Switcheroo, as it allows Greninja to retain momentum on a predicted swap without having to give away its item.

Choice Band Meowscarada paired with Greninja make for a synergistic offensive core. Meowscarada is able to handle Pokemon that can shrug off Greninja's attacks such as Swampert and Gastrodon, while with the appropriate coverage, Greninja can return the favor by taking care of Pokemon that can easily switch into Meowscarada such as Ceruledge and Hatterene. Air Balloon Kingambit is able to switch into both Hippowdon and Choice Band Excadrill's Earthquake, providing a Ground immunity while also being able to ease the Fairy matchup against Pokemon such as Flutter Mane and Clefable. Ting-Lu's ability to set a wide array of entry hazards makes Greninja's job of being a late-game sweeper easier; it is also an important defensive backbone that can switch into Pokemon such as the aforementioned Excadrill and Gouging Fire. Sableye is able to neuter specially defensive Pokemon that shrug off Greninja's attacks such as Corviknight and Articuno with Knock Off and Will-O-Wisp; it also stops setup sweepers such as Gouging Fire and Zamazenta with Encore, all while providing an invaluable Fighting immunity. Both Nasty Plot Darkrai and Hydreigon are also able to wallbreak easily, which makes Greninja's ability to sweep much easier. Darkrai can also cripple defensive Pokemon such as the aforementioned Corviknight and Primarina with Hypnosis, while Hydreigon can readily deal with Archaludon and Alolan Muk. Mandibuzz has access to Defog, which Dark teams lack; it also checks physical setup sweepers such as Dragonite and Gliscor with Foul Play and provides a much-needed Ground immunity for Dark teams outside of Air Balloon Kingambit. Alolan Muk also stomachs Fairy-type attacks and threatens most Fairy-types for Greninja. In return, Greninja is able to take care of Landorus and Great Tusk.

Battle Bond (Water).description: This is a sample set as we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Choice Specs (Dark).description:
By virtue of its ability to outspeed most threats in the metagame as well as a colorful moveset boosted by Protean, Greninja is one of Dark's best wallbreakers and potential cleaners. Hydro Pump not only takes out non-Choice Scarf Great Tusk, Volcarona, and Mamoswine but also guarantees a 2HKO on specially defensive Corviknight after Stealth Rock damage. While Hydro Pump is preferred due to its superior power, Surf can be used due to its consistency while stilling landing an OHKO on Iron Valiant after Stealth Rock. Sludge Wave eliminates Grass- and Fairy-types such as the Ogerpon formes, Azumarill, Primarina, and Clefable. Alternatively, Grass Knot targets Ting-Lu, Swampert, and Gastrodon but fails to threaten the Fairy-types that many of Greninja's teammates dislike. Ice Beam targets Dragon- and Ground-types such as Dragonite, Garchomp, the Landorus formes, and Clodsire. Extrasensory threatens Poison- and Fighting-types like Toxapex, Okidogi, and Keldeo.

Ting-Lu provides entry hazard support in Stealth Rock and Spikes, an Electric immunity, and support against Fairy- and Dragon-types such as Hatterene, Flutter Mane, Raging Bolt, and Hisuian Goodra; in return, Greninja can take advantage of said hazards to more easily handle Corviknight, which can remove them. Mandibuzz provides a Ground immunity, removes hazards with Defog so Greninja can come in more safely, takes advantage of physical attackers such as Scizor and Ceruledge with Foul Play, and pivots Greninja in with U-turn. In return, it appreciates Greninja handling Rock-types such as Ogerpon-C after Sturdy is broken and Choice Band users like Hisuian Arcanine and Terrakion. Sableye provides a Ghost immunity to switch into predicted attacks from Great Tusk and Zamazenta, softens physical attackers with Prankster Will-O-Wisp, blocks Rapid Spin to keep entry hazards, and dissuades setup with Encore. Choice Scarf Meowscarada pairs well with Greninja due to their shared access to Protean, allowing them to take on a multitude of threats for their teammates, with Meowscarada handling Choice Scarf Iron Valiant, Choice Specs Flutter Mane, and unboosted Dragapult. Kingambit is a great potential wincon for Dark-teams thanks to its access to Supreme Overlord, Swords Dance, and Sucker Punch, as well as being able to help deal with Fairy-types such as Flutter Mane and Hatterene. Nasty Plot Hydreigon is a solid wallbreaker, removing walls such as Hisuian Goodra and Corviknight.

Choice Specs (Water).description:
Choice Specs Greninja makes for one of Water's best choices for a wallbreaker thanks to its great array of moveset options that are all further boosted by Protean. Furthermore, its great Speed tier allows it to outspeed and take on a myriad of threats such as unboosted Iron Valiant, Latios, and Garchomp. Dark Pulse threatens Psychic- and Ghost-types such as Slowbro, Gholdengo, and Pecharunt. Ice Beam's great offensive coverage allows Greninja to threaten a myriad of threats like Dragonite, Water Absorb Clodsire, and Amoonguss. Extrasensory targets Poison- and Fighting-types like Toxapex, Okidogi, and Iron Hands. Sludge Wave targets both the Ogerpon formes and Fairy-types such as Primarina and Azumarill. Alternatively, Grass Knot can also be used to hit Ting-Lu, Swampert, and Gastrodon. However, Sludge Wave is preferred, since the Ogerpon formes could otherwise pose significant problems to Water teams.

Greninja appreciates entry hazard support from the likes of Swampert and Gastrodon to wallbreak more easily. Notably, their entry hazards break Choice Band Dragonite's Multiscale and Ogerpon-C's Sturdy so that Greninja can eliminate them immediately, and they also provide an Electric immunity to ease that matchup. Additionally, Swampert can bring Greninja in safely with Flip Turn. In return, Greninja deals with troublesome Grass-types for them like the Ogerpon formes, Hydrapple, and Sinistcha. Poison-type teammates like Toxapex and Tentacruel make for great defensive partners, as their great bulk coupled with their typing allows them to handle Fairy-types that pressure Greninja such as Iron Valiant and Flutter Mane, and they are also able to melt Toxic Spikes so Greninja can come in safely. Moreover, Toxapex walls Choice Scarf Meowscarada, which can threaten Greninja, while Tentacruel serves as great role compression, being able to stack hazards with Toxic Spikes and remove entry hazards from foes with Rapid Spin. In return, Tentacruel appreciates Greninja dealing with Poison-types that can melt its Toxic Spikes like Amoonguss, Toxapex, and Okidogi. Ogerpon-W and Greninja form a great wallbreaking duo, with Ogerpon-W handling bulky Fire-types such as Heatran and Gouging Fire, while it appreciates Greninja taking on Toxapex and Amoonguss in return. Primarina eases the Dragon and Fighting matchups, as its great Calm Mind-boosted bulk lets it take on threats such as Dragapult, Roaring Moon, and Zamazenta. Rain-boosted Barraskewda provides great speed control to threaten faster threats to Greninja like Meowscarada, Sneasler, and Flutter Mane.

Defog (Fire).description:
Talonflame, due to its Ground immunity and access to entry hazard removal with Defog, has a great spot on Fire teams. Gale Wings makes Brave Bird a priority move at full HP, which allows Talonflame to take out threats like Ogerpon-W, Choice Scarf Great Tusk, and Keldeo. Will-O-Wisp weakens physical threats like Mamoswine, Garchomp, Iron Treads, and Excadrill; U-turn can be run over Will-O-Wisp to let Talonflame hit Meowscarada and Hoopa-U while also allowing it to pivot into one of its teammates. But doing so will remove the opportunity to weaken the aforementioned physical threats with a burn, which can be a problem for the team. Heavy-Duty Boots is the go-to item that lets Talonflame avoid taking damage from Stealth Rock. The given EV spread lets Talonflame outspeed and OHKO Ogerpon-W with Brave Bird.

All of Talonflame's teammates appreciate the removal of hazards and Ground immunity that Talonflame provides. Swords Dance Ogerpon-H is an amazing teammate for Talonflame, taking out pesky Water- and Rock-types like Primarina, Quagsire, and Rhyperior at +2 with Horn Leech. After a Dragon Dance boost, Gouging Fire takes out a plethora of threats like Raging Bolt, Choice Specs Walking Wake, Tentacruel, and Iron Hands with Scale Shot and Earthquake. Choice Scarf Cinderace can use High Jump Kick to deal with troublesome Rock-, Normal-, and Dark-types like Choice Band Hisuian Arcanine, Ursaluna-B, and Choice Specs Greninja. Swords Dance Ceruledge is a great setup sweeper that can deal with pesky Psychic- and Ghost-types like Iron Boulder and Flutter Mane with Shadow Sneak after a boost. Choice Band Hisuian Arcanine is a great wallbreaker for Talonflame, being able to take out Flying-types like Gyarados, Dragonite, and Skarmory. Volcanion provides a Water immunity for Talonflame while checking Azumarill with Sludge Wave. Heatran tanks special hits from the likes of Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Power Gem while OHKOing it back with Heavy Slam. Heatran also traps walls like Toxapex with Magma Storm and stops them from recovering with Taunt.

Specially Defensive (Dragon).description: This is a sample set as we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Swords Dance (Fighting).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Goodra-Hisui.comments:
Other Options

Dragon

Hisuian Goodra can use a Dragon-type STAB move like Draco Meteor or Dragon Pulse over Dragon Tail to punish foes in the mirror matchup as well as take down Will-O-Wisp Dragapult. However, Draco Meteor is less spammable and makes Hisuian Goodra vulnerable to setup sweepers, while Dragon Pulse can be underwhelming, and both prevent Hisuian Goodra from phazing . Flamethrower is a decent coverage move that can be used over Dragon Tail, allowing Hisuian Goodra to lure Steel-type foes like Corviknight and Skarmory and prevent Nasty Plot Gholdengo from setting up.

Steel

Acid Spray allows for Hisuian Goodra's special attacks to make further progress against passive teams and allows Hisuian Goodra to check Volcarona. Knock Off synergizes well with Steel's hazard stacking capabilities being able to comfortably remove Heavy-Duty Boots.

Specially Defensive (Dragon).description:
Hisuian Goodra is a staple on Dragon teams, thanks to its exceptional special bulk and typing, which allows it to tank special Fairy-, Ice-, and Dragon-type moves like Moonblast from Clefable, Ice Beam from Greninja, and Draco Meteor from Dragapult. Heavy Slam allows Hisuian Goodra to hit Fairy-type threats like Flutter Mane and Choice Scarf Iron Valiant while denting Calm Mind Primarina and Hatterene to prevent them from setting up. Knock Off permits Hisuian Goodra to remove Leftovers from switch-ins like Corviknight, Ursaluna-B, Archaludon, and opposing Hisuian Goodra. Dragon Tail is a great phazing move, preventing foes like Nasty Plot Gholdengo, Dragon Dance Dragonite, and Gouging Fire from setting up on Hisuian Goodra. Protect grants Hisuian Goodra a form of passive recovery while also permitting it to scout moves from potentially Choice-locked foes like Choice Specs Flutter Mane and Choice Scarf Iron Valiant.

Dragapult is a remarkable teammate for Hisuian Goodra, as it provides a much-needed Fighting immunity, meaning it can comfortably switch into attacks from Barraskewda, Iron Defense Zamazenta, and Skarmory, which Hisuian Goodra is highly susceptible to, and force them out with the threat of Will-O-Wisp. Dragapult also provides Dragon teams with a high Speed tier, allowing it to use U-turn to pivot into Hisuian Goodra before threatening special attackers like Choice Specs Flutter Mane, Hatterene and Greninja can attack it. In return, Hisuian Goodra hits opposing Dragapult and Skeledirge with Knock Off and switches into Moonblast from Choice Scarf Flutter Mane. Garchomp is an astounding lead for Dragon teams, setting up Stealth Rock and Spikes for Hisuian Goodra, which can use Dragon Tail to force foes to take chip damage from the entry hazards Garchomp sets. Garchomp also handles pesky Steel-type foes like Kingambit and Gholdengo, which Hisuian Goodra isn't very good against, with Earthquake. Choice Band Dragonite provides a much-needed Ground immunity for Hisuian Goodra while also serving as a capable wallbreaker and revenge killer with Choice Band Extreme Speed. In return, Hisuian Goodra can come in on attacks like Ice Beam from Greninja and Freeze-Dry from Articuno, which Garchomp and Dragonite are extremely vulnerable to. Archaludon forms a great defensive core with Hisuian Goodra, as not only do they share their typing, but Archaludon also provides outstanding physical bulk. Hisuian Goodra is highly susceptible to physical attacks from foes like Baxcalibur, Dragon Darts Dragapult, and Gouging Fire, which Archaludon can comfortably switch into. Archaludon can also set up Stealth Rock for Dragon teams and threaten foes like Chien-Pao and Kingambit, which Hisuian Goodra can't deal with, with Body Press. In exchange, Hisuian Goodra can easily take on attacks like Moonblast from Flutter Mane and Enamorus and Draco Meteor from Walking Wake and Raging Bolt, which Archaludon cannot survive due to its low special bulk. Baxcalibur and Gouging Fire are amazing setup sweepers that help take out foes like Gliscor, Ogerpon-H, and opposing Hisuian Goodra. Choice Specs Kyurem showcases its wallbreaking ability by OHKOing foes that Hisuian Goodra cannot touch, like Swampert, Belly Drum Azumarill, and Ogerpon-W, with Freeze-Dry. Raging Bolt and Walking Wake are also potentially capable wallbreakers, Raging Bolt providing priority with Thunderclap and Walking Wake exterminating threats like Baxcalibur and Great Tusk with Draco Meteor and Scald, respectively. Roaring Moon and Latios are amazing late-game cleaners, Roaring Moon checking threats like Ceruledge and Choice Scarf Enamorus with Knock Off and Iron Head and Latios denting threats like Keldeo, Great Tusk, and Garchomp with Luster Purge and Draco Meteor. Latias provides Healing Wish support to Dragon teams, allowing Hisuian Goodra to last longer in a game with more special attackers. Both Latios and Latias also provide a Ground immunity thanks to Levitate, which Hisuian Goodra appreciates.
