Kommo-o is a great teammate, as it can set up Stealth Rock and OHKO threats to Hisuian Goodra like Chien-Pao and Kingambit with Vacuum Wave.

Specially Defensive (Steel).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Assault Vest (Steel).description:
Assault Vest Hisuian Goodra finds a niche on Steel-type teams thanks to its incredible special bulk and diverse movepool, allowing it to take on a multitude of the special attacking threats in the metagame such as Hydreigon and Primarina to provide immense support. Thunderbolt hits Skarmory, Corviknight, Pelipper, and Greninja, while Flamethrower can also deal with Skarmory and Corviknight in addition to Gholdengo. Ice Beam checks problematic Flying-types like Landorus and Zapdos, while Earthquake can be used to target down special walls that want to take on Hisuian Goodra such as opposing Hisuian Goodra and Alolan Muk along with completing its coverage against Steel, allowing Hisuian Goodra to deal with Heatran. Draco Meteor enables Hisuian Goodra to be less passive by being able to dish out an immense burst of damage; alternatively, Dragon Pulse can more reliably check threats like Substitute Hydreigon. Heavy Slam allows for Hisuian Goodra to easily deal with Articuno and Primarina; however, Dragon Tail can be used to phaze setup sweepers like Galarian Moltres and rack up damage from entry hazards set up by Hisuian Goodra's teammates. The EV Spread allows for Hisuian Goodra to outspeed Skarmory along with paralyzed threats like Keldeo and Iron Moth and lets it OHKO Latios with Draco Meteor. A Sassy nature allows for Hisuian Goodra to take more damage against foes such as Choice Specs Dragapult, while a Quiet nature gives more power to Hisuian Goodra's special attacks, allowing it to potentially OHKO threats such as Raging Bolt.

Skarmory and Corviknight pair excellently with Hisuian Goodra thanks to their Flying typing giving them a Fighting neutrality and Ground immunity, making them able to come in on threats such as Sneasler, Great Tusk, and Quagsire. Meanwhile, Skarmory and Corviknight appreciate Hisuian Goodra's ability to deal with threats like Greninja and Hisuian Zoroark. Gholdengo provides solid support thanks to its Ghost typing blocking Fighting-type attacks from the likes of Skarmory, Iron Hands, and Zamazenta along with providing Thunder Wave support. Iron Treads supports Hisuian Goodra by being able to use Rapid Spin to remove hazards to provide Hisuian Goodra safe entry along with dealing with Garchomp and Landorus thanks to Ice Spinner. Hisuian Goodra appreciates Archaludon's ability to take on physical attackers such as Kingambit and Ceruledge, which immensely scare Hisuian Goodra. Hisuian Goodra appreciates Kingambit and Scizor being able to pick off faster threats like Meowscarada, Iron Boulder, and Iron Valiant with their powerful priority moves, while Kingambit and Scizor greatly appreciate Hisuian Goodra's ability to remove Skarmory and Corviknight.

Klefki.overview:
Steel

Klefki can serve as a dual screen-setting lead with entry hazard support for Steel teams. However, Steel teams are usually balanced, and Klefki does not bring much defensive utility or longevity to be beneficial long term. It is mostly outclassed by Skarmory as a Spikes setter and Fighting-neutral Pokemon. Skarmory also provides a valuable Ground-immune and potential as a IronPress setup sweeper. On the other hand, Klefki's role compression with dual screens support can be valuable on more offensive teams.

Dual Screens (Fairy).description:
Klefki is an excellent pick for Fairy teams due to its Prankster dual screens and Spikes support, which enables threats such as Azumarill, Primarina, and Hatterene to set up and sweep. Foul Play allows Klefki to punish setup sweepers such as Scizor, Gouging Fire, and Ogerpon-H while preventing Roaring Moon and Excadrill from setting up completely for free. Alternatively, Thunder Wave cripples fast threats such as Sneasler, Iron Moth, and Flutter Mane. Klefki’s Steel typing blocks Mortal Spin and turns annoying matchups against foes like Alolan Muk into an opportunity to set Spikes. Maximum Defense investment allows Klefki to deal with Scizor, which is an extremely dangerous threat for Fairy teams.

Belly Drum Azumarill greatly appreciates Klefki's dual screens support, as it enables Azumarill to easily set up against threats such as Gholdengo and Alolan Muk. Additionally, Spikes provides chip damage to ensure Azumarill OHKOes Ogerpon-H and Ogerpon-C with +6 Aqua Jet. Flutter Mane appreciates Klefki's Spikes support wearing down checks like Hisuian Goodra, Alolan Muk, and Toxapex. In return, Flutter Mane blocks Rapid Spin to keep Klefki's Spikes on the field. Iron Valiant appreciates Klefki's ability to slow down foes such as Flutter Mane, Cinderace, and Sneasler with Thunder Wave. In return, Iron Valiant provides offensive pressure on Steel teams while threatening Defoggers such as Corviknight and Mandibuzz with its wide coverage. Primarina appreciates Klefki's dual screens support, allowing it to set up in the face of Pokemon like Gouging Fire and Archaludon. Hatterene and Klefki form a strong defensive core, with Hatterene checking walls such as Clodsire and Toxapex while Klefki deals with Scizor. Hatterene is excellent at punishing entry hazard setters that can freely set hazards against Klefki like Ting-Lu and Skarmory. Klefki's dual screens support allows Hatterene to easily take on Pokemon such as Ting-Lu, Toxapex, and Clodsire by serving as a wincon with Calm Mind. Clefable is an excellent teammate, as the two can form an entry hazard-stacking core with Spikes and Stealth Rock. As Klefki is vulnerable to Ground-type attacks, Enamorus makes a great ally.

Dual Screens (Steel).description:
Klefki is a niche choice for Steel teams that brings Prankster dual screens and Spikes to the table, allowing it to serve as a lead and support setup sweepers such as Gholdengo and Iron Crown. Foul Play can be used to punish Dragon Dance sweepers such as Gouging Fire and Dragonite while also preventing Klefki from being complete setup fodder to Dark- and Ground-types such as Roaring Moon and Excadrill. Thunder Wave can be used instead to hinder fast threats and special setup sweepers such as Cinderace, Flutter Mane, and Volcarona, aiding sweepers that would otherwise be slower.

Gholdengo is one of Klefki's best teammates, as it blocks Defog from Corviknight and Mandibuzz and Rapid Spin from Great Tusk and Terapagos. This is essential in maintaining the progress Klefki makes. Gholdengo also benefits greatly from dual screen supports, as this eases setting up Nasty Plot on otherwise irritating foes such as Flutter Mane and Alolan Muk. Iron Crown, Excadrill, and Scizor also appreciate the dual screens support from Klefki, which eases setup, while the former can more easily activate Weakness Policy without getting KOed by hits such as Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball and Life Orb Landorus's Earth Power. Klefki cannot check threats such as Gouging Fire, Volcarona, and Landorus, so defensive stalwarts such as Archaludon, Heatran, and Corviknight are essential. In addition, Corviknight can serve as a Bulk Up wincon or as a valuable U-turn pivot for setup sweepers. Klefki cannot prevent entry hazards from being set by setters such as Ting-Lu and Skarmory, so Rapid Spin support from Iron Treads and Excadrill is valuable.

Iron Defense + Calm Mind (Steel).description: This is a sample set as we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Physically Defensive.description:
Thanks to its sky-high Defense stat, reliable recovery, and excellent utility, Avalugg is a useful defensive piece on Ice teams. It can check physical attackers with great efficiency, in addition to being one of Ice teams' best answers to Barraskewda under rain. Rapid Spin allows Avalugg to clear entry hazards for teammates such as Kyurem and Alolan Ninetales. Body Press allows it to threaten dangerous threats like Scizor and Hisuian Arcanine. Iron Defense works excellently with Body Press, and Avalugg finds plenty of setup opportunities under Aurora Veil and snow. This turns it into a potent wincon against Fighting and Dark teams once checks such as Iron Valiant and Darkrai have been removed. Avalanche can be used instead to deal massive damage to Flying-types like Gliscor and Dragonite and prevent them from setting up on Avalugg. This move also prevents Avalugg from being completely walled by Ghost teams. With Mirror Coat, Heavy-Duty Boots, and Sturdy, Avalugg can be a reliable emergency answer to any snowballing special threats such as Volcarona and Flutter Mane.

Avalugg walls physical threats best with snow and Aurora Veil support. Therefore, Alolan Ninetales is a perfect teammate. In addition, Alolan Ninetales can threaten Keldeo and Kommo-o for Avalugg, while it can switch into and threaten Scizor for Alolan Ninetales. Avalugg is a complete liability against Ghost-type threats, as Gholdengo and Hisuian Zoroark are able to easily set up on it. Therefore, Weavile makes a strong ally to deal with Ghost teams. Similarly, Avalugg struggles to do much to Fire- and Poison-type targets such as Heatran and Okidogi. Mamoswine makes a great teammate, as it can tank hits from these foes while threatening them back with Earthquake. Cloyster is also a great because it can offensively threaten Fire teams after a Shell Smash. Avalugg cannot beat opposing physical walls such as Toxapex and Skarmory. Kyurem makes an excellent teammate, as it is able to remove these walls for it.

Noivern.overview:
Dragon

Noivern is heavily outclassed both offensively and defensively by fellow Dragon-types like Latios and Archaludon, which can put far more pressure on opposing teams. However, Noivern comes packing with a useful Flying typing and, more importantly, a crucial Speed tier, outspeeding targets like Iron Valiant, which Latios cannot, along with being one of the only answers to entry hazards Dragon teams have.

Utility (Dragon).description:
Noivern finds a niche on Dragon teams thanks to its blazing Speed stat, allowing it to blitz past threats such as Iron Valiant and non-Choice Scarf Greninja, along with having access to Defog to provide a form of entry hazard removal. Hurricane allows it to check Fighting-types like Iron Valiant, Sneasler, and Gallade with ease. U-turn provides fast pivoting, allowing safe entry for setup sweepers. Alternatively, Flamethrower can be used to allow Noivern to threaten Steel- and Ice-types like Gholdengo, Skarmory, and Froslass, while Draco Meteor provides another strong offensive tool, which can prove useful in the mirror matchup. A defensive EV spread is preferred, allowing Noivern to stick around reliably throughout a game, as it can take two Dark Pulses from Hydreigon and a Power Gem from Glimmora. Alternatively, it can run an offensive spread to assuredly OHKO targets like Latios and the Ogerpon formes.

Archaludon can take on powerful physical Ice- and Rock-type attackers that threaten Noivern such as Weavile, Cloyster, Kleavor, and Iron Boulder and can respond with Flash Cannon. Archaludon can also support Noivern by using Thunder Wave to allow Noivern to outspeed targets like Meowscarada and Zamazenta. Hisuian Goodra, meanwhile, can take on special Dragon- and Fairy-types like Hex Dragapult, Kyurem, Flutter Mane, and Primarina. Hisuian Goodra can also switch into special Ice-type attacks from foes like Greninja and Kyurem, which Noivern is highly susceptible to. Both Archaludon and Hisuian Goodra appreciate Noivern's hazard removal, allowing them to get the most out of their Leftovers and giving them a chance to come in repeatedly. Dragapult provides an incredible Speed tier, being able to handle threats such as Flutter Mane and Latios. Choice Specs Latios and Kyurem can deal with foes attempting to make use of Noivern's passivity like Gliscor and Raging Bolt while also being extremely significant in the mirror matchup, allowing Noivern to forego Draco Meteor. Gouging Fire appreciates Noivern providing a Ground immunity and hazard removal in case its Heavy Duty-boots have been removed, and in return, Gouging Fire can handle Steel-types like Gholdengo, Hisuian Goodra, and Corviknight. Gouging Fire also benefits from Noivern's U-turn, which allows it safe entry and gives it a chance to set up and sweep. Garchomp provides an Electric immunity and a Rock resistance, which makes it capable of taking on threats like Regieleki, Hisuian Arcanine, and Iron Boulder.

Hoopa-Unbound.comments:
Other Options

Dark (Choice Scarf)

Gunk Shot is great for threatening Fairy- and Grass-types like Primarina, Hatterene, and the Ogerpon formes. Focus Blast is another option to OHKO Archaludon, but its low accuracy is unappealing. Destiny Bond is a weird catch-all move that notably lets you trade with IronPress Zamazenta, but it is very unreliable.

Dark (Trick Room)

Nasty Plot provides Hoopa-U with absurd breaking power, which lets it outright OHKO the aforementioned special walls, but this wastes a precious turn under Trick Room. Dark Pulse can be considered, as its combination with Psychic will hit most of the metagame for neutral damage at the very least, but Focus Blast and Thunderbolt's ability to score OHKOs or 2HKOs against prominent threats and walls is more impactful.

Choice Band (Psychic).description:
Hoopa-U is one of Psychic's best physical wallbreakers. Its strong offensive STAB combination coupled with great coverage allows it to muscle through bulky Pokemon such as Skeledirge, Toxapex, Iron Hands, and Amoonguss, and with its great special bulk, it can prove useful against Ghost teams. Drain Punch grants Hoopa-U super effective coverage against Dark- and Steel-types such as Kingambit, Ting-Lu, and Heatran. Brick Break can also be run as Hoopa-U's Fighting-type move, as this allows it to remove dual screens set by Fairy- and Dark-type teams. Trick is a great option for Hoopa-U to hinder Pokemon that can take a hit like Sableye and Klefki, as well as potentially disrupt Pokemon reliant on their items such as Moltres. Gunk Shot is another great option, as it allows Hoopa-U to threaten Fairy-types like Azumarill and to OHKO Hatterene. By investing 8 EVs in Special Defense, Hoopa-U can live a Moonblast from Choice Scarf Flutter Mane.

Azelf and Scream Tail make for great partners, as they can set up entry hazards for Hoopa-U to be able to wallbreak more easily. Azelf can also run Taunt to prevent Defog users like Corviknight removing its hazards, while Scream Tail can also set up dual screens for both Hoopa-U and its teammates and provide Wish support. Because of Hoopa-U's lack of longevity outside of Wish, it can get easily worn down by hazards. Hence, Hatterene is a great partner, as it is able to provide great hazard control for Psychic teams through Magic Bounce. Galarian Slowking is another great partner for Hoopa-U, as it provides Hoopa-U a switch-in to Fairy-types and aids Hoopa-U's wallbreaking through Future Sight. Galarian Slowking can also set up Toxic Spikes to annoy Hoopa-U's switch-ins such as Azumarill, and its Poison typing allows it to remove Toxic Spikes to prevent Hoopa-U from getting worn down by poison. Indeedee is another great addition to Psychic teams, as its Normal typing grants it an immunity to Ghost. Aside from this, Indeedee can set up Psychic Terrain to allow Hoopa-U to threaten Kingambit with Drain Punch without fearing Sucker Punch. Lastly, late-game sweepers such as Gallade and Armarouge appreciate Hoopa-U beating their checks such as Azumarill for the former and Galarian Slowking for the latter. Lastly, Espathra appreciates Hoopa-U breaking through its checks such as Ting-Lu, Kingambit, and Sableye so it can set up and sweep late-game.

Choice Scarf (Psychic).description:
Boasting stellar offenses, Choice Scarf Hoopa-U grants Psychic teams a form of speed control as well as a threatening wallbreaker, outspeeding the whole unboosted metagame bar Deoxys-S and Regieleki, especially key targets such as Choice Specs Flutter Mane and IronPress Zamazenta. Hyperspace Fury OHKOes both Flutter Mane and Dragapult and can be used to break through special tanks such as Hisuian Goodra and Galarian Slowking. Dark Pulse complements it nicely by offering a powerful neutral attack against physically bulky Steel- and Water-types like Archaludon, Iron Treads, Scizor, and Toxapex. Alternatively, Focus Blast targets Dark-type foes like Darkrai and Bisharp. Psychic covers Fighting and Fairy matchups, preventing threats like Iron Valiant and Zamazenta from switching in safely. Expanding Force is a viable alternative if the team uses Psychic Terrain, transforming Hoopa-U into a killing machine for the Terrain's duration. The last moveslot aims at targeting specific foes. Thunderbolt deals with Hisuian Samurott and Greninja, while Gunk Shot helps against the Ogerpon formes. 8 Special Defense EVs allow Hoopa-U to always survive a Moonblast from Choice Scarf Flutter Mane from full health.

Hoopa-U immensely benefits from Galarian Slowking and Hatterene; they can both support Hoopa-U in multiple ways. Galarian Slowking strengthens the wallbreaking potential of Hoopa-U with Future Sight and a slow pivoting option in the form of Chilly Reception. Hatterene can send entry hazards back to the opponent; paralyze the target with Nuzzle; take care of most Dark-types such as Roaring Moon, Hisuian Samurott, and Meowscarada; and provide Healing Wish support to Hoopa-U. Slowbro helps mitigate Hoopa-U's poor physical bulk by absorbing physical moves, spreading burns with Scald, and effectively hard-countering physical bulky setup sweepers such as Gouging Fire with its IronPress combination. Indeedee-M sets up Psychic Terrain, effectively negating any priority move for the Terrain's duration and massively boosting Hoopa-U's potential with Expanding Force, and has access to Healing Wish in case of need. Lastly, Hoopa-U appreciates other sweeper teammates such as Latios, Metagross, and Iron Boulder that can weaken defensive cores of types like Fairy, Flying, and Fire to allow a proper Hoopa-U sweep. Latios is especially threatening to Flying teams with access to BoltBeam coverage and a powerful STAB move in Draco Meteor, while Metagross and Iron Boulder can both offer a breaking potential similar to Latios's in Fairy and Fire matchups, respectively, with access to Heavy Slam, Bullet Punch, and Stealth Rock for Metagross and Mighty Cleave on top of naturally outspeeding both Meowscarada and Greninja for Iron Boulder.

Choice Scarf (Dark).description:
Choice Scarf Hoopa-U is an amazing option on Dark teams thanks to its great Attack stat. Knock Off allows Hoopa-U to not only remove items from foes like Alolan Muk and Articuno but also takes out threats like Choice Specs Flutter Mane. Drain Punch deals with Dark-, Normal-, Steel-, and Ice-types like Greninja, Blissey, Hisuian Goodra, and Chien-Pao, while Psychic cleans up Poison- and Fighting-types like Galarian Weezing, Okidogi, mixed attacker Iron Valiant, Zamazenta, and Choice Specs Keldeo. Thunderbolt is a great coverage move, handling Flying- and Water-types like Skarmory, Corviknight, and Gyarados. Trick can be run over Thunderbolt to Choice-lock foes like Calm Mind Primarina, Ting-Lu, and Archaludon; however, without Thunderbolt Hoopa-U cannot reliably deal with Skarmory, which can then wall it. The given EV spread allows Hoopa-U to survive a Moonblast from Choice Scarf Flutter Mane and retaliate back with Knock Off. Its special bulk is also notable, allowing it to trade blows with the likes of Iron Valiant and Ursaluna-B.

Swords Dance Chien-Pao is an amazing teammate for Hoopa-U, as it is able to deal with Dragon-, Ground-, and Flying-types like Dragonite, Enamorus, and Clodsire with Icicle Crash and Ice Shard. Swords Dance Kingambit provides a Fairy neutrality while also being a great wincon, taking out a plethora of foes for Hoopa-U with Sucker Punch at +2 and with five Supreme Overlord boosts. Alolan Muk is a great special wall, easing the Fairy matchup thanks to its Poison typing while dealing with Primarina and Hatterene with Poison Jab. Choice Scarf Meowscarada deals with Water-, Ground- and Fighting-types like Urshifu-R, Quagsire, and Choice Scarf Iron Valiant with Flower Trick and Play Rough. Choice Specs Greninja covers a lot of matchups thanks to Protean, notably taking out the Ogerpon formes, Hatterene, and the Landorus formes with Sludge Wave and Ice Beam. Sableye provides a Fighting immunity while also weakening physical threats like Excadrill, Sneasler, and Choice Scarf Great Tusk with Will-O-Wisp. Sableye can also use Encore on setup sweepers like Zamazenta and spread paralysis with Thunder Wave so Hoopa-U can outspeed faster threats. Mandibuzz provides entry hazard removal for Hoopa-U with Defog and slow pivoting with U-turn. Mandibuzz also checks Swords Dance sweepers like Ogerpon-H and Scizor with Foul Play. It's also worth mentioning that Mandibuzz provides a Ground immunity, which allows it to come in on Choice Scarf Great Tusk's Headlong Rush for Hoopa-U. Ting-Lu is a great wall that can lay down hazards with Stealth Rock and Spikes, which chip down threats like Iron Valiant and Zamazenta. Ting-Lu also handles Steel-types like non-Air Balloon Heatran and Hisuian Goodra with Earthquake and phazes setup sweepers like Swords Dance Garchomp and Dragon Dance Dragonite with Whirlwind. Hydreigon also sets hazards with Stealth Rock while taking out Dragon-types like Archaludon with Draco Meteor. In return, Hoopa-U deals with Skarmory, Galarian Weezing, and Iron Valiant for its teammates.

Trick Room (Dark).description:
Hoopa-U takes advantage of its ability to run multiple sets in order to force out threats like Keldeo, non-Choice Scarf Iron Valiant, and Hippowdon to set up Trick Room and start decimating faster-paced types like Fighting, Dragon, and Ground. Thunderbolt 2HKOes Articuno and Corviknight, which readily soaks up its other attacks, while Psychic trashes Fighting teams and lets Hoopa-U OHKO Toxapex. Focus Blast lets Hoopa-U immediately OHKO Archaludon, which greatly threatens Dark teams. The given EV spread lets Hoopa-U outspeed Choice Specs Magnezone and slower threats, like Ursaluna-B and Kingambit, without the need for Trick Room so Hoopa-U does not have to set up Trick Room and potentially benefit slower foes, as Dark-type teams can outspeed and handle them without the need for Hoopa-U to do so. Alternatively, one can forgo the Speed and pour the remaining EVs into Defense, giving it a shot at surviving mixed Iron Valiant's Close Combat. The defensive EV investment makes Hoopa-U bulky enough to withstand Choice Scarf Enamorus's Moonblast and Choice Specs Keldeo's Secret Sword. With 160 Special Attack EVs, a Modest nature, and Expert Belt, Hoopa-U is able to 2HKO even the bulkiest special walls in Articuno, Clodsire, and Iron Hands with the appropriate move and is strong enough to even remove Blissey after minimal chip damage with Focus Blast. If this sheer wallbreaking power is not needed, items that improve its longevity such as Heavy-Duty Boots, which is important because Dark teams' access to entry hazard removal is scarce, or Leftovers are preferred.

Kingambit loves Hoopa-U's ability to set Trick Room up, despite not being dependent on it, in order to threaten Fairy- and Dark-types like Iron Valiant and Chien-Pao that normally check it instead. Aside from this, Kingambit forms a wallbreaking core with Hoopa-U, taking advantage of Hoopa-U's ability to remove Skarmory, Ursaluna-B, and Keldeo to wreak havoc on Flying, Ground, and Water teams late-game. Choice Scarf Meowscarada dispatches threats that OHKO Hoopa-U, like Choice Specs Flutter Mane and Roaring Moon, and loves Hoopa-U's ability to remove bulky walls that prevent Meowscarada from making progress like Skarmory, Archaludon, and Toxapex. Chien-Pao acts as a cleaner after Hoopa-U has greatly weakened the opposing Corviknight and Ursaluna-B, tearing through Flying, Ground, and some Water teams after a Swords Dance, if it has the appropriate coverage. Defensive walls like Ting-Lu and Sableye are also appreciated, with Ting-Lu supporting Hoopa-U's wallbreaking by setting entry hazards and Sableye checking strong Fighting-types like Zamazenta and Sneasler, which can OHKO Hoopa-U. Mandibuzz provides Defog support to keep Hoopa-U healthy, checks setup sweepers like Scizor and Dragonite, and pivots Hoopa-U in, if the opportunity arises, with U-turn.

Substitute (Psychic).description:
Outspeeds Kingambit.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Assault Vest (Dark).description:
Hoopa-U, by virtue of its great coverage and high Attack and Special Attack stats, is a great mixed attacker on Dark teams. Furthermore, its excellent Special Defense further boosted by Assault Vest allows it to tank hits other Dark-types struggle with, such as Choice Scarf Iron Valiant's Moonblast and Choice Specs Kyurem's Draco Meteor. Psychic threatens Poison- and Fighting-types that Dark teams struggle with like Galarian Weezing, Toxapex, Iron Valiant, and Okidogi. Knock Off allows Hoopa-U to remove items from holders such as Heavy-Duty Boots from Volcarona, Talonflame, and Articuno, which is appreciated by its entry hazard-stacking teammates. Focus Blast threatens bulky Pokemon that can otherwise shrug off Hoopa-U's attacks such as Archaludon and Heatran. Thunderbolt threatens Flying-types such as Gyarados, Corviknight, Skarmory, and Pelipper. 36 Special Defense EVs in tandem with a Gentle nature allow Hoopa-U to easily take hits from Iron Valiant and Keldeo, while 96 Speed EVs allow it to outspeed and threaten Magnezone and Archaludon.

Ting-Lu and Sableye are great defensive partners for Hoopa-U, as their great bulk allows them to take hits from attackers such as Kingambit, Iron Boulder, and Excadrill. Ting-Lu also provides entry hazard support in Stealth Rock and Spikes and phazes setup sweepers like Dragon Dance Dragonite and Dragon Dance Gouging Fire with Whirlwind, while Sableye provides a Fighting immunity, shuts down wallbreakers like Choice Band Excadrill and Choice Band Zamazenta with Will-O-Wisp, and takes advantage of setup sweepers such as Iron Defense Zamazenta and Dragon Dance Dragapult with Encore. Mandibuzz provides an immunity to Ground, slow pivoting with U-turn, and Defog support so Hoopa-U does not fear hazards when switching in, as well as taking advantage of physical attackers like Excadrill, Scizor, and Ceruledge with Foul Play. Alolan Muk takes off pressure from Hoopa-U by aiding it in handling Fairy-types such as Hatterene, Iron Valiant, and Primarina. Choice Scarf Meowscarada and Choice Specs Greninja make for great teammates, as with their great Speed tiers and abilities, they are able to take care of threats to Hoopa-U. Meowscarada handles Choice Scarf Roaring Moon, Dragapult, and Urshifu-R, while Greninja threatens Great Tusk, Tornadus-T, and Mamoswine. Kingambit is a great potential wincon, as with its excellent ability, Swords Dance, and Sucker Punch, it shines late-game, dealing with frail offensive threats like Flutter Mane.

Water Absorb (Fire).description:
Volcanion is a useful Pokemon on Fire teams mainly thanks to its ability, Water Absorb, offering the type an immunity to one of its most common weaknesses. Steam Eruption is Volcanion's preferred Water-type move, with it being able to burn its switch-ins like Alolan Muk, Hisuian Goodra, and Iron Hands, reducing their overall longevity. Earth Power allows Volcanion to threaten opposing Volcanion, Toxapex, and Heatran. Sludge Bomb allows Volcanion to revenge kill Azumarill after a Belly Drum and threaten other Fairy-type Pokemon like Hatterene and Enamorus. It is also able to target Walking Wake and Rotom-W, which resist Volcanion's STAB attacks, potentially crippling them thanks to the 30% poison chance. Flamethrower is preferred over Fire Blast since it doesn't miss, and the reduced damage is not too significant if Volcanion is under sun, but Fire Blast can be used in order to 2HKO Hisuian Goodra under sun. 96 Speed EVs let Volcanion outspeed Adamant Azumarill in order to revenge kill it with Sludge Bomb, and the rest of the EVs are put in HP to improve Volcanion's overall bulk.

Torkoal is a solid partner for Volcanion that assists it with Stealth Rock support, chipping down its switch-ins like Rotom-W and Alolan Muk and working well in conjunction with Steam Eruption's burn chance. Torkoal can also use Rapid Spin to clear away entry hazards for Volcanion if its Heavy-Duty Boots get removed by Alolan Muk or Meowscarada. Furthermore, Torkoal provides Volcanion with sun thanks to Drought, which boosts Volcanion's Fire-type attacks. In return, Volcanion can switch into Water-type attacks from Barraskewda and Pelipper, which threaten Torkoal. Scovillain helps out Volcanion by threatening Water-immune Pokemon like Clodsire and Gastrodon, and its damage onto the former allows Volcanion to revenge kill it and proceed to threaten slower Ground-types like Quagsire and Ting-Lu. Cinderace is able to threaten Hisuian Goodra with Libero High Jump Kick, whose Assault Vest set easily shrugs off Earth Power from Volcanion and chips it down with Draco Meteor. Cinderace can also steal dual screens from Klefki with Court Change in the Fairy matchup, which supplement Volcanion's naturally good bulk, letting it take hits better. In return, Volcanion offers an answer to Belly Drum Azumarill and threatens Cinderace's defensive answers like Toxapex and Skeledirge. Choice Scarf Hisuian Arcanine offers a solution to handle opposing Dragon-types like Baxcalibur, which can use Volcanion as setup fodder, and also threatens Dragapult and non-Choice Scarf Hydreigon. Rotom-Heat provides an invaluable Ground immunity for Volcanion to avoid Earthquake from Pokemon like Iron Hands, Iron Treads, and Landorus-T and threatens all 3 of them with a burn from Will-O-Wisp. Rotom-H is also able to threaten defensive Water-types like Toxapex and offensive Water-types like Hisuian Samurott and Quaquaval if it opts for a Choice Scarf. Heatran can help Volcanion deal with Poison teams with its stallbreaker set, which allows it to trap and beat Pokemon like Toxapex one-on-one. Choice Scarf Iron Moth can revenge kill weakened Dragon-types like Walking Wake and Baxcalibur.

Wallbreaker (Water).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Primarina.comments:
Other Options

Fairy (Calm Mind)

Heavy-Duty Boots may be used over Leftovers due to Fairy having poor hazard control, but Primarina finds it a bit harder to set up without passive recovery. Alternatively, Covert Cloak may be used to prevent Alolan Muk's Poison Jab or Sneasler's Dire Claw from inflicting status on Primarina. Chilling Water lets Primarina take on physical attacking walls like Alolan Muk and Hisuian Goodra, as it lowers their Attack to manageable levels, but the greatly reduced base power compared to Surf makes Primarina lose out on OHKOing Landorus and Ursaluna-B and 2HKOing Gholdengo and Skeledirge at +1. An EV spread of 252 HP / 64 Def / 192 Spe with a Bold nature may be considered, as it lets Primarina outspeed and KO Modest Ursaluna-B which otherwise severely damages Primarina with Blood Moon, but the reduced bulk is detrimental to Primarina's ability to check Gouging Fire. If one opts for a fast variant of Primarina, Encore over Draining Kiss or Psychic Noise may also be considered to lock threats such as Belly Drum Azumarill and Bulk Up Corviknight into unfavorable moves. Liquid Voice may be considered to compress the effects of Psychic Noise and Surf into one move, making it easier to fit Encore, but being unable to hit Water Absorb Clodsire is undesirable. Substitute over Draining Kiss can also be considered to dodge status and force damage on switch-ins, but the lack of recovery apart from Leftovers can be detrimental.

Fairy (Assault Vest)

Draining Kiss can be used over Psychic Noise to grant Primarina a form of recovery. However, this comes with the cost of being walled by Poison-types like Toxapex and Amoonguss. Alternatively, Primarina can run Psychic Noise with Liquid Voice, which can block the healing of Dark-types like Alolan Muk, but this restricts its coverage and allows Water Absorb Clodsire to wall it.

Calm Mind (Fairy).description:
With an excellent typing and serviceable Speed and bulk, Primarina is one of the better users of Calm Mind for Fairy teams, as it deals with common roadblocks for Fairy like Corviknight, Clodsire, and Gouging Fire. Psychic Noise prevents all forms of recovery, making it harder for walls like the aforementioned Clodsire and Articuno to keep up with Primarina. Coincidentally, Psychic Noise also helps Primarina muscle past other bulky setup sweepers like Gouging Fire and Clefable. Draining Kiss improves Primarina's longevity and threatens Dragon- and Dark-types like Roaring Moon and Chien-Pao. Surf sweeps away Heatran, Skarmory, and Ursaluna-B, all of which are nuisances for Fairy teams. 60 Speed EVs let Primarina outspeed Corviknight and prevent it from recovering with Psychic Noise, making it easier to wear down, while the rest of the EVs are invested in Defense and HP to improve Primarina's matchup against Gouging Fire.

Due to Primarina's relatively low Defense stat, dual screens support from Klefki is vital for its success, as it lets Primarina check Swords Dance Ceruledge and Gouging Fire. In return, Primarina deals with Clodsire, Gouging Fire, and Corviknight, which all take advantage of Klefki. Iron Valiant deals with Ogerpon formes, Kyurem, and Landorus, which overwhelm Primarina, and also deals with bulky Steel-types like Kingambit and Hisuian Goodra with Close Combat and Ice Punch. In return, Primarina checks Gouging Fire, which can take advantage of Choice-locked Iron Valiant. Choice Specs Flutter Mane outspeeds and vaporizes Choice Specs Greninja, Choice Specs Latios, Spectrier, and Ogerpon-H; in return, Primarina breaks down defensive Pokemon such as Articuno, Corviknight, Clodsire, and Skarmory for it. Entry hazards, especially Toxic Spikes, greatly hinder Primarina's ability to set up, so Primarina greatly appreciates Hatterene's ability to bounce back entry hazards with Magic Bounce. Hatterene also has a wide array of supportive moves like Nuzzle and Healing Wish which help circumvent Primarina's low Speed and give it a second chance to sweep. For instance, being able to slow down Articuno and Tornadus and subject Corviknight and Toxapex to the prospect of getting fully paralyzed makes Primarina's job easier. Belly Drum Azumarill is a secondary sweeper that deals with Hisuian Goodra and Alolan Muk, which Primarina struggles to beat, and it's also able to threaten Kingambit and Gliscor more. Choice Scarf Enamorus deals with fast threats like Dragapult and Choice Specs Greninja with Moonblast and loves Primarina being able to soften up opposing teams. Enamorus also provides Healing Wish, which gives Primarina a second chance to threaten opposing teams. Clefable can form a Calm Mind core with Primarina to overload special walls like Articuno and Alolan Muk, or it can set Stealth Rock and slow down the opposing team for Primarina with Thunder Wave. Mimikyu provides a failsafe against sweepers like Ceruledge due to Disguise, and it can use a Swords Dance set to clean up opposing teams late-game.

Calm Mind (Water).description:
With Calm Mind, Primarina turns into a great option for Water teams against Fighting and Dragon teams, being able to threaten the likes of Iron Defense Zamazenta and Hydreigon. When running Liquid Voice, Psychic Noise turns into Primarina's main Water-type STAB move, while running Torrent makes it great coverage against Clodsire. Draining Kiss is Primarina's main source of longevity, being especially effective against the aforementioned Fighting- and Dragon-types. When running Liquid Voice, Primarina can run Ice Beam to threaten Garchomp, Gliscor, and both Landorus formes. Surf is the better option for Primarina when it chooses to run Torrent so it has a stronger Water-type STAB attack. Alternatively, Encore can be used to take advantage of slower walls like Ting-Lu by locking them into an undesirable move. 60 Speed EVs allow Primarina to outspeed Corviknight and some Ursaluna-B variants.

Primarina struggles against Poison-types such as Alolan Muk and Sneasler; therefore, it appreciates teammates such as Swampert and Gastrodon to check them. The two of them also provide an Electric immunity and entry hazard support. Toxapex absorbs Toxic Spikes while dealing with Grass-types that Primarina struggles with such as Meowscarada and the Ogerpon formes. In return, Primarina deals with some of Toxapex's checks like Great Tusk and Ursaluna-B. Keldeo and Urshifu-R are great offensive teammates that can muscle through Steel-types such as Archaludon, Hisuian Goodra, and Kingambit. Primarina deals with Iron Valiant in return. Choice Scarf Hisuian Samurott handles Ghost-types like Gholdengo, Dragapult, and Spectrier, and in return, Primarina threatens Fighting-types like Zamazenta, Urshifu-R, and Keldeo. Choice Specs Greninja handles threats that Primarina struggles against, such as the Ogerpon formes, opposing Primarina, Amoonguss, and Okidogi. Ogerpon-W pairs well offensively with Primarina, handling Landorus, Ursaluna-B, and Iron Treads, while Primarina deals with various Fighting-, Dragon-, and Dark-types like Urshifu-R, Roaring Moon, and Sableye.

Assault Vest (Fairy).description:
With an Assault Vest, Primarina leverages its natural special bulk to serve an incredible role on Fairy teams as a special tank, being able to take hits from the likes of Gholdengo, Iron Moth, and Landorus. Surf hits problematic Fire-types for Fairy such as Heatran and Iron Moth while also being able to force out Gholdengo and Spectrier before it uses Calm Mind. Moonblast hits Water-resistant foes like Hydrapple and Kyurem. Flip Turn gives Primarina a solid pivoting tool to switch out on threats it cannot handle, such as Alolan Muk, Articuno, and Hisuian Goodra. Finally, Psychic Noise allows Primarina to hit Poison-types like Amoonguss, Toxapex, and Okidogi. The EV spread used lets Primarina outspeed threats like Adamant Kingambit and Azumaril. The alternative EV spread is a bulkier set that outspeeds Corviknight and makes it more reliable against threats like Choice Specs Latios and Flutter Mane.

With Primarina's limited recovery options, Hatterene provides excellent support, being able to keep entry hazards off the field and allowing Primarina to come in safely. Hatterene can also spread paralysis against threats like Gholdengo, Tornadus-T, and Gallade using Nuzzle. Klefki can provide hazard and dual screens support, allowing Primarina to combat special walls like Alolan Muk and Hisuian Goodra. Clefable can provide hazard support in Stealth Rock, along with Wish support to heal Primarina. Flutter Mane appreciates Primarina's neutrality to Steel-type attacks from the likes of Choice Scarf Gholdengo, while Primarina appreciates Flutter Mane's strong movepool that can hinder problematic threats like Articuno, Ogerpon-H, and Raging Bolt. Flutter Mane also enjoys Primarina's Flip Turn to grant it safe entry. Primarina values physical Iron Valiant's ability to remove special walls like Blissey, Galarian Slowking, and Clodsire. In return, Iron Valiant takes advantage of Primarina's ability to take on threats like Choice Scarf Latios, Choice Specs Dragapult, and Choice Scarf Enamorus. Mimikyu appreciates Primarina's pivoting to grant it safe entry and setup opportunities. In exchange, Primarina welcomes Mimikyu's ability to remove threats like Flutter Mane and Iron Hands. Choice Scarf Enamorus can remove fasters threats like Sneasler and Iron Valiant and provide Healing Wish support.

Sticky Web (Electric).description:
200 Speed EVs lets Vikavolt outspeed Corviknight.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Ribombee.comments:
Other Options

Bug

Ribombee can also run a dual screens + Light Clay set to further facilitate its team's setup attempts, dropping Stun Spore and Quiver Dance; however, the loss of Focus Sash is notable and getting both Reflect and Light Screen up at times can be difficult due to Ribombee's very lacking bulk. Skill Swap can be used over Quiver Dance in order to force Gliscor out by removing its Poison Heal, since Gliscor is a major problem for Bug teams.

Sticky Web Lead (Bug).description:
Ribombee is the premier Sticky Web setter for Bug teams thanks to its high Speed, access to further utility in Stun Spore, and Shield Dust letting it always get Sticky Web up against threats such as Choice Scarf Sneasler without worrying about status conditions. Moonblast allows Ribombee to hit Dark- and Fighting-types such as Chien-Pao and Great Tusk, which can either outspeed Ribombee or remove Sticky Web thanks to Rapid Spin. Stun Spore allows Ribombee to annoy threats such as Flutter Mane and Choice Scarf Walking Wake, letting its teammates outspeed and remove said foes later on in the game. Quiver Dance allows Ribombee to exert pressure throughout a game while potentially turning it into a win condition in the Dragon and Fighting matchups if it is not needed as a lead. Focus Sash lets Ribombee get Sticky Web up as a lead without having to fear being OHKOed due to its poor bulk.

Choice Scarf Kleavor is an excellent teammate for Ribombee, as it appreciates being able to outspeed nearly everything in the metagame under Sticky Web, including opposing Choice Scarf users such as Roaring Moon and Meowscarada. It also appreciates Ribombee hitting Fighting-types, such as Great Tusk and Iron Valiant, with Moonblast, allowing it to spam Stone Axe late-game to clean up weakened teams. In return, Kleavor threatens Fire-types such as Torkoal and Moltres that Bug teams struggle to break through. It also compounds with Ribombee's entry hazard pressure thanks to Stone Axe setting Stealth Rock. Swords Dance Scizor is another good teammate for Ribombee, as it appreciates being able to hit normally-faster threats that don't mind Bullet Punch, like Heatran and Walking Wake, hard thanks to Sticky Web not forcing it to rely on Bullet Punch for damage. In compensation, Scizor uses its Poison immunity to come in on threats such as Choice Scarf Sneasler that would otherwise threaten Ribombee and use them as a setup opportunity. It also removes Hatterene, which is invaluable to let Ribombee set up Sticky Web. Slither Wing is another great teammate, as it removes common Steel-types such as Hisuian Goodra and Empoleon that Ribombee wouldn't be able to do much against. Forretress can keep hazards off of the field to enhance Ribombee's late-game sweeping potential and preserve its Focus Sash while being able to set hazards itself and take on threats such as Kingambit with Body Press. It also, similarly to Kleavor, can add to the hazard pressure by setting Spikes. Volcarona benefits greatly from Sticky Web, as after one Quiver Dance, it outspeeds Choice Scarf users that would otherwise attempt to revenge kill it, such as Roaring Moon and Urshifu-R. Ribombee, in turn, appreciates the fact that Volcarona can switch in on threats such as Gholdengo and stay healthy while being able to hit Steel-types with a strong Fiery Dance. Lokix can clean teams weakened by Ribombee thanks to its strong U-turn and First Impression while hitting Ghost-types such as Skeledirge and Gholdengo that pose large roadblocks for Bug teams and amplifying the effects of Sticky Web with Knock Off. In exchange, Lokix appreciates being able to outspeed common threats such as Choice Specs Flutter Mane under Sticky Web. Heracross can, in a similar vein to Slither Wing, deal with Steel-types such as Heatran and Kingambit while also using Knock Off to both remove key items from defensive behemoths such as Toxapex and increase the effects of Sticky Web on the opposing team. It appreciates Sticky Web to patch up its lackluster Speed. Finally, Frosmoth is another Quiver Dance user that has massive special bulk thanks to Ice Scales that also appreciates Sticky Web patching up its low Speed.

Choice Band.description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Choice Band (Rock).description:
Lycanroc-D is a great choice for Rock teams thanks to its offensive presence and good Speed tier, which allows it to outspeed and get rid of threats like Urshifu-R, Walking Wake, and Iron Treads. An excellent ability combined with a STAB priority move in Accelerock allows Lycanroc-D to revenge kill foes that greatly threaten Rock teams like Chien-Pao, Belly Drum Azumarill, and Shell Smash Cloyster. With Choice Band, Stone Edge 2HKOes Corviknight. Close Combat deals with Normal-, Rock-, Dark- and Steel-types like Ursaluna, Tyranitar, Ting-Lu, Iron Treads, and Hisuian Goodra. Psychic Fangs not only breaks screens in the Fairy matchup, but it also deals with Fighting- and Poison-types like Urshifu-R, Great Tusk, Toxapex, Amoonguss, and Clodsire. Play Rough is another option to deal with Dragon- and Dark- types like Walking Wake, Garchomp, Hydreigon, and Sableye.

Garganacl pairs well with Lycanroc-D, as Salt Cure wears down defensive Pokemon Lycanroc-D struggles with such as Quagsire and Corviknight. In return, Garganacl benefits from Lycanroc-D's ability to remove wallbreakers such as Walking Wake and Urshifu-R which threaten Garganacl's Iron Defense + Body Press set. Tyranitar is an essential teammate as it sets up sand to further chip down walls and checks threats like Flutter Mane, Espathra, and Kingambit due to its sheer bulk and great coverage in Heavy Slam, Crunch, and Low Kick. Hisuian Arcanine's wallbreaking power covers walls that are harder for Lycanroc-D to take down, dealing with Toxapex and Corviknight with Head Smash and Flare Blitz, respectively. Kleavor is a great lead, as Stone Axe sets up Stealth Rock to break through any opposing Focus Sash, allowing Lycanroc-D and Hisuian Arcanine to clean teams more easily. It can also pivot into Lycanroc-D with U-turn, luring in foes like Toxapex, Iron Treads, and Heatran in the process. Choice item Glimmora's colorful moveset helps against walls like Quagsire and Toxapex through the use of Energy Ball and Earth Power, with Choice Scarf allowing Glimmora to outspeed and take down fast offensive threats such as Iron Valiant and Greninja if they aren't running Choice Scarf. Coalossal removes entry hazards with Rapid Spin, checks Scizor, Chien-Pao, and Kingambit with Flamethrower and Body Press, and can burn threats with Flame Body. Iron Defense + Calm Mind Diancie can check Garchomp with Moonblast. Shell Smash Air Balloon Drednaw provides a temporary Ground-type immunity and appreciates defensive walls being worn down by Lycanroc-D. In return, it readily cleans weakened Flying and Ground teams, eliminating threats like Landorus-T and Great Tusk.

Toxapex.comments:
Other Options

Water

Eject Button is a solid choice Toxapex can run on rain teams, as it allows for Toxapex to become a one-time pivot to keep up offensive momentum. Eject Button can still be ran without rain, but its need for momentum preservation is less desired and can lead to Toxapex being forced out against a threat it would need to land Toxic or Haze against such as Sinistcha.

Poison

Air Balloon can serve a crucial niche, allowing Toxapex to wall Ceruledge once its Air Balloon is popped, along with granting it a temporary Ground immunity that allows it to pivot in on Choice-locked Ground-types like Excadrill and Mamoswine safely. Baneful Bunker can be used over Toxic and Toxic Spikes with Infestation and Black Sludge, enabling Toxapex to easily trap and wear down targets like Choice Band Gouging Fire and Barraskewda, as Baneful Bunker can spread poison and help Toxapex recover with Black Sludge simultaneously. Using both Surf and Infestation is a viable tactic that allows Toxapex to trap and eliminate Toxic-immune targets such as Klefki and Galarian Weezing while also wearing down certain targets greatly, such as Archaludon and Alolan Muk, during Infestation's trapping turns to either remove or cripple checks to teammates such as Okidogi and Iron Moth.

Water (Physically Defensive)

Liquidation and Surf allow Toxapex to not be countered by opposing Steel-types, being able to hit targets like Scizor and Skarmory. Of course, this gives up one of Toxapex's valuable utility options or even its Poison-type STAB moves, which can hinder Toxapex in other matchups.

Mixed Wall (Water).description:
A spread with mixed bulk investment can allow Toxapex's walling capabilities to be expanded to more reliably check special attackers such as Flutter Mane while still taking on physical threats like Meowscarada. Poison Jab puts pressure onto Grass- and Fairy-types like Hisuian Lilligant, Primarina, and Enamorus. Toxic forces bulkier foes such as Iron Hands and Gouging Fire on timers. Finally, Haze prevents the likes of Iron Defense Zamazenta and Swords Dance Hisuian Samurott from using Toxapex as a setup opportunity. Black Sludge allows Toxapex to stick around longer without requiring the usage of Recover, but Heavy-Duty Boots can be used to allow Toxapex safe entry in the face of entry hazards. The EV spread prevents a 2HKO from Meowscarada's Flower Trick and Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball.

Ogerpon-W serves as a wonderful teammate, as it is neutral to Electric-type attacks, can lock Raging Bolt into a setup move with Encore, and threatens Ground-types that handle Toxapex such as Great Tusk and Sandy Shocks while appreciating Toxapex's Poison Jab removing Grass-types like Meowscarada and Hisuian Lilligant that otherwise wall it. Swampert is immune to Electric and can use Earthquake to check Poison- and Steel-types that wall Toxapex such as Alolan Muk, Galarian Slowking, Heatran, and Gholdengo. Greninja can outspeed and remove Psychic-types such as Latios and Metagross and uses coverage such as Sludge Wave to deal with Grass-types Toxapex cannot handle such as the Ogerpon formes and Hydrapple or Ice Beam to break through Clodsire. Alternatively, Hisuian Samurott can be ran as the team's Dark-type, with Ceaseless Edge being a more reliable way of taking on Hoopa-U while setting up Spikes to wear down Toxapex's checks like Choice Specs Iron Moth. Keldeo and Urshifu-R provide solid ways to break Steel-types like Empoleon and Hisuian Goodra along with handling Kyurem. Primarina appreciates Toxapex absorbing Toxic Spikes and using Toxic to wear down targets such as Iron Hands and opposing Primarina, and in return, it can take on Dragon-types like Gouging Fire, Garchomp, and Roaring Moon.

Physically Defensive (Poison).description:
Thanks to its Water typing and incredible combination of defensive stats in tandem with Regenerator, Toxapex serves as a pivotal wall for Poison teams, taking on several key offensive threats such as Gouging Fire, Barraskewda, and Weavile. Surf provides a consistent form of damage for Toxapex and threatens Fire- and Rock-types like Moltres, Hisuian Arcanine, and Kleavor. Infestation can trap and wear down foes such as Hisuian Samurott and Keldeo, especially when paired with Toxic. Alternatively, Chilling Water can lower the Attack of would-be threats like Dragon Dance Gouging Fire and Bulk Up Okidogi, preventing them from sweeping the team. Haze enables Toxapex to remove buffs from setup sweepers such as Ceruledge, Scizor, and Urshifu-R. Toxic allows Toxapex to check Dragon Dance Gouging Fire and Volcarona, putting them on timers and enabling Poison teams to outlast them. Alternatively, Toxic Spikes can be used on teams already having a Toxic user to more reliably wear down types lacking good entry hazard removal, such as Dark and Ghost, forcing the majority of the opposing team on a timer. Heavy-Duty Boots prevents Toxapex from getting worn down when switching into threats such as Iron Boulder and Cloyster. Alternatively, Rocky Helmet punishes contact attackers such as Sneasler and allows Toxapex to counter Tidy Up Maushold. Finally, Black Sludge pairs well with Infestation, enabling Toxapex to stay in on trapped foes more reliably.

Amoonguss and Galarian Slowking pair excellently with Toxapex, creating a defensive Regenerator core for Poison teams, with Toxapex being the sturdiest physical wall out of the trio, handling threats like Meowscarada and Cloyster, which the other two cannot handle. In return, Amoonguss can come in on Ground- and Electric-types like Great Tusk, Sandy Shocks, and Regieleki to handle them with its Grass-type STAB moves, as well as dealing with setup sweepers such as Dragon Dance Dragapult and Swords Dance Ogerpon-W with Foul Play. Assault Vest Galarian Slowking complements Toxapex by being a specially bulky Regenerator wall, taking on the likes of Heatran, Latios, and Zapdos for Toxapex. Alolan Muk provides an incredible special wall, capable of taking on Psychic- and Ghost-type threats such as Galarian Slowking, Hatterene, Flutter Mane, and Spectrier. Galarian Weezing provides incredible Ground and Dragon immunities, which help it check threats like Mamoswine, Garchomp, and Hydrapple while spreading burns with Will-O-Wisp, making it easier for Toxapex to wall physical attackers like Kleavor. Galarian Weezing also appreciates Toxapex's Water typing to take on Steel-types attacks from the likes of Scizor and Tinkaton. Iron Moth enjoys Toxapex's ability to come in on Water-type moves from the likes of Choice Scarf Urshifu-R and Barraskewda. In return, Iron Moth can remove Steel- and Ice-types like non-Choice Scarf Iron Treads, Gholdengo, Alolan Sandslash, and Alolan Ninetales with its Fire-type STAB moves while also dealing with Landorus and Kyurem with Choice Specs-boosted Overheat. Sneasler and Okidogi can remove special walls that can absorb Toxapex's Toxic, such as Blissey, Hisuian Goodra, and Alolan Muk, with their powerful Fighting-type STAB moves, while appreciating Toxapex's Toxic wearing down physical walls like Sableye, Moltres, and Slowbro. Choice Scarf Sneasler can also reliably check threats such as Choice Scarf Hoopa-U, Iron Valiant, and the Ogerpon formes for Toxapex.

Physically Defensive (Water).description:
With its incredible bulk and Grass neutrality, Toxapex provides an essential check to many physical attackers such as Meowscarada and Sneasler. Its Poison-type STAB moves enable Toxapex to take on threatening Grass- and Fairy-types such as Meowscarada, Hisuian Lilligant, Primarina, and Hatterene, with Poison Jab being preferred over other Poison-type STAB moves thanks to its ability to beat bulky Calm Mind users such as Primarina and Hatterene. Haze prevents setup from Skarmory and Zamazenta, forcing them to attack into Toxapex's Rocky Helmet and take chip damage. Toxic can be used to force bulkier foes such as Sinistcha and Iron Hands onto dangerous timers; alternatively, Toxic Spikes can be used to force immediate pressure onto targets such as the Ogerpon formes upon entry and punish teams without solid entry hazard removal like Dragon and Water. Heavy Duty-Boots prevents Toxapex from being worn down, so it can continually find safe entry into foes like Meowscarada and Iron Boulder. However, Rocky Helmet punishes the plethora of contact attackers such as Scizor and Kleavor, while Black Sludge racks up recovery over time, enabling Toxapex to stay in longer against threats like Gouging Fire.

Swampert and Gastrodon make for an excellent defensive core, being able to take on many of the Electric-types that are tasked with removing Toxapex such as Raging Bolt, Magnezone, and Iron Hands and wear down Toxapex's checks like Kyurem with Stealth Rock support. Empoleon can similarly provide Stealth Rock support along with more reliably taking on the special Grass-types that Toxapex struggles against like Sinistcha and Hydrapple and being able to check Kyurem. Greninja provides a crucial Psychic immunity, threatens foes like Latios and Metagross, and uses its colorful coverage and blazing Speed tier to remove problematic offensive threats like the Ogerpon formes and Dragonite while apprecating Toxapex's ability to switch into faster physical targets like Meowscarada and Dragapult. Alternatively, Hisuian Samurott can take the role of the team's Dark-type attacker, being able to set up Spikes with Ceaseless Edge and more reliably remove targets like Hoopa-U and Gallade. Ogerpon-W is able to take on foes like Sandy Shocks and Rotom-W that check Toxapex otherwise while apprecating Toxapex's ability to wear down Grass-types that wall it such as Hydrapple. Keldeo and Urshifu-R are powerful wallbreakers that can handle Steel-types like Heatran, Hisuian Goodra, and Gholdengo that hardwall Toxapex otherwise. Primarina enjoys Toxapex being able to put targets like Ting-Lu and opposing Primarina onto timers while absorbing Poison-type moves from the likes of Sneasler and Alolan Muk, and in return, Primarina can take on powerful Dragon-types like Roaring Moon and Garchomp that can overwhelm Toxapex.

Sticky Web (Bug).description:
Araquanid makes for a good Sticky Web setter for Bug teams due to having more bulk than other Sticky Web setters, such as Galvantula and Ribombee, as well as being a huge asset to Bug teams with its Water Bubble ability, resisting Fire-type moves and hitting Fire-type Pokemon super effectively. Liquidation is a strong STAB move capable of 2HKOing common entry hazard removers such as Great Tusk and Iron Treads. Infestation helps trap and check Pokemon, such as Ting Lu and Klefki. Mirror Coat is used to take advantage of Araquanid's naturally good special bulk to OHKO threats such as Raging Bolt and Zapdos.

Choice Scarf Kleavor is a great teammate for Araquanid because it can deal with Fire- and Flying-types such as Ogerpon-H, Moltres, and Articuno. Kleavor's Stone Axe also synergizes nicely with Araquanid’s Sticky Web, as more entry hazards further help the sweepers and wallbreakers on the team while also breaking Ceruledge's Focus Sash, which would otherwise be a huge problem for Bug teams. Scizor is another great teammate for Araquanid, as Sticky Web enables it to set up with Swords Dance easier and also allows it to take out Iron Treads, Kingambit, and Choice Band Hisuian Arcanine. Volcarona also benefits from Sticky Web, as it outspeeds faster threats like Greninja and Iron Valiant at -1. Slither Wing and Lokix both appreciate Sticky Web, as it helps them revenge kill faster threats such as Gholdengo, Ogerpon-H, and Hisuian Arcanine. Forretress provides a strong physical wall on Bug teams, removes entry hazards with Rapid Spin, and is a slow pivot for Araquanid with Volt Switch to ensure its safe entry so it can repeatedly set up Sticky Web if needed.

Iron Defense (Bug).description:
Thanks to its unique ability and Water typing, Araquanid finds itself a niche outside of being a Sticky Web setter on Bug-type teams as a strong defensive option against brutal Fire-type attacks such as Flare Blitz and Flamethrower. Its naturally high Special Defense stat allows it to check threatening special attackers in Heatran and opposing Volcarona. Iron Defense allows Araquanid to boost alongside potent metagame setup sweepers and ignore their threat, such as Ceruledge, which prove troublesome to Bug-type teams. Infestation allows Araquanid to trap setup sweepers and bulkier Pokemon alike such as the aforementioned Quagsire, allowing it to freely boost with Iron Defense and take them on with Liquidation.

Forretress provides a crucial type neutrality to Rock- and Flying-type attacks headed towards Araquanid while also removing entry hazards with Rapid Spin. In return, Araquanid helps take on the aforementioned Fire-types such as Heatran and Volcarona. Choice Scarf Kleavor is another teammate for Bug teams, as it threatens Fire- and Flying-type threats like Ogerpon-H, Choice Band Hisuian Arcanine, and Gyarados with its Rock-type STAB moves, while also threatening Heatran with Close Combat. Additionally, it can set Stealth Rock with Stone Axe, forming an entry-hazard stacking core with Spikes from Forretress. Volcarona and Frosmoth are both powerful setup sweepers, with the former assisting Bug-type teams by taking out troublesome Steel-types that are unfavorable for Araquanid and Kleavor, such as Skarmory and Corviknight. On the other hand, Frosmoth can reliably deal with Ground-type Pokemon that act as a stopgap to Volcarona's sweeping potential, such as Clodsire and offensive Garchomp, after a Quiver Dance boost. Additionally, Frosmoth gains a significant boost in its ability to take Electric-type attacks that threaten Araquanid from foes such as Raging Bolt and Iron Valiant, thanks to its ability Ice Scales. In return, Araquanid, as well as Kleavor, help deal with Heatran, which can render both Volcarona and Frosmoth useless. Lastly, Scizor is another setup sweeper that is appreciated by Araquanid, as it is capable of handling setup sweepers that can wall Araquanid, such as Dragapult and Primarina, with its Technician-boosted Bullet Punch in tandem with Swords Dance.

Salazzle.overview:
Poison

Salazzle provides great disruption with moves like Encore and Corrosion Toxic, applying immense pressure against walls, and it's the second fastest Poison-type, which lets it outspeed the Ogerpon formes. Despite this, Glimmora can also provide Corrosion Toxic along with providing entry hazard support, and Iron Moth will generally act as a superior Fire-type option thanks to having a superior set of coverage options and vastly increased Special Attack.
Salazzle.comments:
Other Options

Poison

Overheat can be run with an EV spread of 112 HP / 144 SpA / 252 Spe to OHKO defensive Gholdengo and Torterra.

Toxic Spreader (Poison).description:
With Corrosion, Salazzle can inflict Toxic onto key defensive threats like Heatran, Empoleon, Amoonguss, and Toxapex, greatly decreasing their longevity. Flamethrower gives Salazzle some offensive pressure, letting it force out Steel-, Grass-, and Ice-type threats like Gholdengo, Brambleghast, and Alolan Sandslash. With Salazzle's high Speed, Encore can prevent threats like Sinistcha, Ursaluna-B, Okidogi, and Hydreigon from setting up, as well as lock Ogerpon formes into Swords Dance. Substitute paired with Black Sludge can allow Salazzle to accumulate Toxic damage on slower threats like Hisuian Goodra, along with finding repeated chances to safely set up Substitutes against foes that cannot break through them like Galarian Weezing and Amoonguss to effortlessly spread Toxic. Protect racks up Black Sludge healing and allows safe scouting against Choice-locked threats like Iron Valiant, Greninja, and Flutter Mane. Heavy-Duty Boots allows Salazzle to come in safely and land a Toxic.

With Salazzle's crippling Ground-type weakness, Galarian Weezing serves as a crucial ally thanks to its Ground immunity, being able to safely switch in on threats like Great Tusk, Mamoswine, and Quagsire, and ability to remove Stealth Rock to give Salazzle safe entry. Amoonguss helps to force out pesky Ground- and Water-types like Great Tusk, Gastrodon, and Ogerpon-W with Giga Drain and Foul Play. It can also use Spore to allow Salazzle safe entry to get up a free Substitute, while in return Amoonguss appreciates the removal of Steel-types like Gholdengo and Corviknight, which can use it as setup fodder. With its immense physical bulk and access to STAB Surf and Haze, Toxapex can deal with threats such as Scizor and Kleavor, while Salazzle limits foes like Articuno and Thundurus-T that majorly threaten Toxapex. Unaware Clodsire checks special setup sweepers like Kommo-o and Volcarona while also providing additional chip damage with Stealth Rock. Alolan Muk's superb special bulk and access to Knock Off and Poison Jab allow it to easily handle Ghost-type threats that force Salazzle out like Flutter Mane and Hisuian Zoroark. Overqwil, while not as specially bulky, can still serve as a solid Psychic- and Ghost-type response and works much better against threats like Gallade, Ceruledge, and Dragapult thanks to its high physical bulk and Intimidate. Galarian Slowking can create Future Sight traps to force in the team's opposing Dark-type or special walls like Alolan Muk and Hisuian Goodra, which Salazzle can take advantage of by getting in safely to either land a Toxic or set up a Substitute. Galarian Slowking also helps Salazzle by dealing with deadly special attackers like Volcanion, Iron Moth, and Walking Wake. Okidogi majorly appreciates Salazzle's Toxic shutting down bulky walls like Skeledirge, Quagsire, and Galarian Weezing by putting them on timers, and in return Okidogi handles threats like Heatran, Garganacl, and Bisharp with Drain Punch. Sneasler can use U-turn to bring Salazzle in on walls like Amoonguss, Klefki, and Toxapex and use them as an opportunity to get up a Substitute or land a critical Toxic. Meanwhile, Sneasler removes threats like Enamorus, Iron Valiant, and Kingambit. Choice Specs Icy Wind Gengar helps majorly in removing Gliscor, which can effortlessly switch into Salazzle thanks to Poison Heal. Thanks to STAB Shadow Ball and Thunderbolt, Gengar also helps in removing key threats like Landorus, Hatterene, and Dondozo, which majorly threaten Salazzle.

Minior.comments:
Other Options

(Rock)

Power Gem with a Naive nature allows Minior to hit Skarmory while also having an 100% accurate Rock-type move. Can instead run Earth Power with 8 Special Attack EVs and a Naive nature to OHKO Archaludon after a Shell Smash boost and Stealth Rock. However, Earthquake targets are more common, and running Earth Power notably makes Minior miss out on hitting Hisuian Goodra and Alolan Muk. An Adamant nature allows Minior to OHKO Iron Defense Zamazenta after a boost with +2 Acrobatics and after Stealth Rock chip.

Shell Smash (Rock).description:
Shell Smash Minior is a great sweeper for Rock teams due to its great Speed, being able to take out Choice Scarf users like Iron Valiant, Sneasler, and Meowscarada after a boost. Minior is also appreciated on Rock teams as a Ground-immune Pokemon. Stone Edge at +2 is able to take out targets like Gouging Fire, Pelipper, and Landorus. Acrobatics after a Shell Smash + White Herb boost is a hard-hitting STAB move, which allows Minior to take out Sneasler, Iron Valiant, non-Iron Defense Zamazenta, and Ogerpon-W. Earthquake deals with weakened Poison- and Steel-types like Toxapex, Alolan Muk, and Hisuian Goodra at +2. White Herb allows Minior to revert its negative stats back to neutral after a Shell Smash. It is also the easiest way to boost the Base Power of Acrobatics when compared to other items. Shields Down allows Minior to survive a Close Combat from Choice Scarf Great Tusk when above 50 of its HP, allowing it to be able to set up a Shell Smash afterwards; Minior also can't be statused when above 50 percent of its HP, which makes it very safe to set up against Toxapex or Clodsire.

Swords Dance Ogerpon-C is an amazing teammate, being able to take out Water-, Rock-, and Ground-types like Primarina, Azumarill, Garganacl, and Ursaluna-B at +2. Choice Band Hisuian Arcanine provides immediate wallbreaking power for Minior by being able to take out Corviknight and Skarmory with Flare Blitz. Alternatively, a defensive Hisuian Arcanine can handle the Steel matchup more effectively, notably taking out Scizor. Choice Scarf Iron Boulder outspeeds and takes out fast threats if Minior has not gotten the opportunity to set up, notably eliminating Greninja and Meowscarada with Close Combat. Furthermore, Minior complements Iron Boulder by weakening Zamazenta and Iron Hands, which allows Iron Boulder to pick them off with Zen Headbutt. Glimmora, with its coverage options, takes out a plethora of threats like Archaludon, Hatterene, and Quagsire. With Toxic Debris, Glimmora also sets Toxic Spikes upon being hit, putting foes on timers. Furthermore, Glimmora removes Stealth Rock for Minior while also poisoning non-Steel- and Poison-types with Mortal Spin. IronPress Garganacl is a great stallbreaker that can set up on passive Water and Steel teams and wearing them down over time with Salt Cure. Coalossal is a nice wall for Minior, removing entry hazards with Rapid Spin and checking threats like Scizor, Kingambit, and Chien-Pao with Flamethrower and Body Press. In return, Minior takes out Iron Valiant, Sneasler, and Meowscarada with Acrobatics after a Shell Smash. Rhyperior is able to take out Scizor with Fire Punch.

Swords Dance (Fairy).description:
Mimikyu is one of Fairy's premier setup sweepers thanks to Disguise near guaranteeing one free turn to set up Swords Dance to boost its Attack. Play Rough is Mimikyu's strongest STAB move and allows Mimikyu to secure an OHKO on Iron Hands after a Swords Dance and also deals with bulky Great Tusk. Shadow Sneak lets Mimikyu revenge kill weakened offensive threats like Iron Moth and faster Ghost-type Pokemon such as Flutter Mane and Dragapult. Shadow Claw lets Mimikyu break past bulkier Ghost-type Pokemon such as Gholdengo and Skeledirge more readily compared to Shadow Sneak, while Drain Punch is an alternative that threatens opposing Steel-types such as Magnezone and Kingambit. Mimikyu's preferred item is Life Orb to boost its damage output as much as possible.

One of Mimikyu's best partners on Fairy teams is Klefki. Mimikyu appreciates Spikes from Klefki, which allows Mimikyu to take down Pokemon easier after a Swords Dance boost. In return, Mimikyu can block Rapid Spin, allowing Klefki's hazards to stay up during the course of the game. Flutter Mane is often paired with Mimikyu since it can threaten physically defensive pokemon that give Mimikyu a hard time like Amoonguss, Quagsire, and Forretress and also faster offensive threats like Iron Moth and Kilowattrel. Mimikyu is able to break through specially defensive Pokemon like Dragalge which gives Flutter Mane an easier time. Hatterene is also a good partner for Mimikyu, as it can bounce back debilitating status conditions like Will-O-Wisp from Sableye and Thunder Wave from Klefki and also bounces back hazards, which helps with Mimikyu's longevity since it runs Life Orb. Furthermore, Mimikyu with its Disguise up can check opposing Ghost-type Pokemon like Flutter Mane and Gholdengo for Hatterene. Iron Valiant is also one of Mimikyu's best offensive teammates, as special sets are able to threaten other physically defensive Pokemon like Dondozo. Additionally, Iron Valiant is useful for Mimikyu in the Ground matchup, where a Choice Specs set can check answers to Mimikyu, such as Quagsire and Clodsire, using Psyshock. Azumarill can use Belly Drum against Steel teams and weaken foes like Orthworm and revenge kill Iron Treads with Aqua Jet.

Swords Dance (Ghost).description:
Mimikyu is a staple on Ghost-type teams, as Disguise allows it to deal with Dark-types and faster threats such as Barraskewda. Swords Dance can further take advantage of Disguise. Play Rough threatens Dark- and Fighting-types such as Meowscarada, Krookodile, and Quaquaval. Shadow Sneak picks off faster threats that could otherwise revenge kill Mimikyu, such as Dragapult and Flutter Mane. Drain Punch helps against Steel-types like Kingambit and offers some recovery—Disguise's recoil, entry hazards, and Life Orb damage can wear Mimikyu down pretty easily. Wood Hammer can potentially be used over Drain Punch to hit Pokemon such as Quagsire better, but the recoil damage isn't appreciated. Mimikyu's mediocre Attack forces it to use Life Orb to significantly damage neutral targets.

All of Mimikyu's teammates appreciate its ability to take on Dark-type teams. Froslass and Brambleghast can place Spikes to help Mimikyu clean up and use Taunt or Rapid Spin, respectively, so opposing entry hazards don't wear it down. Choice Scarf Flutter Mane helps Mimikyu against both Dark- and Dragon-type teams by taking down faster threats that could KO it after Disguise has been removed, such as Meowscarada and Chien-Pao, which resist Shadow Sneak. Nasty Plot Gholdengo deals with bulkier teams like Ground and Poison teams, as well as absorbing Toxic from bulky walls such as Toxapex. Furthermore, Gholdengo can also run Trick with a Choice item, which can cripple annoying walls such as Quagsire and Dondozo to help Mimikyu deal with them. Polteageist can clean up Poison teams after Skuntank is KOed, as well as Ground, Water, and Fighting teams. Spiritomb can tank some Dark-type attacks so that Mimikyu needn't waste Disguise's protection. Skeledirge can take some hits from foes like Iron Valiant and Dragalge for the same benefit. Dragapult can use a Dragon Dance set to boost against faster Pokemon that threaten Mimikyu, such as Iron Moth.

Kommo-o.comments:
Other Options

Dragon (Clangorous Soul)

Drain Punch is a good option to hit special walls like Ting-Lu and Heatran harder and increases longevity; however, without Vacuum Wave, Dragon heavily struggles against Ice and Dark, specifically against Chien-Pao and Play Rough Meowscarada. Boomburst, also activating Throat Spray, allows Kommo-o to hit Pokemon resistant to Dragon and Fighting like Iron Valiant and Galarian Weezing. An EV spread of 24 HP / 68 Def / 212 SpA / 204 Spe outpaces Dragapult after a Clangorous Soul boost, prevents Kommo-o from being OHKOed by Chien-Pao after a Swords Dance and Choice Scarf Dragapult's Dragon Darts, and in return OHKOes Chien-Pao and Dragapult with Vacuum Wave and Clanging Scales, respectively. Taunt may be used to prevent Haze or Whirlwind from Toxapex and Ting-Lu, respectively, although it means Kommo-o misses out on vital coverage. Flash Cannon can be used to aid in the Fairy and Ice matchups, hitting Iron Valiant, Mamoswine, Hatterene, and Alolan Ninetales.

Dragon (Choice Spec)

Heavy-Duty Boots can be ran in order to let Kommo-o enter the field without fear of entry hazards like Spikes set by Skarmory, but Choice Specs' immediate breaking power is usually preferred.

Clangorous Soul (Dragon).description:
Kommo-o cements itself as an excellent setup sweeper on Dragon teams due to it's respectable offensive stats, great bulk, access to Clangorous Soul, and setup ability, using Pokemon like Hisuian Samurott, Kingambit, and Alolan Sandslash as setup fodder, heavily aiding in the Dark and Ice matchups. Clanging Scales is Kommo-o's best move for Pokemon like Toxapex, Gastrodon, and Gliscor. Furthermore, Clanging Scales and Clangorous Soul both trigger Throat Spray, enhancing Kommo-o's wallbreaking capabilities. Vacuum Wave notably picks off Chien-Pao without a Clangorous Soul boost, Meowscarada at +2 Special Attack, and hits other faster threats like Greninja and Mamoswine. Flamethrower threatens Steel- and Ice-type Pokemon such as Corviknight, Gholdengo, and Avalugg. Soundproof prevents Kommo-o from being hit by Clanging Scales from opposing Kommo-o as well as being phazed out by Piloswine and Empoleon's Roar.

Hisuian Goodra is an excellent check for Fairy-types, as Kommo-o is effectively helpless against the type, fighting off Flutter Mane, Hatterene, and Clefable as well as helping against Ice-types like Articuno and Alolan Ninetales. Dragapult threatens the aforementioned Flutter Mane with a Choice Specs, Choice Band, or Dragon Dance set and hinders and potentially removes offensive Pokemon such as Iron Valiant and Chien-Pao via Thunder Wave and Will-O-Wisp with a utility Hex set, helping Kommo-o set up easier in the Fighting and Dark matchups. Dragapult appreciates the removal of Steel-types and threats like Meowscarada, Urshifu, and Chien-Pao. Cyclizar's entry hazard removal is greatly valued, and it offers Kommo-o easy setup with Shed Tail. Garchomp enhances Kommo-o's wallbreaking with entry hazard stacking and also helps in the Poison and Steel matchups, weakening walls like Empoleon, Alolan Muk, and Toxapex for Kommo-o late-game. Choice Scarf Roaring Moon outpaces and removes Psychic- and Ghost-types such as Jirachi, Gholdengo, and Flutter Mane and revenge kills Fairy-types like Iron Valiant with Iron Head. Walking Wake is capable of outpacing and OHKOing Chien-Pao and Baxcalibur with its Choice Scarf set and heavily pressuring Steel and Poison team walls like Corviknight, Heatran, and Clodsire with a Choice Specs set, allowing Kommo-o to efficiently clean up late-game. Dragalge offers Toxic Spikes support and provides a check to Fairy-types such as Iron Valiant, Flutter Mane, and Enamorus. Dragonite threatens specially defensive foes like Empoleon, Clodsire, and Alolan Muk and in return appreciates Kommo-o's removal of Corviknight, Air Balloon Gholdengo, and Chien-Pao.

Choice Specs (Dragon).description:
Choice Specs Kommo-o is a great wallbreaker for Dragon teams thanks to its incredible STAB combination, respectable Special Attack stat, and good STAB options. Aura Sphere is Kommo-o's Fighting-type STAB option on this set, hitting Steel-, Ice-, and Normal-types like Heatran, Archaludon, Alolan Sandslash, and Ursaluna-B that otherwise trouble Dragon teams. Clanging Scales punishes Fighting-immune foes, like Spectrier and Dragapult, that attempt to predict an Aura Sphere from Kommo-o. Vacuum Wave lets Kommo-o pick off massive threats to Dragon teams like Choice Band Chien-Pao, Choice Band Excadrill, and Kingambit. Flamethrower allows Kommo-o to threaten Gholdengo, which can otherwise wall it, very hard, while Flash Cannon provides coverage against miscellaneous Fairy-types like Clefable and Hatterene. Soundproof is the chosen ability in order to help against opposing Kommo-o as well as against Psychic Noise users like Hoopa-U.

Both Archaludon and Hisuian Goodra help with Kommo-o's debilitating Fairy weakness by dealing with physical and special attackers respectively: Archaludon deals with threats like Azumarill that can use Kommo-o as a setup opportunity, while Hisuian Goodra can sponge attacks from the likes of Choice Scarf Flutter Mane, Choice Specs Iron Valiant, and Primarina. Archaludon also provides Stealth Rock support, a welcome tool to help Kommo-o break through and revenge kill foes. Both can handle opposing Dragon-types on their respective sides as well; Archaludon can cover against Dragon Dance Dragapult, while Hisuian Goodra can handle Latios. Choice Scarf Roaring Moon appreciates Kommo-o's ability to threaten Steel-types that can take it on like Skarmory, and in return it provides speed control and acts as a check to Psychic-types like Choice Scarf Hoopa-U and Galarian Slowking. Dragon Dance Dragapult can hit Ghost-types like Choice Specs Flutter Mane while appreciating Kommo-o's Dark resistance and ability to take on Kingambit. Gouging Fire can also take on miscellaneous Fairy-types, although to a lesser extent than the other two, and it can also set up and potentially sweep weakened teams once its answers, like Air Balloon Heatran, are taken out by Kommo-o. Both Latios and Latias are great teammates for Kommo-o, as they provide welcome speed control as well as help in the Psychic and Fighting matchups, two major struggles for Kommo-o. Latias also provides very helpful utility in the form of Healing Wish and Trick to render checks like Galarian Slowking much less potent.
