Dragon Dance (Dragon).description: This is a winning set from the Monotype Rising sets project. This will be updated as we work on new analyses. Stay tuned!

Clangorous Soul (Fighting).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Choice Band.description:
Choice Band Rillaboom functions as both a strong wallbreaker and late-game sweeper thanks to Grassy Glide. It also provides great support with Grassy Terrain, both boosting its teammates' Grass-type STAB moves and granting them a form of recovery. Thanks to Grassy Glide, not only does Rillaboom dismantle walls like Empoleon and Garganacl with ease, but it also targets faster threats such as Iron Boulder, Flutter Mane, and Keldeo. Wood Hammer removes targets that Grassy Glide wouldn't fare well against like Toxapex and Gliscor. Knock Off grants coverage against Ghost-types like Dragapult, Gholdengo, and Brambleghast and removes items from the likes of Corviknight and Dragonite. Alternatively, High Horsepower targets bulky Poison- and Steel-types such as Alolan Muk, Hisuian Goodra, and Heatran. U-turn allows Rillaboom to pivot one of its teammates in safely while still dealing big damage to the likes of Meowscarada and Hydreigon. A Jolly nature allows Rillaboom to outspeed and threaten non-Choice Scarf Gholdengo and speed tie with unboosted Kingdra.

Brambleghast aids Rillaboom's wallbreaking thanks to its Spikes wearing down incoming foes and Rapid Spin removing entry hazards so Rillaboom has more opportunities to switch in. Brambleghast is also able to switch in against an anticipated Hurricane, Blizzard, or Heat Wave thanks to its Wind Rider ability. Amoonguss makes for another great teammate, being able to immobilize a check to Rillaboom like Galarian Weezing or Sneasler with Spore and punish physical attackers that threaten Rillaboom such as Scizor with Foul Play. Rillaboom forms strong wallbreaking cores with special attackers like Sinistcha and Hydrapple. It checks Flutter Mane and Ting-Lu for them, and in return, Sinistcha handles Zamazenta as well as potentially spreading burns with Matcha Gotcha, while Hydrapple can set up and deal with Archaludon if it is not running Draco Meteor. Ogerpon-H and Ogerpon-C remove foes that Rillaboom struggles with. Specifically, Ogerpon-H deals with Corviknight, Amoonguss, and Choice Specs Iron Crown, while Ogerpon-C handles Moltres and unboosted Volcarona. In return, Rillaboom deals with faster threats such as Choice Scarf Landorus and Greninja. Choice Scarf Meowscarada outspeeds and threatens speedy threats like Chien-Pao and Choice Scarf Roaring Moon, and thanks to Protean, it improves Grass's matchup against types like Dragon. Rillaboom's wallbreaking paves the way for opportunities for Hisuian Lilligant to clean late-game. .

Cinderace.comments:
Other Options

Fire

Gunk Shot is an alternative to make Cinderace more efficient at defeating Fairy-types, getting rid of foes such as Primarina, Iron Valiant and Azumarill.

Choice Scarf.description:
Cinderace is a staple on Fire teams thanks to its incredible Speed tier and coverage, which allow it to take advantage of Libero to sweep effectively. With Choice Scarf, Cinderace outspeeds and OHKOes foes like Iron Valiant, non-Choice Scarf Greninja, and non-Choice Scarf Flutter Mane. Gunk Shot allows Cinderace to hit Fairy-types like Primarina and Azumarill, which resist Pyro Ball. Gunk Shot also secures an OHKO against threats like Ogerpon-H and Ogerpon-W. High Jump Kick allows Cinderace to hit foes like non-Choice Scarf Greninja and Heatran, the latter of which being immune to both Pyro Ball and Gunk Shot. Additionally, using High Jump Kick removes Cinderace's weaknesses to Rock and Dark so it can handle threats from Ogerpon-C's Ivy Cudgel and Hisuian Arcanine's Head Smash more easily. U-turn grants Cinderace the ability to act as a pivot on Fire teams, luring in its common checks like Landorus and Great Tusk.

Teammates like Torkoal and Ninetales are ideal on sun teams, with the former setting and removing entry hazards with Stealth Rock and Rapid Spin, respectively, and the latter supporting teams with Healing Wish. Furthermore, Ninetales can use Solar Beam under sun to take down annoying foes like Gastrodon and Great Tusk. Ogerpon-H is a great wallbreaking partner that provides aid against Water- and Ground-type threats like Dondozo, Swampert, Ursaluna, and Gliscor, which Cinderace may have difficulty breaking. Heatran is an inordinately good partner for Cinderace thanks to its neutrality to Rock and it can not only set up Stealth Rock to boost Cinderace's sweeping capabilities but also switch into predicted Ground-type attacks if it's holding an Air Balloon. Furthermore, it can trap foes like Toxapex and Clodsire with Magma Storm and damage them with Earth Power in tandem with Taunt to prevent them from recovering. Volcanion provides a much-needed Water immunity thanks to Water Absorb, in addition to dealing with Ground-type foes like Great Tusk, Landorus, and Gliscor if it is running Air Balloon. Talonflame is a splendid pivot with access to U-turn and a much-needed Ground immunity. Furthermore, it can also use Defog to remove hazards from the field and prevent chip damage to Cinderace while also taking out fast Fighting-type threats like Sneasler and Iron Valiant with priority Brave Bird thanks to Gale Wings. Ceruledge is a great example of a setup sweeper, breaking teams with +2 Poltergeist and Bitter Blade; however, foes like Porygon2 and Terapagos may cause trouble for it, in which case Cinderace can deal with them using High Jump Kick. Lastly, Volcarona is an amazing setup sweeper that complements Cinderace's sweeping potential by setting up with Quiver Dance and 2HKOing foes like Toxapex and Clodsire with Psychic. In return, Cinderace deals with Heatran, which can completely wall Volcarona.

Offensive Utility.description:
Cinderace is a great asset to Fire teams due to its mix of offensive presence and utility. Pyro Ball deals a lot of damage under sun and comes with the nice touch of not activating Libero. Libero-boosted High Jump Kick provides valuable coverage, hitting Archaludon, Hydreigon, and Garganacl. Low Kick is an alternative, letting Cinderace deal decent damage to most heavy foes such as Archaludon and Heatran without the large risk of High Jump Kick's crash damage. With minimal chip damage, Libero-boosted Sucker Punch OHKOes Choice Specs Dragapult and Latios that resist the combination of Pyro Ball and High Jump Kick and can also pick up KOs on weakened foes such as Flutter Mane. U-turn can be used as an option over either High Jump Kick or Sucker Punch, letting Cinderace keep momentum against foes it cannot threaten out like defensive Great Tusk and Garchomp. Lastly, Court Change gives Cinderace hazard control, helping the team stay healthy.

Torkoal and Ninetales are natural teammates for Cinderace, as they provide sun to boost Cinderace's Pyro Ball damage and can help by removing entry hazards from the field and healing Cinderace with Healing Wish, respectively. In return, Cinderace can keep hazards off for Ninetales and Torkoal, letting them run Heat Rock to maximize sun's duration. Ogerpon-H and Ceruledge both appreciate support from Cinderace, as it can keep hazards off their side, bolstering their sweeping potential, while they can break through defensive cores in the Flying and Dragon matchups, effortlessly disposing of Gliscor, Dragonite, and Garchomp. Heatran is another great partner for Cinderace, as it deals with defensive Pokemon like Toxapex with Magma Storm and offensive Pokemon like Choice Specs Flutter Mane. Finally, both variants of Volcarona benefit from Court Change support. Defensive Volcarona is a wincon against types such as Flying and Fighting that are reliant on physical attackers like Dragonite and Urshifu-R to take it out and can spread burns against foes like Great Tusk and Clodsire with Will-O-Wisp to facilitate a late-game sweep from Cinderace, while offensive Volcarona can hit a wide array of targets such as Gastrodon, Hippowdon, Swampert, and Toxapex with the appropriate coverage in Giga Drain and Psychic.

Specially Defensive (Flying).description:
Specially defensive Corviknight serves an important role on Flying by being able to sponge special attacks from the likes of Frosmoth, Greninja, and Flutter Mane. Iron Head threatens the Fairy- and Ice-types that can scare Flying, like Hatterene, Iron Valiant, and Kyurem. U-turn allows for Corviknight to safely pivot in teammates. Defog eases entry for teammates like Choice Band Dragonite. The given EV spread maximizes Corviknight's special bulk while allowing it to OHKO Flutter Mane with Iron Head.

The Landorus formes can check problematic Electric-, Fire-, and Steel-types like Raging Bolt, Hisuian Arcanine, and Gholdengo for Corviknight while appreciating it being able to take on special Ice-type attacks from the likes of Articuno and Darkrai. Choice Scarf variants of the Landorus formes can also outspeed and remove Flutter Mane and Hoopa-U. Gliscor threatens Electric- and Steel-types like Sandy Shocks and Heatran while also providing Toxic support to wear down bulky targets like Swampert and Pelipper. Skarmory serves as a solid defensive partner for Corviknight, being able to comfortably take on physical Rock- and Ice-types like Kleavor and Cetitan, as well as other physical threats like Meowscarada, along with providing entry hazard support. Dragonite greatly appreciates Corviknight handling Fairy-types like Flutter Mane and Hatterene. In return, Dragonite can easily remove Fire-types such as Iron Moth and Ninetales and pick off threats like Meowscarada with Extreme Speed. Assault Vest Tornadus-T assists Corviknight by using Knock Off to remove Choice Specs from the likes of Flutter Mane, giving Corviknight an easier time handling them. Additionally, Tornadus-T can use its Flying-type attack to remove Iron Valiant and Ogerpon-W. Zapdos can handle Water-types that resist Corviknight's Iron Head like Toxapex, Empoleon, and Swords Dance Urshifu-R along with checking opposing Corviknight. Choice Scarf Enamorus deals with Dragon- and Dark-types like Choice Specs Dragapult, Choice Specs Greninja, and Hisuian Samurott along with providing Healing Wish for Corviknight if necessary. Gyarados can help to stave off physical threats like Cinderace, Barraskewda, and Gallade along with spreading paralysis, enabling Corviknight to outspeed Glimmora, which makes it easier to check.

Bulk Up (Steel).description:
Bulk Up Corviknight serves as a solid wincon for Steel teams thanks to its solid natural bulk and Flying typing, granting it a key immunity and neutrality to Ground and Fighting, respectively. Brave Bird is Corviknight's main offensive tool, easily removing Fighting-types like Gallade, Sneasler, and Scrafty along with dealing with other problematic foes like Dragapult and Ogerpon-W. Body Press provides a solid complement to Brave Bird, helping to deal with the Steel- and Rock-types that resist Brave Bird such as Bisharp, Empoleon, and Ogerpon-C. Alternatively, Taunt can be used to stop attempts to handle Corviknight with opposing threats such as Whirlwind Hippowdon and Haze Toxapex; otherwise, Substitute enables Corviknight to easily set up in front of the likes of Dragon Tail Garchomp, punishes defensive pivots such as Mandibuzz and opposing Corviknight, and grants it a safety net against wallbreakers that would otherwise threaten it out. The main EV spread maximizes Corviknight's special bulk, while the alternative EV spread can be used to let Corviknight outspeed Skarmory and use Taunt against it before it can set up Iron Defense or Roost, enabling Corviknight to eventually win.

Heatran serves as an excellent teammate, easily taking on the Fire-types that would handle Corviknight such as Iron Moth, Skeledirge, and opposing Heatran along with absorbing Will-O-Wisp from the likes of Dragapult and Moltres. Iron Treads's Ground typing allows it to easily handle the Electric-types that threaten Corviknight like Raging Bolt and Sandy Shocks; it also removes Landorus with Ice Spinner, preventing it from grounding Corviknight with Gravity. Gholdengo can help Corviknight by using Thunder Wave to slow down threats like Ogerpon-W as well as handling foes such as Iron Valiant and Pecharunt. Archaludon can handle physical attackers that threaten to break Corviknight like Ogerpon-H and Urshifu-R thanks to Stamina. Alternatively, Choice Scarf Archaludon can outspeed and remove threats such as Keldeo with Thunderbolt. Hisuian Goodra is a nice special wall capable of taking on threats like Flutter Mane, Latios, and Dragapult along with being able to use Knock Off to remove Rocky Helmet from the likes of Toxapex and Skarmory. Bisharp can remove problematic Ghost-types like Gholdengo and Sableye as well as use Sucker Punch to check fast threats like Hoopa-U.

Physically Defensive (Flying).description: This is a sample set as we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Defog (Steel).description: This is a sample set as we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Defog (Flying).description:
Corviknight is an invaluable part of Flying teams by virtue of its incredible defensive typing and access to utility options that many of its teammates appreciate. Defog removes Stealth Rock so that its teammates that don't run Heavy-Duty Boots or had theirs removed have an easier time switching in. Defog also removes dual screens set by foes, allowing its wallbreaking teammates to remove various threats. Iron Head threatens Rock- and Ice-types that can threaten its teammates such as Iron Boulder, Ogerpon-C, and Alolan Ninetales. Body Press handles Rock- and Ice-types as well, and in addition, it handles Steel- and Dark-types such as Excadrill, Kingambit, Chien-Pao, and Greninja. Alternatively, U-turn allows Corviknight to pivot out of bad matchups such as Fire- and Electric-types. Pressure allows it to punish Sableye using Encore. On the other hand, Mirror Armor can be used to punish attacks such as Bleakwind Storm from Tornadus-T and Moonblast from the likes of Iron Valiant and Enamorus. A Careful nature along with 252 HP EVs and 144 Special Defense EVs allow Corviknight to survive two Shadow Balls from Choice Specs Flutter Mane, and 12 Attack EVs let it OHKO back with Iron Head.

Landorus appreciates Corviknight removing Stealth Rock, which would otherwise wear it down over time due to its lack of recovery. In return, Landorus takes out Fire-types such as Heatran, Ceruledge, and Hisuian Arcanine, and its Electric immunity eases that matchup, handling the likes of Raging Bolt and Magnezone. Skarmory is another beneficiary of Corviknight's removal of entry hazards, as it preserves Sturdy so it is able to set its own entry hazards. Articuno, with its great special bulk, takes on Water-types such as Choice Specs Greninja and Primarina and threatens them back with Freeze-Dry. In return, it appreciates Corviknight handling Rock-types. Choice Specs Zapdos and Choice Band Dragonite are two more offensive teammates that appreciate the removal of entry hazards, which would otherwise weaken them. Zapdos also appreciates Corviknight taking out Rock-types such as Ogerpon-C and Kleavor, while Dragonite appreciates the removal of Fairy-types such as Flutter Mane and Hatterene. In return, Zapdos handles Primarina, while Dragonite takes on Fire-types such as Ogerpon-H and Heatran. Choice Scarf Enamorus provides great speed control for Flying teams, outspeeding and threatening the likes of Dragapult and Choice Specs Iron Valiant. In return, Enamorus appreciates Corviknight taking on Steel- and Ice-types such as Excadrill, Empoleon, and Chien-Pao. Setup sweepers such as Double Dance Galarian Moltres and Dragon Dance Dragonite appreciate Corviknight walling and removing their threats so they can find opportunities to set up and sweep late-game.

Shell Smash (Rock).description:
Drednaw is a fierce setup sweeper, capable of turning the tide against unfavorable matchups like Ground, Steel, and Water. Stone Edge is Drednaw's hardest hitting move, dealing with Pelipper and Dragonite. Liquidation hits troublesome Ground-types like Great Tusk, Iron Treads, and Ting-Lu. Earthquake threatens Water Absorb Clodsire, Toxapex, and Kingambit, while Strong Jaw-boosted Crunch nails switch-ins such as Slowbro, Brambleghast, and Air Balloon Gholdengo. Swift Swim is preferred to aid Rock in the matchup against Water rain teams; however, Strong Jaw allows Drednaw to muscle through the aforementioned roadblocks when using Crunch. Air Balloon improves Drednaw's performance in the Ground matchup, allowing for more setup opportunities, while White Herb retains Drednaw's defensive stats to have an improved chance against priority move users like Azumarill, Mimikyu, and Bisharp.

Garganacl's ability to pressure Gastrodon, Quagsire, and Corviknight with Salt Cure is heavily appreciated, easing Drednaw's time sweeping. Swords Dance Ogerpon-C works alongside Drednaw to overwhelm types such as Flying, Water, and Ground by breaking down walls such as Skarmory, Toxapex, and Clodsire. Hisuian Arcanine deals with Steel types like Scizor and Skarmory. Choice Scarf Iron Boulder outspeeds and removes Choice Scarfed threats like Meowscarada, Roaring Moon, and Greninja which outspeeds and revenge-kills Drednaw even after a Shell Smash. Glimmora's colorful movepool allows it to check a myriad of threats like Breloom, Meowscarada, and Iron Valiant with Sludge Wave, Great Tusk, Quagsire, and Quaquaval using Energy Ball, Gholdengo, Toxapex, and Toxicroak with Earth Power, and finally Hydreigon and Gallade using Dazzling Gleam. Choice Band Tyranitar heavily dents walls such as Corviknight, Slowbro, and Toxapex and sets up sand to increase Drednaw's bulk. Lycanroc aids in the Dark matchup due to its useful coverage in Close Combat and Play Rough and takes out faster foes like Enamorus and Flutter Mane with Accelerock. Coalossal provides entry hazards in Spikes and Stealth Rock, removes entry hazards with Rapid Spin, and helps against Gholdengo and Meowscarada due to its Fire typing.

Physically Defensive (Rock).description:
Coalossal is a decent defensive wall that fits well on Rock teams due to it being able to tank physical hits from Scizor and Meowscarada, which greatly threaten Rock teams. Coalossal does well in the Steel matchup, as it threatens Gholdengo, Corviknight, and Skarmory. Flame Body allows it to fish for burns to weaken physical threats like Kleavor, Scizor, Bisharp, Mimikyu, and Meowscarada. Body Press is a great move thanks to Coalossal's high Defense stat that allows it to deal incredible damage to Bisharp. Rapid Spin combined with Heavy-Duty Boots allows Coalossal to come in and remove hazards without taking any chip damage, so its teammates won't get worn down. Will-O-Wisp allows Coalossal to burn physical threats such as Kleavor, Hoopa-U, and Iron Hands. Spikes is another option to run on Coalossal over Will-O-Wisp to help Rock teams stack hazards and wear down foes.

Garganacl helps Coalossal by dealing with defensive Pokemon like Quagsire, Gastrodon, and Heatran with Salt Cure. In return Garganacl appreciates Coalossal checking Meowscarada. Air Balloon Shell Smash Drednaw is another good teammate for Coalossal, providing a soft Ground-type immunity and dealing with Ground- and Steel- types like Landorus-T, Sandy Shocks, Iron Treads, Heatran, and Hisuian-Goodra. Choice Scarf Glimmora with its diverse moveset is another option to pair with Coalossal, as it can outspeed and threaten to OHKO non-Choice Scarf users like Iron Valiant and Greninja. Glimmora can also deal with Water-, Fighting-, Dark-, and Dragon- Types like Quagsire, Hisuian Liligant, Hisuian Samurott, and Hydreigon with its various coverage moves. Furthermore, Glimmora run Air Balloon to act as an alternative Ground-type immunity that can deal with threats like Quagsire and Great Tusk. Tyranitar sets sand for Coalossal to boosts its Special Defense, which can allow Coalossal to tank special attacks from Choice Scarf Gholdengo and Choice Specs Magnezone and threaten them in return. Choice Band Lycanroc-D is a good revenge killer that can help out Coalossal by taking out threats such as Enamorus and Cloyster with Accelerock and Urshifu-R and Clodsire with Psychic Fangs. Hisuian Arcanine is another good revenge killer with Extreme Speed and can act as a wallbreaker, taking out foes such as Toxapex and Clodsire with Head Smash and Flare Blitz, respectively. Kleavor is a good lead for Rock teams, as it can deal damage while setting up Stealth Rock with Stone Axe, which helps with hazard stacking. In return, Coalossal complements Kleavor by dealing with Scizor. Diancie can ease the Fighting match by dealing decent damage to Gallade and Iron Valiant with Moonblast and by being able to take Fighting-type moves due to its Fairy-typing. In return, Coalossal helps Diancie by dealing with Scizor, Bisharp, and Meowscarada.

Barraskewda.comments:
Other Options

Waterfall may be used to flinch switch-ins, such as Rotom-W, Corviknight, and Mandibuzz, to add extra chip damage; however, Liquidation has a higher Base Power and may provide a Defense drop, significantly hindering their ability to wall Barraskewda.

Choice Band.description:
Barraskewda is a potent wallbreaker due to it's blazing Speed tier, outpacing Flutter Mane and Chien Pao, a great Attack stat, and its ability, Swift Swim, heavily threatening teams with no sturdy resistances to Water like Dark, Fairy, and Flying. Flip Turn forms a pivoting core with teammates like Rotom-W, Pelipper, and Greninja, slowly chipping away at switch-ins like Rotom-W, Corviknight, and Dragonite. Close Combat hits Water-resistant Steel-types like Hisuian Goodra and Empoleon. Ice Fang may be used to hit Dragon-types such as Garchomp and Dragonite. Psychic Fangs nails common switch-ins such as Toxapex, Amoonguss, and Kommo-o, as well as removes dual screens in the Fairy matchup. Alternatively, Crunch may be used to break Sinistcha, Brambleghast, and Dragapult. A Jolly nature is preferred to outpace Flutter Mane outside of rain.

Pelipper sets rain for Barraskewda and brings it in safely with U-turn, as well as weakens walls like Corviknight, Amoonguss, and Toxapex with a Choice Specs set. Gastrodon and Quagsire provide entry hazards and an Electric immunity, allowing Gastrodon to switch into Regieleki and Sandy Shocks while Quagsire walls Iron Hands, Pawmot, and Magnezone. In return, Barraskewda lures in aforementioned Grass-types like Amoonguss and Brambleghast and removes them with the corresponding coverage moves. Toxapex provides a Grass neutrality, notably walling Meowscarada and Ogerpon-W, and offers entry hazards to wear down Barraskewda checks, while Barraskewda removes Ground-types like Landorus, Gliscor, and Mamoswine for it. Empoleon sets up Stealth Rock to wear down Barraskewda's checks as well as walls Dragon-types like Walking Wake and Kommo-o lacking adequate Fighting-type coverage. Quaquaval offers entry hazard removal with Rapid Spin and switches into Steel-types like Empoleon, Hisuian Goodra, and Hisuian Samurott. Hisuian Samurott threatens Ghost- and Psychic-type Pokemon like Brambleghast, Slowbro, and Sinistcha while also providing utility support with Knock Off and Spikes set up via Ceaseless Edge. Urshifu-R is great in the Steel and Dark matchups, threatening Hisuian Goodra, Empoleon, and Bisharp. Manaphy forms a wallbreaking core with Barraskewda in the Poison and Steel matchups, taking out Corviknight, Toxapex, and Amoonguss for Barraskewda, while Barraskweda hits Galarian Slowking and Alolan Muk in return. Choice Scarf Walking Wake is great in the Dragon matchup, notably outpacing and removing Baxcalibur, Dragapult, and Kommo-o, while a Choice Specs set weakens walls like Toxapex, Hisuian Goodra, and Slowbro. Basculegion-F is a huge asset in the Ghost and Psychic matchups, taking out Sinistcha, Slowbro, and Brambleghast.

Entry Hazard Support (Electric).description: This is a sample set as we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Calm Mind (Psychic).description:
Boasting a Fairy typing, great natural bulk, and access to Calm Mind, Hatterene becomes an excellent addition for Psychic teams, taking on Dark- and Dragon-type threats like Hydreigon, Roaring Moon, and Choice Scarf Meowscarada while also providing entry hazard control thanks to Magic Bounce. Psyshock targets special walls like Clodsire and Blissey and allows Hatterene to defeat setup sweepers like Calm Mind Primarina and Quiver Dance Volcarona one-on-one. Draining Kiss handles Dark- and Dragon-types and provides Hatterene with a form of recovery. Nuzzle lets Hatterene spread paralysis, while Mystical Fire allows it to threaten pesky Steel-types like Corviknight and Iron Treads. 52 Speed EVs allow Hatterene to outspeed Toxapex, letting it attack Toxapex before it can remove Hatterene's Calm Mind boosts with Haze.

Wallbreakers like Choice Band Hoopa-U and Choice Specs Latios make excellent partners for Hatterene. Hoopa-U dispatches special walls like Hisuian Goodra, Heatran, and Galarian Slowking as well as Gholdengo, while Latios eliminates threats like Gouging Fire and Archaludon, and it also assists against Water, Ground, and Flying matchups with its BoltBeam coverage. In return, both teammates appreciate Hatterene's paralysis support, which allows them to outrun foes like Tornadus-T and Ogerpon formes. Alternatively, Hoopa-U can utilize a Choice Scarf set to make short work of faster Ghost-types like Choice Specs Flutter Mane and Spectrier. Deoxys-S sets up dual screens and entry hazards to create sweeping opportunities for Hatterene. Iron Boulder and Gallade threaten special walls like Hisuian Goodra and Heatran, with both teammates also assisting against Dark teams; Choice Scarf Iron Boulder removes faster threats like Greninja and Weavile, and Gallade eliminates bulkier targets like Alolan Muk and Ting-Lu, relieving pressure from Hatterene. Armarouge melts Steel-types like Scizor and Corviknight. Slowbro, with its access to Scald and Iron Defense, takes on physical attackers like Choice Band Excadrill, Barraskewda, Dragon Dance Gouging Fire, and even Ceruledge when Slowbro is not holding an item. Galarian Slowking takes advantage of its special bulk to stave off threats like Iron Moth and Choice Specs Kyurem while also setting Toxic Spikes. Furthermore, Slowbro and Galarian Slowking can spread paralysis, allowing Hatterene to use Mystical Fire over Nuzzle. Indeedee leverages its Normal typing to switch into Ghost-type attacks from foes like Choice Specs Flutter Mane, provide Psychic terrain support to block priority moves like Scizor's Bullet Punch and boost Hatterene's Psyshock, and provide Healing Wish support.

Calm Mind (Fairy).description:
Hatterene is a near-essential Pokemon on Fairy teams thanks to Magic Bounce and its Psychic typing, only further bolstered by its wide setup and support coverage that allows it to remove Pokemon like Toxapex, Clodsire, and Chien-Pao. Magic Bounce is especially notable, as it is the only form of entry hazard denial for Fairy teams. Calm Mind turns Hatterene into a deadly sweeper, notably stopping unboosted Flutter Mane from OHKOing it, instead OHKOing Flutter Mane in return after a single boost with Psyshock and letting Hatterene overheal Ting-Lu's Earthquake with Draining Kiss. Psyshock also lets Hatterene break through Unaware Clodsire, Dragalge, and Assault Vest Iron Hands, whereas Psychic 2HKOes Amoonguss and Toxapex as well as generally hitting targets for more damage overall. Draining Kiss gives Hatterene much-needed recovery, allowing it to heal against neutral and super effective targets, notably Dark-types like Chien-Pao and Ting-Lu. It can even beat Heavy Slam Ting-Lu with Reflect support from Klefki and Grimmsnarl. Mystical Fire threatens Steel-types like Scizor, Pressure Corviknight, and Gholdengo, which would otherwise safely switch into Hatterene and force it out. Alternatively, Giga Drain allows Hatterene to surprise foes like Gastrodon and Quagsire with an OHKO and generally allows Hatterene to win the Ground- and rainless Water-type matchups alone with minimal support; it can even be used sometimes over Draining Kiss depending on the team's needs, although the amount of HP regained is substantially less. Nuzzle can be used over Mystical Fire or Giga Drain to better support the team via paralysis. The given EVs let Hatterene outspeed an uninvested Toxapex so it can attack before its Calm Mind boosts are removed by Haze, with the rest of the EVs put into Defense to maximize bulk. If preferred, however, 204 Special Attack EVs and a Modest nature can be used instead to have increased offensive potential, although at the cost of being more reliant on dual screens support; most notably, this lets Psyshock often OHKO Clodsire and Psychic always 2HKO both Unaware Clodsire and Quagsire. Heavy-Duty Boots is also an option over Leftovers as to more safely switch in when entry hazards are up, either from those that Hatterene could not block or simply was too pressured to switch into, although this does remove a large source of longevity.

Dual screens support from Klefki and Grimmsnarl is almost essential, as it allows Hatterene to be much more aggressive with its Calm Mind boosts and switch-in opportunities. These teammates also provide extra support in Spikes from the former and both Taunt and Parting Shot from the latter, and in return, they can use Hatterene to block entry hazards from being set up, especially from Bombirdier and Ting-Lu. Flutter Mane and Iron Valiant can remove threats to Hatterene like Gholdengo, Skeledirge, Kingambit, and Chien-Pao as to facilitate setup opportunities for Hatterene, and they can rely on Hatterene to block hazards, especially Stealth Rock and Spikes. Tinkaton can neutralize Fairy- and Poison-type threats like Flutter Mane, Mimikyu, opposing Tinkaton, and Skuntank, which would otherwise impede on Hatterene's sweep, and set Stealth Rock and spread paralysis via Thunder Wave to ease sweeping opportunities further. Trick support from Iron Valiant and Gardevoir also helps Hatterene sweep, as this prevents bulkier Pokemon like Unaware Clodsire and Quagsire, Toxapex, and Dondozo from healing any damage taken and instead becoming setup fodder. Gardevoir also helps in the rain and sun matchups, as Trace copying Swift Swim and Chlorophyll removes the burden that Barraskewda, Floatzel, and Scovillain place by outspeeding and OHKOing all three. Azumarill and Mimikyu can support Hatterene as extra sweepers in order to overload the enemy's defensive core and majorly help in the Steel-type matchup that Hatterene dreads so much, notably pressuring Iron Treads, Kingambit, Corviknight, and Gholdengo.

Dual Screens (Dark).description:
Grimmsnarl's access to Prankster, as well as Reflect and Light Screen, makes it invaluable on hyper offensive variants of Dark teams and as a way to take on opposing Dark teams. Prankster lets Grimmsnarl set up priority Reflect and Light Screen, making it easier for teammates to set up. Grimmsnarl's access to Parting Shot allows it to bring in a teammate immediately, but Taunt is also a viable option to prevent Defog and opposing leads setting up entry hazards. Thunder Wave also can be used as a form of speed control. Spirit Break lets Grimmsnarl threaten opposing Dark-type setup sweepers such as Hydreigon and Chien-Pao that may leverage their Prankster immunity to set up on Grimmsnarl. Grimmsnarl should be used aggressively early-game to capitalize on its teammates' sweeping potential.

Teammates such as Swords Dance Chien-Pao, Nasty Plot Hydreigon, Swords Dance Kingambit, and Dragon Dance Roaring Moon all appreciate Grimmsnarl reducing the damage they take while setting up with dual screens. Entry hazard setters like Ting-Lu can be useful to help wear down opposing defensive Pokemon so that Grimmsnarl's teammates can sweep. Choice Scarf Meowscarada is appreciated for being able to revenge kill Pokemon such as Great Tusk and Iron Valiant. Chien-Pao and Kingambit can utilize Grimmsnarl's dual screens to break through opposing teams, and Hydreigon can break through Steel-types that may threaten Grimmsnarl out. Greninja can threaten out Cinderace and prevent it from using Court Change while also being able to revenge kill Iron Valiant.

Frosmoth.comments:
Other Options

Ice

Frosmoth can invest 208 EVs into Defense to prevent Corviknight's Iron Head from breaking Substitute under snow and Aurora Veil. However, Frosmoth needs 252 Special Attack EVs to OHKO Skarmory after Stealth Rock if it uses a Timid nature so it doesn't get phazed by Whirlwind.

Quiver Dance (Bug).description:
Quiver Dance Frosmoth is an incredibly threatening setup sweeper thanks to its ability to do massive damage in matchups that Bug struggles with such as Flying and Dragon as well as find opportunities to set up on numerous special attackers like Choice Specs Iron Valiant and Spectrier thanks to Ice Scales. Substitute allows Frosmoth to take advantage of special attackers like those aforementioned as well as dodge status from Pokemon such as Galarian Weezing that cannot break Frosmoth's Substitute. Giga Drain allows Frosmoth to hit troublesome Water-types like Empoleon that can otherwise take it on while allowing it to run away with the Ground matchup by annihilating Quagsire and Mamoswine after a Quiver Dance boost. Ice Beam easily muscles past Ground-, Flying-, and Dragon-types like Gliscor, Dragonite, and Raging Bolt that otherwise pose problems for Bug teams. Heavy-Duty Boots allows Frosmoth to avoid its debilitating Stealth Rock weakness while giving it more opportunities to set up thanks to avoiding Toxic Spikes.

Kleavor is a great teammate for Frosmoth, as it takes care of Fire-types that trouble Frosmoth like Ogerpon-H, Skeledirge, and Gouging Fire as well as setting up entry hazards through Stone Axe to soften defensive checks to Frosmoth such as Heatran. In return, it appreciates Frosmoth taking advantage of revenge killing attempts from the likes of Choice Scarf Latias and Choice Scarf Iron Valiant to set up. Scizor ravages Rock- and Fairy-types that Frosmoth does not appreciate, like Garganacl, Iron Boulder, Flutter Mane, and Choice Band Iron Valiant, with its strong Bullet Punch. In return, it appreciates Frosmoth freezing checks to it like Quagsire and Skarmory. Volcarona melts Steel-types like Gholdengo and Corviknight that trouble Frosmoth, while Slither Wing takes out Heatran and Blissey, making both good teammates. Araquanid provides a pseudo-Fire resistance with Water Bubble and can deal with Fire-types like Heatran, Gouging Fire, and Volcarona. Forretress is a decent teammate, acting as a physically defensive sponge with a good typing as well as a great option in the hazard war, removing hazards with Rapid Spin while setting its own up with Spikes.

Quiver Dance (Ice).description:
Frosmoth is a dangerous setup sweeper on Ice teams when given snow and Aurora Veil support. Quiver Dance allows Frosmoth to be a dangerous wincon when given free turns against passive walls like Amoonguss. Frosmoth's ability to threaten Zamazenta is especially important, as teammates such as Kyurem and Weavile have a hard time dealing with it. Hurricane allows Frosmoth to sweep through Fighting teams after two Quiver Dance boosts while allowing it threaten Fire-types such as Volcarona. Substitute can be used instead to avoid status conditions and easily set up against more passive walls such as Amoonguss and Rotom-W. Giga Drain provides Frosmoth with longevity in sweeping, deals with bulky Water-types like Primarina and Gastrodon, and threatens troublesome Rock teams. Frosmoth's ability to deal large amounts of damage to physical walls like Garganacl and Skarmory is very important to ease the job of other setup sweepers like Weavile and Cloyster. A Timid nature is preferred, as it allows Frosmoth to outspeed threats such as Cinderace, Ogerpon formes, and Iron Valiant after a Quiver Dance. A Modest nature can be used to break past threats such as Empoleon and Alolan Muk

Frosmoth needs snow and Aurora Veil support in order to easily set up on threats like Primarina and Archaludon. Therefore, Alolan Ninetales makes an excellent teammate. Alolan Ninetales can also use Encore to provide Frosmoth with free switch-in opportunities. Frosmoth tends to be slow even after a Quiver Dance boost due to its low initial Speed stat. At +1, it is easily revenge killed by Choice Scarf Iron Boulder, Choice Scarf Roaring Moon, and Choice Scarf Sneasler, so switch-ins to these threats such as Avalugg and Mamoswine are appreciated. Speed control options such as Slush Rush Alolan Sandslash and Thunder Wave Froslass support Frosmoth excellently. Froslass provides Spikes support to chip down checks such as Hisuian Goodra and Galarian Slowking. Sandslash can deal with Hatterene and Articuno for Frosmoth while clearing entry hazards with Rapid Spin, should Frosmoth's Heavy-Duty Boots get Knocked Off. Frosmoth can struggle to break through Haze Toxapex and Articuno, so Kyurem and Weavile make excellent teammates. Frosmoth and Kyurem can work together to overwhelm their shared checks such as Corviknight and Galarian Slowking. Weavile is able to pressure the Fire-types Frosmoth can't break past such as Rotom-H and Heatran with Knock Off and Mamoswine's Stealth Rock support. Cloyster is also a great ally, as it can shred through Fire teams with Rock Blast after a Shell Smash, notably dealing with Ceruledge, which otherwise is extremely difficult to face.

Indeedee.comments:
Other Options

Normal

Shadow Ball can be run instead of Trick to hit Gholdengo and Ceruledge, helping in the Ghost matchup. Doing so will lose Indeedee-M the ability to Choice-lock walls like Corviknight and Ting-Lu, which can be a pain to break through.

Psychic

Psyshock can be used over Trick to make Indeedee-M more effective against some Calm Mind users and special walls like Primarina and Blissey, respectively, but the overlapping coverage with Expanding Force can often feel wasteful in comparison to Trick or Shadow Ball. Encore can let Indeedee-M act as a failsafe against bulkier setup sweepers that it can't immediately KO, such as Calm Mind Primarina and Nasty Plot Spectrier; this also gives more setup opportunities to Indeedee-M's own frail teammates. However, the opportunity cost of dropping Trick or Healing Wish is extremely high.

Choice Scarf (Normal).description:
Indeedee-M is a good Choice Scarf user on Normal teams due to its decent Speed stat, being able to outspeed threats like Zamazenta and Okidogi. Thanks to its part-Psychic typing, it is able to take out foes like Iron Valiant and Urshifu-R with Expanding Force. Combining Psychic Surge with Expanding Force allows Indeedee-M to take out threats like Zamazenta, Great Tusk, Iron Hands, and Toxapex. Dazzling Gleam lets Indeedee-M pressure Dark-, Fighting-, and Dragon-types like Choice Specs Greninja, Scrafty, and Hydreigon. Trick can punish common walls like Ting-Lu, Corviknight, and Empoleon, while Healing Wish provides support for the team.

Choice Specs Hisuian Zoroark is a nice teammate for Indeedee-M, being able to check Ghost-, Steel- and Psychic-types like Ceruledge, Archaludon, and Metagross. Hisuian Zoroark also provides help by using Trick to Choice-lock walls like Alolan Muk and Assault Vest Iron Hands. Indeedee-M returns the favor by taking out bulky foes like Clodsire and Toxapex and providing immunity against Sucker Punch Kingambit while the Psychic Terrain from its ability remains active. Ditto helps Indeedee-M as a late-game wincon by transforming into Chien-Pao, Garchomp, and Gouging Fire in the Dark, Dragon, and Fire matchups, respectively, reverse sweeping when possible. Smeargle is a nice entry hazard setter, providing Spikes and Sticky Web for Indeedee-M to slow down fast Choice Scarf users like Sneasler, Urshifu-R, and Roaring Moon. Calm Mind Ursaluna-B deals with specially defensive Pokemon that Indeedee-M can't break like Alolan Muk, Hisuian Goodra, and Tyranitar. In return, Indeedee-M takes out Iron Valiant and Urshifu-R without Choice Scarf for Ursaluna-B and Smeargle. Blissey is a nice teammate that can tank special hits from foes like Greninja and Flutter Mane while also setting Stealth Rock and spreading paralysis with Thunder Wave. Porygon2 is a good defensive wall that is able to tank hits from Ogerpon formes, Gouging Fire, and Ceruledge while also checking them with Foul Play. Porygon2 also pressures Flying-types like Corviknight, Dragonite, and Mandibuzz with Discharge and Ice Beam. Indeedee-M doesn't like hazards, so Braviary is a great option that can remove hazards with Defog while taking out foes like Lokix and Hisuian Samurott with Brave Bird and Close Combat, respectively. Terapagos is another option due to its colorful moveset, including BoltBeam coverage that can take out Skarmory, Garchomp, and Landorus, and it can also remove hazards for the team with Rapid Spin. Terapagos's signature move Tera Starstorm allows Terapagos to dent bulky Pokemon. Loaded Dice Cinccino can be a physical sweeper and hazard remover with Tidy Up. Cinccino also has great coverage, including moves that can deal with Ground-, Water-, Flying-, Dragon-, and Ice-types with Bullet Seed, Triple Axel, and Rock Blast.

Choice Scarf (Psychic).description:
Choice Scarf Indeedee-M's exclusive access to Psychic Surge immediately gives it a niche on Psychic teams as a Terrain setter, and its solid support options, decent offenses, and immunity to Ghost ensure it isn't dead weight outside of that. Expanding Force effectively has 156 Base Power under Psychic Terrain before factoring in STAB, easily making up for Indeedee-M's middling Special Attack with its devastating strength. This makes Indeedee-M a brutally effective revenge killer, picking off most neutral targets, like the Ogerpon formes and Choice Specs Dragapult, after some chip damage. Dazzling Gleam is critical coverage for Dark-types that try to switch into Expanding Force, notably OHKOing Hydreigon, Lokix, and non-Choice Scarf Roaring Moon after Stealth Rock damage. Trick prevents Indeedee-M from becoming dead weight against teams with bulky special walls like Blissey, Alolan Muk, and Hisuian Goodra, letting it hinder them with an unwanted Choice item. Alternatively, Shadow Ball gives Indeedee-M an option to hit Gholdengo with, which can prove useful for Psychic teams, and it also hits opposing Psychic-types like Hatterene super effectively. However, a lack of Trick will make Indeedee-M far easier to handle with the aforementioned special walls. Finally, Healing Wish is an extremely powerful support tool that lets Indeedee-M give a dangerous teammate like Calm Mind Latios a second chance at sweeping. A Timid nature is required, since it lets Indeedee-M outspeed other common Choice Scarf users like Kleavor and Great Tusk.

Steel-types are the bane of Indeedee-M's existence, since it lacks any kind of coverage for them, so having a fallback plan against them is essential. Slowbro is a great switch-in against Steel-type attackers like Excadrill and Heatran, resisting their STAB moves and threatening a powerful Body Press in return; its great physical bulk also helps the team play around other major threats like Tyranitar and Mamoswine. In return, Indeedee-M takes out Hydreigon for Slowbro. Hatterene doesn't fare as well against Steel-types defensively, but it can threaten them with Mystical Fire and give Indeedee-M's team a potent wincon that's made more threatening if Indeedee-M cripples a special wall like Alolan Muk with Trick; reflecting entry hazards with Magic Bounce also improves Indeedee-M's longevity and helps to chip foes into cleanup range. Swords Dance Iron Boulder is a terrifying setup sweeper that can plow through bulkier Pokemon that Indeedee-M struggles with, especially Blissey and Kingambit with Close Combat, and Psychic Terrain is incredible support for it, since it otherwise fears common priority moves. Choice Scarf Iron Boulder is also a great option to cover faster Choice Scarf users that Psychic struggles with like Meowscarada. Choice Band Hoopa-U is another physical wallbreaker that can deal with specially bulky Pokemon, notably OHKOing Kingambit and Gholdengo with Drain Punch and Knock Off. Indeedee-M returns the favor by taking out Choice Scarf Great Tusk and mixed Iron Valiant for Hoopa-U, and it becomes much harder to KO when shielded from Kingambit's Sucker Punch and other priority moves. Offensive Deoxys-S becomes incredibly threatening under Psychic Terrain, since it can use Expanding Force for its STAB move, making Choice Specs and Nasty Plot sets far more threatening. Latios doesn't directly benefit from Psychic Terrain, but it provides a useful Ground immunity for the team, and it enjoys the speed control and Ghost immunity Indeedee-M provides to help it against threats like Flutter Mane. Entry hazard support can greatly help to nudge foes into Indeedee-M's KO range, letting it clean up late-game more easily; Jirachi and Metagross are both decent Stealth Rock setters that can help with this, and Deoxys-S can provide even more hazards thanks to Spikes at the cost of defensive utility. The former two can also switch into common threats to Indeedee-M, like Scizor and Iron Boulder, and Jirachi can use them to generate momentum with U-turn and get Indeedee-M on the field more easily.

Dragapult.comments:
Other Options

Dragon

Spell Tag lets Dragapult OHKO Iron Valiant after it has been inflicted with status, which can be crucial in the Fighting matchup. However, Dragapult becomes much easier to wear down and will have a harder time overcoming bulkier types like Water or Poison. U-turn can be used over Substitute or Thunder Wave if using Heavy-Duty Boots to pivot in its teammates like Walking Wake to take advantage of switch-ins like Ursaluna-B and Heatran, but not having Substitute means Dragapult cannot stallbreak as well.

Choice Band (Dragon).description:
Choice Band Dragapult is a formidable wallbreaker and late-game cleaner for Dragon teams with its high Attack and incredible Speed, powerful STAB combination, and great ability in Infiltrator. Dragon Darts is a strong and reliable STAB option, which with Stealth Rock damage, OHKOes foes like Greninja and Darkrai and 2HKOes Toxapex. Sucker Punch allows Dragapult to pick off weakened faster threats like Choice Scarf Latias, Iron Boulder, and opposing Dragapult. Psychic Fangs, on the other hand, threatens Poison- and Fighting-types like Galarian Weezing and Iron Valiant, potentially OHKOing the latter. With U-turn, Dragapult can pivot out of unfavorable matchups against foes like Toxapex, Archaludon, and Skarmory, bringing in teammates like Choice Specs Latios and Raging Bolt.

With their exceptional bulk and typing, Archaludon and Hisuian Goodra provide a defensive backbone for Dragapult. Archaludon handles physical attackers like Ceruledge, Weavile, the Ogerpon formes, and Choice Scarf users like Meowscarada and Roaring Moon while also providing Stealth Rock support. Hisuian Goodra takes on Fairy-types like Primarina and Clefable and can safely switch into and threaten Choice Specs Greninja and Flutter Mane. Kyurem and Latios break through bulky Ground- and Flying-types like Hippowdon, Gliscor, and Mandibuzz and eliminate physical walls like Archaludon, Skarmory, and Dondozo. Latios and Latias threaten bulky Poison- and Fighting-types like Toxapex, Galarian Weezing, Great Tusk, and Iron Hands; Latias cripples the aforementioned foes with Trick and also provide Healing Wish support. Garchomp can set Spikes, which makes it easier for Dragapult to break through bulky foes, and handles Steel- and Poison-types like Heatran and Toxapex. Choice Scarf Roaring Moon can eliminate common Choice Scarf users like Latias, Enamorus, and Gholdengo as well as opposing non-Choice Scarf Dragapult.

Hex (Dragon).description:
Dragapult provides great offensive support for Dragon teams, being an effective form of status spreading thanks to its great Speed and ability, Infiltrator. This allows it to bypass Substitute to inflict status on foes hiding behind them. Furthermore, Infiltrator allows Dragapult to render dual screens useless, thus improving the Fairy matchup. Will-O-Wisp weakens common switch-ins to Dragapult like Iron Hands, Alolan Muk, and Hisuian Goodra, reducing their offensive capabilities. Hex takes advantage of Dragapult's great status spreading to deal high damage to afflicted foes. Draco Meteor can be run over Dragon Darts, both when Substitute is not being used and if it needs to handle Archaludon in a better way. However, Dragon Darts is preferred, since the Special Attack drop from Draco Meteor is undesirable when run alongside Substitute. Substitute allows Dragapult to take advantage of passive walls such as Toxapex and Clodsire to spread status more safely. Alternatively, Thunder Wave can be used to target faster threats such as +1 Volcarona and Choice Scarf Sneasler. However, Substitute is the preferred option, since most foes that outspeed Dragapult can OHKO it outright, but Substitute must only be run with Leftovers as an item. 148 Special Attack EVs allow Dragapult to OHKO Flutter Mane with Hex after it is statused, while 108 Attack EVs further improve the power of Dragon Darts.

Early-game wallbreakers such as Choice Band Dragonite and Choice Specs Latios appreciate Dragapult's status spreading, with Latios fearing less from Iron Hands's Ice Punch. Dragonite threatens Corviknight, Alolan Muk, Hisuian Goodra, and Heatran, while Latios targets Toxapex and Iron Hands. Steel-type partners such as Archaludon and Hisuian Goodra can take hits from offensive threats to Dragapult, with Archaludon taking hits from Bisharp and Meowscarada and threatening back with Body Press, further helped by Stamina, as well as setting up Stealth Rock. Hisuian Goodra threatens a multitude of Fairy-types including Iron Valiant, Flutter Mane, and Enamorus. Raging Bolt handles Water-types that can cause Dragapult trouble such as Azumarill and Empoleon. Lastly, Dragapult's ability to stallbreak and weaken walls with status opens the door for setup sweepers like Roaring Moon, Garchomp, and Raging Bolt to sweep late-game.

Choice Specs (Dragon).description:
Dragapult makes for a great special wallbreaker and late-game cleaner on Dragon teams by virtue of its great coverage and high Speed, making it the fastest unboosted Pokemon in the metagame. Furthermore, a great ability in Infiltrator allows it to be effective against types that commonly run dual screens like Fairy and Ice, and it can bypass Substitute from setup sweepers such as Spectrier. Draco Meteor and Shadow Ball form an incredible STAB move combination that targets a great number of threats and is only resisted by a few. Flamethrower targets Ice-types like Alolan Sandslash, Frosmoth, and Alolan Ninetales, as well as Steel-types like Corviknight, Scizor, and Klefki. Thunderbolt threatens bulky Water- and Flying-types such as Toxapex, Primarina, and Mandibuzz. U-turn allows Dragapult to bring in one of its teammates safely into foes that check it like Swampert, Alolan Muk, and Ting-Lu. However, Thunderbolt is preferred, since it doesn't render Dragapult entirely helpless against Primarina and Azumarill.

Archaludon provides Stealth Rock support and grants defensive coverage against Bisharp. Early-game wallbreakers such as Nasty Plot Hydreigon, Choice Specs Latios, and Choice Specs Kyurem make for excellent partners, as they remove Dragapult's checks so that it can easily clean up late-game. Hydreigon handles Articuno, Latios threatens bulky Poison-types like Galarian Weezing and Clodsire, and Kyurem targets bulky Ground-types like Clodsire, Gliscor, and Ting-Lu, as well as Heatran. Garchomp is a great partner, as it sets up Spikes to aid Dragapult's wallbreaking and cleaning, and it can potentially sweep late-game with Swords Dance and Scale Shot. Dragapult appreciates speed control from Choice Scarf users like Roaring Moon and Latias, as Roaring Moon threatens Choice Scarf Iron Valiant, Latias, and Gholdengo, while Latias not only outspeeds and threatens Choice Scarf Great Tusk and Walking Wake, but it can also give its Choice Scarf to a wall with Trick. In addition, it provides Healing Wish support for Dragapult. Dragapult's role as a wallbreaker is appreciated by setup sweepers like Raging Bolt and Dragonite, which benefit from the removal of Alolan Ninetales and Sableye so they can safely sweep late-game.

Choice Scarf (Dragon).description:
Choice Scarf Dragapult is an exceptional revenge killer due to its incredible Speed tier and ability to pressure opposing Dragon teams. Infiltrator allows Dragapult to threaten sweepers behind Substitute like opposing Dragapult as well as ignore Aurora Veil, dealing with Kyurem. Dragon Darts is Dragapult's most reliable Dragon type move, boasting a great Base Power and the ability to easily clean Dragon teams late-game. Phantom Force targets Ghost-types like Flutter Mane and Spectrier, removing them in a pinch. Alternatively, Shadow Ball may be used instead for a one-turn Ghost-type move; however, most foes need to be chipped down, as the move uses Dragapult's lower Special Attack stat, unlike Phantom Force. U-turn enables Dragapult as a fast pivot, allowing it to escape unfavorable situations as well as lure in Dark types like Hoopa-U and Meowscarada. Thunder Wave and Will-O-Wisp allow Dragapult to hinder offensive threats that its other moves don't threaten; the former slows down Choice Scarf Enamorus and Iron Valiant, while the latter weakens Bisharp. Fire Blast may be used as a substitute to threaten Steel- and Ice-types such as Skarmory, Alolan Sandslash, and Weavile. A Jolly nature grants Dragapult the ability to outpace other Choice Scarf users like Flutter Mane, Darkrai, and Spectrier, while a Hasty nature may be used should Shadow Ball or Fire Blast be opted for.

Archaludon provides great physical bulk, taking on threats such as Dragonite and Mimikyu as well as setting up Stealth Rock, enhancing Dragapult's revenge killing ability. In return, Dragapult offers a Fighting immunity, combating threats such as Sneasler and Keldeo. Latias and Latios scare away Poison-type walls like Okidogi, Toxapex, and Galarian Weezing as well as take on Ground types such as Great Tusk, Landorus, and Clodsire. Kyurem appreciates Dragapult's aforementioned Fighting immunity and ability to remove faster Dragon-types like Roaring Moon and Latias. In exchange, Kyurem breaks walls like Toxapex, Mandibuzz, and Hippowdon as well as removes Archaludon once pivoted in by U-turn. Raging Bolt breaks Water- and Flying-type threats like Primarina, Corviknight, and Galarian Moltres. Additionally, Thunderclap allows Raging Bolt to remove faster threats such as Choice Scarf Enamorus, Greninja, and Barraskewda. Hisuian Goodra provides an answer to Ice- and Fairy- types like Kyurem, Articuno, and Hatterene and gives Knock Off support to ease Dragapult's cleaning late-game.

Hex (Ghost).description:
Dragapult carries a plethora of utility options in its movepool to hinder the opposition. It leverages its high Speed to outspeed and threaten Hisuian Samurott and Flutter Mane with status for its teammates. Heavy-Duty Boots also enables Dragapult to switch in much more often. Will-O-Wisp weakens physical attackers that pose a threat to Ghost teams, such as Great Tusk, Urshifu-R, and Hisuian Samurott, while Thunder Wave disrupts faster opposition such as Choice Scarf Hisuian Samurott, Ogerpon-H, and Spectrier. Hex is also a great choice for beating Gliscor and other Pokemon affected by Dragapult spreading status. U-turn is another great form of support as it lets Dragapult, scout switches and bring in its teammates safely. Dragapult's ability, Infiltrator, also grants it the capability to ignore dual screens set up by Klefki in the Fairy matchup. The given EV spread allows Dragapult to guarantee a 2HKO against Hatterene after recovery from Leftovers and always outspeed Flutter Mane.

Flutter Mane is the biggest beneficiary of Dragapult's services, as it can outspeed Choice Scarf users crippled by Thunder Wave or live a few physical attacks from foes burned by Will-O-Wisp such as Earthquake from Landorus-T and Dire Claw from Sneasler. Flutter Mane repays Dragapult by blasting through Dark-types that give Ghost teams trouble such as Greninja, Choice Scarf Darkrai, and, if using a Choice Scarf, Roaring Moon. Spectrier is another great teammate for taking advantage of the status spread by Dragapult by threatening to win games with Hex. Dragapult's status also allows Spectrier to freely run Substitute and Nasty Plot together without needing to run Will-O-Wisp. Dragapult also safely pivots both Flutter Mane and Spectrier in, which is useful as both are quite frail. Gholdengo is an excellent choice, as with a Hex set, it is able to use the status spread by Dragapult to great effect and enhance its power. Skeledirge is a good choice as well, as it can withstand hits and reply back with a boosting Torch Song while also posing a threat to Heatran with Earth Power. Skeledirge also threatens Ice-types such as Alolan Ninetales and Frosmoth. Hisuian Zoroark is a much appreciated Ghost immunity that can deceive opponents into thinking it may be Dragapult or its vulnerable teammates, then take advantage of that to unleash powerful attacks against opposing Spectrier and Ceruledge or cripple walls such as Toxapex and Empoleon with Knock Off. Substitute Sinistcha is another choice to take care of one of Ghost's biggest problems in Ursaluna-B. Dragapult's spreading of status also allows for Mimikyu and Ceruledge to set up much more easily to threaten Fighting-types like Iron Hands and Steel-types like Corviknight, respectively. Mimikyu is also a one-time check to Bisharp with Disguise, both of which greatly threaten Ghost teams. Brambleghast can set up Spikes, which can wear down the opposition quickly in conjunction with burns from Dragapult's Will-O-Wisp, while Gengar can set up Toxic Spikes, letting Dragapult and Spectrier use Hex much more often.

Dragon Dance (Ghost).description:
Dragon Dance gives Dragapult the ability to not just boost its fantastic Speed to new heights, allowing it to outspeed fast Choice Scarf users such as Meowscarada and Roaring Moon, but also beef up its decent Attack stat. Dragon Darts is a reliable, hard-hitting Dragon-type STAB move that allows Dragapult to break Breloom's Focus Sash and Dragonite's Multiscale. Phantom Force is Dragapult's best choice for Ghost-tpye STAB move, as otherwise it is walled by any Fairy- or Steel-type, while Disable can disrupt Choice-locked Pokemon from potentially breaking its Substitute or attacking Dragapult in general. Substitute allows Dragapult to ease prediction and also adds a layer of protection against status moves, allowing it to set up on more passive Pokemon such as Toxapex and Amoonguss. It also synergizes well with Disable, allowing Dragapult to set up with ease. Will-O-Wisp is another option over Disable to allow Clodsire and Quagsire to become setup bait, while also crippling Bisharp and Ting-Lu; however, Disable is more consistent. Leftovers allows Dragapult to use Substitute multiple times throughout a game and be more annoying overall with Disable, while Dragon Fang is a good choice to boost Dragon Darts.

Skeledirge is a fantastic partner, as it can wall Fairy-types such as Choice Scarf Iron Valiant and Hatterene while also threatening foes like Bisharp that can easily take out Dragapult with their STAB priority moves. Gholdengo is another fantastic partner that can threaten Fairy-types like Klefki and Flutter Mane, if Gholdengo uses a Choice Scarf, and take care of physical walls such as opposing Skeledirge. Brambleghast is another good partner, as it can keep entry hazards off of the field, allowing Dragapult to come in multiple times, as well as providing Spikes support to soften up Steel-types such as Gholdengo and Iron Treads. Hisuian Zoroark provides the team with not just a Ghost immunity, but also can easily use Illusion to disguise itself as Dragapult and lure in foes that would normally threaten it, such as Bisharp, Archaludon, and opposing Dragapult, to open up for a potential Dragapult sweep. Flutter Mane is another great partner thanks to its ability to handle opposing Dragon-types such as Baxcalibur, Roaring Moon, and Walking Wake. It can also provide immediate speed control if need be to take care of other Choice Scarf users that could revenge kill Dragapult before it gets a Dragon Dance up. Mimikyu is an amazing wallbreaker that can either help wear down physical walls for Dragapult to clean up or can take advantage of Dragapult punching holes in the opponent's team to clean up itself. Mimikyu can also heavily threaten opposing Ghost-types for Dragapult like Choice Scarf Flutter Mane, Dragapult, and Choice Scarf Gholdengo thanks to its STAB priority in Shadow Sneak. It also provides a one-time check to setup sweepers such as Bisharp and Ceruledge thanks to its ability Disguise.

Choice Scarf (Fighting).description:
Choice Scarf Urshifu-R is a solid option for Fighting teams wanting speed control with great offense thanks to its nice coverage options. Urshifu-R is a potent force to reckon with in matchups like Dragon and Flying, where its direct competitors, Keldeo and Choice Scarf Sneasler, would struggle to make progress. Reaching a respectable 483 Speed, Choice Scarf Urshifu-R outspeeds the whole unboosted metagame, barring Regieleki and Deoxys-S, as well as some common Choice Scarf Pokemon such as Great Tusk, Kleavor, and Hoopa-U. Surging Strikes OHKOes Choice Specs Flutter Mane, Hisuian Zoroark, Choice Scarf Hoopa-U, and Focus Sash Ceruledge. Close Combat destroys Dark- and Steel-types such as Choice Specs Greninja and Choice Scarf Archaludon. U-turn lets it pivot out safely against its checks like Toxapex and Primarina. Lastly, Ice Spinner deals with Dragon-types such as Dragapult, Latios, and Dragonite and provides a safe option to hit Water Absorb Clodsire.

With numerous utility options such as Rapid Spin, Stealth Rock, and Knock Off, Great Tusk is a teammate of choice for Urshifu-R, preventing it from being injured by entry hazards and removing Choice Scarf from the likes of Landorus and Greninja, with the help of Focus Sash, to ensure Urshifu-R keeps the Speed advantage. Assault Vest Iron Hands and Gallade are two other solid partners that can withstand special hits from Choice Specs Latios and Dragapult for Urshifu-R ; they also significantly improve some of the tough matchups of Urshifu-R, namely Water and Poison, by dealing with Primarina, Toxapex, and Amoonguss. By virtue of its revenge killer status, Choice Scarf Urshifu-R pairs well with most Fighting-type wallbreakers, including Iron Valiant, Sneasler, Okidogi, and Scrafty. Iron Valiant leverages its fantastic movepool and offensive stats to patch any offensive shortcoming the team may have. Thanks to its access to BoltBeam coverage and highly synergetic STAB moves, Iron Valiant dominates the Flying, Dragon, and Water matchups, easily removing Skarmory, Defensive Gyarados, Latios, and Toxapex. Unburden Sneasler helps to get the upper hand in matchups like Fighting and Fairy, destroying both types after one Swords Dance. Lastly, Okidogi and Scrafty are two potent Bulk Up wallbreakers that can make the difference in the Ghost, Dragon, and Poison matchups. With its solid defensive typing and great bulk, Okidogi puts heavy pressure on Ghost teams, addressing the likes of Dragapult and Gholdengo while preventing Flutter Mane from making any progress, thanks to its Fairy neutrality. Its utility is also much appreciated in the Poison matchup where its typing lets it come repeatedly on the field to absorb Toxic and Toxic Spikes while threatening the opposing defensive core with Knock Off. Blessed with a Psychic immunity, Scrafty is a considerable asset in the Dragon and Ghost matchups where its immunity and resistances are useful by preventing Choice Specs Latios from progressing through Luster Purge spamming and leaving both Dragapult and Latios with Draco Meteor only to make progress.

Choice Scarf (Water).description:
With a Choice Scarf, Urshifu-R can act as a solid form of speed control for Water teams, being able to outspeed threats such as Tornadus-T, Choice Specs Flutter Mane, and Choice Scarf Hisuian Samurott. Close Combat handles Steel- and Dark-types such as Archaludon and Choice Specs Greninja. U-turn allows for Urshifu-R to keep up momentum against would-be checks like Toxapex. Finally, Ice Spinner allows Urshifu-R to threaten Grass- and Dragon-types such as Hydrapple, Dragapult, and Dragonite. Alternatively, Poison Jab can be used to pick off Ogerpon-W and Fairy-types like Primarina.

Choice Specs Greninja and Urshifu-R form a devastating wallbreaking core, with Greninja being able to remove physical walls that hamper Urshifu-R such as Amoonguss, Skarmory, and Galarian Weezing with ease while Urshifu-R removes special walls that check Greninja such as Hisuian Goodra and Blissey. Greninja also provides a check to Psychic- and Ghost-type threats such as Latios and Sinistcha that could easily take Urshifu-R's attacks. Similarly, Swords Dance Hisuian Samurott can act as a check to Ghost- and Psychic-types along with providing Spikes with Ceaseless Edge and being able to use Sucker Punch to pick off faster targets like Choice Scarf Latias. Toxapex can handle Grass- and Fairy-types such as Choice Scarf Meowscarada and Hatterene and set Toxic Spikes to put bulky targets like Slowbro and Primarina on timers. Swampert can take on Electric-type threats such as Iron Hands, Sandy Shocks, and Regieleki. Swampert also provides support with Stealth Rock to wear down foes like Dragapult and Archaludon. Empoleon likewise can provide Stealth Rock support while dealing with threats such as Kyurem and Hatterene. Swampert and Empoleon can also both provide Urshifu-R safe entry with their slow Flip Turns. Pelipper provides rain, granting Urshifu-R the power boost to take out threats like Gholdengo, Zapdos, and Iron Valiant with Surging Strikes. Ogerpon-W appreciates Urshifu-R dealing with Tornadus-T and Lokix, and in return, Ogerpon-W can remove Water-types such as Primarina and Dondozo that would otherwise effortlessly wall Urshifu-R. Primarina provides a solid check to Dragon-type threats such as Archaludon and Walking Wake that naturally check Urshifu-R.

Swords Dance (Water).description:
Swords Dance Urshifu-R is a good choice on Water teams thanks to its high Attack - further boosted by Swords Dance - and decent Speed tier, allowing it to dispatch many of the metagame's defensive staples such as Unaware Clodsire, Alolan Muk, and Corviknight. Swords Dance allows Urshifu-R to set up on a predicted switch. Surging Strikes is a generally powerful move that allows Urshifu-R to muscle past threats such as Bulk Up Corviknight and defensive Gholdengo after a Swords Dance. Close Combat hits Dark- and Steel-types such as Hydreigon and Hisuian Goodra that try to switch in on Surging Strikes, while Drain Punch is weaker but provides some much-appreciated recovery. Finally, Urshifu-R has many viable options for its 4th moveslot; Aqua Jet deters Iron Valiant and Flutter Mane from attempting to revenge kill Urshifu-R, Thunder Punch hits Flying-types such as Pelipper as well as heavily damaging Toxapex, and Ice Punch hits Water Absorb Clodsire, Garchomp, and Flying-types such as Zapdos and Dragonite. Zen Headbutt can be run to damage Amoonguss and do well against Poison teams. Punching Glove allows Urshifu to gain a small boost to its punching moves while being protected from Zapdos's Static and other contact-punishing abilities.

Greninja and Hisuian Samurott are great teammates for Urshifu-R, as they take Psychic-type attacks such as Choice Scarf Indeedee's Psychic and Choice Band Hoopa-U's Zen Headbutt with impunity and punish them with Dark Pulse and Ceaseless Edge, respectively. Hisuian Samurott also sets Spikes to aid in Urshifu-R's wallbreaking efforts, while Greninja can threaten Fighting-types that Urshifu-R struggles with such as Choice Specs Iron Valiant and Sneasler with Extrasensory. In return, Urshifu-R can take Bug-type attacks such as Choice Band Scizor's U-turn and Choice Scarf Kleavor's X-Scissor, as well as threaten opposing Dark-types such as Chien-Pao. Pelipper provides rain support to augment Urshifu-R's already scary wallbreaking abilities as well as a Grass neutrality to take Choice Scarf Meowscarada's Flower Trick. Toxapex and Quagsire take Fairy- and Electric-type attacks, respectively, while both wearing attackers down with Toxic. Toxapex also removes Toxic Spikes, which can put Urshifu-R on a timer. Gastrodon is an alternative Electric immunity, sacrificing physical bulk for a better specially defensive profile. Rotom-W does well in the Water mirror matchup, as well as doing good damage to Toxapex with Volt Switch. Additionally, it can create setup opportunities for Urshifu-R by burning physical attackers such as Dragonite and Great Tusk thanks to Will-O-Wisp. Barraskewda provides a good source of speed control as well as respectable power, while Basculegion-F is a good special attacker that can blow through common Urshifu-R checks such as physically defensive Toxapex and Quagsire. Both of these appreciate Urshifu-R breaking through their checks: Bulk Up Corviknight for Barraskewda and Gastrodon for Basculegion-F. Finally, Walking Wake can blow through defensive staples such as Toxapex, Rotom-W, and Amoonguss with Choice Specs-boosted Draco Meteors. In exchange, Urshifu-R takes care of Hisuian Goodra.

Swords Dance (Fighting).description:
Urshifu-R is a great wallbreaker on Fighting teams thanks to its deadly STAB combination, decent Speed tier, and access to Swords Dance, allowing it to be a good asset versus types like Poison, Water, and Fire. Close Combat is preferred due to its superior damage output; however, Drain Punch may be used instead for recovery and to ignore adverse contact effects thanks to Punching Glove. Aqua Jet threatens frailer revenge killers, taking out faster targets like Flutter Mane, Sandy Shocks, and Volcarona after a Swords Dance boost. Alternatively, Thunder Punch may be used to better deal with Azumarill, Pelipper, and Toxapex, while Zen Headbutt hits Amoonguss in addition to Toxapex and Clodsire. Surging Strikes notably deals with Landorus-T, Skeledirge, and Great Tusk as well as threatening Bulk Up Corviknight and Iron Defense Zamazenta. Other options include Ice Punch to hit Amoonguss while also threatening Dragon-types such as Dragonite and Dragapult and Taunt to prevent Toxapex, Quagsire, and Water Absorb Clodsire from using recovery moves as well as Toxic and Haze. Heavy-Duty Boots improves the matchup against hazard stacking teams like Poison; however, Punching Glove is preferred to use Surging Strikes freely without activating Rocky Helmet chip or Static, easing the Flying matchup and minimizing the need for predictions.

Great Tusk is an amazing teammate, providing Stealth Rock to enhance Urshifu-R's wallbreaking abilities and removing entry hazards with Rapid Spin if Urshifu-R isn't using Heavy-Duty Boots. Furthermore, Great Tusk deals with Toxapex if Urshifu-R isn't using coverage to hit it. Iron Hands provides a buffer in the Flying, Water, and Fairy matchup, threatening Corviknight, Pelipper, and Basculegion-F as well as hitting Flutter Mane, Hatterene, and Iron Valiant with Heavy Slam. Furthermore, Assault Vest Iron Hands acts as a great pivot into special attacks, as Urshifu-R's Special Defense is rather lackluster. In return, Urshifu-R deals with the Ground-types such as Great Tusk and Iron Treads along with Skeledirge. Sneasler is great in the Fairy matchup and provides pivoting and Toxic Spikes to accentuate Urshifu-R's wallbreaking potential. Zamazenta appreciates Urshifu-R heavily wearing down teams to allow it to easily clean up late-game with Iron Defense. Iron Valiant removes threats such as Hisuian Lilligant, Meowscarada, and Greninja while also being a huge asset in the Flying matchup thanks to Thunderbolt. Iron Valiant also values Urshifu-R's ability to break Clodsire and lure in Toxapex.

Choice Band (Grass).description:
Zarude can serve as a physical wallbreaker with a great Speed tier and Choice Band, which allow it to outspeed and beat Pokemon like Gholdengo, Skeledirge, and Heatran, as well as a great pivot with U-turn. Power Whip is an excellent STAB move that allows Zarude to 2HKO Toxapex and Hatterene. Drain Punch grants Zarude a form of recovery while still 2HKOing Hisuian Goodra and Heatran, whereas Close Combat grants Zarude a stronger Fighting-type coverage. Alternatively, Jungle Healing allows Zarude access to longevity and removing its own status safely, as it forces many switches.

Amoonguss is a great defensive partner for Zarude, as it is able to resist Fighting- and Fairy-type attacks from Flutter Mane, Sneasler, and Iron Valiant, melt Toxic Spikes, and spread status for more offensive teammates with either Toxic or Spore. In return, Zarude can threaten the Psychic-types Amoonguss loses to, like Hatterene, Armarouge, and Iron Leaves. Choice Scarf Meowscarada makes for another good teammate, as it can outspeed and threaten Dragon-types such as Dragonite, Dragapult, and Hydreigon with Play Rough. In return, Zarude can handle the aforementioned Steel-types that Meowscarada struggles with, and the two of the form a strong U-turn core to complement their teammates. Hisuian Electrode and Rotom-C is a great addition on any Grass team, as thanks to its Speed tier and Electric typing, it can threaten slower Flying-types such as Corviknight and Enamorus as well as Water-types like Toxapex and Volcanion. Zarude's wallbreaking and support role enables sweepers like Hisuian Liligant to sweep Flying thanks to the latter's access to Ice Spinner as well as being able to clean Steel teams. Brambleghast and Toedscruel make for great teammates, as they can set up hazards to wear down incoming Pokemon for Zarude to break easier and remove them with Rapid Spin to enhance Zarude's pivoting ability. Toedscruel also has enough Special Defense to survive a Flamethrower from Choice Scarf Iron Moth and OHKO it back. On the other hand, Brambleghast's Ghost typing also allows it to spinblock, thus preserving hazards on the field, and thanks to its ability Wind Rider, it can switch into anticipated Flying-type attacks. Iron Leaves makes for another great partner, being able to provide Grass teams a positive matchup against Fighting and Poison teams. In return, Zarude can threaten the Ghost-types it struggles with, like Skeledirge and Gholdengo.

Swords Dance (Grass).description:
Decent in the Steel matchup. Black Glasses lets it 2HKO Skeledirge with Crunch.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Zoomies (Offensive Entry Hazard Support).description:
Regieleki offers Electric teams an incredibly fast cleaner and pivot, shocking threats such as Iron Valiant, Spectrier, and Greninja. Volt Switch lets Regieleki punish foes like Amoonguss, Galarian Slowking, and Hisuian Goodra, which can take advantage of it, allowing teammates like Zapdos and Iron Hands to exploit them instead. Rapid Spin leverages Regieleki's capability to force opponents to bring in a Ground-type or risk significant damage, providing Electric teams with much-needed entry hazard control. Thunder Wave mitigates the threat of Hisuian Lilligant, Spectrier, and Zamazenta if Regieleki is unable to finish these off. Heavy-Duty Boots enhances Regieleki's ability to pivot and consistently remove entry hazards. Alternatively, 28 Atk EVs in conjunction with a Naive nature could be considered, and Magnet is recommended when using Regieleki with Wild Charge to secure an OHKO against Flutter Mane. Magnet also enables Regieleki to reach specific damage thresholds, such as OHKOing Iron Valiant with Thunderbolt. A Timid or Naive nature with maximum Speed EVs is needed to outspeed Choice Scarf users like Iron Valiant, Enamorus, and Hisuian Zoroark.

Given that Ground-types like Ting-Lu, Great Tusk, and Quagsire shut down Regieleki's antics, teammates like Nasty Plot Rotom-W, Swords Dance Iron Hands, and Substitute Zapdos that capitalize on these are crucial for its success. It's important to keep in mind that the player using Regieleki can also choose to double out when anticipating a Ground-type switch-in, allowing teammates to threaten these walls. In return, Regieleki eliminates Greninja, Iron Valiant, and Chien-Pao, which threaten its allies. Magnezone can equip an Assault Vest to check Choice Scarf users like Flutter Mane and Greninja, which zoom past Regieleki, and it can wear down Landorus-T and Quagsire as they repeatedly switch in. Sandy Shocks provides entry hazards to further wear down the opposing team, is bulky enough to bear a hit from and deal with Choice Scarf Sneasler, and puts pressure on Quagsire and Glimmora. Pawmot handles fast Ground-types like Landorus, applies pressure on Flying and Water teams with its Ice- and Grass-type coverage, and grants Regieleki a second chance at sweeping through Revival Blessing. Thundurus-T and Rotom-C are also appreciated, as Thundurus-T provides colorful coverage to deal with Poison- and Ground-types like Amoonguss and Great Tusk, while Rotom-C is able to greatly threaten the entirety of Water teams with its STAB moves.

Choice Specs.description:
Modest nature guarantees the 2HKO on Corviknight with Dragon Energy.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Swords Dance.description:
240 Speed EVs outspeeds Corviknight.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Spectrier.comments:
Other Options

Heavy-Duty Boots may be used if Brambleghast is not chosen as a teammate due to Spectrier's weakness to Toxic Spikes; however, Spectrier doesn't like losing passive recovery if using Substitute. Draining Kiss is an option over Substitute, hitting Dark- and Normal-types like Hydreigon, Ursaluna-B, Darkrai, and Hisuian Zoroark, although Spectrier is susceptible to Toxic and revenge killing attempts without Substitute.

Nasty Plot.description:
Spectrier is a deadly special attacker that is able to quickly snowball against teams thanks to its high Speed, outrinning some of the metagame's fastest threats like Greninja and Iron Valiant. Spectrier utilizes Draining Kiss to hit Dark-type Pokemon that would otherwise resist its STAB Shadow Ball like the aforementioned Greninja as well as non-Choice Scarf Meowscarada and Roaring Moon. Draining Kiss also serves as a secondary recovery option to help heal off the damage taken by setting up a Substitute. Nasty Plot is used to elevate Spectrier's Special Attack to incredible heights without having to KO foes beforehand.
