Lycanroc-D is also a really good partner for Garganacl that appreciates its ability to wear down foes so it can clean up late-game. Coalossal is also a good partner that can not only burn foes but also lay down entry hazards. Coalossal can also clear its side of the field as well with Rapid Spin, alleviating chip damage on the team. It also acts as a soft check to Scizor and Meowscarada due to its neutralities and can potentially neuter them with Flame Body.

Armarouge.comments:
Other Options

Psychic

Psyshock can be used over Stored Power, which allows Armarouge to break through special walls like Blissey and Clodsire. Destiny Bond can be used as the last move, which allows Armarouge to take foes like Alolan Muk or Ting-Lu down with it, opening up opportunities for teammates like Deoxys-S.

Calm Mind (Psychic).description:
With its great defensive stats, access to Calm Mind and Stored Power, and Weak Armor ability, Armarouge becomes a potent setup sweeper on Psychic teams. Flamethrower complements Armarouge's Stored Power, allowing it to hit Steel-types like Scizor, Gholdengo, and Iron Treads. Iron Defense increases Armarouge's survivability against physical attacks, negating Defense drops from Weak Armor as well as letting it survive super effective moves like Earthquake from defensive Great Tusk, activating its Weakness Policy. At +1, Focus Blast allows Armarouge to OHKO Dark-types like Roaring Moon, Hydreigon, and potentially Tyranitar while also 2HKOing Hisuian Goodra and specially defensive Heatran. Aura Sphere can be used over Focus Blast for its accuracy; however, it trades off Focus Blast's higher power, requiring multiple boosts to OHKO common foes like Roaring Moon. Weak Armor boost allows Armarouge to outspeed faster threats like Dragapult, Flutter Mane, and Choice Scarf users like Roaring Moon, Hisuian Samurott, and Landorus while also boosting the power of Stored Power.

Deoxys-S is an excellent partner for Armarouge, providing dual screens support for easier setup and setting entry hazards, making it easier for Armarouge to break through bulky foes. Indeedee sets up Psychic Terrain, which boosts the power of Armarouge's Psychic moves and blocks priority moves like Bisharp's Sucker Punch and Azumarill's Aqua Jet. Indeedee can also provide Healing Wish support, giving Armarouge a second chance to sweep. Latios provides a Ground immunity and a Water resistance and threatens foes with these types back with its BoltBeam coverage. Gallade threatens Dark-types like Ting-Lu and Alolan Muk, while Hoopa-U deals with Ghost-types like non-Choice Specs Flutter Mane, Skeledirge, and Spectrier. Armarouge also appreciates the pair's ability to break through special walls such as Hisuian Goodra, Swampert, and Blissey. Hatterene provides hazard control thanks to Magic Bounce, and Choice Scarf Iron Boulder deals with faster threats like Choice Specs Flutter Mane and Choice Scarf Meowscarada, Greninja, and Roaring Moon. Both appreciate Armarouge handling Steel-types like Archaludon, Scizor, and Corviknight.

Swords Dance (Fire).description:
Ceruledge is an exceptional wallbreaker on Fire teams with its access to strong STAB moves and priority. Swords Dance allows it to set up quickly, enabling it to break walls like Iron Hands and Hisuian Goodra with relative ease. Bitter Blade allows Ceruledge to re-enable its Focus Sash if it's not already consumed. Poltergeist hits foes that resist Bitter Blade like Archaludon, Toxapex, and Heatran. Shadow Sneak allows Ceruledge to check faster threats like Dragapult, Iron Boulder, and Flutter Mane. Jolly Nature makes Ceruledge faster than threats like Choice Scarf Iron Boulder and Choice Scarf Landorus after a boost from Weak Armor, checking the former with Poltergeist and the latter with +2 Bitter Blade.

Both sun setters, Ninetales and Torkoal, are amazing teammates for Ceruledge. Ninetales has access to utility moves such as Encore and Healing Wish to ensure Ceruledge can come safely on the field and can also use Solar Beam to punish Gastrodon and Swampert, while Torkoal can set Stealth Rock up and remove opposing entry hazards with Rapid Spin. Sun is especially primordial for Ceruledge, as it boosts the power of Bitter Blade and enhances Ceruledge's wallbreaking capabilities, notably allowing it to OHKO specially defensive Gliscor after a Swords Dance. Cinderace provides support with Court Change, ensuring Ceruledge's Focus Sash remains intact, and can take out Dark-type foes such as Hydreigon and Tyranitar with High Jump Kick. Ogerpon-H is a great wallbreaking partner for Ceruledge, hitting Heatran whose Air Balloon has been popped as well as Water- and Ground-type threats such as Hisuian Samurott, Keldeo, Swampert, and Hippowdon. Air Balloon Heatran is another great partner, providing a Ground immunity and dealing with Flutter Mane. Finally, Volcarona is a valuable teammate, as it can ease Ceruledge's job by disposing of Toxapex and Urshifu-R while benefiting from the breaches Ceruledge can create against opposing special walls such as Gliscor and Clodsire.

Swords Dance (Ghost).description:
Ceruledge is an impeccable wallbreaker and late-game setup sweeper on Ghost teams, boasting a great Attack stat, a useful ability in Weak Armor, and a hard-hitting STAB combination. Poltergeist is Ceruledge's hardest hitting STAB move, notably OHKOing walls like Clodsire, Sinistcha, and Pecharunt after a Swords Dance. Alternatively, Close Combat may be used to threaten Dark-types such as Ting-Lu, Roaring Moon, and Hisuian Samurott as well as Steel-types such as Heatran and Archaludon. However, Ceruledge without a powerful Ghost-type STAB move will be walled by Skeledirge, Garchomp, and Toxapex. Bitter Blade allows Ceruledge to eliminate Steel-types like Skarmory, and Iron Treads as well as recover any chip damage so Focus Sash can be properly utilized. Furthermore, Bitter Blade can be used to trade with threats like Alolan Muk, Chien-Pao, and Meowscarada. Shadow Sneak scares away faster Ghost-types such as Flutter Mane, Dragapult, and Spectrier, OHKOing them after Ceruledge boosts its Attack stat. A Jolly nature enables Ceruledge to outpace Choice Scarf users like Darkrai, Iron Boulder, Greninja, and Meowscarada after a Weak Armor boost, while an Adamant nature allows Ceruledge to OHKO Archaludon and Rotom-W after a Swords Dance and Stealth Rock damage.

Flutter Mane is a great teammate due to its ability to check Dark-types like Mandibuzz, Hydreigon, and Greninja while in return, Ceruledge takes out specially defensive walls such as Heatran, Clodsire, and Hisuian Goodra. Air Balloon Gholdengo breaks past threats like Ursaluna and Toxapex should Ceruledge not opt for Poltergeist. In exchange, Ceruledge threatens the aforementioned Steel-types and breaks past specially defensive walls like Blissey and Swampert. Sinistcha leverages its resistance to Ground and Water to switch into attacks from Ogerpon-W, Excadrill, and Keldeo, and it can also spread burns via Matcha Gotcha to weaken walls. Dragapult spreads status ailments through Thunder Wave and Will-O-Wisp to chip down physically defensive walls and threatens Dragon-types such as Kommo-o, Raging Bolt, and Dragonite. Spectrier also spreads burns with Will-O-Wisp and appreciates Ceruledge weakening teams so it can easily clean late-game by setting up Calm Mind repeatedly or sweeping via a Choice Scarf set. Brambleghast removes entry hazards with Rapid Spin to maintain Ceruledge's Focus Sash and provides the same resistances that Sinistcha does. Hisuian Zoroark offers a Ghost-type immunity and the ability to remove Dark-types like Hydreigon and Hisuian Samurott via Focus Blast. Froslass provides Spikes support to wear down foes and prevents hazards from being set by using Taunt. Golurk offers Stealth Rock support and can set up beneficial trades using Berries or a Focus Sash.

Choice Specs (Flying).description:
Kilowattrel is an essential component to Flying teams, providing an Electric immunity, pivot support, an excellent Speed tier that allows it to outspeed Choice Specs Greninja and Iron Valiant, and a range of hard-hitting attacks. With rain support, Thunder can be used as Kilowattrel's hard-hitting STAB attack to hit Pokemon—such as Toxapex—that Flying teams can struggle to take down. Thunderbolt is a fine substitute on Flying teams that do not utilize rain. Volt Switch allows Kilowattrel to pivot, making use of Kilowattrel's high Speed tier to get off damage while not being Choice locked. Hurricane couples with the preceding moves to cover Kilowattrel's STAB combination, specifically hitting Ground-types such as Quagsire and Gastrodon. The last slot depends on whether rain is being taken advantage of: on rain teams, Weather Ball can be used to hit Ground-types such as Unaware Clodsire, while Air Slash is another option for non-rain teams that can make up for Hurricane's lower accuracy. Choice Specs allows Kilowattrel to hit extremely hard, letting it OHKO Pokemon such as Azumarill with Volt Switch and Amoonguss with Hurricane. Volt Absorb provides the only Electric immunity for Flying-type teams.

Corviknight is one of Kilowattrel's greatest assets; beyond providing a neutral switch-in to Ice-type attacks—especially in the cases of Chien-Pao and Choice Scarf Greninja—Corviknight provides a physical wall that Kilowattrel can pivot into. It is also Flying's most common Defogger, which is essential, as Kilowattrel is susceptible to Stealth Rock damage, hindering its pivoting. Pelipper is very useful in supporting Kilowattrel, as rain support ensures accuracy of Kilowattrel's Thunder and Hurricane, and U-turn on Pelipper ensures safe pivoting. Talonflame is another defensive supporter, covering Kilowattrel's weakness to Ice-types and offering another Defogger. Dragonite hits the specially defensive walls that Kilowattrel struggles with such as Clodsire and Blissey. Gyarados finds great support from Kilowattrel; as Kilowattrel punches holes in defensive Pokemon such as Amoonguss and Toxapex, Gyarados will have a better chance to sweep late-game. While Kilowattrel has excellent Speed itself, Choice Scarf users such as Flamigo and Salamence can revenge kill Pokemon such as Dragapult and Flutter Mane that outspeed Kilowattrel. Bombirdier offers Stealth Rock support and uses Knock Off to remove key items such as Leftovers on Gastrodon, which puts it into 2HKO range of Hurricane after Stealth Rock damage.

Metronome (Flying).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Offensive Ground Immunity (Electric).description: These are the sample sets before we work on new analyses. These will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Offensive Electric Immunity (Flying).description: These are the sample sets before we work on new analyses. These will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Brambleghast.comments:
Other Options

Grass

Spell Tag is an alternative over Heavy-Duty Boots, as it allows Adamant Brambleghast to OHKO Flutter Mane with Shadow Sneak.

Entry Hazard Control (Ghost).description:
Brambleghast's unique attributes allow it to act not only as an entry hazard setter but as a hazard remover as well. Spikes helps offensive teams deal extra chip damage to Pokemon that would otherwise stifle progress, such as Ting-Lu and Alolan Muk. Rapid Spin removes opposing hazards, helping preserve offensive teammates as well as keeping Ceruledge's Focus Sash intact. Rapid Spin also allows teammates to forgo Heavy-Duty Boots in favor of different items. Power Whip is a great way of making sure Brambleghast is not completely passive, allowing it to hit foes like Swampert, Glimmora, and Primarina for solid damage. Strength Sap not only allows Brambleghast to recover HP, but it also weakens physically oriented foes that fail to OHKO it, such as Great Tusk, Barraskewda, and Hisuian Samurott. Additionally, Brambleghast outspeeds Adamant Azumarill and OHKOes with Power Whip. An offensive EV spread with an Adamant nature can be used to surprise opponents expecting defensive Brambleghast. In this case, Shadow Sneak is an option to OHKO Flutter Mane after Spikes damage. Infiltrator is preferred on offensive sets because it allows Brambleghast to ignore Reflect.

Offensive teammates greatly appreciate Brambleghast's Spikes damage helping them muscle through opposing teams. Choice Specs Flutter Mane thrives when its would-be switch-ins, notably Hisuian Goodra and Alolan Muk, are weakened by Spikes, turning 3HKOs into 2HKOs. Additionally, Flutter Mane is able to take out Dark- and Fire-type Pokemon, such as Mandibuzz, Greninja, and Ogerpon-H, via Moonblast and Power Gem. Spectrier is another Pokemon that thrives with entry hazard support, as it becomes increasingly difficult for opposing teams to switch into Shadow Ball as the Grim Neigh boosts begin to stack. Ceruledge pairs nicely with Brambleghast, as Rapid Spin ensures that Ceruledge's Focus Sash will be kept intact, and it can be used to the best of its ability. Ceruledge is also able to take out Steel-type Pokemon that Brambleghast is unable to deal with. Sinistcha is a great setup sweeper that can utilize Spikes support to steamroll through teams once it gets some Calm Mind boosts. Gholdengo also pairs nicely with Brambleghast, as not only is Gholdengo immune to Rapid Spin, but it also blocks Defog with Good as Gold, ensuring Spikes stays up. Choice Scarf Dragapult is able to deal with faster threats that would otherwise take care of Brambleghast, such as Meowscarada and Hoopa-U. Dragapult's set variety keeps the opponent guessing, which makes switches very punishing. Hisuian Zoroark is a great teammate, as it can freely disguise itself as Gholdengo and not have Stealth Rock damage give the illusion away. Skeledirge is a nice defensive teammate for Brambleghast, as it is able to deal with Steel-type Pokemon and setup sweepers that Brambleghast struggles with.

Spooky Spinner [Entry Hazard Support] (G.description:
Brambleghast finds a position on Grass teams thanks to its unique set of properties in access to Rapid Spin and Spikes, which, along with its part Ghost typing, allows it to set entry hazards reliably while spinblocking Pokemon such as Iron Treads and Great Tusk. Wind Rider allows Brambleghast to check Zapdos and Tornadus-T. Poltergeist lets Brambleghast threaten Ghost- and Psychic-types like Gholdengo, Sinistcha, and Hatterene. Shadow Sneak provides Brambleghast with a much needed from of priority, allowing it to pick off weakened targets such as Dragapult, Iron Boulder, and Latios. Strength Sap can be used over Spikes, as it allows Brambleghast to weaken physical threats like Iron Hands while providing a form of recovery. Adamant is preferred thanks to allowing Brambleghast to OKHO Flutter Mane after minimal chip damage and 2HKO Skarmory after an Attack boost from Hurricane and Stealth Rock damage. Jolly can be used, as it allows Brambleghast to outspeed and check Gholdengo with Poltergeist.

Choice Scarf Meowscarada is a crucial ally for Brambleghast due to it being able to threaten opposing Ghost- and Dark-types like Flutter Mane, Spectrier, and Greninja with Knock Off and Play Rough. Hisuian Lilligant and Breloom can take care of Dark- and Steel-types such as Alolan Muk, Bisharp, and Heatran. Both Ogerpon-H and Ogerpon-C can be used to threaten Bug- and Ice-types such as Galvantula, Frosmoth, and Articuno; on top of that, Ogerpon-H also handles Steel-types such as Corviknight, Gholdengo, and Scizor, while Ogerpon-C deals with Flying- and Fire-type threats such as Enamorus and Volcarona. Amoonguss can support Brambleghast by threatening Fairy-types out such as Iron Valiant, Enamorus, and Primarina with its Sludge Bomb along with being able to use Spore to give Brambleghast safe entry. Hydrapple provides a Fire neutrality and can use Earth Power to deal with Fire-types like Heatran and Volcanion. Sinistcha appreciates Brambleghast setting up Spikes, and in return, it can act as a second spinblocker that reliably checks threats such as Iron Hands and Skarmory.

Entry Hazard Support (Grass).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Sun Sweeper (Fire).description:
Scovillain is one of Fire's best sweepers thanks to Chlorophyll. Under sun, Scovillain outspeeds a multitude of threats such as non-Choice Scarf Greninja and Chien-Pao. Growth is run for Scovillain to boost its damage output while under sun, letting it secure KOs more easily. Giga Drain threatens Pokemon like Ting-Lu, allowing Scovillain's teammates to break through them late-game, and it also aids in improving Scovillain's longevity by recovering its HP. Fire Blast can be used to have a chance of 2HKOing Skeledirge and Clodsire under sun, but Flamethrower is the preferred Fire-type STAB move, since its accuracy is higher than Fire Blast's. Stomping Tantrum hits opposing Fire-types such as Iron Moth. Solar Beam is an alternative to Stomping Tantrum, OHKOing the aforementioned Ting-Lu and Toxapex after Growth in sun. Life Orb and 32 Attack EVs maximize Scovillain's power, letting it 2HKO specially defensive Clodsire with Stomping Tantrum after Stealth Rock damage. If opting for Solar Beam, the remaining EVs go into HP. A Naive nature allows Scovillain to outspeed Choice Scarf users like Great Tusk and Iron Moth under sun while not losing out on Stomping Tantrum damage.

Torkoal is a mandatory partner for Scovillain, as its ability to set up sun allows Scovillain to outspeed many faster threats like Iron Treads, Iron Jugulis, and Quaquaval, dealing heavy chip damage or outright KOing them. Scovillain appreciates Torkoal getting rid of entry hazards; in return, Scovillain deals with Water- and Ground-types like Gastrodon, Quagsire, and Sandy Shocks. Paldean Tauros-F is a great offensive partner for Scovillain, granting benefits such as breaking dual screens from Pokemon like Klefki and Grimmsnarl, which impede Scovillain's sweeping ability. Paldean Tauros-F is also able to check specially defensive walls like Blissey; in return, Scovillain breaks past bulky Water-types like Slowking and Toxapex after one Growth under sun. Cinderace can offer alternate entry hazard removal with Court Change, which helps Scovillain's longevity. Furthermore, Cinderace's Speed tier allows it to handle offensive Pokemon that naturally outpace Scovillain outside of sun like Hydreigon and Iron Treads, the former of which Scovillain cannot hit neutrally. Scovillain also appreciates Volcarona as an offensive partner thanks to its non-weather-reliant sweeping potential in Quiver Dance, dealing with Dragon-types such as Hydreigon and Garchomp, while Scovillain can weaken Volcarona's checks like Ting-Lu, Unaware Clodsire, and Toxapex throughout the course of the game.

Choice Specs (Fire).description:
Scovillain turns up the heat on its Fire Blast with a Choice Specs set, burning up Clodsire and Skeledirge, which usually have no problem with its Growth set. It's notably also strong enough to score a 2HKO on physically defensive Toxapex after minimal chip damage, allowing Scovillain to beat Poison teams if it hits every move. Alternatively, Overheat has better accuracy and still 2HKOes Skeledirge and Clodsire, but the Special Attack drop makes it less spammable. Giga Drain threatens a 2HKO on Pelipper, which may be tempted to come into Scovillain to block Solar Beam, and also provides Scovillain a form of recovery. A Timid nature lets it outspeed threats such as Choice Scarf Gengar and Protosynthesis-boosted Choice Specs Walking Wake to burn them to a crisp, while a Modest nature has better odds of 2HKOing Toxapex with Giga Drain and OHKOing Baxcalibur with Flamethrower at the cost of outspeeding only up to non-Speed boosting Choice Scarf Sandy Shocks.

Torkoal is a mandatory teammate, as it sets sun, which Scovillain needs to boost its Speed with Chlorophyll, and provides entry hazard support with its ability to set Stealth Rock and remove entry hazards with Rapid Spin. Other forms of entry hazard support in Defog Talonflame and Court Change Cinderace are also appreciated; they also have access to U-turn, which allows Scovillain to get in more times to wallbreak. Ceruledge packs Shadow Sneak to deal with Flutter Mane, which otherwise outspeeds and dispatches Scovillain with ease. In return, Scovillain obliterates bulky Unaware walls like Quagsire, Dondozo, and Skeledirge, all of which hinder Swords Dance Ceruledge from cutting down Water and Ghost teams. Similarly, Volcarona and Iron Moth love Scovillain's ability to eliminate bulky walls like Clodsire and Ting-Lu, allowing them to clean up Poison and Ground teams late-game. Skeledirge deals with Kingambit and Choice Scarf Meowscarada, which threaten Scovillain with priority or by outspeeding it and picking it off.

Tinkaton.comments:
Other Options

Fairy

Thunder Wave can provide valuable support, slowing down threats like Sneasler and Meowscarada and allowing them to be comfortably eliminated. Encore can lock foes into passive moves such as Roost or Recover, giving Tinkaton safe setup opportunities or a safe switch-in for one of its teammates. An alternative EV spread of of 112 HP / 252 Atk / 144 Spe with an Adamant nature can also be used. This EV spread still outspeeds Mamoswine but can now OKHO Gliscor and Primarina with a Swords Dance boost and Stealth Rock chip damage.

Swords Dance (Fairy).description:
Tinkaton finds a niche on Fairy teams thanks to its secondary Steel typing and unique support options. Gigaton Hammer OHKOes Rock- and Fairy-types like Glimmora, Kleavor, Flutter Mane, and Hatterene. Knock Off provides Tinkaton with another offensive option that removes important items from Steel-types such as Corviknight and Archaludon. Swords Dance allows Tinkaton to gain offensive pressure, securing OKHOs on more defensive Pokemon such as Galarian Weezing and Amoonguss while also dealing with walls like Defog Corviknight. Finally, Stealth Rock allows Tinkaton to provide utility when causing havoc offensively isn't an option. The EVs allow Tinkaton to get a jump on threats like Glimmora and Kleavor, with the rest invested into its bulk.

Tinkaton majorly appreciates the support of Flutter Mane, which can use Thunderbolt and Power Gem to handle the Water- and Fire-types that Tinkaton cannot handle, namely Toxapex, Greninja, Ogerpon-H, and Torkoal. Enamorus, thanks to its secondary Flying typing, can switch in to Ground-type attacks from the likes of Great Tusk, Gliscor, Landorus, and Excadrill and threaten back with the appropriate coverage. Klefki and Tinkaton form an entry hazard-stacking core that Fairy's offensive threats appreciate. Tinkaton also enjoys dual screens support from Klefki, making its setup much safer. Mixed Iron Valiant provides incredible coverage, being able to remove targets like Landorus, Toxapex, and Archaludon, which otherwise wall Tinkaton. Hatterene values Tinkaton's utility in Stealth Rock and Knock Off chipping down switch-ins like Alolan Muk and Hisuian Goodra and can support Tinkaton by being able to use Nuzzle and slow down faster threats like Iron Boulder and Iron Valiant, which can threaten Tinkaton. Primarina cherishes Tinkaton's ability to remove Assault Vest from targets like Iron Hands and Galarian Slowking that can prove problematic. In return, Calm Mind Primarina can threaten bulky Steel- and Fire-type targets like Corviknight, Heatran, and Gouging Fire, which are hinderances for Tinkaton. Azumarill takes advantage of Tinkaton's Stealth Rock, which provides crucial chip damage, allowing it to OHKO targets like Tozapex and Corviknight that can be hurdles for both Tinkaton and Azumarill.

Entry Hazard Support (Flying).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Glimmora.comments:
Other Options

Rock

Choice Specs can be run over Choice Scarf to become a fierce wallbreaker, taking on Toxapex, Rotom-W, and Ursaluna-B easier. However, this makes Glimmora vulnerable to faster threats, such as Greninja, Iron Valiant, and Chien-Pao, and will likely require some other form of speed control. Spikes can be used to allow Glimmora to rack up entry hazard damage on forced switches against foes such as Iron Valiant and Quagsire.

Poison (Choice Scarf)

Corrosion + Toxic can provide a reasonable deterrence to multiple of Glimmora's checks like Corviknight, Galarian Slowking, and Alolan Muk along with catching Sucker Punch from Kingambit. However, this will force Glimmora to always switch because it will be locked into Toxic, necessitating a solid defensive backbone to take the incoming hits.

Toxic Spreader (Poison).description:
Glimmora provides useful utility for Poison teams thanks to its unique set of tools in entry hazard support and Corrosion Toxic, which is capable of putting walls such as Toxapex and Corviknight on a timer. Power Gem is used to threaten problematic Flying- and Fire-types like Articuno, Zapdos, Torkoal, and Iron Moth. Earth Power allows Glimmora to deal solid damage to Steel-types like Gholdengo and Heatran after their Air Balloon is popped. Alternatively, Mortal Spin can be run to spread poison onto Hatterene, which cannot be poisoned otherwise thanks to Magic Bounce, and remove entry hazards.

Due to Glimmora's immense weakness to Ground- and Water-type attacks, Amoonguss is a valuable partner, taking on dangerous threats such as Great Tusk, Swampert, and Urshifu-R with ease. Toxapex can similarly assist against Water-types like Barraskewda and Keldeo, Steel-types like Scizor and Corviknight, and Fighting-types like Zamazenta and Sneasler. Toxapex can also run Toxic Spikes to assist Glimmora with hazard stacking. Galarian Weezing provides a solid Ground immunity thanks to Levitate, allowing it to come in on threats like Clodsire, Garchomp, and Ting-Lu, and it provides solid hazard removal with Defog. Overqwil pairs well with Glimmora, providing both Spikes and Toxic Spikes, which allows it to complete the hazard stacking-core while also taking on foes like Iron Boulder, Gallade, and Dragapult thanks to Intimidate. Alolan Muk provides Knock Off support to remove Heavy-Duty Boots from foes such as Dragonite, Iron Moth, and Volcarona, increasing the threat of Glimmora's Stealth Rock; it can also deal with Psychic- and Ghost-type threats like Espathra, Hatterene, and Flutter Mane. Galarian Slowking's Future Sight can lure in special walls such as Alolan Muk and Hisuian Goodra, which Glimmora can take advantage of to spread Toxic. Galarian Slowking can also check threats like Heatran and Terapagos, which prove problematic for Glimmora. Okidogi and Sneasler greatly appreciate Glimmora's ability to put physical walls like Pecharunt, Toxapex, and Sableye on timers with Toxic, while Glimmora appreciates their ability to check troublesome Steel-types like Kingambit, Hisuian Goodra, and Empoleon.

Choice Scarf (Rock).description:
Glimmora is a decent Choice Scarf user for Rock teams due to its high Special Attack and Speed to take on threats like Ogerpon-W, Hisuian Lilligant, and non-Choice Scarf Urshifu-R. Earth Power threatens Steel- and Poison-types like Gholdengo, non-Air Balloon Heatran, Iron Moth, and Sneasler. Sludge Wave is a strong STAB move that can take on Fairy- and Grass-types such as Hisuian Lilligant, Ogerpon-W, Ogerpon-H, and non-Choice Scarf Iron Valiant. Dazzling Gleam takes out Dark-, Dragon-, and Fighting-types like Sableye, Hydreigon, and Kommo-o. Energy Ball allows Glimmora to deal with Water- and Ground-types like Quagsire and non-Choice Scarf Greninja and Great Tusk. Mortal Spin can be run over Energy Ball to help remove entry hazards and poison foes in the process. Power Gem can be run instead to deal with Baxcalibur, Chien-Pao, Volcarona, and Choice Scarf Kleavor.

Tyranitar provides sand and a Psychic immunity while also taking on special attackers for Glimmora such as Spectrier, Espathra, and Hisuian Zoroark. Thanks to the sand Tyranitar provides, Glimmora can survive a Choice Specs Draco Meteor from Dragapult due to the Special Defense boost and 2HKO it with Dazzling Gleam. In return, Glimmora also takes out Hisuian Samurott, Quagsire, and Ogerpon-W for Tyranitar. Ogerpon-C can compensate for Glimmora's Ground weakness, and, after setup, it can eliminate Ursaluna-B, Dragonite, and Landorus. Glimmora aids Ogerpon-C by handling threats such as Kleavor when running Power Gem, Iron Valiant, and Hisuian Lilligant. Glimmora can further aid Ogerpon-C with Mortal Spin by removing entry hazards to help prevent Ogerpon-C's Sturdy from breaking. Choice Band Hisuian Arcanine is a strong wallbreaker that can deal with Corviknight, Clodsire, and Toxapex. Coalossal can serve as entry hazard control to allow Glimmora to drop Mortal Spin; it can additionally support the team with Spikes, facilitating Glimmora's cleaning. Coalossal also deals with Scizor, Kingambit, Chien-Pao, and Corviknight. Glimmora returns the favor by threatening Clodsire and Toxapex, which can threaten Coalossal. Lead Kleavor can set up Stealth Rock and potentially break opposing Ceruledge's Focus Sash. In exchange, Glimmora eliminates physical walls like Quagsire and non-Air Balloon Heatran for Kleavor. Iron Defense Garganacl is a stallbreaker that can force progress with Salt Cure in matchups against defensive Pokemon like Toxapex, Hisuian Goodra, and Galarian Slowking. Glimmora dispatches Choice Band Mamoswine after Stealth Rock, entry hazard chip and Urshifu-R, which can threaten Garganacl. Alolan Golem can trap and eliminate Steel-types like Scizor and Corviknight. Diancie can set up Stealth Rock while also OHKOing Chien-Pao with Body Press and Kommo-o with Moonblast if Glimmora is not running Dazzling Gleam.

Choice Scarf (Poison).description:
Choice Scarf allows Glimmora to become a potent offensive threat on Poison teams, being able to outspeed several key targets like Iron Valiant, Ogerpon-H, and Chien-Pao and swiftly remove them. Power Gem picks off the threatening Ice- and Fire-types of the tier including Chien-Pao, Ceruledge, and Cinderace. Sludge Wave is Glimmora's strongest move and can KO threats like Ogerpon-H, Iron Valiant, and Alolan Ninetales. Earth Power hits the Steel-types that would effortlessly switch into Glimmora's STAB moves such as non-Air Balloon Heatran, Gholdengo, and Archaludon. Finally, Glimmora has a choice between Energy Ball, which threatens Choice Specs Greninja and Ground-types like Mamoswine and Ursaluna-B, and Dazzling Gleam, which strikes Dragon-type foes including Dragapult and Choice Band Roaring Moon.

Levitate Galarian Weezing's immunity to Ground- and Dragon-type attacks allows it to come in on the bulky Ground- and Dragon-types Glimmora can't handle such as Clodsire, Garchomp, and Dragonite. Galarian Weezing also provides solid utility by taking Knock Off from Meowscarada and Great Tusk, in addition to removing entry hazards with Defog to allow Glimmora safe entry. Amoonguss and Toxapex handle Water-types that can outspeed Glimmora or survive its Energy Ball like Urshifu-R, Barraskewda, and Dondozo. Amoonguss also helps out against Ground-types like Iron Treads and Excadrill thanks to Giga Drain and Foul Play along with providing safe entry for Glimmora thanks to Spore. Toxapex can switch into Steel-types like Scizor and Metagross, which threaten Glimmora out with their priority Bullet Punch, and handle them with Rocky Helmet and Recover. Alolan Muk can switch into the Ghost- and Psychic-types that threaten Glimmora like Gholdengo, Flutter Mane, and Latias and threaten them back with Knock Off, which can prevent them from threatening Glimmora later. Overqwil handles physical Psychic-types like Gallade, Metagross, and Iron Boulder and can set Spikes to chip special walls like Alolan Muk and Hisuian Goodra attemping to threaten Glimmora out. Overqwil meanwhile benefits from Glimmora's Toxic Debris powering up Barb Barrage. Both Okidogi and Sneasler complement Glimmora by being physical attackers capable of removing special walls like Alolan Muk and Blissey with their incredible Fighting-type STAB moves, and both benefit from Glimmora's ability to remove physical walls like Talonflame and Skarmory. Iron Moth complements Glimmora by being able to use its Fire-type STAB moves to melt Steel-types like Corviknight, Archaludon, and Excadrill, which give Glimmora significant issues.

Belly Drum.description:
Cetitan's unique combination of Slush Rush and Belly Drum make it a great snow sweeper for Ice teams. Cetitan is able to use Belly Drum in combination with Slush Rush to boost its Attack and Speed to some of the highest in the tier. Icicle Crash is Cetitan's best way of attacking, shredding most foes that aim to stand in its way. Ice Shard is used to pick off the few Choice Scarf users that outspeed Cetitan, such as Meowscarada, Enamorus, and Flutter Mane. Earthquake is useful for hitting the Steel-, Water- and Fire-types that resist Icicle Crash and Ice Shard, such as Heatran, Toxapex, and Ceruledge. Sitrus Berry is used to restore some of Cetitan's HP after Belly Drum, increasing its longevity.

Since Cetitan needs snow to be able to fulfill its role, Alolan Ninetales is a mandatory teammate. Not only can Alolan Ninetales provide snow support, but it can also provide Aurora Veil support, further helping Cetitan stay on the field. Since Cetitan opts to use Sitrus Berry instead of Heavy-Duty Boots, teammates that can remove entry hazards are great support, such as Avalugg and Alolan Sandslash. Avalugg serves better as a dedicated defensive wall, while Sandslash can also take advantage of Slush Rush, Swords Dance, and Knock Off. Kyurem is excellent at dealing with Unaware walls that would otherwise ignore Cetitan's Belly Drum boost; it is able to use Freeze-Dry and defeat walls such as Quagsire and Dondozo while also having access to Earth Power, which defeats Skeledirge. Mamoswine is a good teammate, as it can provide hazard support to break Focus Sash and secure OHKOs on targets such as Corviknight, as well as soften the blow from Fire-type attacks.

Curse + Resttalk.description:
Dondozo is a staple on rainless Water teams due to its phenomenal bulk and ability to check setup sweepers such as Gholdengo and Ceruledge, thanks to Unaware. Dondozo faces competition from Quagsire as the team's Unaware user, as Quagsire has an immunity to Electric-type attacks and can stack entry hazards; however, it drops to Grass-type attacks. Curse allows Dondozo to apply offensive pressure, boosting its attack and allowing it to better hit targets such as Ogerpon-W and Urshifu-R while also allowing it to better tank hits in return. Rest allows Dondozo to shrug off status and gives it longevity, allowing it to constantly absorb powerful attacks for Water teams, such as Great Tusk's Headlong Rush. Sleep Talk enables Dondozo to further take advantage of Rest, allowing it to continue to setup or attack its target while asleep. Dondozo takes advantage of its STAB through the use of Waterfall, doing more damage, but Avalanche allows Dondozo to OHKO Meowscarada, as well as pressure Water-immune Pokemon such as Clodsire and Gastrodon. Its EV spread allows Dondozo to tank attacks from Gholdengo and Flutter Mane, due to its already high physical defense, which may be further boosted by Curse.

Choice Specs Greninja is an insane wallbreaker, with coverage allowing it to take on a variety of Pokemon such as an opposing Dondozo or Ting-Lu with Grass Knot, Garchomp with Ice Beam, Amoonguss and Clodsire with Extrasensory, and Espathra with Dark Pulse. Toxapex absorbs Toxic Spikes for Dondozo, spreads Toxic, and shrugs off Grass-type attacks such as Flower Trick from Choice Scarf Meowscarada and Grass Knot from Greninja. Gastrodon provides an Electric immunity and it can tank attacks from special attackers such as Flutter Mane; however, it needs to be wary of Energy Ball. Gastrodon can also stack Spikes or set Stealth Rock, wearing down foes for Dondozo. The defensive core of Dondozo, Toxapex, and Gastrodon also gives Water teams opportunities to scout powerful attacks by allowing for each to switch-in for another, such as Dondozo switching in for Gastrodon or Toxapex to check Ceruledge. Earthquake also allows it to take on Poison- and Electric-type Pokemon such as Clodsire and Sandy Shocks. Quaquaval can remove hazards with Rapid Spin for Dondozo and offensive Quaquaval sets can take on common threats to Water teams such as Greninja after one Aqua Step or Meowscarada after two.

Clodsire.overview:
Poison

Clodsire has a lot of tools going for it on Poison such as Stealth Rock, Unaware or Water Absorb, and the best special bulk of any viable Poison-type, making it the perfect counter to Flutter Mane, Hydreigon, or Walking Wake, depending on the chosen ability. However, Alolan Muk and Galarian Slowking offer more in terms of a special wall, with Alolan Muk offering an immunity to Psychic and a resistance to Ghost, while Galarian Slowking is a Regenerator wall that can take on Latios and has a flurry of coverage options that may make them more appealing to the reader.
Clodsire.comments:
Other Options

Ground

Gunk Shot can be used instead of Poison Jab for more power, notably 2HKOing Primarina.

Water Absorb (Ground).description:
Due to its remarkable bulk, rare dual-typing, and fantastic ability, Clodsire is a mainstay on Ground teams. Water Absorb stops common Water-type threats like Keldeo, Toxapex, and Primarina in their tracks. Poison Jab hits threats like Primarina, Enamorus, and Iron Valiant. Haze can be used to slow down opposing setup sweepers such as Hatterene and Volcarona. Toxic Spikes eases the Dragon and Fairy matchups due to their lack of entry hazard removal and applies pressure on teams in general, completing Ground's entry hazard stacking core. Toxic may be used instead to punish Pokemon like Latios and Mandibuzz, which freely switch into Clodsire otherwise. The given EV spread avoids the 2HKO from Choice Scarf Greninja's Ice Beam, Choice Scarf Meowscarada's Flower Trick, and Ogerpon-W's unboosted Horn Leech.

Great Tusk, Iron Treads, and Excadrill appreciate Clodsire checking the aforementioned Water-types as well as other threats such as Iron Valiant and Flutter Mane. In return, Choice Scarf Great Tusk pressures Ice- and Dark-types like Hydreigon, Kyurem, and Choice Specs Greninja. Iron Treads clears entry hazards and threatens Hatterene, as well as being able to switch into Psychic-type attacks from Pokemon like Indeedee and Latios. Excadrill appreciates Clodsire's ability to switch into Water-type attackers that it cannot OHKO, such as Primarina, Urshifu-R, and Keldeo. Landorus and Gliscor are both great teammates for Clodsire because they can switch into Ground-type attacks from Pokemon such as Excadrill, Great Tusk, and Garchomp. In return, Landorus is capable of dealing with Grass-type Pokemon such as Breloom and Rillaboom, while Gliscor can stack more hazards. Unaware Quagsire pairs well with Clodsire, as it checks setup sweepers such as Azumarill, Ceruledge, and Dragonite. Furthermore, Quagsire is capable of using Toxic, allowing Clodsire to freely run Toxic Spikes, adding to the team's hazard stacking prowess. Ting-Lu not only forms a potent hazard stacking core with Clodsire but can switch into Psychic-type attacks.

The Clod (Special Wall) (Poison).description:
Due to its amazing Special Defense and ability in Unaware, Clodsire is a wall that can check the multitude of special setup sweepers in the tier such as Hydreigon, Volcarona, and Raging Bolt. Earthquake deals solid damage to threats like Volcarona, Gholdengo, and Heatran. Low Kick allows Clodsire to deal with Hydreigon and pop Air Balloon on the likes of Heatran and Raging Bolt. Stealth Rock can chip Flying-types like Corviknight, Enamorus, and Galarian Weezing that wall it. Alternatively, Spikes can be used to provide more reliable chip damage on threats such as Okidogi, Great Tusk, and Excadrill, which majorly threaten Clodsire. Alternatively, Curse can let Clodsire boost its Defense, turning it into a threatening wincon, and allow it to comfortably handle physical attackers like Gouging Fire. Running Black Sludge grants Clodsire superior longevity, if setting up with Curse, while Heavy-Duty Boots can allow it to come in safely on threats. The alternative EV spread used allows Clodsire to survive three Modest Raging Bolt Draco Meteors with maximum EVs in Special Attack and three uninvested Gouging Fire Earthquakes after a singular Curse.

Amoonguss and Toxapex assist Clodsire by being defensive walls capable of taking on Water-type threats such as Barraskewda, Quaquaval, and Keldeo. Amoonguss can also take on Ground-types that threaten Clodsire like Great Tusk and Swampert, while Toxapex can handle Ice-type threats like Weavile and Cloyster. Overqwil can handle threats like Iron Boulder and Gallade, and it can complement Clodsire by running Spikes and Toxic Spikes to create an entry hazard-stacking core. Galarian Weezing provides entry hazard removal with Defog and burns physical setup sweepers like Iron Hands, allowing Clodsire to easily wall them. Alolan Muk is a teammate with a Psychic immunity that can handle threats like Hatterene, Espathra, and Deoxys-S. Clodsire appreciates Glimmora being able to spread Corrosion Toxic onto walls like Skarmory and Corviknight, which sit on Clodsire, along with being able to threaten Flying-types like Zapdos and Moltres with Power Gem. Iron Moth helps to remove Ice-type threats like Alolan Ninetales, Mamoswine, and Frosmoth. Okidogi and Sneasler help break down Ice- and Steel-type threats Clodsire cannot handle such as Kyurem, Alolan Sandslash, and Skarmory.

Offensive Utility (Fighting).description:
With an impressive physical statline, Great Tusk smashes through the competition, providing great utility and offensive presence all in one slot. Focus Sash synergizes well, as it lets Great Tusk take an attack from Flutter Mane and KO it in return and get rid of popular Air Balloon users such as Glimmora, Heatran, and Raging Bolt through the combination Rapid Spin and Earthquake. Earthquake is Great Tusk's key STAB move, threatening Poison-, Electric-, and Fire-types like Toxapex, Iron Hands, Gouging Fire, and Ceruledge. Headlong Rush is another option to secure an OHKO on Greninja after Stealth Rock. Knock Off hits both Dragapult and Latios hard while providing general utility against the rest of the tier such as removing Choice Scarf, Rocky Helmet, and Heavy Duty Boots from the opposing team. Alternatively, Ice Spinner can be used to improve the Flying matchup, as it deals with Dragonite and Gliscor. Rapid Spin plays an important role by removing entry hazards from Great Tusk's side and boosting its Speed, allowing Great Tusk to outspeed many prominent threats such as Choice Specs Flutter Mane, Dragapult, and Latios. Taunt can be used instead to notably prevent Skarmory, Ting Lu, and Corviknight from setting up entry hazards, setting up itself, or using utility moves like Defog, Roost, and Whirlwind. Lastly, Great Tusk can set Stealth Rock up, ensuring opposing Focus Sashes will not impede the team's progress in the game.

Assault Vest Iron Hands and Gallade are both great partners, as they can absorb special hits that would OHKO Great Tusk from foes like Hatterene, Choice Scarf Greninja, and Choice Scarf Enamorus. They also aid Great Tusk, should its Focus Sash be disabled, by checking and OHKOing in retaliation popular Choice Specs users like Dragapult, Latios, and Flutter Mane, while they both appreciate Great Tusk's ability to remove entry hazards from the field. They both come with their matchups of predilection: Flying and Fairy for Iron Hands and Poison and Water for Gallade. Iron Hands takes on Primarina, Hatterene, and Corviknight, while Gallade slashes through Amoonguss, Galarian Weezing, and Keldeo. Choice Scarf Sneasler can deal with Grass- and Fairy-types such as the Ogerpon formes, Primarina, and Iron Valiant while retaining momentum with U-turn. With its especially large movepool, Iron Valiant can help Great Tusk in many ways, from getting rid of Flying-type Pokemon with BoltBeam coverage like Landorus, Corviknight, and Gliscor to deleting physical walls such as Sableye and Hippowdon with STAB Moonblast, and it appreciates Great Tusk's ability to remove Assault Vest from Tornadus-T. Water-type wallbreakers like Keldeo and Urshifu-R also synergize quite well with Great Tusk, as Great Tusk provides a useful Electric immunity, allowing them to focus on dismantling opposing defensive Pokemon such as Corviknight and Skarmory. Zamazenta benefits a lot from the hazard control Great Tusk offers, as it lets Zamazenta run safely an IronPress or Choice Band set without worrying about entry hazards. Finally, Hisuian Lilligant provides some utility in the form of Sleep Powder and can also aid offensively in the Flying, Water, and Ground matchups with its Victory Dance set, effectively suppressing the likes of Urshifu-R, Swampert, and Landorus.

Defensive Utility (Fighting).description:
Boasting impressive bulk, Great Tusk takes the physical wall role for Fighting teams, being able to tank multiple hits from physical attackers such as Dragonite and Ceruledge. Earthquake threatens Poison-, Electric-, and Fire-types like Clodsire, Iron Hands, and Gouging Fire. Knock Off hits Earthquake switch-ins such as Air Balloon Gholdengo, Latios, and Tornadus-T and removes their item. Alternatively, Ice Spinner can threaten Gliscor and Dragonite, preventing them from setting up on Great Tusk. Rapid Spin provides entry hazard control and boosts Great Tusk's Speed, which can allow it to weaken offensive foes such as Latios. Taunt can be used instead to notably prevent Skarmory, Ting-Lu, and Hippowdon from setting up hazards and prevents Corviknight's Defog. Lastly, Great Tusk can set Stealth Rock up, breaking Focus Sash on Ceruledge and Breloom and greatly helping the team progress in the game. The EV spread lets Great Tusk outspeed maximum Speed Modest Raging Bolt while maximizing Great Tusk's physical bulk.

Defensive Great Tusk appreciates teammates that can make up for its abysmal special bulk like Assault Vest Iron Hands and Assault Vest Gallade. Assault Vest Iron Hands deals with Flying- and Fairy-types threats such as Primarina, Hatterene, and Gyarados. Gallade gives Fighting teams the edge in troublesome matchups like Poison and Water by slashing through Keldeo, Amoonguss, and Galarian Weezing. In return, they both appreciate Great Tusk dealing with Excadrill. Defensive Great Tusk also synergizes well with popular Fighting team sweepers such as Iron Valiant, Keldeo, and Sneasler, removing entry hazards and taking physical hits for them, while they break through the opponent's team. Iron Valiant can delete Fighting-, Dark-, and Dragon-types like Keldeo, Sableye, and Choice Specs Latios with Moonblast while threatening Flying teams thanks to its access to BoltBeam. Keldeo appreciates the Electric immunity Great Tusk comes with, as it lets it focus more on overwhelming defensive cores like Corviknight and Skarmory. Sneasler takes on Fairy- and Grass-types threats such as Enamorus, Iron Valiant, and Ogerpon formes while providing U-turn support to bring Great Tusk in on physical threats such as Gliscor. Hisuian Lilligant can put a foe to sleep and dispose of Ground- and Water-types foes with its Victory Dance set such as Landorus, Swampert, and Urshifu-R. Finally, Both IronPress and Choice Band Zamazenta benefit a lot from the hazard control Great Tusk offers by setting up or sweeping without having to worry about hazards.

Bulk Up (Ground).description:
With Bulk Up, Great Tusk acts as a decent setup sweeper on Ground teams that also deters Iron Defense Zamazenta and Kingambit, both of which can be a bit difficult for Ground teams to handle. Body Press OHKOes Kingambit, Weavile, and Mamoswine after Stealth Rock while also taking advantage of its respectable Defense and Bulk Up to muscle through foes like Corviknight and Zamazenta. Knock Off provides coverage against Ghost-types like Gholdengo and Dragapult while removing key items such as Archaludon's Leftovers and Skarmory's Rocky Helmet. Rapid Spin not only removes entry hazards to support its teammates, but with the Speed boost, Great Tusk is also able to outspeed normally faster foes like Gouging Fire. 44 Speed EVs allow Great Tusk to outspeed and threaten Modest Magnezone and Jolly Kingambit.

Clodsire is a crucial teammate for Great Tusk, since it sets up entry hazards to wear down incoming foes, is a Water-immune teammate, and fares well against the likes of Flutter Mane, Walking Wake, and Primarina, which Great Tusk hates. In return, Clodsire appreciates Great Tusk beating Ground-types that threaten it such as Excadrill and Iron Treads. Ting-Lu can also set up entry hazards, and in addition, it phazes out setup sweepers such as Volcarona and Hydreigon with Whirlwind and fares well in the Psychic and Dragon matchups, notably switching in against Latios and Choice Specs Dragapult. Mamoswine and Landorus appreciate Great Tusk removing hazards, which would otherwise wear them down easily. In return, Mamoswine aids in the Flying and Dragon matchups, taking on the likes of Enamorus, Dragonite, Hisuian Goodra, and Dragapult, while Landorus's coverage hits a myriad of foes like Hatterene, Archaludon, and IronPress Zamazenta. Late-game sweepers such as Swords Dance Garchomp appreciate Great Tusk beating foes like Kingambit so it can sweep more easily. Mixed Garchomp is also an option, as it lures and heavily damages Skarmory and Archaludon, which give Great Tusk trouble. Sand teams benefit from Great Tusk's ability to keep Zamazenta and Kingambit at bay; in return, Sand Rush Excadrill swiftly deals with Flutter Mane, Choice Scarf Meowscarada, and Greninja for Great Tusk.

Choice Scarf (Ground).description:
A Choice Scarf combined with high-power STAB moves, great physical bulk, and high Attack makes Great Tusk one of the best options on Ground teams for a wallbreaker and late-game cleaner, threatening the likes of Choice Scarf Gholdengo and Kingambit. Close Combat hits different threats to Ground teams like Choice Specs Greninja and Hoopa-U. Headlong Rush OHKOes Flutter Mane. Earthquake can be used over Headlong Rush despite its lower power due to not causing Defense and Special Defense drops, making it better for sweeping. Ice Spinner targets the likes of Garchomp, Dragonite, Gliscor, and Landorus. Alternatively, Stone Edge targets Flying- and Bug-types such as Articuno, Talonflame, and Volcarona. Megahorn can also be used to target Grass- and Psychic-types such as Ogerpon-W, Latios, and Slowbro; Slowbro is notably 2HKOed by it after Stealth Rock damage. Knock Off prevents Air Balloon Gholdengo from walling Great Tusk, and it also removes items from foes such as Heavy-Duty Boots from Gyarados and Brambleghast and Leftovers from Corviknight.

Clodsire, Ting-Lu, Hippowdon, and Gliscor provide entry hazard support in wearing down foes to aid Great Tusk, guaranteeing a 2HKO on specially defensive Corviknight and an OHKO on the Ogerpon formes. Additionally, Clodsire provides a Water immunity, and its Poison typing allows it to melt Toxic Spikes and threaten Grass- and Fairy-types such as Meowscarada, Flutter Mane, and Clefable; Ting-Lu phazes setup sweepers such as Volcarona and Dragonite with Whirlwind; Hippowdon sets up sand to wear down foes further; and Gliscor spreads status with Toxic and shuts down passive walls with Taunt. In return, they appreciate Great Tusk dealing with Ice-types like Kyurem. Sand-boosted Excadrill takes out Choice Scarf users such as Iron Valiant, Enamorus, and Iron Boulder. In return, Great Tusk deals with Dragon-types like Garchomp. When Great Tusk chooses to forego Ice Spinner, Mamoswine makes for a great teammate to cover Dragon- and Flying-types like Choice Scarf Latias, Dragonite, and Landorus. Landorus makes for another great partner, as with its colorful coverage, it takes on the likes of Iron Defense Zamazenta, Primarina, and Clefable, and it can also provide Gravity support so Great Tusk fares better against Corviknight and Skarmory. Landorus appreciates Great Tusk taking out Ice-types in return. Iron Treads provides immense utility that helps Great Tusk, such as hazard removal and pivoting via Volt Switch, and it appreciates Great Tusk taking out Excadrill in return. Garchomp is a great late-game sweeper that appreciates Great Tusk's ability to take out bulky Pokemon such as Articuno, Ting-Lu, and Gliscor with the appropriate coverage, which in turn allows Garchomp to sweep much more easily.

Defensive Support (Psychic).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Flutter Mane.comments:
Other Options

Ghost

Mystical Fire may be used against Steel-types such as Bisharp and Iron Treads as well as Amoonguss. Power Gem is helpful in the Fire and Flying matchups, hitting Ogerpon-H, Volcarona, Articuno, and Moltres. Substitute may be used to outplay Sucker Punch users such as Bisharp. Calm Mind is an option to capitalize on Flutter Mane's ability to force out most Pokemon, allowing it potentially overpower switch-ins such as Gastrodon and Empoleon. Psyshock threatens specially defensive walls like Clodsire and Blissey.

Choice Specs (Ghost).description:
Flutter Mane is the premier Choice Specs user on Ghost teams thanks to its amazing Special Attack and Speed, outpacing Pokemon like Greninja and Gengar, with immense coverage giving it tools for every situation. Moonblast is both Flutter Mane's strongest move and can remove problematic Dark- and Dragon-types like Greninja, Hydreigon, and Archaludon with ease. Shadow Ball gives Flutter Mane a STAB option into Fairy-resistant foes like Amoonguss and allows it to threaten slower Ghost-type threats like Gholdengo and Sinistcha. Thunderbolt shocks Water- and Flying-types like Toxapex, Empoleon, Corviknight, and Enamorus. Finally, Power Gem shatters problematic Ice- and Fire-types including Alolan Ninetales, Frosmoth, Ogerpon-H, and Volcarona.

Spikes support from the likes of Brambleghast and Froslass helps chip down special walls such as Alolan Muk, Hisuian Goodra, and Ting-Lu that could otherwise threaten Flutter Mane. Brambleghast can also provide Rapid Spin support to give Flutter Mane safe entry and can threaten bulky Water- and Ground-types like Swampert, Gastrodon, and Clodsire. Froslass, meanwhile, can prevent the placement of entry hazards and Defog with Taunt. Gholdengo assists Flutter Mane by taking Steel-type attacks from the likes of Scizor, Corviknight, and Hisuian Goodra, status from the likes of Blissey, and Defog from the likes of Corviknight; in return, Gholdengo appreciates Power Gem support to remove Fire-types like Volcarona and Ogerpon-H that threaten it. Pecharunt, thanks to its high physical bulk, can withstand hits from the likes of Iron Hands, Ogerpon-W, and Scizor and threaten back with Malignant Chain to spread status to weaken walls or Foul Play to clear physical attackers away. Pecharunt can also safely bring in Flutter Mane thanks to Parting Shot. Sinistcha can help to take on the several Water- and Ground-types of the tier, including Barraskewda, Swampert, and Clodsire, along with being able to use Matcha Gotcha to burn physical attackers that can threaten Flutter Mane such as Alolan Muk and Iron Treads. Ceruledge benefits Flutter Mane by being able to use Bitter Blade to remove problematic Steel-types like Scizor and Magnezone along with being able to use Poltergeist to hit hard into special walls like Clodsire and Heatran. Ceruledge can also check opposing Flutter Mane and Dragapult thanks to Shadow Sneak. Dragapult enjoys Flutter Mane being able to break physical walls, including Archaludon, Great Tusk, and Overqwil. In return, Dragapult can wear down special walls like Alolan Muk and Iron Hands with its powerful STAB moves so Flutter Mane can effortlessly remove them. If wielding a Choice Scarf, Dragapult can also check opposing Choice Scarf threats like Meowscarada, Roaring Moon, and Hoopa-U, which all pose a significant threat to Flutter Mane.

Choice Specs (Fairy).description:
Flutter Mane has a powerful dual STAB combination in Moonblast and Shadow Ball, as well as a plethora of coverage moves that allow it to choose its good matchups. Mystical Fire hits Steel-types such as Klefki and Iron Treads. Psyshock allows Flutter Mane to punish specially defensive switch-ins like Dragalge, Blissey, and Clodsire. Flutter Mane can run Power Gem to pressure Fire teams, OHKOing foes like Volcarona and Torkoal, and it also benefits from Protosynthesis allowing it to outspeed Scovillain under the sun. Additionally, Flutter Mane usually goes with either Thunderbolt or Energy Ball. Both are useful against Water teams, with the former helping against Toxapex and Pelipper while the latter deals with Gastrodon and Quagsire. Choice Specs further enhances Flutter Mane's wallbreaking power, allowing it to overwhelm foes such as Ting-Lu after some chip damage.

On Fairy teams, Flutter Mane is a menacing wallbreaker that excels at taking down slower foes such as Hydreigon, Skeledirge, and Corviknight. When paired with Iron Valiant, Flutter Mane forms an offensive core that's able to alternate between Fairy-, Ghost-, and Fighting-type STAB to take down a wide range of enemies. Flutter Mane can handle Psychic-type foes such as Espathra and Hatterene, while Iron Valiant takes care of Steel-types like Bisharp and Iron Treads. Flutter Mane can fall back on either Hatterene or Tinkaton when faced with an unfavorable matchup. Both of these Pokemon provide dependable defensive options and some type of entry hazard control, but Hatterene is particularly useful due to it breaking down walls like Dondozo and Clodsire. Flutter Mane also pairs well with setup sweepers like Belly Drum Azumarill and Swords Dance Mimikyu, as it is able to poke holes in the opponent's team, allowing them to clean late-game. In return, Azumarill can take care of Ceruledge and Hisuian Goodra. In terms of support options, Flutter Mane can rely on Fairy's Prankster users, Klefki and Grimmsnarl, to set up dual screens, therefore allowing it to withstand hits such as Mimikyu's Shadow Sneak and Gholdengo's Make It Rain. Grimmsnarl can then bring in Flutter Mane relatively safely thanks to Parting Shot. Klefki's Spikes and Tinkaton's Stealth Rocks also support Flutter Mane in breaking its checks such as Iron Hands and Ting-Lu. Entry hazard stacking proves particularly useful against less bulky teams, as it highly limits their capacity to scout Flutter Mane without having to sacrifice a member in the process.

Choice Scarf (Ghost).description:
Choice Scarf Flutter Mane is an incredibly potent revenge killer and late-game cleaner thanks to its strong STAB combination, solid coverage options, and blazing Speed tier. Notably, it outspeeds faster Pokemon like Dragapult, boosted threats such as Baxcalibur and Quaquaval, and Choice Scarf users like Greninja and Meowscarada, all of which can threaten the offensive teams that Flutter Mane is part of. Mystical Fire threatens Steel-types such as Corviknight and Iron Treads, while Psyshock revenge kills Choice Scarf Iron Moth and hits specially bulky Pokemon like Clodsire. Thunderbolt pressures Corviknight better and 2HKOes physically defensive Toxapex after Stealth Rock, while Energy Ball takes care of Gastrodon.

Spikes from the likes of Brambleghast and Froslass are terrific support options, chipping down bulky foes like Toxapex and Ting-Lu that would otherwise switch into Flutter Mane freely. Thanks to Good as Gold blocking Defog and its Ghost-typing, Gholdengo is a notable partner to keep Spikes up. Brambleghast also helps threaten Gastrodon and provides Rapid Spin support as well. Wallbreakers like Mimikyu and Gholdengo can pressure the opposition early-game, allowing for Flutter Mane to clean up late-game with ease; moreover, Mimikyu can overwhelm Steel-types like Bisharp and Iron Treads with Drain Punch, while Gholdengo can make use of Trick to cripple walls like Clodsire and Corviknight. Setup sweepers such as Dragon Dance Dragapult and Swords Dance Ceruledge are valuable teammates that function as back-up late-game cleaners, especially against types Flutter Mane can struggle with such as Poison and Steel. Moreover, Ceruledge and Mimikyu have the added benefit of safely revenge killing opposing fast threats Flutter Mane can't handle easily, like Choice Scarf Flutter Mane and Dragon Dance Dragapult, with Shadow Sneak. Skeledirge is a notable partner to compensate for Flutter Mane's lack of physical bulk, taking on Bullet Punch users like Scizor and Lucario as well as being fantastic in the Steel, Fighting, and Bug matchups.

Bulky Choice Specs (Fairy).description:
Bulky Choice Specs Flutter Mane serves as a strong specially offensive wallbreaker that can survive one hit from most unboosted physical attacks, such as Ting Lu's Heavy Slam and Baxcalibur's Icicle Crash, with relative safety. Psyshock allows Flutter Mane to break through most Poison cores on its own with proper hazard support, most notably 2HKOing Clodsire, which otherwise walls it. Alternatively, Mystical Fire lets Flutter Mane break through defensive Steel-types like Iron Treads and and surprise more offensive Steel-types like Scizor behind Reflect, while Energy Ball targets would-be Rock-, Water-, and Ground-type walls like Garganacl and Gastrodon. The given EVs let Flutter Mane outspeed Spectrier, always survive +1 Dragonite's Earthquake, and almost always win the one-on-one matchup against Ting-Lu by having a 15/16 chance to survive its Heavy Slam and a 78% chance to 2HKO it with Moonblast in return after Leftovers recovery, using the minimum HP and Defense EVs possible.

Bulky Choice Specs Flutter Mane takes advantage of its unexpected bulk to create surprise KOs, such as versus Dragon Dance Dragonite, while retaining its ability to remove key threats like Skeledirge, Corviknight, and Galarian Slowking. For this reason, setup sweepers like Belly Drum Azumarill and Calm Mind Hatterene are strong partners, as they can take advantage of the holes that Flutter Mane creates in defensive cores. Iron Valiant is another strong partner, as it can take advantage of both the specially defensive Pokemon that Flutter Mane may not be able to remove, such as Hisuian Goodra, Alolan Muk, and Heatran, while creating a generally strong offensive core. As Flutter Mane is slower than Dragapult and opposing Flutter Mane, Choice Scarf Pokemon such as the Enamorus and the aforementioned Iron Valiant are necessary to handle these threats. Choice Scarf Enamorus in particular is a strong partner, as it can reduce the necessity of Flutter Mane on the field while threatening its own powerful late-game cleanup with Contrary Superpower, supporting its team with Healing Wish, and using Iron Head to KO opposing Flutter Mane after hazard chip; it also has the added benefit of having a stronger matchup versus Choice Scarf Meowscarada than Iron Valiant. On the other hand, Choice Scarf Iron Valiant is more immediately threatening with a Choice Scarf, allowing it to outspeed Choice Scarf Iron Moth and Gengar, Chlorophyll Scovillain, and Slush Rush Cetitan, and OHKO threats that Enamorus could only dream of removing, such as Weavile and Latias. Flutter Mane also struggles versus Steel-types like Bisharp, Gholdengo, and Choice Scarf Iron Treads, so support from Klefki and Tinkaton, along with offensive checks like Azumarill, Iron Valiant, and Enamorus, allows Flutter Mane to break through these cores much more reliably. The Poison-type matchup is particularly difficult, so Steel-types like Klefki and Tinkaton and Magic Bounce support from Hatterene help Flutter Mane, as they can provide hazard support while blocking or punishing Toxic Spikes. In return, Flutter Mane can pressure Clodsire and Galarian Slowking and chip Alolan Muk by capitalizing on the lack of switch-ins to the combination of Psyshock, Moonblast, Shadow Ball, and entry hazards.

All-Out Attacker (Ghost).description:
Heavy-Duty Boots Flutter Mane is a potent offensive pivot and revenge killer, taking advantage of its immunity to entry hazards to stay out of KO range from priority moves such as Swords Dance Urshifu-R's boosted Aqua Jet and Mimikyu's Shadow Sneak as well as bluff Choice Scarf to surprise foes with the ability to switch between moves. Moonblast threatens Dark- and Dragon-type Pokemon like Greninja, Darkrai, and Walking Wake. Energy Ball hits Ground- and Water-type foes such as Mamoswine, Dondozo, Gastrodon, and Quagsire. Thunderbolt nails Water-types like Pelipper, Toxapex, and Empoleon, allowing Flutter Mane to threaten every Water-type Pokemon super effectively in tandem with Energy Ball. Furthermore, Thunderbolt wards off Flying-types such as Corviknight and Moltres. The given EV spread permits Flutter Mane to take a Shadow Sneak from Life Orb Mimikyu, easing the Ghost matchup.

Gholdengo is an excellent teammate, as it takes advantage of Poison- and Steel-type Pokemon like Sneasler, Empoleon, and Amoonguss for Nasty Plot setup, while in return Flutter Mane threatens Ground-types such as Sandy Shocks and Gastrodon. Focus Sash Ceruledge is a really good wallbreaker against Steel and Dark teams, easily taking out Alolan Muk, Hisuian Goodra, and Bisharp. Colbur Berry Spectrier excels in the Poison and Fighting matchups, weakening shared checks like Assault Vest Iron Hands and specially defensive Toxapex using Will-O-Wisp as well as takes out potential revenge killers like Choice Scarf Roaring Moon with Draining Kiss. Additionally, Choice Scarf Spectrier is great in the Ghost mirror matchup, threatening Dragapult, Gholdengo, and Flutter Mane, appreciating Flutter Mane removing Dark-types like Hydreigon and Darkrai in return. Brambleghast and Froslass provide Spikes setup to push Flutter Mane's targets into OHKO ranges, while the former also applies additional pressure on Water and Ground teams. Skeledirge wears down teams by spreading Will-O-Wisp and bypassing Substitute with Torch Song, walling and shutting down setup Pokemon such as Dragonite and Iron Hands. Hisuian Zoroark provides a Ghost-type immunity, switching into attacks from opposing Ceruledge and Flutter Mane as well as providing utility via Will-O-Wisp and Knock Off, weakening physical attackers that Flutter Mane is vulnerable to such as Clodsire, Corviknight, and Poison Jab Toxapex and rendering foes susceptible to Spikes. Dragapult provides utility via Thunder Wave and Will-O-Wisp, hindering threats like Hisuian Goodra and opposing Flutter Mane. Furthermore, Choice Scarf Dragapult removes other Choice Scarf users like Meowscarada and Roaring Moon.

All-Out Attacker (Fairy).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Slither Wing.comments:
Other Options

Bug

Flare Blitz can be run to threaten Amoonguss, Scizor, and Forretress, while Wild Charge takes care of Pelipper and Gyarados. However, stacking Life Orb recoil with recoil from the aforementioned moves is not appreciated.

All-out Attacker (Bug).description:
All-out attacker Slither Wing is a great option on Bug teams due to its part-Fighting typing and its access to First Impression and Close Combat, which let it deal with troublesome threats like Bisharp, Hisuian Goodra, and Iron Boulder. Close Combat is Slither Wing's strongest STAB move, which takes out Normal-, Rock-, Steel-, and Ice-types like Blissey, Garganacl, Hisuian Goodra, and Mamoswine. U-turn not only damages foes, but it also allows Slither Wing to pivot out into one of its teammates like Frosmoth. Morning Sun can be run over U-turn to increase Slither Wing's longevity throughout the battle, notably in the Steel matchup; however, doing so means Slither Wing lacks the key pivoting it gets from U-turn. First Impression provides priority for Slither Wing to deal with fast threats like Iron Boulder, Latios, and Darkrai. Earthquake allows Slither Wing to deal with Gholdengo while also threatening pesky Poison-types like Clodsire and 2HKOing Toxapex. Life Orb is the go-to item for Slither Wing so it can hit as hard as possible, notably giving it a chance to OHKO Ursaluna-B. Heavy-Duty Boots can be run over Life Orb to let Slither Wing ignore entry hazards and stay healthy. However, losing the additional power Life Orb provides is not appreciated. Adamant is its preferred nature, maximizing Slither Wing's damage to let it 2HKO Skarmory and specially defensive Corviknight with Life Orb-boosted Close Combat.

Choice Scarf Kleavor is a great teammate for Slither Wing, dealing with Flying- and Fire-types like Dragonite, Moltres, and Ogerpon-H with Stone Axe, which also sets Stealth Rock, weakening foes that Slither Wing can pick off with First Impression. Swords Dance Scizor at +2 can deal with troublesome Fairy- and Rock-types like Flutter Mane, Enamorus, and Choice Scarf Hisuian Arcanine. Slither Wing taking out Steel-types like Klefki and Bisharp means that Scizor has an easier time sweeping with Bullet Punch. Volcarona and Frosmoth are fierce setup sweepers that make for great partners; Volcarona at +1 deals with Galarian Weezing, Iron Valiant, and Great Tusk with Psychic and Giga Drain, while Frosmoth at +1 deals with Dragonite, Gliscor, and the Landorus formes with Ice Beam. Ribombee, Galvantula, and Araquanid all provide Sticky Web support, which allows Slither Wing to outspeed and eliminate threats like Ogerpon-H, Choice Band Hisuian Arcanine, and Choice Specs Iron Moth. Each Sticky Web setter also provides additional support for Slither Wing: Ribombee is the fastest of the setters and also threatens Dragon-, Dark-, and Fighting-types like Dragonite, Sableye, Iron Valiant, and Great Tusk, Galvantula eases the Flying and Water matchups thanks to its part-Electric typing and the combination of Thunder and Energy Ball, and Araquanid provides bulk while soaking up Fire-type attacks like Overheat from Ninetales under sun thanks to Water Bubble. Forretress removes entry hazards with Rapid Spin and provides slow pivoting for Slither Wing with Volt Switch to ensure safe entry.

Sandy Shocks.comments:
Other Options

Electric

An alternative EV spread of 252 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe can be used to net a 2HKO on physically defensive Quagsire. However, this spread makes Protosynthesis boost Special Attack instead of Speed, making Sandy Shocks vulnerable to faster threats like Ogerpon-H and Cinderace.

Entry Hazard Support (Electric).description:
Sandy Shocks provides immense utility to Electric teams due to it being the premier entry hazard setter of the type, as well as its Ground-type STAB move threatening non-Air Balloon Heatran and Archaludon. Sandy Shocks also gives Electric teams breathing room against Fire teams due to Protosynthesis boosting its Speed, allowing it to outspeed the likes of Cinderace and Choice Scarf Ninetales. Volt Switch allows Sandy Shocks to pivot its teammates in safely. Stealth Rock is what makes Sandy Shocks valuable to Electric teams, as the chip damage wears down foes, potentially breaking Focus Sash and Sturdy from Pokemon like Ceruledge and Ogerpon-C. Sandy Shocks also benefits from Stealth Rock, as it is able to 2HKO Alolan Muk after Stealth Rock damage. In the fourth moveslot, Thunderbolt can be used as Sandy Shocks's primary STAB move in order to net more damage against foes, notably OHKOing Skarmory, which it cannot do with Volt Switch. Power Gem can be run as well to remove the likes of Volcarona, Moltres, and Ogerpon-H, although the latter is only a target when Sandy Shocks's Speed is boosted under sun. Additionally, Spikes can also be run so that Sandy Shocks can set more entry hazards, but running either attacking move in the fourth slot will be much better in the long run, since Spikes can be ignored by Flying-types as well as Levitate and Air Balloon users. The Special Attack EVs allow Sandy Shocks to almost certainly 2HKO Clodsire variants without heavy Special Attack investment. The EVs also make Protosynthesis boost Sandy Shocks's Speed.

Sandy Shocks's entry hazard support is appreciated by a multitude of offensive teammates. Choice Specs users such as Zapdos and Magnezone greatly appreciate the hazards Sandy Shocks sets, as they allow them to better wallbreak. Notably, Zapdos takes out Grass- and Fighting-types such as Amoonguss, Hydrapple, and Great Tusk, and Magnezone handles Fairy-types like Flutter Mane for Sandy Shocks. Iron Hands and Pawmot are additional beneficiaries of Sandy Shocks's hazards; Iron Hands also appreciates Sandy Shocks being able to remove Moltres, which can cripple it with Will-O-Wisp. In return, Iron Hands and Pawmot can remove threats Sandy Shocks hates such as Chien-Pao and Greninja. Additionally, Shuca Berry Iron Hands is useful in the Ground matchup, and Pawmot has the additional benefit of reviving fallen teammates with Revival Blessing. Raging Bolt benefits from Sandy Shocks being able to remove some Clodsire variants; in return, Raging Bolt revenge kills speedy Water-types like Greninja, Barraskewda, and Keldeo. Rotom-W is another great teammate, as it spreads burns with Will-O-Wisp, provides a Ground immunity, and helps in both the Ground and Fire matchups. Lastly, Regieleki provides valuable hazard removal for the team, and it can spread paralysis via Thunder Wave so that Sandy Shocks outspeeds and threatens would-be faster threats like Greninja and Keldeo.

Gravity Utility (Ground).description:
Sandy Shocks is incredibly useful on any Ground team thanks to its ability to threaten common types that Ground struggles against, such as Steel and Water, by targeting Skarmory, Corviknight, and Pelipper and to the Gravity support it provides, which mainly benefits sand variants of Ground teams. With Gravity active, Sandy Shocks can hit popular Air Balloon users such as Heatran, Gholdengo, and Raging Bolt super effectively while ensuring Latios cannot switch in freely. Volt Switch coupled with Gravity epitomizes Sandy Shocks's role allowing for as a fast-paced pivot designed to make the opponent suffocating under the constant offensive pressure by safely bringing in wallbreakers like Choice Band Excadrill and Choice Scarf Great Tusk. The last slot leaves room for creativity. Thunderbolt gives Sandy Shocks a more offensive role in the Flying and Water matchups by OHKOing both Skarmory and Corviknight after Stealth Rock, while Power Gem prevents Volcarona from setting up on it. Alternatively, Spikes synergizes well with Gravity and can help chip down bulky foes like Hisuian Goodra. On teams without sand, Gravity can be replaced with any of the aforementioned moves, as these teams lack a fast wallbreaker comparable to Excadrill. An alternative EV spread of 48 HP / 208 SpA / 252 Spe can be used to boost Speed with Protosynthesis, allowing Sandy Shocks to answer sun teams offensively by outspeeding Cinderace, Protosynthesis Gouging Fire, and Ogerpon-H and 2HKOing them with Earth Power.

Sandy Shocks pairs well with most Ground-type wallbreakers, such as Landorus, Excadrill, Mamoswine, and Great Tusk, as they appreciate Gravity support. With Gravity Sandy Shocks as a teammate, Landorus can either run a Choice Scarf set to surprise foes like Air Balloon Iron Treads or stick to Life Orb and run an extra coverage move or double down and keep Gravity. Landorus's versatility and impressive wallbreaking capabilities make it an excellent partner for Sandy Shocks by removing Grass-type threats, like Ogerpon-H and Ogerpon-W, from the field with Sludge Wave and OHKOing Volcarona with Rock Slide. On teams without sand, Choice Scarf Great Tusk synergizes well with Sandy Shocks, as its STAB move combination is nigh-unresisted with Gravity up, which, coupled with its decent Speed tier and great offensive power, ensures troublesome foes like Choice Specs Dragapult, Latios, and Flutter Mane succumb after Stealth Rock damage, making it a key asset in many matchups such as Ghost, Dragon, Fairy, and Flying. Mamoswine and Excadrill are both formidable wallbreakers that can use Gravity to their advantage to break through opposing teams, as Ground STAB is threatening to most of the tier, such as in the Steel, Dragon, Fairy, and Flying matchups. However, they contribute differently to the team, with Mamoswine taking advantage of the Ice- and Ground-type STAB move combination to delete any foe in the Flying and Dragon matchups, while Excadrill crushes opposing teams with Choice Band Earthquake in sand. Defensively, Sandy Shocks appreciates both physical and special walls like Hippowdon and Clodsire, which can tank physical hits from Gouging Fire and opposing Excadrill or absorb Water-type moves from Keldeo, respectively. They both also come with their own perks; Hippowdon can set up Stealth Rock and phaze opposing Pokemon, while Clodsire provides Toxic Spikes or Toxic support, can deal with special setup sweepers with Haze, and can check Choice Specs Flutter Mane. On teams without sand, Gastrodon, Ting-Lu, and Gliscor make for great defensive teammates: Gastrodon can tank Ice Beam from Choice Specs Latios and Greninja while setting up entry hazards; Ting-Lu can set up both Spikes and Stealth Rock while phazing the enemy to wear down the opposing team thanks to its impressive mixed bulk; Gliscor supplements the defensive core on teams without sand through its Ground immunity, status immunity, and passive recovery.

Choice Band (Steel).description:
Choice Band Iron Treads is a great addition on Steel teams, serving as a wallbreaker and leveraging its Ground typing and excellent coverage options to ease Fire, Electric, and Steel matchups. Earthquake targets Fire-, Electric-, and Steel-types like Torkoal, Raging Bolt, and Archaludon as well as Toxapex. Ice Spinner threatens Ground- and Dragon-types like the Landorus formes, Gliscor, Garchomp, and Hydreigon. Knock Off messes up would-be switch-ins like Corviknight, Skarmory, and Dondozo by removing their Leftovers, Rocky Helmet, and Heavy-Duty Boots, respectively, while also punishing spinblockers like Air Balloon Gholdengo and Dragapult. Supercell Slam OHKOes Primarina after minimal chip damage and 2HKOes foes like Skarmory and Slowbro, while Stone Edge secures an OHKO on Volcarona and Moltres. Rapid Spin can also be used in the last slot, allowing Iron Treads to support its teammates by removing entry hazards.

Iron Treads's ability to offensively threaten Fire-types is greatly appreciated by many of its teammates. Skarmory and Corviknight are great partners for Iron Treads, boasting a Ground immunity and a Fighting neutrality, which allows them to take on foes like Excadrill, Great Tusk, and Sneasler. Skarmory also provides Spikes support, which, in conjunction with Iron Treads's Knock Off removing Heavy-Duty Boots and Leftovers, weakens bulky foes like Great Tusk and Dondozo, while Corviknight provides U-turn support and serves as a Defogger. Gholdengo brings a crucial Fighting immunity to the team that allows it to handle foes like Iron Defense Zamazenta and mixed Iron Valiant.
